https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/about-claude/models/all-models#model-names */\nconst anthropicMaxOutputs = {\n  'claude-3-haiku': 4096,\n  'claude-3-sonnet': 4096,\n  'claude-3-opus': 4096,\n  'claude-haiku-4-5': 64000,\n  'claude-sonnet-4': 64000,\n  'claude-opus-4': 32000,\n  'claude-opus-4-5': 64000,\n  'claude-opus-4-6': 128000,\n  'claude-3.5-sonnet': 8192,\n  'claude-3-5-sonnet': 8192,\n  'claude-3.7-sonnet': 128000,\n  'claude-3-7-sonnet': 128000,\n};\n\n/** Outputs from https://api-docs.deepseek.com/quick_start/pricing */\nconst deepseekMaxOutputs = {\n  deepseek: 8000, // deepseek-chat default: 4K, max: 8K\n  'deepseek-chat': 8000,\n  'deepseek-reasoner': 64000, // default: 32K, max: 64K\n  'deepseek-r1': 64000,\n  'deepseek-v3': 8000,\n  'deepseek.r1': 64000,\n};\n\nexport const maxOutputTokensMap = {\n  [EModelEndpoint.anthropic]: anthropicMaxOutputs,\n  [EModelEndpoint.azureOpenAI]: modelMaxOutputs,\n  [EModelEndpoint.openAI]: { ...modelMaxOutputs, ...deepseekMaxOutputs },\n  [EModelEndpoint.custom]: { ...modelMaxOutputs, ...deepseekMaxOutputs },\n};\n\n/**\n * Finds the first matching pattern in the tokens map.\n * @param {string} modelName\n * @param {Record<string, number> | EndpointTokenConfig} tokensMap\n * @returns {string|null}\n */\nexport function findMatchingPattern(\n  modelName: string,\n  tokensMap: Record<string, number> | EndpointTokenConfig,\n): string | null {\n  const keys = Object.keys(tokensMap);\n  const lowerModelName = modelName.toLowerCase();\n  for (let i = keys.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {\n    const modelKey = keys[i];\n    if (lowerModelName.includes(modelKey)) {\n      return modelKey;\n    }\n  }\n\n  return null;\n}\n\n/**\n * Retrieves a token value for a given model name from a tokens map.\n *\n * @param modelName - The name of the model to look up.\n * @param tokensMap - The map of model names to token values.\n * @param [key='context'] - The key to look up in the tokens map.\n * @returns The token value for the given model or undefined if no match is found.\n */\nexport function getModelTokenValue(\n  modelName: string,\n  tokensMap?: EndpointTokenConfig | Record<string, number>,\n  key = 'context' as keyof TokenConfig,\n): number | undefined {\n  if (typeof modelName !== 'string' || !tokensMap) {\n    return undefined;\n  }\n\n  const value = tokensMap[modelName];\n  if (typeof value === 'number') {\n    return value;\n  }\n\n  if (value?.context) {\n    return value.context;\n  }\n\n  const matchedPattern = findMatchingPattern(modelName, tokensMap);\n\n  if (matchedPattern) {\n    const result = tokensMap[matchedPattern];\n    if (typeof result === 'number') {\n      return result;\n    }\n\n    const tokenValue = result?.[key];\n    if (typeof tokenValue === 'number') {\n      return tokenValue;\n    }\n    return tokensMap.system_default as number | undefined;\n  }\n\n  return tokensMap.system_default as number | undefined;\n}\n\n/**\n * Retrieves the maximum tokens for a given model name.\n *\n * @param modelName - The name of the model to look up.\n * @param endpoint - The endpoint (default is 'openAI').\n * @param [endpointTokenConfig] - Token Config for current endpoint to use for max tokens lookup\n * @returns The maximum tokens for the given model or undefined if no match is found.\n */\nexport function getModelMaxTokens(\n  modelName: string,\n  endpoint = EModelEndpoint.openAI,\n  endpointTokenConfig?: EndpointTokenConfig,\n): number | undefined {\n  const tokensMap = endpointTokenConfig ?? maxTokensMap[endpoint as keyof typeof maxTokensMap];\n  return getModelTokenValue(modelName, tokensMap);\n}\n\n/**\n * Retrieves the maximum output tokens for a given model name.\n *\n * @param modelName - The name of the model to look up.\n * @param endpoint - The endpoint (default is 'openAI').\n * @param [endpointTokenConfig] - Token Config for current endpoint to use for max tokens lookup\n * @returns The maximum output tokens for the given model or undefined if no match is found.\n */\nexport function getModelMaxOutputTokens(\n  modelName: string,\n  endpoint = EModelEndpoint.openAI,\n  endpointTokenConfig?: EndpointTokenConfig,\n): number | undefined {\n  const tokensMap =\n    endpointTokenConfig ?? maxOutputTokensMap[endpoint as keyof typeof maxOutputTokensMap];\n  return getModelTokenValue(modelName, tokensMap, 'output');\n}\n\n/**\n * Retrieves the model name key for a given model name input. If the exact model name isn't found,\n * it searches for partial matches within the model name, checking keys in reverse order.\n *\n * @param modelName - The name of the model to look up.\n * @param endpoint - The endpoint (default is 'openAI').\n * @returns The model name key for the given model; returns input if no match is found and is string.\n *\n * @example\n * matchModelName('gpt-4-32k-0613'); // Returns 'gpt-4-32k-0613'\n * matchModelName('gpt-4-32k-unknown'); // Returns 'gpt-4-32k'\n * matchModelName('unknown-model'); // Returns undefined\n */\nexport function matchModelName(\n  modelName: string,\n  endpoint = EModelEndpoint.openAI,\n): string | undefined {\n  if (typeof modelName !== 'string') {\n    return undefined;\n  }\n\n  const tokensMap: Record<string, number> = maxTokensMap[endpoint as keyof typeof maxTokensMap];\n  if (!tokensMap) {\n    return modelName;\n  }\n\n  if (tokensMap[modelName]) {\n    return modelName;\n  }\n\n  const matchedPattern = findMatchingPattern(modelName, tokensMap);\n  return matchedPattern || modelName;\n}\n\nexport const modelSchema = z.object({\n  id: z.string(),\n  pricing: z.object({\n    prompt: z.string(),\n    completion: z.string(),\n  }),\n  context_length: z.number(),\n});\n\nexport const inputSchema = z.object({\n  data: z.array(modelSchema),\n});\n\n/**\n * Processes a list of model data from an API and organizes it into structured data based on URL and specifics of rates and context.\n * @param {{ data: Array<z.infer<typeof modelSchema>> }} input The input object containing base URL and data fetched from the API.\n * @returns {EndpointTokenConfig} The processed model data.\n */\nexport function processModelData(input: z.infer<typeof inputSchema>): EndpointTokenConfig {\n  const validationResult = inputSchema.safeParse(input);\n  if (!validationResult.success) {\n    throw new Error('Invalid input data');\n  }\n  const { data } = validationResult.data;\n\n  /** @type {EndpointTokenConfig} */\n  const tokenConfig: EndpointTokenConfig = {};\n\n  for (const model of data) {\n    const modelKey = model.id;\n    if (modelKey === 'openrouter/auto') {\n      model.pricing = {\n        prompt: '0.00001',\n        completion: '0.00003',\n      };\n    }\n    const prompt = parseFloat(model.pricing.prompt) * 1000000;\n    const completion = parseFloat(model.pricing.completion) * 1000000;\n\n    tokenConfig[modelKey] = {\n      prompt,\n      completion,\n      context: model.context_length,\n    };\n  }\n\n  return tokenConfig;\n}\n\nexport const tiktokenModels = new Set([\n  'text-davinci-003',\n  'text-davinci-002',\n  'text-davinci-001',\n  'text-curie-001',\n  'text-babbage-001',\n  'text-ada-001',\n  'davinci',\n  'curie',\n  'babbage',\n  'ada',\n  'code-davinci-002',\n  'code-davinci-001',\n  'code-cushman-002',\n  'code-cushman-001',\n  'davinci-codex',\n  'cushman-codex',\n  'text-davinci-edit-001',\n  'code-davinci-edit-001',\n  'text-embedding-ada-002',\n  'text-similarity-davinci-001',\n  'text-similarity-curie-001',\n  'text-similarity-babbage-001',\n  'text-similarity-ada-001',\n  'text-search-davinci-doc-001',\n  'text-search-curie-doc-001',\n  'text-search-babbage-doc-001',\n  'text-search-ada-doc-001',\n  'code-search-babbage-code-001',\n  'code-search-ada-code-001',\n  'gpt2',\n  'gpt-4',\n  'gpt-4-0314',\n  'gpt-4-32k',\n  'gpt-4-32k-0314',\n  'gpt-3.5-turbo',\n  'gpt-3.5-turbo-0301',\n]);\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { CohereConstants } from 'librechat-data-provider';\n\n/**\n * Extracts a valid OpenAI baseURL from a given string, matching \"url/v1,\" followed by an optional suffix.\n * The suffix can be one of several predefined values (e.g., 'openai', 'azure-openai', etc.),\n * accommodating different proxy patterns like Cloudflare, LiteLLM, etc.\n * Returns the original URL if no valid pattern is found.\n *\n * Examples:\n * - `https://open.ai/v1/chat` -> `https://open.ai/v1`\n * - `https://open.ai/v1/chat/completions` -> `https://open.ai/v1`\n * - `https://gateway.ai.cloudflare.com/v1/account/gateway/azure-openai/completions` -> `https://gateway.ai.cloudflare.com/v1/account/gateway/azure-openai`\n * - `https://open.ai/v1/hi/openai` -> `https://open.ai/v1/hi/openai`\n * - `https://api.example.com/v1/replicate` -> `https://api.example.com/v1/replicate`\n *\n * @param url - The URL to be processed.\n * @returns The matched pattern or input if no match is found.\n */\nexport function extractBaseURL(url: string): string | null | undefined {\n  if (!url || typeof url !== 'string') {\n    return undefined;\n  }\n\n  if (url.startsWith(CohereConstants.API_URL)) {\n    return null;\n  }\n\n  if (!url.includes('/v1')) {\n    return url;\n  }\n\n  const v1Index = url.indexOf('/v1');\n  let baseUrl = url.substring(0, v1Index + 3);\n\n  const openai = 'openai';\n  const suffixes = [\n    'azure-openai',\n    openai,\n    'aws-bedrock',\n    'anthropic',\n    'cohere',\n    'deepseek',\n    'google-ai-studio',\n    'google-vertex-ai',\n    'grok',\n    'groq',\n    'mistral',\n    'openrouter',\n    'perplexity-ai',\n    'replicate',\n    'huggingface',\n    'workers-ai',\n    'aws-bedrock',\n  ];\n  const suffixUsed = suffixes.find((suffix) => url.includes(`/${suffix}`));\n\n  if (suffixUsed === 'azure-openai') {\n    return url.split(/\\/(chat|completion)/)[0];\n  }\n\n  const openaiIndex = url.indexOf(`/${openai}`, v1Index + 3);\n  const suffixIndex =\n    suffixUsed === openai ? openaiIndex : url.indexOf(`/${suffixUsed}`, v1Index + 3);\n\n  if (openaiIndex === v1Index + 3) {\n    const nextSlashIndex = url.indexOf('/', openaiIndex + 7);\n    if (nextSlashIndex === -1) {\n      baseUrl = url.substring(0, openaiIndex + 7);\n    } else {\n      baseUrl = url.substring(0, nextSlashIndex);\n    }\n  } else if (suffixIndex > 0) {\n    baseUrl = url.substring(0, suffixIndex + (suffixUsed?.length ?? 0) + 1);\n  }\n\n  return baseUrl;\n}\n\n/**\n * Extracts the base URL (protocol + hostname + port) from the provided URL.\n * Used primarily for Ollama endpoints to derive the host.\n * @param fullURL - The full URL.\n * @returns The base URL (protocol://hostname:port).\n */\nexport function deriveBaseURL(fullURL: string): string {\n  try {\n    const parsedUrl = new URL(fullURL);\n    const protocol = parsedUrl.protocol;\n    const hostname = parsedUrl.hostname;\n    const port = parsedUrl.port;\n\n    if (!protocol || !hostname) {\n      return fullURL;\n    }\n\n    return `${protocol}//${hostname}${port ? `:${port}` : ''}`;\n  } catch (error) {\n    logger.error('Failed to derive base URL', error);\n    return fullURL;\n  }\n}\n","import { Constants } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { TFile, TMessage } from 'librechat-data-provider';\n\n/** Fields to strip from files before client transmission */\nconst FILE_STRIP_FIELDS = ['text', '_id', '__v'] as const;\n\n/** Fields to strip from messages before client transmission */\nconst MESSAGE_STRIP_FIELDS = ['fileContext'] as const;\n\n/**\n * Strips large/unnecessary fields from a file object before transmitting to client.\n * Use this within existing loops when building file arrays to avoid extra iterations.\n *\n * @param file - The file object to sanitize\n * @returns A new file object without the stripped fields\n *\n * @example\n * // Use in existing file processing loop:\n * for (const attachment of client.options.attachments) {\n *   if (messageFiles.has(attachment.file_id)) {\n *     userMessage.files.push(sanitizeFileForTransmit(attachment));\n *   }\n * }\n */\nexport function sanitizeFileForTransmit<T extends Partial<TFile>>(\n  file: T,\n): Omit<T, (typeof FILE_STRIP_FIELDS)[number]> {\n  const sanitized = { ...file };\n  for (const field of FILE_STRIP_FIELDS) {\n    delete sanitized[field as keyof typeof sanitized];\n  }\n  return sanitized;\n}\n\n/**\n * Sanitizes a message object before transmitting to client.\n * Removes large fields like `fileContext` and strips `text` from embedded files.\n *\n * @param message - The message object to sanitize\n * @returns A new message object safe for client transmission\n *\n * @example\n * sendEvent(res, {\n *   final: true,\n *   requestMessage: sanitizeMessageForTransmit(userMessage),\n *   responseMessage: response,\n * });\n */\nexport function sanitizeMessageForTransmit<T extends Partial<TMessage>>(\n  message: T,\n): Omit<T, (typeof MESSAGE_STRIP_FIELDS)[number]> {\n  if (!message) {\n    return message as Omit<T, (typeof MESSAGE_STRIP_FIELDS)[number]>;\n  }\n\n  const sanitized = { ...message };\n\n  // Remove message-level fields\n  for (const field of MESSAGE_STRIP_FIELDS) {\n    delete sanitized[field as keyof typeof sanitized];\n  }\n\n  // Always create a new array when files exist to maintain full immutability\n  if (Array.isArray(sanitized.files)) {\n    sanitized.files = sanitized.files.map((file) => sanitizeFileForTransmit(file));\n  }\n\n  return sanitized;\n}\n\n/** Minimal message shape for thread traversal */\ntype ThreadMessage = {\n  messageId: string;\n  parentMessageId?: string | null;\n  files?: Array<{ file_id?: string }>;\n};\n\n/** Result of thread data extraction */\nexport type ThreadData = {\n  messageIds: string[];\n  fileIds: string[];\n};\n\n/**\n * Extracts thread message IDs and file IDs in a single O(n) pass.\n * Builds a Map for O(1) lookups, then traverses the thread collecting both IDs.\n *\n * @param messages - All messages in the conversation (should be queried with select for efficiency)\n * @param parentMessageId - The ID of the parent message to start traversal from\n * @returns Object containing messageIds and fileIds arrays\n */\nexport function getThreadData(\n  messages: ThreadMessage[],\n  parentMessageId: string | null | undefined,\n): ThreadData {\n  const result: ThreadData = { messageIds: [], fileIds: [] };\n\n  if (!messages || messages.length === 0 || !parentMessageId) {\n    return result;\n  }\n\n  /** Build Map for O(1) lookups instead of O(n) .find() calls */\n  const messageMap = new Map<string, ThreadMessage>();\n  for (const msg of messages) {\n    messageMap.set(msg.messageId, msg);\n  }\n\n  const fileIdSet = new Set<string>();\n  const visitedIds = new Set<string>();\n  let currentId: string | null | undefined = parentMessageId;\n\n  /** Single traversal: collect message IDs and file IDs together */\n  while (currentId) {\n    if (visitedIds.has(currentId)) {\n      break;\n    }\n    visitedIds.add(currentId);\n\n    const message = messageMap.get(currentId);\n    if (!message) {\n      break;\n    }\n\n    result.messageIds.push(message.messageId);\n\n    /** Collect file IDs from this message */\n    if (message.files) {\n      for (const file of message.files) {\n        if (file.file_id) {\n          fileIdSet.add(file.file_id);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    currentId = message.parentMessageId === Constants.NO_PARENT ? null : message.parentMessageId;\n  }\n\n  result.fileIds = Array.from(fileIdSet);\n  return result;\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport {\n  EModelEndpoint,\n  removeNullishValues,\n  normalizeEndpointName,\n} from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { TCustomConfig, TEndpoint, TTransactionsConfig } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { AppConfig } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { isEnabled } from '~/utils';\n\n/**\n * Retrieves the balance configuration object\n * */\nexport function getBalanceConfig(appConfig?: AppConfig): Partial<TCustomConfig['balance']> | null {\n  const isLegacyEnabled = isEnabled(process.env.CHECK_BALANCE);\n  const startBalance = process.env.START_BALANCE;\n  /** @type {} */\n  const config: Partial<TCustomConfig['balance']> = removeNullishValues({\n    enabled: isLegacyEnabled,\n    startBalance: startBalance != null && startBalance ? parseInt(startBalance, 10) : undefined,\n  });\n  if (!appConfig) {\n    return config;\n  }\n  return { ...config, ...(appConfig?.['balance'] ?? {}) };\n}\n\n/**\n * Retrieves the transactions configuration object\n * */\nexport function getTransactionsConfig(appConfig?: AppConfig): Partial<TTransactionsConfig> {\n  const defaultConfig: TTransactionsConfig = { enabled: true };\n\n  if (!appConfig) {\n    return defaultConfig;\n  }\n\n  const transactionsConfig = appConfig?.['transactions'] ?? defaultConfig;\n  const balanceConfig = getBalanceConfig(appConfig);\n\n  // If balance is enabled but transactions are disabled, force transactions to be enabled\n  // and log a warning\n  if (balanceConfig?.enabled && !transactionsConfig.enabled) {\n    logger.warn(\n      'Configuration warning: transactions.enabled=false is incompatible with balance.enabled=true. ' +\n        'Transactions will be enabled to ensure balance tracking works correctly.',\n    );\n    return { ...transactionsConfig, enabled: true };\n  }\n\n  return transactionsConfig;\n}\n\nexport const getCustomEndpointConfig = ({\n  endpoint,\n  appConfig,\n}: {\n  endpoint: string | EModelEndpoint;\n  appConfig?: AppConfig;\n}): Partial<TEndpoint> | undefined => {\n  if (!appConfig) {\n    throw new Error(`Config not found for the ${endpoint} custom endpoint.`);\n  }\n\n  const customEndpoints = appConfig.endpoints?.[EModelEndpoint.custom] ?? [];\n  return customEndpoints.find(\n    (endpointConfig) => normalizeEndpointName(endpointConfig.name) === normalizeEndpointName(endpoint),\n  );\n};\n\nexport function hasCustomUserVars(appConfig?: 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { TCustomConfig, TMemoryConfig } from 'librechat-data-provider';\n\nconst hasValidAgent = (agent: TMemoryConfig['agent']) =>\n  !!agent &&\n  (('id' in agent && !!agent.id) ||\n    ('provider' in agent && 'model' in agent && !!agent.provider && !!agent.model));\n\nconst isDisabled = (config?: TMemoryConfig | TCustomConfig['memory']) =>\n  !config || config.disabled === true;\n\nexport function loadMemoryConfig(config: TCustomConfig['memory']): TMemoryConfig | undefined {\n  if (!config) return undefined;\n  if (isDisabled(config)) return config as TMemoryConfig;\n\n  if (!hasValidAgent(config.agent)) {\n    return { ...config, disabled: true } as TMemoryConfig;\n  }\n\n  const charLimit = memorySchema.shape.charLimit.safeParse(config.charLimit).data ?? 10000;\n\n  return { ...config, charLimit };\n}\n\nexport function isMemoryEnabled(config: TMemoryConfig | undefined): boolean {\n  if (isDisabled(config)) return false;\n  return hasValidAgent(config!.agent);\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport {\n  SystemRoles,\n  Permissions,\n  roleDefaults,\n  PermissionTypes,\n  getConfigDefaults,\n} from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { IRole, AppConfig } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { isMemoryEnabled } from '~/memory/config';\n\n/**\n * Checks if a permission type has explicit configuration\n */\nfunction hasExplicitConfig(\n  interfaceConfig: AppConfig['interfaceConfig'],\n  permissionType: PermissionTypes,\n) {\n  switch (permissionType) {\n    case PermissionTypes.PROMPTS:\n      return interfaceConfig?.prompts !== undefined;\n    case PermissionTypes.BOOKMARKS:\n      return interfaceConfig?.bookmarks !== undefined;\n    case PermissionTypes.MEMORIES:\n      return interfaceConfig?.memories !== undefined;\n    case PermissionTypes.MULTI_CONVO:\n      return interfaceConfig?.multiConvo !== undefined;\n    case PermissionTypes.AGENTS:\n      return interfaceConfig?.agents !== undefined;\n    case PermissionTypes.TEMPORARY_CHAT:\n      return interfaceConfig?.temporaryChat !== undefined;\n    case PermissionTypes.RUN_CODE:\n      return interfaceConfig?.runCode !== undefined;\n    case PermissionTypes.WEB_SEARCH:\n      return interfaceConfig?.webSearch !== undefined;\n    case PermissionTypes.PEOPLE_PICKER:\n      return interfaceConfig?.peoplePicker !== undefined;\n    case PermissionTypes.MARKETPLACE:\n      return interfaceConfig?.marketplace !== undefined;\n    case PermissionTypes.FILE_SEARCH:\n      return interfaceConfig?.fileSearch !== undefined;\n    case PermissionTypes.FILE_CITATIONS:\n      return interfaceConfig?.fileCitations !== undefined;\n    case PermissionTypes.MCP_SERVERS:\n      return interfaceConfig?.mcpServers !== undefined;\n    case PermissionTypes.REMOTE_AGENTS:\n      return interfaceConfig?.remoteAgents !== undefined;\n    default:\n      return false;\n  }\n}\n\nexport async function updateInterfacePermissions({\n  appConfig,\n  getRoleByName,\n  updateAccessPermissions,\n}: {\n  appConfig: AppConfig;\n  getRoleByName: (roleName: string, fieldsToSelect?: string | string[]) => Promise<IRole | null>;\n  updateAccessPermissions: (\n    roleName: string,\n    permissionsUpdate: Partial<Record<PermissionTypes, Record<string, boolean | undefined>>>,\n\n    roleData?: IRole | null,\n  ) => Promise<void>;\n}) {\n  const loadedInterface = appConfig?.interfaceConfig;\n  if (!loadedInterface) {\n    return;\n  }\n  /** Configured values for interface object structure */\n  const interfaceConfig = appConfig?.config?.interface;\n  const memoryConfig = appConfig?.config?.memory;\n  const memoryEnabled = isMemoryEnabled(memoryConfig);\n  /** Check if memory is explicitly disabled (memory.disabled === true) */\n  const isMemoryExplicitlyDisabled = memoryConfig?.disabled === true;\n  /** Check if memory should be enabled (explicitly enabled or valid config) */\n  const shouldEnableMemory =\n    memoryConfig?.disabled === false ||\n    (memoryConfig && memoryEnabled && memoryConfig.disabled === undefined);\n  /** Check if personalization is enabled (defaults to true if memory is configured and enabled) */\n  const isPersonalizationEnabled =\n    memoryConfig && memoryEnabled && memoryConfig.personalize !== false;\n\n  /** Helper to get permission value with proper precedence */\n  const getPermissionValue = (\n    configValue?: boolean,\n    roleDefault?: boolean,\n    schemaDefault?: boolean,\n  ) => {\n    if (configValue !== undefined) return configValue;\n    if (roleDefault !== undefined) return roleDefault;\n    return schemaDefault;\n  };\n\n  const defaults = getConfigDefaults().interface;\n\n  // Permission precedence order:\n  // 1. Explicit user configuration (from librechat.yaml)\n  // 2. Role-specific defaults (from roleDefaults)\n  // 3. Interface schema defaults (from interfaceSchema.default())\n  for (const roleName of [SystemRoles.USER, SystemRoles.ADMIN]) {\n    const defaultPerms = roleDefaults[roleName]?.permissions;\n\n    const existingRole = await getRoleByName(roleName);\n    const existingPermissions = existingRole?.permissions as\n      | Partial<Record<PermissionTypes, Record<string, boolean | undefined>>>\n      | undefined;\n    const permissionsToUpdate: Partial<\n      Record<PermissionTypes, Record<string, boolean | undefined>>\n    > = {};\n\n    /**\n     * Helper to add permission if it should be updated\n     */\n    const addPermissionIfNeeded = (\n      permType: PermissionTypes,\n      permissions: Record<string, boolean | undefined>,\n    ) => {\n      const permTypeExists = existingPermissions?.[permType];\n      const isExplicitlyConfigured =\n        interfaceConfig && hasExplicitConfig(interfaceConfig, permType);\n      const isMemoryDisabled = permType === PermissionTypes.MEMORIES && isMemoryExplicitlyDisabled;\n      const isMemoryReenabling =\n        permType === PermissionTypes.MEMORIES &&\n        shouldEnableMemory &&\n        existingPermissions?.[PermissionTypes.MEMORIES]?.[Permissions.USE] === false;\n\n      // Only update if: doesn't exist OR explicitly configured OR memory state change\n      if (!permTypeExists || isExplicitlyConfigured || isMemoryDisabled || isMemoryReenabling) {\n        permissionsToUpdate[permType] = permissions;\n        if (!permTypeExists) {\n          logger.debug(`Role '${roleName}': Setting up default permissions for '${permType}'`);\n        } else if (isExplicitlyConfigured) {\n          logger.debug(`Role '${roleName}': Applying explicit config for '${permType}'`);\n        } else if (isMemoryDisabled) {\n          logger.debug(`Role '${roleName}': Disabling memories as memory.disabled is true`);\n        } else if (isMemoryReenabling) {\n          logger.debug(\n            `Role '${roleName}': Re-enabling memories due to valid memory configuration`,\n          );\n        }\n      } else {\n        logger.debug(`Role '${roleName}': Preserving existing permissions for '${permType}'`);\n      }\n    };\n\n    // Helper to extract value from boolean or object config\n    type PermissionConfig =\n      | boolean\n      | { use?: boolean; create?: boolean; share?: boolean; public?: boolean }\n      | undefined;\n    const getConfigUse = (config: PermissionConfig) =>\n      typeof config === 'boolean' ? config : config?.use;\n    const getConfigCreate = (config: PermissionConfig) =>\n      typeof config === 'boolean' ? undefined : config?.create;\n    const getConfigShare = (config: PermissionConfig) =>\n      typeof config === 'boolean' ? undefined : '@azure/identity';\nimport type { ContainerClient, BlobServiceClient } from '@azure/storage-blob';\n\nlet blobServiceClient: BlobServiceClient | null = null;\nlet azureWarningLogged = false;\n\n/**\n * Initializes the Azure Blob Service client.\n * This function establishes a connection by checking if a connection string is provided.\n * If available, the connection string is used; otherwise, Managed Identity (via DefaultAzureCredential) is utilized.\n * Note: Container creation (and its public access settings) is handled later in the CRUD functions.\n * @returns The initialized client, or null if the required configuration is missing.\n */\nexport const initializeAzureBlobService = async (): Promise<BlobServiceClient | null> => {\n  if (blobServiceClient) {\n    return blobServiceClient;\n  }\n  const connectionString = process.env.AZURE_STORAGE_CONNECTION_STRING;\n  if (connectionString) {\n    const { BlobServiceClient } = await import('@azure/storage-blob');\n    blobServiceClient = BlobServiceClient.fromConnectionString(connectionString);\n    logger.info('Azure Blob Service initialized using connection string');\n  } else {\n    const accountName = process.env.AZURE_STORAGE_ACCOUNT_NAME;\n    if (!accountName) {\n      if (!azureWarningLogged) {\n        logger.error(\n          '[initializeAzureBlobService] Azure Blob Service not initialized. Connection string missing and AZURE_STORAGE_ACCOUNT_NAME not provided.',\n        );\n        azureWarningLogged = true;\n      }\n      return null;\n    }\n    const url = `https://${accountName}.blob.core.windows.net`;\n    const credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();\n    const { BlobServiceClient } = await import('@azure/storage-blob');\n    blobServiceClient = new BlobServiceClient(url, credential);\n    logger.info('Azure Blob Service initialized using Managed Identity');\n  }\n  return blobServiceClient;\n};\n\n/**\n * Retrieves the Azure ContainerClient for the given container name.\n * @param [containerName=process.env.AZURE_CONTAINER_NAME || 'files'] - The container name.\n * @returns The Azure ContainerClient.\n */\nexport const getAzureContainerClient = async (\n  containerName = process.env.AZURE_CONTAINER_NAME || 'files',\n): Promise<ContainerClient | null> => {\n  const serviceClient = await initializeAzureBlobService();\n  return serviceClient ? serviceClient.getContainerClient(containerName) : null;\n};\n","import firebase from 'firebase/app';\nimport { getStorage } from 'firebase/storage';\nimport { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { FirebaseStorage } from 'firebase/storage';\nimport type { FirebaseApp } from 'firebase/app';\n\nlet firebaseInitCount = 0;\nlet firebaseApp: FirebaseApp | null = null;\n\nexport const initializeFirebase = () => {\n  if (firebaseApp) {\n    return firebaseApp;\n  }\n\n  const firebaseConfig = {\n    apiKey: process.env.FIREBASE_API_KEY,\n    authDomain: process.env.FIREBASE_AUTH_DOMAIN,\n    projectId: process.env.FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID,\n    storageBucket: process.env.FIREBASE_STORAGE_BUCKET,\n    messagingSenderId: process.env.FIREBASE_MESSAGING_SENDER_ID,\n    appId: process.env.FIREBASE_APP_ID,\n  };\n\n  if (Object.values(firebaseConfig).some((value) => !value)) {\n    if (firebaseInitCount === 0) {\n      logger.info(\n        '[Optional] Firebase CDN not initialized. Cannot initialize S3.');\n    return null;\n  }\n\n  // Read the custom endpoint if provided.\n  const endpoint = process.env.AWS_ENDPOINT_URL;\n  const accessKeyId = process.env.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID;\n  const secretAccessKey = process.env.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY;\n\n  const config = {\n    region,\n    // Conditionally add the endpoint if it is provided\n    ...(endpoint ? { endpoint } : {}),\n  };\n\n  if (accessKeyId && secretAccessKey) {\n    s3 = new S3Client({\n      ...config,\n      credentials: { accessKeyId, secretAccessKey },\n    });\n    logger.info('[initializeS3] S3 initialized with provided credentials.');\n  } else {\n    // When using IRSA, credentials are automatically provided via the IAM Role attached to the ServiceAccount.\n    s3 = new S3Client(config);\n    logger.info('[initializeS3] S3 initialized using default credentials (IRSA).');\n  }\n\n  return s3;\n};\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { FileSources } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { AppConfig } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { initializeAzureBlobService } from '~/cdn/azure';\nimport { initializeFirebase } from = (rateLimits?: TCustomConfig['rateLimits']) => {\n  if (!rateLimits) {\n    return;\n  }\n\n  const rateLimitKeys = {\n    fileUploads: RateLimitPrefix.FILE_UPLOAD,\n    conversationsImport: keyof typeof rateLimitKeys];\n    if (rateLimit) {\n      setRateLimitEnvVars(prefix, rateLimit);\n    }\n  });\n};\n\ntype RateLimitConfig = {\n  ipMax?: number | undefined;\n  ipWindowInMinutes?: number | undefined;\n  userMax?: number | undefined;\n  userWindowInMinutes?: number | undefined;\n};\n\n/**\n * Set environment variables for rate limit configurations\n *\n * @param prefix - Prefix   ipMax: `${prefix}_IP_MAX`,\n    ipWindowInMinutes: `${prefix}_IP_WINDOW`,\n    userMax: `${prefix}_USER_MAX`,\n    userWindowInMinutes: `${prefix}_USER_WINDOW`,\n  };\n\n  Object.entries(envVarsMapping).forEach(([key, envVar]) => {\n    const value = rateLimit[key as keyof RateLimitConfig];\n    if (value !== undefined) {\n      process.env[envVar] = value.toString();\n    }\n  });\n};\n","import { logger, webSearchKeys } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { Constants, extractVariableName } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { TCustomConfig } from
