FlowStateManager intervals...');\n      this.intervals.forEach((interval) => clearInterval(interval));\n      this.intervals.clear();\n      process.exit(0);\n    };\n\n    process.on('SIGTERM', cleanup);\n    process.on('SIGINT', cleanup);\n    process.on('SIGQUIT', cleanup);\n    process.on('SIGHUP', cleanup);\n  }\n\n  private getFlowKey(flowId: string, type: string): string {\n    return `${type}:${flowId}`;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Normalizes an expiration timestamp to milliseconds.\n   * Detects whether the input is in seconds or milliseconds based on magnitude.\n   * Timestamps below 10 billion are assumed to be in seconds (valid until ~2286).\n   * @param timestamp - The expiration timestamp (in seconds or milliseconds)\n   * @returns The timestamp normalized to milliseconds\n   */\n  private normalizeExpirationTimestamp(timestamp: number): number {\n    const SECONDS_THRESHOLD = 1e10;\n    if (timestamp < SECONDS_THRESHOLD) {\n      return timestamp * 1000;\n    }\n    return timestamp;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Checks if a flow's token has expired based on its expires_at field\n   * @param flowState - The flow state to check\n   * @returns true if the token has expired, false otherwise (including if no expires_at exists)\n   */\n  private isTokenExpired(flowState: FlowState<T> | undefined): boolean {\n    if (!flowState?.result) {\n      return false;\n    }\n\n    if (typeof flowState.result !== 'object') {\n      return false;\n    }\n\n    if (!('expires_at' in flowState.result)) {\n      return false;\n    }\n\n    const expiresAt = (flowState.result as { expires_at: unknown }).expires_at;\n\n    if (typeof expiresAt !== 'number' || !Number.isFinite(expiresAt)) {\n      return false;\n    }\n\n    const normalizedExpiresAt = this.normalizeExpirationTimestamp(expiresAt);\n    return normalizedExpiresAt < Date.now();\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Creates a new flow and waits for its completion\n   */\n  async createFlow(\n    flowId: string,\n    type: string,\n    metadata: FlowMetadata = {},\n    signal?: AbortSignal,\n  ): Promise<T> {\n    const flowKey = this.getFlowKey(flowId, type);\n\n    let existingState = (await this.keyv.get(flowKey)) as FlowState<T> | undefined;\n    if (existingState) {\n      logger.debug(`[${flowKey}] Flow already exists`);\n      return this.monitorFlow(flowKey, type, signal);\n    }\n\n    await new Promise((resolve) => setTimeout(resolve, 250));\n\n    existingState = (await this.keyv.get(flowKey)) as FlowState<T> | undefined;\n    if (existingState) {\n      logger.debug(`[${flowKey}] Flow exists on 2nd check`);\n      return this.monitorFlow(flowKey, type, signal);\n    }\n\n    const initialState: FlowState = {\n      type,\n      status: 'PENDING',\n      metadata,\n      createdAt: Date.now(),\n    };\n\n    logger.debug(`[${flowKey}] Creating initial flow state`);\n    await this.keyv.set(flowKey, initialState, this.ttl);\n    return this.monitorFlow(flowKey, type, signal);\n  }\n\n  private monitorFlow(flowKey: string, type: string, signal?: AbortSignal): Promise<T> {\n    return new Promise<T>((resolve, reject) => {\n      const checkInterval = 2000;\n      let elapsedTime = 0;\n      let isCleanedUp = false;\n      let intervalId: NodeJS.Timeout | null = null;\n\n      // Cleanup function to avoid duplicate cleanup\n      const cleanup = () => {\n        if (isCleanedUp) return;\n        isCleanedUp = true;\n        if (intervalId) {\n          clearInterval(intervalId);\n          this.intervals.delete(intervalId);\n        }\n        if (signal && abortHandler) {\n          signal.removeEventListener('abort', abortHandler);\n        }\n      };\n\n      // Immediate abort handler - responds instantly to abort signal\n      const abortHandler = async () => {\n        cleanup();\n        logger.warn(`[${flowKey}] Flow aborted (immediate)`);\n        const message = `${type} flow aborted`;\n        try {\n          await this.keyv.delete(flowKey);\n        } catch {\n          // Ignore delete errors during abort\n        }\n        reject(new Error(message));\n      };\n\n      // Register abort handler immediately if signal provided\n      if (signal) {\n        if (signal.aborted) {\n          // Already aborted, reject immediately\n          cleanup();\n          reject(new Error(`${type} flow aborted`));\n          return;\n        }\n        signal.addEventListener('abort', abortHandler, { once: true });\n      }\n\n      intervalId = setInterval(async () => {\n        if (isCleanedUp) return;\n\n        try {\n          const flowState = (await this.keyv.get(flowKey)) as FlowState<T> | undefined;\n\n          if (!flowState) {\n            cleanup();\n            logger.error(`[${flowKey}] Flow state not found`);\n            reject(new Error(`${type} Flow state not found`));\n            return;\n          }\n\n          if (signal?.aborted) {\n            cleanup();\n            logger.warn(`[${flowKey}] Flow aborted`);\n            const message = `${type} flow aborted`;\n            await this.keyv.delete(flowKey);\n            reject(new Error(message));\n            return;\n          }\n\n          if (flowState.status !== 'PENDING') {\n            cleanup();\n            logger.debug(`[${flowKey}] Flow completed`);\n\n            if (flowState.status === 'COMPLETED' && flowState.result !== undefined) {\n              resolve(flowState.result);\n            } else if (flowState.status === 'FAILED') {\n              await this.keyv.delete(flowKey);\n              reject(new Error(flowState.error ?? `${type} flow failed`));\n            }\n            return;\n          }\n\n          elapsedTime += checkInterval;\n          if (elapsedTime >= this.ttl) {\n            cleanup();\n            logger.error(\n              `[${flowKey}] Flow timed out | Elapsed time: ${elapsedTime} | TTL: ${this.ttl}`,\n            );\n            await this.keyv.delete(flowKey);\n            reject(new Error(`${type} flow timed out`));\n          }\n          logger.debug(`[${flowKey}] Flow state elapsed time: ${elapsedTime}, checking again...`);\n        } catch (error) {\n          logger.error(`[${flowKey}] Error checking flow state:`, error);\n          cleanup();\n          reject(error);\n        }\n      }, checkInterval);\n\n      this.intervals.add(intervalId);\n    });\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Completes a flow successfully\n   */\n  async completeFlow(flowId: string, type: string, result: T): Promise<boolean> {\n    const flowKey = this.getFlowKey(flowId, type);\n    const flowState = (await this.keyv.get(flowKey)) as FlowState<T> | undefined;\n\n    if (!flowState) {\n      logger.warn('[FlowStateManager] Cannot complete flow - flow state not found', {\n        flowId,\n        type,\n      });\n      return false;\n    }\n\n    /** Prevent duplicate completion */\n    if (flowState.status === 'COMPLETED') {\n      logger.debug(\n        '[FlowStateManager] Flow already completed, skipping to prevent duplicate completion',\n        {\n          flowId,\n          type,\n        },\n      );\n      return true;\n    }\n\n    const updatedState: FlowState<T> = {\n      ...flowState,\n      status: 'COMPLETED',\n      result,\n      completedAt: Date.now(),\n    };\n\n    await this.keyv.set(flowKey, updatedState, this.ttl);\n\n    logger.debug('[FlowStateManager] Flow completed successfully', {\n      flowId,\n      type,\n    });\n\n    return true;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Checks if a flow is stale based on its age and status\n   * @param flowId - The flow identifier\n   * @param type - The flow type\n   * @param staleThresholdMs - Age in milliseconds after which a non-pending flow is considered stale (default: 2 minutes)\n   * @returns Object with isStale boolean and age in milliseconds\n   */\n  async isFlowStale(\n    flowId: string,\n    type: string,\n    staleThresholdMs: number = 2 * 60 * 1000,\n  ): Promise<{ isStale: boolean; age: number; status?: string }> {\n    const flowKey = this.getFlowKey(flowId, type);\n    const flowState = (await this.keyv.get(flowKey)) as FlowState<T> | undefined;\n\n    if (!flowState) {\n      return { isStale: false, age: 0 };\n    }\n\n    if (flowState.status === 'PENDING') {\n      return { isStale: false, age: 0, status: flowState.status };\n    }\n\n    const completedAt = flowState.completedAt || flowState.failedAt;\n    const createdAt = flowState.createdAt;\n\n    let flowAge = 0;\n    if (completedAt) {\n      flowAge = Date.now() - completedAt;\n    } else if (createdAt) {\n      flowAge = Date.now() - createdAt;\n    }\n\n    return {\n      isStale: flowAge > staleThresholdMs,\n      age: flowAge,\n      status: flowState.status,\n    };\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Marks a flow as failed\n   */\n  async failFlow(flowId: string, type: string, error: Error | string): Promise<boolean> {\n    const flowKey = this.getFlowKey(flowId, type);\n    const flowState = (await this.keyv.get(flowKey)) as FlowState | undefined;\n\n    if (!flowState) {\n      return false;\n    }\n\n    const updatedState: FlowState = {\n      ...flowState,\n      status: 'FAILED',\n      error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : error,\n      failedAt: Date.now(),\n    };\n\n    await this.keyv.set(flowKey, updatedState, this.ttl);\n    return true;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Gets current flow state\n   */\n  async getFlowState(flowId: string, type: string): Promise<StoredDataNoRaw<FlowState<T>> | null> {\n    const flowKey = this.getFlowKey(flowId, type);\n    return this.keyv.get(flowKey);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Creates a new flow and waits for its completion, only executing the handler if no existing flow is found\n   * @param flowId - The ID of the flow\n   * @param type - The type of flow\n   * @param handler - Async function to execute if no existing flow is found\n   * @param signal - Optional AbortSignal to cancel the flow\n   */\n  async createFlowWithHandler(\n    flowId: string,\n    type: string,\n    handler: () => Promise<T>,\n    signal?: AbortSignal,\n  ): Promise<T> {\n    const flowKey = this.getFlowKey(flowId, type);\n    let existingState = (await this.keyv.get(flowKey)) as FlowState<T> | undefined;\n    if (existingState && !this.isTokenExpired(existingState)) {\n      logger.debug(`[${flowKey}] Flow already exists with valid token`);\n      return this.monitorFlow(flowKey, type, signal);\n    }\n\n    await new Promise((resolve) => setTimeout(resolve, 250));\n\n    existingState = (await this.keyv.get(flowKey)) as FlowState<T> | undefined;\n    if (existingState && !this.isTokenExpired(existingState)) {\n      logger.debug(`[${flowKey}] Flow exists on 2nd check with valid token`);\n      return this.monitorFlow(flowKey, type, signal);\n    }\n\n    const initialState: FlowState = {\n      type,\n      status: 'PENDING',\n      metadata: {},\n      createdAt: Date.now(),\n    };\n    logger.debug(`[${flowKey}] Creating initial flow state`);\n    await this.keyv.set(flowKey, initialState, this.ttl);\n\n    try {\n      const result = await handler();\n      await this.completeFlow(flowId, type, result);\n      return result;\n    } catch (error) {\n      await this.failFlow(flowId, type, error instanceof Error ? error : new Error(String(error)));\n      throw error;\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Deletes a flow state\n   */\n  async deleteFlow(flowId: string, type: string): Promise<boolean> {\n    const flowKey = this.getFlowKey(flowId, type);\n    try {\n      await this.keyv.delete(flowKey);\n      logger.debug(`[${flowKey}] Flow deleted`);\n      return true;\n    } catch (error) {\n      logger.error(`[${flowKey}] Error deleting flow:`, error);\n      return false;\n    }\n  }\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport {\n  Permissions,\n  EndpointURLs,\n  EModelEndpoint,\n  PermissionTypes,\n  isAgentsEndpoint,\n} from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { NextFunction, Request as ServerRequest, Response as ServerResponse } from 'express';\nimport type { IRole, IUser } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\n\nexport function skipAgentCheck(req?: ServerRequest): boolean {\n  if (!req || !req?.body?.endpoint) {\n    return false;\n  }\n\n  if (req.method !== 'POST') {\n    return false;\n  }\n\n  if (!req.originalUrl?.includes(EndpointURLs[EModelEndpoint.agents])) {\n    return false;\n  }\n  return !isAgentsEndpoint(req.body.endpoint);\n}\n\n/**\n * Core function to check if a user has one or more required permissions\n * @param user - The user object\n * @param permissionType - The type of permission to check\n * @param permissions - The list of specific permissions to check\n * @param bodyProps - An optional object where keys are permissions and values are arrays of properties to check\n * @param checkObject - The object to check properties against\n * @param skipCheck - An optional function that takes the checkObject and returns true to skip permission checking\n * @returns Whether the user has the required permissions\n */\nexport const checkAccess = async ({\n  req,\n  user,\n  permissionType,\n  permissions,\n  getRoleByName,\n  bodyProps = {} as Record<Permissions, string[]>,\n  checkObject = {},\n  skipCheck,\n}: {\n  user: IUser;\n  req?: ServerRequest;\n  permissionType: PermissionTypes;\n  permissions: Permissions[];\n  bodyProps?: Record<Permissions, string[]>;\n  checkObject?: object;\n  /** If skipCheck function is provided and returns true, skip permission checking */\n  skipCheck?: (req?: ServerRequest) => boolean;\n  getRoleByName: (roleName: string, fieldsToSelect?: string | string[]) => Promise<IRole | null>;\n}): Promise<boolean> => {\n  if (skipCheck && skipCheck(req)) {\n    return true;\n  }\n\n  if (!user || !user.role) {\n    return false;\n  }\n\n  const role = await getRoleByName(user.role);\n  const permissionValue = role?.permissions?.[permissionType as keyof typeof role.permissions];\n  if (role && role.permissions && permissionValue) {\n    const hasAnyPermission = permissions.every((permission) => {\n      if (permissionValue[permission as keyof typeof permissionValue]) {\n        return true;\n      }\n\n      if (bodyProps[permission] && checkObject) {\n        return bodyProps[permission].every((prop) =>\n          Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(checkObject, prop),\n        );\n      }\n\n      return false;\n    });\n\n    return hasAnyPermission;\n  }\n\n  return false;\n};\n\n/**\n * Middleware to check if a user has one or more required permissions, optionally based on `req.body` properties.\n * @param permissionType - The type of permission to check.\n * @param permissions - The list of specific permissions to check.\n * @param bodyProps - An optional object where keys are permissions and values are arrays of `req.body` properties to check.\n * @param skipCheck - An optional function that takes req.body and returns true to skip permission checking.\n * @param getRoleByName - A function to get the role by name.\n * @returns Express middleware function.\n */\nexport const generateCheckAccess = ({\n  permissionType,\n  permissions,\n  bodyProps = {} as Record<Permissions, string[]>,\n  skipCheck,\n  getRoleByName,\n}: {\n  permissionType: PermissionTypes;\n  permissions: Permissions[];\n  bodyProps?: Record<Permissions, string[]>;\n  skipCheck?: (req?: ServerRequest) => boolean;\n  getRoleByName: (roleName: string, fieldsToSelect?: string | string[]) => Promise<IRole | null>;\n}): ((req: ServerRequest, res: ServerResponse, next: NextFunction) => Promise<unknown>) => {\n  return async (req, res, next) => {\n    try {\n      const hasAccess = await checkAccess({\n        req,\n        user: req.user as IUser,\n        permissionType,\n        permissions,\n        bodyProps,\n        checkObject: req.body,\n        skipCheck,\n        getRoleByName,\n      });\n\n      if (hasAccess) {\n        return next();\n      }\n\n      logger.warn(\n        `[${permissionType}] Forbidden: \"${req.originalUrl}\" - Insufficient permissions for User ${(req.user as IUser)?.id}: ${permissions.join(', ')}`,\n      );\n      return res.status(403).json({ message: 'Forbidden: Insufficient permissions' });\n    } catch (error) {\n      logger.error(error);\n      return res.status(500).json({\n        message: `Server error: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error'}`,\n      });\n    }\n  };\n};\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { SystemRoles } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { NextFunction, Response } from 'express';\nimport type { ServerRequest } from '~/types/http';\n\n/**\n * Middleware to check if authenticated user has admin role.\n * Should be used AFTER authentication middleware (requireJwtAuth, requireLocalAuth, etc.)\n */\nexport const requireAdmin = (req: ServerRequest, res: Response, next: NextFunction) => {\n  if (!req.user) {\n    logger.warn('[requireAdmin] No user found in request');\n    return res.status(401).json({\n      error: 'Authentication required',\n      error_code: 'AUTHENTICATION_REQUIRED',\n    });\n  }\n\n  if (!req.user.role || req.user.role !== SystemRoles.ADMIN) {\n    logger.debug(`[requireAdmin] Access denied for non-admin user: ${req.user.email}`);\n    return res.status(403).json({\n      error: 'Access denied: Admin privileges required',\n      error_code: 'ADMIN_REQUIRED',\n    });\n  }\n\n  next();\n};\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { ErrorTypes } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { NextFunction, Request, Response } from 'express';\nimport type { MongoServerError, ValidationError, CustomError } from '~/types';\n\nconst handleDuplicateKeyError = (err: MongoServerError, res: Response) => {\n  logger.warn('Duplicate key error: ' + (err.errmsg || err.message));\n  const field = err.keyValue ? `${JSON.stringify(Object.keys(err.keyValue))}` : 'unknown';\n  const code = 409;\n  res\n    .status(code)\n    .send({ messages: `An document with that ${field} already exists.`, fields: field });\n};\n\nconst handleValidationError = (err: ValidationError, res: Response) => {\n  logger.error('Validation error:', err.errors);\n  const errorMessages = Object.values(err.errors).map((el) => el.message);\n  const fields = `${JSON.stringify(Object.values(err.errors).map((el) => el.path))}`;\n  const code = 400;\n  const messages =\n    errorMessages.length > 1\n      ? `${JSON.stringify(errorMessages.join(' '))}`\n      : `${JSON.stringify(errorMessages)}`;\n\n  res.status(code).send({ messages, fields });\n};\n\n/** Type guard for ValidationError */\nfunction isValidationError(err: unknown): err is ValidationError {\n  return err !== null && typeof err === 'object' && 'name' in err && err.name === 'ValidationError';\n}\n\n/** Type guard for MongoServerError (duplicate key) */\nfunction isMongoServerError(err: unknown): err is MongoServerError {\n  return err !== null && typeof err === 'object' && 'code' in err && err.code === 11000;\n}\n\n/** Type guard for CustomError with statusCode and body */\nfunction isCustomError(err: unknown): err is CustomError {\n  return err !== null && typeof err === 'object' && 'statusCode' in err && 'body' in err;\n}\n\nexport const ErrorController = (\n  err: Error | CustomError,\n  req: Request,\n  res: Response,\n  next: NextFunction,\n): Response | void => {\n  try {\n    if (!err) {\n      return next();\n    }\n    const error = err as CustomError;\n\n    if (\n      (error.message === ErrorTypes.AUTH_FAILED || error.code === ErrorTypes.AUTH_FAILED) &&\n      req.originalUrl &&\n      req.originalUrl.includes('/oauth/') &&\n      req.originalUrl.includes('/callback')\n    ) {\n      const domain = process.env.DOMAIN_CLIENT || 'http://localhost:3080';\n      return res.redirect(`${domain}/login?redirect=false&error=${ErrorTypes.AUTH_FAILED}`);\n    }\n\n    if (isValidationError(error)) {\n      return handleValidationError(error, res);\n    }\n\n    if (isMongoServerError(error)) {\n      return handleDuplicateKeyError(error, res);\n    }\n\n    if (isCustomError(error) && error.statusCode && error.body) {\n      return res.status(error.statusCode).send(error.body);\n    }\n\n    logger.error('ErrorController => error', err);\n    return res.status(500).send('An unknown error occurred.');\n  } catch (processingError) {\n    logger.error('ErrorController => processing error', processingError);\n    return res.status(500).send('Processing error in ErrorController.');\n  }\n};\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { NextFunction, Request as ServerRequest, Response as ServerResponse } from 'express';\nimport type { IBalance, IUser, BalanceConfig, ObjectId, AppConfig } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { Model } from 'mongoose';\nimport type { BalanceUpdateFields } from '~/types';\nimport { getBalanceConfig } from '~/app/config';\n\nexport interface BalanceMiddlewareOptions {\n  getAppConfig: (options?: { role?: string; refresh?: boolean }) => Promise<AppConfig>;\n  Balance: Model<IBalance>;\n}\n\n/**\n * Build an object containing fields that need updating\n * @param config - The balance configuration\n * @param userRecord - The user's current balance record, if any\n * @param userId - The user's ID\n * @returns Fields that need updating\n */\nfunction buildUpdateFields(\n  config: BalanceConfig,\n  userRecord: IBalance | null,\n  userId: string,\n): BalanceUpdateFields {\n  const updateFields: BalanceUpdateFields = {};\n\n  // Ensure user record has the required fields\n  if (!userRecord) {\n    updateFields.user = userId;\n    updateFields.tokenCredits = config.startBalance;\n  }\n\n  if (userRecord?.tokenCredits == null && config.startBalance != null) {\n    updateFields.tokenCredits = config.startBalance;\n  }\n\n  const isAutoRefillConfigValid =\n    config.autoRefillEnabled &&\n    config.refillIntervalValue != null &&\n    config.refillIntervalUnit != null &&\n    config.refillAmount != null;\n\n  if (!isAutoRefillConfigValid) {\n    return updateFields;\n  }\n\n  if (userRecord?.autoRefillEnabled !== config.autoRefillEnabled) {\n    updateFields.autoRefillEnabled = config.autoRefillEnabled;\n  }\n\n  if (userRecord?.refillIntervalValue !== config.refillIntervalValue) {\n    updateFields.refillIntervalValue = config.refillIntervalValue;\n  }\n\n  if (userRecord?.refillIntervalUnit !== config.refillIntervalUnit) {\n    updateFields.refillIntervalUnit = config.refillIntervalUnit;\n  }\n\n  if (userRecord?.refillAmount !== config.refillAmount) {\n    updateFields.refillAmount = config.refillAmount;\n  }\n\n  // Initialize lastRefill if it's missing when auto-refill is enabled\n  if (config.autoRefillEnabled && !userRecord?.lastRefill) {\n    updateFields.lastRefill = new Date();\n  }\n\n  return updateFields;\n}\n\n/**\n * Factory function to create middleware that synchronizes user balance settings with current balance configuration.\n * @param options - Options containing getBalanceConfig function and Balance model\n * @returns Express middleware function\n */\nexport function createSetBalanceConfig({\n  getAppConfig,\n  Balance,\n}: BalanceMiddlewareOptions): (\n  req: ServerRequest,\n  res: ServerResponse,\n  next: NextFunction,\n) => Promise<void> {\n  return async (req: ServerRequest, res: ServerResponse, next: NextFunction): Promise<void> => {\n    try {\n      const user = req.user as IUser & { _id: string | ObjectId };\n      const appConfig = await getAppConfig({ role: user?.role });\n      const balanceConfig = getBalanceConfig(appConfig);\n      if (!balanceConfig?.enabled) {\n        return next();\n      }\n      if (balanceConfig.startBalance == null) {\n        return next();\n      }\n\n      if (!user || !user._id) {\n        return next();\n      }\n      const userId = typeof user._id === 'string' ? user._id : user._id.toString();\n      const userBalanceRecord = await Balance.findOne({ user: userId }).lean();\n      const updateFields = buildUpdateFields(balanceConfig, userBalanceRecord, userId);\n\n      if (Object.keys(updateFields).length === 0) {\n        return next();\n      }\n\n      await Balance.findOneAndUpdate(\n        { user: userId },\n        { $set: updateFields },\n        { upsert: true, new: true },\n      );\n\n      next();\n    } catch (error) {\n      logger.error('Error setting user balance:', error);\n      next(error);\n    }\n  };\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { Request, Response, NextFunction } from 'express';\n\n/**\n * Middleware to handle JSON parsing errors from express.json()\n * Prevents user input from being reflected in error messages (XSS prevention)\n *\n * This middleware should be placed immediately after express.json() middleware.\n *\n * @param err - Error object from express.json()\n * @param req - Express request object\n * @param res - Express response object\n * @param next - Express next function\n *\n * @example\n * app.use(express.json({ limit: '3mb' }));\n * app.use(handleJsonParseError);\n */\nexport function handleJsonParseError(\n  err: Error & { status?: number; body?: unknown },\n  req: Request,\n  res: Response,\n  next: NextFunction,\n): void {\n  if (err instanceof SyntaxError && err.status === 400 && 'body' in err) {\n    logger.warn('[JSON Parse Error] Invalid JSON received', {\n      path: req.path,\n      method: req.method,\n      ip: req.ip,\n    });\n\n    res.status(400).json({\n      error: 'Invalid JSON format',\n      message: 'The request body contains malformed JSON',\n    });\n    return;\n  }\n\n  next(err);\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { CacheKeys, Time, ViolationTypes } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport { standardCache, cacheConfig, ioredisClient } from '~/cache';\nimport { isEnabled, math } from '~/utils';\n\nconst { USE_REDIS } = cacheConfig;\n\nconst LIMIT_CONCURRENT_MESSAGES = process.env.LIMIT_CONCURRENT_MESSAGES;\nconst CONCURRENT_MESSAGE_MAX = math(process.env.CONCURRENT_MESSAGE_MAX, 2);\nconst CONCURRENT_VIOLATION_SCORE = math(process.env.CONCURRENT_VIOLATION_SCORE, 1);\n\n/** Lazily initialized cache for pending requests (used only for in-memory fallback) */\nlet pendingReqCache: ReturnType<typeof standardCache> | null = null;\n\n/**\n * Get or create the pending requests cache for in-memory fallback.\n * Uses lazy initialization to avoid creating cache before app is ready.\n */\nfunction getPendingReqCache(): ReturnType<typeof standardCache> | null {\n  if (!isEnabled(LIMIT_CONCURRENT_MESSAGES)) {\n    return null;\n  }\n  if (!pendingReqCache) {\n    pendingReqCache = standardCache(CacheKeys.PENDING_REQ);\n  }\n  return pendingReqCache;\n}\n\n/**\n * Build the cache key for a user's pending requests.\n * Note: ioredisClient already has keyPrefix applied, so we only add namespace:userId\n */\nfunction buildKey(userId: string): string {\n  const namespace = CacheKeys.PENDING_REQ;\n  return `${namespace}:${userId}`;\n}\n\n/**\n * Build the cache key for in-memory fallback (Keyv).\n */\nfunction buildMemoryKey(userId: string): string {\n  return `:${userId}`;\n}\n\nexport interface PendingRequestResult {\n  allowed: boolean;\n  pendingRequests: number;\n  limit: number;\n}\n\nexport interface ViolationInfo {\n  type: string;\n  limit: number;\n  pendingRequests: number;\n  score: number;\n}\n\n/**\n * Check if a user can make a new concurrent request and increment the counter if allowed.\n * This is designed for resumable streams where the HTTP response lifecycle doesn't match\n * the actual request processing lifecycle.\n *\n * When Redis is available, uses atomic INCR to prevent race conditions.\n * Falls back to non-atomic get/set for in-memory cache.\n *\n * @param userId - The user's ID\n * @returns Object with `allowed` (boolean), `pendingRequests` (current count), and `limit`\n */\nexport async function checkAndIncrementPendingRequest(\n  userId: string,\n): Promise<PendingRequestResult> {\n  const limit = Math.max(CONCURRENT_MESSAGE_MAX, 1);\n\n  if (!isEnabled(LIMIT_CONCURRENT_MESSAGES)) {\n    return { allowed: true, pendingRequests: 0, limit };\n  }\n\n  if (!userId) {\n    logger.warn('[concurrency] checkAndIncrementPendingRequest called without userId');\n    return { allowed: true, pendingRequests: 0, limit };\n  }\n\n  // Use atomic Redis INCR when available to prevent race conditions\n  if (USE_REDIS && ioredisClient) {\n    const key = buildKey(userId);\n    try {\n      // Pipeline ensures INCR and EXPIRE execute atomically in one round-trip\n      // This prevents edge cases where crash between operations leaves key without TTL\n      const pipeline = ioredisClient.pipeline();\n      pipeline.incr(key);\n      pipeline.expire(key, 60);\n      const results = await pipeline.exec();\n\n      if (!results || results[0][0]) {\n        throw new Error('Pipeline execution failed');\n      }\n\n      const newCount = results[0][1] as number;\n\n      if (newCount > limit) {\n        // Over limit - decrement back and reject\n        await ioredisClient.decr(key);\n        logger.debug(\n          `[concurrency] User ${userId} exceeded concurrent limit: ${newCount}/${limit}`,\n        );\n        return { allowed: false, pendingRequests: newCount, limit };\n      }\n\n      logger.debug(\n        `[concurrency] User ${userId} incremented pending requests: ${newCount}/${limit}`,\n      );\n      return { allowed: true, pendingRequests: newCount, limit };\n    } catch (error) {\n      logger.error('[concurrency] Redis atomic increment failed:', error);\n      // On Redis error, allow the request to proceed (fail-open)\n      return { allowed: true, pendingRequests: 0, limit };\n    }\n  }\n\n  // Fallback: non-atomic in-memory cache (race condition possible but acceptable for in-memory)\n  const cache = getPendingReqCache();\n  if (!cache) {\n    return { allowed: true, pendingRequests: 0, limit };\n  }\n\n  const key = buildMemoryKey(userId);\n  const pendingRequests = +((await cache.get(key)) ?? 0);\n\n  if (pendingRequests >= limit) {\n    logger.debug(\n      `[concurrency] User ${userId} exceeded concurrent limit: ${pendingRequests}/${limit}`,\n    );\n    return { allowed: false, pendingRequests, limit };\n  }\n\n  await cache.set(key, pendingRequests + 1, Time.ONE_MINUTE);\n  logger.debug(\n    `[concurrency] User ${userId} incremented pending requests: ${pendingRequests + 1}/${limit}`,\n  );\n\n  return { allowed: true, pendingRequests: pendingRequests + 1, limit };\n}\n\n/**\n * Decrement the pending request counter for a user.\n * Should be called when a generation job completes, errors, or is aborted.\n *\n * This function handles errors internally and will never throw - it's a cleanup\n * operation that should not interrupt the main flow if cache operations fail.\n *\n * When Redis is available, uses atomic DECR to prevent race conditions.\n * Falls back to non-atomic get/set for in-memory cache.\n *\n * @param userId - The user's ID\n */\nexport async function decrementPendingRequest(userId: string): Promise<void> {\n  try {\n    if (!isEnabled(LIMIT_CONCURRENT_MESSAGES)) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    if (!userId) {\n      logger.warn('[concurrency] decrementPendingRequest called without userId');\n      return;\n    }\n\n    // Use atomic Redis DECR when available\n    if (USE_REDIS && ioredisClient) {\n      const key = buildKey(userId);\n      try {\n        const newCount = await ioredisClient.decr(key);\n        if (newCount < 0) {\n          // Counter went negative - reset to 0 and delete\n          await ioredisClient.del(key);\n          logger.debug(`[concurrency] User ${userId} pending requests cleared (was negative)`);\n        } else if (newCount === 0) {\n          // Clean up zero-value keys\n          await ioredisClient.del(key);\n          logger.debug(`[concurrency] User ${userId} pending requests cleared`);\n        } else {\n          logger.debug(`[concurrency] User ${userId} decremented pending requests: ${newCount}`);\n        }\n      } catch (error) {\n        logger.error('[concurrency] Redis atomic decrement failed:', error);\n      }\n      return;\n    }\n\n    // Fallback: non-atomic in-memory cache\n    const cache = getPendingReqCache();\n    if (!cache) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    const key = buildMemoryKey(userId);\n    const currentReq = +((await cache.get(key)) ?? 0);\n\n    if (currentReq >= 1) {\n      await cache.set(key, currentReq - 1, Time.ONE_MINUTE);\n      logger.debug(`[concurrency] User ${userId} decremented pending requests: ${currentReq - 1}`);\n    } else {\n      await cache.delete(key);\n      logger.debug(`[concurrency] User ${userId} pending requests cleared (was ${currentReq})`);\n    }\n  } catch (error) {\n    logger.error('[concurrency] Error decrementing pending request:', error);\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Get violation info for logging purposes when a user exceeds the concurrent request limit.\n */\nexport function getViolationInfo(pendingRequests: number, limit: number): ViolationInfo {\n  return {\n    type: ViolationTypes.CONCURRENT,\n    limit,\n    pendingRequests,\n    score: CONCURRENT_VIOLATION_SCORE,\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Check if concurrent message limiting is enabled.\n */\nexport function isConcurrentLimitEnabled(): boolean {\n  return isEnabled(LIMIT_CONCURRENT_MESSAGES);\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { FileSources } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { Agent, AgentAvatar } from 'librechat-data-provider';\n\nconst MAX_AVATAR_REFRESH_AGENTS = 1000;\nconst AVATAR_REFRESH_BATCH_SIZE = 20;\n\nexport { MAX_AVATAR_REFRESH_AGENTS, AVATAR_REFRESH_BATCH_SIZE };\n\nexport type RefreshS3UrlFn = (avatar: AgentAvatar) => Promise<string | undefined>;\n\nexport type UpdateAgentFn = (\n  searchParams: { id: string },\n  updateData: { avatar: AgentAvatar },\n  options: { updatingUserId: string; skipVersioning: boolean },\n) => Promise<unknown>;\n\nexport type RefreshListAvatarsParams = {\n  agents: Agent[];\n  userId: string;\n  refreshS3Url: RefreshS3UrlFn;\n  updateAgent: UpdateAgentFn;\n};\n\nexport type RefreshStats = {\n  updated: number;\n  not_s3: number;\n  no_id: number;\n  no_change: number;\n  s3_error: number;\n  persist_error: number;\n};\n\n/**\n * Opportunistically refreshes S3-backed avatars for agent list responses.\n * Processes agents in batches to prevent database connection pool exhaustion.\n * Only list responses are refreshed because they're the highest-traffic surface and\n * the avatar URLs have a short-lived TTL. The refresh is cached per-user for 30 minutes\n * so we refresh once per interval at most.\n *\n * Any user with VIEW access to an agent can refresh its avatar URL. This ensures\n * avatars remain accessible even when the owner hasn't logged in recently.\n * The agents array should already be filtered to only include agents the user can access.\n */\nexport const refreshListAvatars = async ({\n  agents,\n  userId,\n  refreshS3Url,\n  updateAgent,\n}: RefreshListAvatarsParams): Promise<RefreshStats> => {\n  const stats: RefreshStats = {\n    updated: 0,\n    not_s3: 0,\n    no_id: 0,\n    no_change: 0,\n    s3_error: 0,\n    persist_error: 0,\n  };\n\n  if (!agents?.length) {\n    return stats;\n  }\n\n  logger.debug('[refreshListAvatars] Refreshing S3 avatars for agents: %d', agents.length);\n\n  for (let i = 0; i < agents.length; i += AVATAR_REFRESH_BATCH_SIZE) {\n    const batch = agents.slice(i, i + AVATAR_REFRESH_BATCH_SIZE);\n\n    await Promise.all(\n      batch.map(async (agent) => {\n        if (agent?.avatar?.source !== FileSources.s3 || !agent?.avatar?.filepath) {\n          stats.not_s3++;\n          return;\n        }\n\n        if (!agent?.id) {\n          logger.debug(\n            '[refreshListAvatars] Skipping S3 avatar refresh for agent: %s, ID is not set',\n            agent._id,\n          );\n          stats.no_id++;\n          return;\n        }\n\n        try {\n          logger.debug('[refreshListAvatars] Refreshing S3 avatar for agent: %s', agent._id);\n          const newPath = await refreshS3Url(agent.avatar);\n\n          if (newPath && newPath !== agent.avatar.filepath) {\n            try {\n              await updateAgent(\n                { id: agent.id },\n                {\n                  avatar: {\n                    filepath: newPath,\n                    source: agent.avatar.source,\n                  },\n                },\n                {\n                  updatingUserId: userId,\n                  skipVersioning: true,\n                },\n              );\n              stats.updated++;\n            } catch (persistErr) {\n              logger.error('[refreshListAvatars] Avatar refresh persist error: %o', persistErr);\n              stats.persist_error++;\n            }\n          } else {\n            stats.no_change++;\n          }\n        } catch (err) {\n          logger.error('[refreshListAvatars] S3 avatar refresh error: %o', err);\n          stats.s3_error++;\n        }\n      }),\n    );\n  }\n\n  logger.info('[refreshListAvatars] Avatar refresh summary: %o', stats);\n  return stats;\n};\n","import { PromptTemplate } from '@langchain/core/prompts';\nimport { BaseMessage, getBufferString } from '@langchain/core/messages';\nimport type { GraphEdge } from '@librechat/agents';\n\nconst DEFAULT_PROMPT_TEMPLATE = `Based on the following conversation and analysis from previous agents, please provide your insights:\\n\\n{convo}\\n\\nPlease add your specific expertise and perspective to this discussion.`;\n\n/**\n * Helper function to create sequential chain edges with buffer string prompts\n *\n * @deprecated Agent Chain helper\n * @param agentIds - Array of agent IDs in order of execution\n * @param promptTemplate - Optional prompt template string; defaults to a predefined template if not provided\n * @returns Array of edges configured for sequential chain with buffer prompts\n */\nexport async function createSequentialChainEdges(\n  agentIds: string[],\n  promptTemplate = DEFAULT_PROMPT_TEMPLATE,\n): Promise<GraphEdge[]> {\n  const edges: GraphEdge[] = [];\n\n  for (let i = 0; i < agentIds.length - 1; i++) {\n    const fromAgent = agentIds[i];\n    const toAgent = agentIds[i + 1];\n\n    edges.push({\n      from: fromAgent,\n      to: toAgent,\n      edgeType: 'direct',\n      // Use a prompt function to create the buffer string from all previous results\n      prompt: async (messages: BaseMessage[], startIndex: number) => {\n        /** Only the messages from this run (after startIndex) are passed in */\n        const runMessages = messages.slice(startIndex);\n        const bufferString = getBufferString(runMessages);\n        const template = PromptTemplate.fromTemplate(promptTemplate);\n        const result = await template.invoke({\n          convo: bufferString,\n        });\n        return result.value;\n      },\n      /** Critical: exclude previous results so only the prompt is passed */\n      excludeResults: true,\n      description: `Sequential chain from ${fromAgent} to ${toAgent}`,\n    });\n  }\n\n  return edges;\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { isAgentsEndpoint } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport { labelContentByAgent, getTokenCountForMessage } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type { MessageContentComplex } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type { Agent, TMessage } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { BaseMessage } from '@langchain/core/messages';\nimport type { ServerRequest } from '~/types';\nimport Tokenizer from '~/utils/tokenizer';\nimport { logAxiosError } from '~/utils';\n\nexport const omitTitleOptions = new Set([\n  'stream',\n  'thinking',\n  'streaming',\n  'clientOptions',\n  'thinkingConfig',\n  'thinkingBudget',\n  'includeThoughts',\n  'maxOutputTokens',\n  'additionalModelRequestFields',\n]);\n\nexport function payloadParser({ req, endpoint }: { req: ServerRequest; endpoint: string }) {\n  if (isAgentsEndpoint(endpoint)) {\n    return;\n  }\n  return req.body?.endpointOption?.model_parameters;\n}\n\nexport function createTokenCounter(encoding: Parameters<typeof Tokenizer.getTokenCount>[1]) {\n  return function (message: BaseMessage) {\n    const countTokens = (text: string) => Tokenizer.getTokenCount(text, encoding);\n    return getTokenCountForMessage(message, countTokens);\n  };\n}\n\nexport function logToolError(_graph: unknown, error: unknown, toolId: string) {\n  logAxiosError({\n    error,\n    message: `[api/server/controllers/agents/client.js #chatCompletion] Tool Error \"${toolId}\"`,\n  });\n}\n\nconst AGENT_SUFFIX_PATTERN = /____(\\d+)$/;\n\n/** Finds the primary agent ID within a set of agent IDs (no suffix or lowest suffix number) */\nexport function findPrimaryAgentId(agentIds: Set<string>): string | null {\n  let primaryAgentId: string | null = null;\n  let lowestSuffixIndex = Infinity;\n\n  for (const agentId of agentIds) {\n    const suffixMatch = agentId.match(AGENT_SUFFIX_PATTERN);\n    if (!suffixMatch) {\n      return agentId;\n    }\n    const suffixIndex = parseInt(suffixMatch[1], 10);\n    if (suffixIndex < lowestSuffixIndex) {\n      lowestSuffixIndex = suffixIndex;\n      primaryAgentId = agentId;\n    }\n  }\n\n  return primaryAgentId;\n}\n\ntype ContentPart = TMessage['content'] extends (infer U)[] | undefined ? U : never;\n\n/**\n * Creates a mapMethod for getMessagesForConversation that processes agent content.\n * - Strips agentId/groupId metadata from all content\n * - For parallel agents (addedConvo with groupId): filters each group to its primary agent\n * - For handoffs (agentId without groupId): keeps all content from all agents\n * - For multi-agent: applies agent labels to content\n *\n * The key distinction:\n * - Parallel execution (addedConvo): Parts have both agentId AND groupId\n * - Handoffs: Parts only have agentId, no groupId\n */\nexport function createMultiAgentMapper(primaryAgent: Agent, agentConfigs?: Map<string, Agent>) {\n  const hasMultipleAgents = (primaryAgent.edges?.length ?? 0) > 0 || (agentConfigs?.size ?? 0) > 0;\n\n  let agentNames: Record<string, string> | null = null;\n  if (hasMultipleAgents) {\n    agentNames = { [primaryAgent.id]: primaryAgent.name || 'Assistant' };\n    if (agentConfigs) {\n      for (const [agentId, agentConfig] of agentConfigs.entries()) {\n        agentNames[agentId] = agentConfig.name || agentConfig.id;\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  return (message: TMessage): TMessage => {\n    if (message.isCreatedByUser || !Array.isArray(message.content)) {\n      return message;\n    }\n\n    const hasAgentMetadata = message.content.some(\n      (part) =>\n        (part as ContentPart & { agentId?: string; groupId?: number })?.agentId ||\n        (part as ContentPart & { groupId?: number })?.groupId != null,\n    );\n    if (!hasAgentMetadata) {\n      return message;\n    }\n\n    try {\n      const groupAgentMap = new Map<number, Set<string>>();\n\n      for (const part of message.content) {\n        const p = part as ContentPart & { agentId?: string; groupId?: number };\n        const groupId = p?.groupId;\n        const agentId = p?.agentId;\n        if (groupId != null && agentId) {\n          if (!groupAgentMap.has(groupId)) {\n            groupAgentMap.set(groupId, new Set());\n          }\n          groupAgentMap.get(groupId)!.add(agentId);\n        }\n      }\n\n      const groupPrimaryMap = new Map<number, string>();\n      for (const [groupId, agentIds] of groupAgentMap) {\n        const primary = findPrimaryAgentId(agentIds);\n        if (primary) {\n          groupPrimaryMap.set(groupId, primary);\n        }\n      }\n\n      const filteredContent: ContentPart[] = [];\n      const agentIdMap: Record<number, string> = {};\n\n      for (const part of message.content) {\n        const p = part as ContentPart & { agentId?: string; groupId?: number };\n        const agentId = p?.agentId;\n        const groupId = p?.groupId;\n\n        const isParallelPart = groupId != null;\n        const groupPrimary = isParallelPart ? groupPrimaryMap.get(groupId) : null;\n        const shouldInclude = !isParallelPart || !agentId || agentId === groupPrimary;\n\n        if (shouldInclude) {\n          const newIndex = filteredContent.length;\n          const { agentId: _a, groupId: _g, ...cleanPart } = p;\n          filteredContent.push(cleanPart as ContentPart);\n          if (agentId && hasMultipleAgents) {\n            agentIdMap[newIndex] = agentId;\n          }\n        }\n      }\n\n      const finalContent =\n        Object.keys(agentIdMap).length > 0 && agentNames\n          ? labelContentByAgent(filteredContent as MessageContentComplex[], agentIdMap, agentNames)\n          : filteredContent;\n\n      return { ...message, content: finalContent as TMessage['content'] };\n    } catch (error) {\n      logger.error('[AgentClient] Error processing multi-agent message:', error);\n      return message;\n    }\n  };\n}\n","import { DynamicStructuredTool } from '@langchain/core/tools';\nimport { Constants } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { Agent, TEphemeralAgent } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { LCTool } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type { Logger } from 'winston';\nimport type { MCPManager } from '~/mcp/MCPManager';\n\n/**\n * Agent type with optional tools array that can contain DynamicStructuredTool or string.\n * For context operations, we only require id and instructions, other Agent fields are optional.\n */\nexport type AgentWithTools = Pick<Agent, 'id'> &\n  Partial<Omit<Agent, 'id' | 'tools'>> & {\n    tools?: Array<DynamicStructuredTool | string>;\n    /** Serializable tool definitions for event-driven mode */\n    toolDefinitions?: LCTool[];\n  };\n\n/**\n * Extracts unique MCP server names from an agent's tools or tool definitions.\n * Supports both full tool instances (tools) and serializable definitions (toolDefinitions).\n * @param agent - The agent with tools and/or tool definitions\n * @returns Array of unique MCP server names\n */\nexport function extractMCPServers(agent: AgentWithTools): string[] {\n  const mcpServers = new Set<string>();\n\n  /** Check tool instances (non-event-driven mode) */\n  if (agent?.tools?.length) {\n    for (const tool of agent.tools) {\n      if (tool instanceof DynamicStructuredTool && tool.name.includes(Constants.mcp_delimiter)) {\n        const serverName = tool.name.split(Constants.mcp_delimiter).pop();\n        if (serverName) {\n          mcpServers.add(serverName);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  /** Check tool definitions (event-driven mode) */\n  if (agent?.toolDefinitions?.length) {\n    for (const toolDef of agent.toolDefinitions) {\n      if (toolDef.name?.includes(Constants.mcp_delimiter)) {\n        const serverName = toolDef.name.split(Constants.mcp_delimiter).pop();\n        if (serverName) {\n          mcpServers.add(serverName);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  return Array.from(mcpServers);\n}\n\n/**\n * Fetches MCP instructions for the given server names.\n * @param {string[]} mcpServers - Array of MCP server names\n * @param {MCPManager} mcpManager - MCP manager instance\n * @param {Logger} [logger] - Optional logger instance\n * @returns {Promise<string>} MCP instructions string, empty if none\n */\nexport async function getMCPInstructionsForServers(\n  mcpServers: string[],\n  mcpManager: MCPManager,\n  logger?: Logger,\n): Promise<string> {\n  if (!mcpServers.length) {\n    return '';\n  }\n  try {\n    const mcpInstructions = await mcpManager.formatInstructionsForContext(mcpServers);\n    if (mcpInstructions && logger) {\n      logger.debug('[AgentContext] Fetched MCP instructions for servers:', mcpServers);\n    }\n    return mcpInstructions || '';\n  } catch (error) {\n    if (logger) {\n      logger.error('[AgentContext] Failed to get MCP instructions:', error);\n    }\n    return '';\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Builds final instructions for an agent by combining shared run context and agent-specific context.\n * Order: sharedRunContext -> baseInstructions -> mcpInstructions\n *\n * @param {Object} params\n * @param {string} [params.sharedRunContext] - Run-level context shared by all agents (file context, RAG, memory)\n * @param {string} [params.baseInstructions] - Agent's base instructions\n * @param {string} [params.mcpInstructions] - Agent's MCP server instructions\n * @returns {string | undefined} Combined instructions, or undefined if empty\n */\nexport function buildAgentInstructions({\n  sharedRunContext,\n  baseInstructions,\n  mcpInstructions,\n}: {\n  sharedRunContext?: string;\n  baseInstructions?: string;\n  mcpInstructions?: string;\n}): string | undefined {\n  const parts = [sharedRunContext, baseInstructions, mcpInstructions].filter(Boolean);\n  const combined = parts.join('\\n\\n').trim();\n  return combined || undefined;\n}\n\n/**\n * Applies run context and MCP instructions to an agent's configuration.\n * Mutates the agent object in place.\n *\n * @param {Object} params\n * @param {Agent} params.agent - The agent to update\n * @param {string} params.sharedRunContext - Run-level shared context\n * @param {MCPManager} params.mcpManager - MCP manager instance\n * @param {Object} [params.ephemeralAgent] - Ephemeral agent config (for MCP override)\n * @param {string} [params.agentId] - Agent ID for logging\n * @param {Logger} [params.logger] - Optional logger instance\n * @returns {Promise<void>}\n */\nexport async function applyContextToAgent({\n  agent,\n  sharedRunContext,\n  mcpManager,\n  ephemeralAgent,\n  agentId,\n  logger,\n}: {\n  agent: AgentWithTools;\n  sharedRunContext: string;\n  mcpManager: MCPManager;\n  ephemeralAgent?: TEphemeralAgent;\n  agentId?: string;\n  logger?: Logger;\n}): Promise<void> {\n  const baseInstructions = agent.instructions || '';\n\n  try {\n    const mcpServers = ephemeralAgent?.mcp?.length ? ephemeralAgent.mcp : extractMCPServers(agent);\n    const mcpInstructions = await getMCPInstructionsForServers(mcpServers, mcpManager, logger);\n\n    agent.instructions = buildAgentInstructions({\n      sharedRunContext,\n      baseInstructions,\n      mcpInstructions,\n    });\n\n    if (agentId && logger) {\n      logger.debug(`[AgentContext] Applied context to agent: ${agentId}`);\n    }\n  } catch (error) {\n    agent.instructions = buildAgentInstructions({\n      sharedRunContext,\n      baseInstructions,\n      mcpInstructions: '',\n    });\n\n    if (logger) {\n      logger.error(\n        `[AgentContext] Failed to apply context to agent${agentId ? ` ${agentId}` : ''}, using base instructions only:`,\n        error,\n      );\n    }\n  }\n}\n","import type { GraphEdge } from 'librechat-data-provider';\n\n/**\n * Creates a stable key for edge deduplication.\n * Handles both single and array-based from/to values.\n */\nexport function getEdgeKey(edge: GraphEdge): string {\n  const from = Array.isArray(edge.from) ? [...edge.from].sort().join('|') : edge.from;\n  const to = Array.isArray(edge.to) ? [...edge.to].sort().join('|') : edge.to;\n  const type = edge.edgeType ?? 'handoff';\n  return `${from}=>${to}::${type}`;\n}\n\n/**\n * Extracts all agent IDs referenced in an edge (both from and to).\n */\nexport function getEdgeParticipants(edge: GraphEdge): string[] {\n  const participants: string[] = [];\n  if (Array.isArray(edge.from)) {\n    participants.push(...edge.from);\n  } else if (typeof edge.from === 'string') {\n    participants.push(edge.from);\n  }\n  if (Array.isArray(edge.to)) {\n    participants.push(...edge.to);\n  } else if (typeof edge.to === 'string') {\n    participants.push(edge.to);\n  }\n  return participants;\n}\n\n/**\n * Filters out edges that reference non-existent (orphaned) agents.\n * Only filters based on the 'to' field since those are the handoff targets.\n */\nexport function filterOrphanedEdges(edges: GraphEdge[], skippedAgentIds: Set<string>): GraphEdge[] {\n  if (!edges || skippedAgentIds.size === 0) {\n    return edges;\n  }\n  return edges.filter((edge) => {\n    const toIds = Array.isArray(edge.to) ? edge.to : [edge.to];\n    return !toIds.some((id) => typeof id === 'string' && skippedAgentIds.has(id));\n  });\n}\n\n/**\n * Result of discovering and aggregating edges from connected agents.\n */\nexport interface EdgeDiscoveryResult {\n  /** Deduplicated edges from all discovered agents */\n  edges: GraphEdge[];\n  /** Agent IDs that were not found (orphaned references) */\n  skippedAgentIds: Set<string>;\n}\n\n/**\n * Collects and deduplicates edges, tracking new agents to process.\n * Used for BFS discovery of connected agents.\n */\nexport function createEdgeCollector(\n  checkAgentInit: (agentId: string) => boolean,\n  skippedAgentIds: Set<string>,\n): {\n  edgeMap: Map<string, GraphEdge>;\n  agentsToProcess: Set<string>;\n  collectEdges: (edgeList: GraphEdge[] | undefined) => void;\n} {\n  const edgeMap = new Map<string, GraphEdge>();\n  const agentsToProcess = new Set<string>();\n\n  const collectEdges = (edgeList: GraphEdge[] | undefined): void => {\n    if (!edgeList || edgeList.length === 0) {\n      return;\n    }\n    for (const edge of edgeList) {\n      const key = getEdgeKey(edge);\n      if (!edgeMap.has(key)) {\n        edgeMap.set(key, edge);\n      }\n      const participants = getEdgeParticipants(edge);\n      for (const id of participants) {\n        if (!checkAgentInit(id) && !skippedAgentIds.has(id)) {\n          agentsToProcess.add(id);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  };\n\n  return { edgeMap, agentsToProcess, collectEdges };\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { GraphEvents, Constants } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type {\n  LCTool,\n  EventHandler,\n  LCToolRegistry,\n  ToolCallRequest,\n  ToolExecuteResult,\n  ToolExecuteBatchRequest,\n} from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type { StructuredToolInterface } from '@langchain/core/tools';\n\nexport interface ToolEndCallbackData {\n  output: {\n    name: string;\n    tool_call_id: string;\n    content: string | unknown;\n    artifact?: unknown;\n  };\n}\n\nexport interface ToolEndCallbackMetadata {\n  run_id?: string;\n  thread_id?: string;\n  [key: string]: unknown;\n}\n\nexport type ToolEndCallback = (\n  data: ToolEndCallbackData,\n  metadata: ToolEndCallbackMetadata,\n) => Promise<void>;\n\nexport interface ToolExecuteOptions {\n  /** Loads tools by name, using agentId to look up agent-specific context */\n  loadTools: (\n    toolNames: string[],\n    agentId?: string,\n  ) => Promise<{\n    loadedTools: StructuredToolInterface[];\n    /** Additional configurable properties to merge (e.g., userMCPAuthMap) */\n    configurable?: Record<string, unknown>;\n  }>;\n  /** Callback to process tool artifacts (code output files, file citations, etc.) */\n  toolEndCallback?: ToolEndCallback;\n}\n\n/**\n * Creates the ON_TOOL_EXECUTE handler for event-driven tool execution.\n * This handler receives batched tool calls, loads the required tools,\n * executes them in parallel, and resolves with the results.\n */\nexport function createToolExecuteHandler(options: ToolExecuteOptions): EventHandler {\n  const { loadTools, toolEndCallback } = options;\n\n  return {\n    handle: async (_event: string, data: ToolExecuteBatchRequest) => {\n      const { toolCalls, agentId, configurable, metadata, resolve, reject } = data;\n\n      try {\n        const toolNames = [...new Set(toolCalls.map((tc: ToolCallRequest) => tc.name))];\n        const { loadedTools, configurable: toolConfigurable } = await loadTools(toolNames, agentId);\n        const toolMap = new Map(loadedTools.map((t) => [t.name, t]));\n        const mergedConfigurable = { ...configurable, ...toolConfigurable };\n\n        const results: ToolExecuteResult[] = await Promise.all(\n          toolCalls.map(async (tc: ToolCallRequest) => {\n            const tool = toolMap.get(tc.name);\n\n            if (!tool) {\n              logger.warn(\n                `[ON_TOOL_EXECUTE] Tool \"${tc.name}\" not found. Available: ${[...toolMap.keys()].join(', ')}`,\n              );\n              return {\n                toolCallId: tc.id,\n                status: 'error' as const,\n                content: '',\n                errorMessage: `Tool ${tc.name} not found`,\n              };\n            }\n\n            try {\n              const toolCallConfig: Record<string, unknown> = {\n                id: tc.id,\n                stepId: tc.stepId,\n                turn: tc.turn,\n              };\n\n              if (\n                tc.codeSessionContext &&\n                (tc.name === Constants.EXECUTE_CODE ||\n                  tc.name === Constants.PROGRAMMATIC_TOOL_CALLING)\n              ) {\n                toolCallConfig.session_id = tc.codeSessionContext.session_id;\n                if (tc.codeSessionContext.files && tc.codeSessionContext.files.length > 0) {\n                  toolCallConfig._injected_files = tc.codeSessionContext.files;\n                }\n              }\n\n              if (tc.name === Constants.PROGRAMMATIC_TOOL_CALLING) {\n                const toolRegistry = mergedConfigurable?.toolRegistry as LCToolRegistry | undefined;\n                const ptcToolMap = mergedConfigurable?.ptcToolMap as\n                  | Map<string, StructuredToolInterface>\n                  | undefined;\n                if (toolRegistry) {\n                  const toolDefs: LCTool[] = Array.from(toolRegistry.values()).filter(\n                    (t) =>\n                      t.name !== Constants.PROGRAMMATIC_TOOL_CALLING &&\n                      t.name !== Constants.TOOL_SEARCH,\n                  );\n                  toolCallConfig.toolDefs = toolDefs;\n                  toolCallConfig.toolMap = ptcToolMap ?? toolMap;\n                }\n              }\n\n              const result = await tool.invoke(tc.args, {\n                toolCall: toolCallConfig,\n                configurable: mergedConfigurable,\n                metadata,\n              } as Record<string, unknown>);\n\n              if (toolEndCallback) {\n                await toolEndCallback(\n                  {\n                    output: {\n                      name: tc.name,\n                      tool_call_id: tc.id,\n                      content: result.content,\n                      artifact: result.artifact,\n                    },\n                  },\n                  {\n                    run_id: (metadata as Record<string, unknown>)?.run_id as string | undefined,\n                    thread_id: (metadata as Record<string, unknown>)?.thread_id as\n                      | string\n                      | undefined,\n                    ...metadata,\n                  },\n                );\n              }\n\n              return {\n                toolCallId: tc.id,\n                content: result.content,\n                artifact: result.artifact,\n                status: 'success' as const,\n              };\n            } catch (toolError) {\n              const error = toolError as Error;\n              logger.error(`[ON_TOOL_EXECUTE] Tool ${tc.name} error:`, error);\n              return {\n                toolCallId: tc.id,\n                status: 'error' as const,\n                content: '',\n                errorMessage: error.message,\n              };\n            }\n          }),\n        );\n\n        resolve(results);\n      } catch (error) {\n        logger.error('[ON_TOOL_EXECUTE] Fatal error:', error);\n        reject(error as Error);\n      }\n    },\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Creates a handlers object that includes ON_TOOL_EXECUTE.\n * Can be merged with other handler objects.\n */\nexport function createToolExecuteHandlers(\n  options: ToolExecuteOptions,\n): Record<string, EventHandler> {\n  return {\n    [GraphEvents.ON_TOOL_EXECUTE]: createToolExecuteHandler(options),\n  };\n}\n","import fs from 'fs';\nimport { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type {\n  AudioProcessingResult,\n  ServerRequest,\n  AudioFileInfo,\n  STTService,\n  FileObject,\n} from '~/types';\n\n/**\n * Processes audio files using Speech-to-Text (STT) service.\n * @returns A promise that resolves to an object containing text and bytes.\n */\nexport async function processAudioFile({\n  req,\n  file,\n  sttService,\n}: {\n  req: ServerRequest;\n  file: FileObject;\n  sttService: STTService;\n}): Promise<AudioProcessingResult> {\n  try {\n    const audioBuffer = await fs.promises.readFile(file.path);\n    const audioFile: AudioFileInfo = {\n      originalname: file.originalname,\n      mimetype: file.mimetype,\n      size: file.size,\n    };\n\n    const [provider, sttSchema] = await sttService.getProviderSchema(req);\n    const text = await sttService.sttRequest(provider, sttSchema, { audioBuffer, audioFile });\n\n    return {\n      text,\n      bytes: Buffer.byteLength(text, 'utf8'),\n    };\n  } catch (error) {\n    logger.error('Error processing audio file with STT:', error);\n    throw new Error(`Failed to process audio file: ${(error as Error).message}`);\n  }\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { FileSources, mergeFileConfig } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { IMongoFile } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { ServerRequest } from '~/types';\nimport { processTextWithTokenLimit } from '~/utils/text';\n\n/**\n * Extracts text context from attachments and returns formatted text.\n * This handles text that was already extracted from files (OCR, transcriptions, document text, etc.)\n * @param params - The parameters object\n * @param params.attachments - Array of file attachments\n * @param params.req - Express request object for config access\n * @param params.tokenCountFn - Function to count tokens in text\n * @returns The formatted file context text, or undefined if no text found\n */\nexport async function extractFileContext({\n  attachments,\n  req,\n  tokenCountFn,\n}: {\n  attachments: IMongoFile[];\n  req?: ServerRequest;\n  tokenCountFn: (text: string) => number;\n}): Promise<string | undefined> {\n  if (!attachments || attachments.length === 0) {\n    return undefined;\n  }\n\n  const fileConfig = mergeFileConfig(req?.config?.fileConfig);\n  const fileTokenLimit = req?.body?.fileTokenLimit ?? fileConfig.fileTokenLimit;\n\n  if (!fileTokenLimit) {\n    // If no token limit, return undefined (no processing)\n    return undefined;\n  }\n\n  let resultText = '';\n\n  for (const file of attachments) {\n    const source = file.source ?? FileSources.local;\n    if (source === FileSources.text && file.text) {\n      const { text: limitedText, wasTruncated } = await processTextWithTokenLimit({\n        text: file.text,\n        tokenLimit: fileTokenLimit,\n        tokenCountFn,\n      });\n\n      if (wasTruncated) {\n        logger.debug(\n          `[extractFileContext] Text content truncated for file: ${file.filename} due to token limits`,\n        );\n      }\n\n      resultText += `${!resultText ? 'Attached document(s):\\n```md' : '\\n\\n---\\n\\n'}# \"${file.filename}\"\\n${limitedText}\\n`;\n    }\n  }\n\n  if (resultText) {\n    resultText += '\\n```';\n    return resultText;\n  }\n\n  return undefined;\n}\n","'use strict';\nconst {PassThrough: PassThroughStream} = require('stream');\n\nmodule.exports = options => {\n\toptions = {...options};\n\n\tconst {array} = options;\n\tlet {encoding} = options;\n\tconst isBuffer = encoding === 'buffer';\n\tlet objectMode = false;\n\n\tif (array) {\n\t\tobjectMode = !(encoding || isBuffer);\n\t} else {\n\t\tencoding = encoding || 'utf8';\n\t}\n\n\tif (isBuffer) {\n\t\tencoding = null;\n\t}\n\n\tconst stream = new PassThroughStream({objectMode});\n\n\tif (encoding) {\n\t\tstream.setEncoding(encoding);\n\t}\n\n\tlet length = 0;\n\tconst chunks = [];\n\n\tstream.on('data', chunk => {\n\t\tchunks.push(chunk);\n\n\t\tif (objectMode) {\n\t\t\tlength = chunks.length;\n\t\t} else {\n\t\t\tlength += chunk.length;\n\t\t}\n\t});\n\n\tstream.getBufferedValue = () => {\n\t\tif (array) {\n\t\t\treturn chunks;\n\t\t}\n\n\t\treturn isBuffer ? Buffer.concat(chunks, length) : chunks.join('');\n\t};\n\n\tstream.getBufferedLength = () => length;\n\n\treturn stream;\n};\n","'use strict';\nconst {constants: BufferConstants} = require('buffer');\nconst stream = require('stream');\nconst {promisify} = require('util');\nconst bufferStream = require('./buffer-stream');\n\nconst streamPipelinePromisified = promisify(stream.pipeline);\n\nclass MaxBufferError extends Error {\n\tconstructor() {\n\t\tsuper('maxBuffer exceeded');\n\t\tthis.name = 'MaxBufferError';\n\t}\n}\n\nasync function getStream(inputStream, options) {\n\tif (!inputStream) {\n\t\tthrow new Error('Expected a stream');\n\t}\n\n\toptions = {\n\t\tmaxBuffer: Infinity,\n\t\t...options\n\t};\n\n\tconst {maxBuffer} = options;\n\tconst stream = bufferStream(options);\n\n\tawait new Promise((resolve, reject) => {\n\t\tconst rejectPromise = error => {\n\t\t\t// Don't retrieve an oversized buffer.\n\t\t\tif (error && stream.getBufferedLength() <= BufferConstants.MAX_LENGTH) {\n\t\t\t\terror.bufferedData = stream.getBufferedValue();\n\t\t\t}\n\n\t\t\treject(error);\n\t\t};\n\n\t\t(async () => {\n\t\t\ttry {\n\t\t\t\tawait streamPipelinePromisified(inputStream, stream);\n\t\t\t\tresolve();\n\t\t\t} catch (error) {\n\t\t\t\trejectPromise(error);\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t})();\n\n\t\tstream.on('data', () => {\n\t\t\tif (stream.getBufferedLength() > maxBuffer) {\n\t\t\t\trejectPromise(new MaxBufferError());\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t});\n\t});\n\n\treturn stream.getBufferedValue();\n}\n\nmodule.exports = getStream;\nmodule.exports.buffer = (stream, options) => getStream(stream, {...options, encoding: 'buffer'});\nmodule.exports.array = (stream, options) => getStream(stream, {...options, array: true});\nmodule.exports.MaxBufferError = MaxBufferError;\n","import getStream from 'get-stream';\nimport { Providers } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport { FileSources, mergeFileConfig, getEndpointFileConfig } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { IMongoFile } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { ServerRequest, StrategyFunctions, ProcessedFile } from '~/types';\n\n/**\n * Extracts the configured file size limit for a specific provider from fileConfig\n * @param req - The server request object containing config\n * @param params - Object containing provider and optional endpoint\n * @param params.provider - The provider to get the limit for\n * @param params.endpoint - Optional endpoint name for lookup\n * @returns The configured file size limit in bytes, or undefined if not configured\n */\nexport const getConfiguredFileSizeLimit = (\n  req: ServerRequest,\n  params: {\n    provider: Providers;\n    endpoint?: string;\n  },\n): number | undefined => {\n  if (!req.config?.fileConfig) {\n    return undefined;\n  }\n  const { provider, endpoint } = params;\n  const fileConfig = mergeFileConfig(req.config.fileConfig);\n  const endpointConfig = getEndpointFileConfig({\n    fileConfig,\n    endpoint: endpoint ?? provider,\n  });\n  return endpointConfig?.fileSizeLimit;\n};\n\n/**\n * Processes a file by downloading and encoding it to base64\n * @param req - Express request object\n * @param file - File object to process\n * @param encodingMethods - Cache of encoding methods by source\n * @param getStrategyFunctions - Function to get strategy functions for a source\n * @returns Processed file with content and metadata, or null if filepath missing\n */\nexport async function getFileStream(\n  req: ServerRequest,\n  file: IMongoFile,\n  encodingMethods: Record<string, StrategyFunctions>,\n  getStrategyFunctions: (source: string) => StrategyFunctions,\n): Promise<ProcessedFile | null> {\n  if (!file?.filepath) {\n    return null;\n  }\n\n  const source = file.source ?? FileSources.local;\n  if (!encodingMethods[source]) {\n    encodingMethods[source] = getStrategyFunctions(source);\n  }\n\n  const { getDownloadStream } = encodingMethods[source];\n  const stream = await getDownloadStream(req, file.filepath);\n  const buffer = await getStream.buffer(stream);\n\n  return {\n    file,\n    content: buffer.toString('base64'),\n    metadata: {\n      file_id: file.file_id,\n      temp_file_id: file.temp_file_id,\n      filepath: file.filepath,\n      source: file.source,\n      filename: file.filename,\n      type: file.type,\n    },\n  };\n}\n","import { Providers } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport { mbToBytes, isOpenAILikeProvider } from 'librechat-data-provider';\n\nexport interface PDFValidationResult {\n  isValid: boolean;\n  error?: string;\n}\n\nexport interface VideoValidationResult {\n  isValid: boolean;\n  error?: string;\n}\n\nexport interface AudioValidationResult {\n  isValid: boolean;\n  error?: string;\n}\n\nexport interface ImageValidationResult {\n  isValid: boolean;\n  error?: string;\n}\n\nexport async function validatePdf(\n  pdfBuffer: Buffer,\n  fileSize: number,\n  provider: Providers,\n  configuredFileSizeLimit?: number,\n): Promise<PDFValidationResult> {\n  if (provider === Providers.ANTHROPIC) {\n    return validateAnthropicPdf(pdfBuffer, fileSize, configuredFileSizeLimit);\n  }\n\n  if (isOpenAILikeProvider(provider)) {\n    return validateOpenAIPdf(fileSize, configuredFileSizeLimit);\n  }\n\n  if (provider === Providers.GOOGLE || provider === Providers.VERTEXAI) {\n    return validateGooglePdf(fileSize, configuredFileSizeLimit);\n  }\n\n  return { isValid: true };\n}\n\n/**\n * Validates if a PDF meets Anthropic's requirements\n * @param pdfBuffer - The PDF file as a buffer\n * @param fileSize - The file size in bytes\n * @param configuredFileSizeLimit - Optional configured file size limit from fileConfig (in bytes)\n * @returns Promise that resolves to validation result\n */\nasync function validateAnthropicPdf(\n  pdfBuffer: Buffer,\n  fileSize: number,\n  configuredFileSizeLimit?: number,\n): Promise<PDFValidationResult> {\n  try {\n    const providerLimit = mbToBytes(32);\n    const effectiveLimit = configuredFileSizeLimit ?? providerLimit;\n\n    if (fileSize > effectiveLimit) {\n      const limitMB = Math.round(effectiveLimit / (1024 * 1024));\n      return {\n        isValid: false,\n        error: `PDF file size (${Math.round(fileSize / (1024 * 1024))}MB) exceeds the ${limitMB}MB limit`,\n      };\n    }\n\n    if (!pdfBuffer || pdfBuffer.length < 5) {\n      return {\n        isValid: false,\n        error: 'Invalid PDF file: too small or corrupted',\n      };\n    }\n\n    const pdfHeader = pdfBuffer.subarray(0, 5).toString();\n    if (!pdfHeader.startsWith('%PDF-')) {\n      return {\n        isValid: false,\n        error: 'Invalid PDF file: missing PDF header',\n      };\n    }\n\n    const pdfContent = pdfBuffer.toString('binary');\n    if (\n      pdfContent.includes('/Encrypt ') ||\n      pdfContent.includes('/U (') ||\n      pdfContent.includes('/O (')\n    ) {\n      return {\n        isValid: false,\n        error: 'PDF is password-protected or encrypted. Anthropic requires unencrypted PDFs.',\n      };\n    }\n\n    const pageMatches = pdfContent.match(/\\/Type[\\s]*\\/Page[^s]/g);\n    const estimatedPages = pageMatches ? pageMatches.length : 1;\n\n    if (estimatedPages > 100) {\n      return {\n        isValid: false,\n        error: `PDF has approximately ${estimatedPages} pages, exceeding Anthropic's 100-page limit`,\n      };\n    }\n\n    return { isValid: true };\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error('PDF validation error:', error);\n    return {\n      isValid: false,\n      error: 'Failed to validate PDF file',\n    };\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Validates if a PDF meets OpenAI's requirements\n * @param fileSize - The file size in bytes\n * @param configuredFileSizeLimit - Optional configured file size limit from fileConfig (in bytes)\n * @returns Promise that resolves to validation result\n */\nasync function validateOpenAIPdf(\n  fileSize: number,\n  configuredFileSizeLimit?: number,\n): Promise<PDFValidationResult> {\n  const providerLimit = mbToBytes(10);\n  const effectiveLimit = configuredFileSizeLimit ?? providerLimit;\n\n  if (fileSize > effectiveLimit) {\n    const limitMB = Math.round(effectiveLimit / (1024 * 1024));\n    return {\n      isValid: false,\n      error: `PDF file size (${Math.round(fileSize / (1024 * 1024))}MB) exceeds the ${limitMB}MB limit`,\n    };\n  }\n\n  return { isValid: true };\n}\n\n/**\n * Validates if a PDF meets Google's requirements\n * @param fileSize - The file size in bytes\n * @param configuredFileSizeLimit - Optional configured file size limit from fileConfig (in bytes)\n * @returns Promise that resolves to validation result\n */\nasync function validateGooglePdf(\n  fileSize: number,\n  configuredFileSizeLimit?: number,\n): Promise<PDFValidationResult> {\n  const providerLimit = mbToBytes(20);\n  const effectiveLimit = configuredFileSizeLimit ?? providerLimit;\n\n  if (fileSize > effectiveLimit) {\n    const limitMB = Math.round(effectiveLimit / (1024 * 1024));\n    return {\n      isValid: false,\n      error: `PDF file size (${Math.round(fileSize / (1024 * 1024))}MB) exceeds the ${limitMB}MB limit`,\n    };\n  }\n\n  return { isValid: true };\n}\n\n/**\n * Validates video files for different providers\n * @param videoBuffer - The video file as a buffer\n * @param fileSize - The file size in bytes\n * @param provider - The provider to validate for\n * @param configuredFileSizeLimit - Optional configured file size limit from fileConfig (in bytes)\n * @returns Promise that resolves to validation result\n */\nexport async function validateVideo(\n  videoBuffer: Buffer,\n  fileSize: number,\n  provider: Providers,\n  configuredFileSizeLimit?: number,\n): Promise<VideoValidationResult> {\n  if (provider === Providers.GOOGLE || provider === Providers.VERTEXAI) {\n    const providerLimit = mbToBytes(20);\n    const effectiveLimit = configuredFileSizeLimit ?? providerLimit;\n\n    if (fileSize > effectiveLimit) {\n      const limitMB = Math.round(effectiveLimit / (1024 * 1024));\n      return {\n        isValid: false,\n        error: `Video file size (${Math.round(fileSize / (1024 * 1024))}MB) exceeds the ${limitMB}MB limit`,\n      };\n    }\n  }\n\n  if (!videoBuffer || videoBuffer.length < 10) {\n    return {\n      isValid: false,\n      error: 'Invalid video file: too small or corrupted',\n    };\n  }\n\n  return { isValid: true };\n}\n\n/**\n * Validates audio files for different providers\n * @param audioBuffer - The audio file as a buffer\n * @param fileSize - The file size in bytes\n * @param provider - The provider to validate for\n * @param configuredFileSizeLimit - Optional configured file size limit from fileConfig (in bytes)\n * @returns Promise that resolves to validation result\n */\nexport async function validateAudio(\n  audioBuffer: Buffer,\n  fileSize: number,\n  provider: Providers,\n  configuredFileSizeLimit?: number,\n): Promise<AudioValidationResult> {\n  if (provider === Providers.GOOGLE || provider === Providers.VERTEXAI) {\n    const providerLimit = mbToBytes(20);\n    const effectiveLimit = configuredFileSizeLimit ?? providerLimit;\n\n    if (fileSize > effectiveLimit) {\n      const limitMB = Math.round(effectiveLimit / (1024 * 1024));\n      return {\n        isValid: false,\n        error: `Audio file size (${Math.round(fileSize / (1024 * 1024))}MB) exceeds the ${limitMB}MB limit`,\n      };\n    }\n  }\n\n  if (!audioBuffer || audioBuffer.length < 10) {\n    return {\n      isValid: false,\n      error: 'Invalid audio file: too small or corrupted',\n    };\n  }\n\n  return { isValid: true };\n}\n\n/**\n * Validates image files for different providers\n * @param imageBuffer - The image file as a buffer\n * @param fileSize - The file size in bytes\n * @param provider - The provider to validate for\n * @param configuredFileSizeLimit - Optional configured file size limit from fileConfig (in bytes)\n * @returns Promise that resolves to validation result\n */\nexport async function validateImage(\n  imageBuffer: Buffer,\n  fileSize: number,\n  provider: Providers | string,\n  configuredFileSizeLimit?: number,\n): Promise<ImageValidationResult> {\n  if (provider === Providers.GOOGLE || provider === Providers.VERTEXAI) {\n    const providerLimit = mbToBytes(20);\n    const effectiveLimit = configuredFileSizeLimit ?? providerLimit;\n\n    if (fileSize > effectiveLimit) {\n      const limitMB = Math.round(effectiveLimit / (1024 * 1024));\n      return {\n        isValid: false,\n        error: `Image file size (${Math.round(fileSize / (1024 * 1024))}MB) exceeds the ${limitMB}MB limit`,\n      };\n    }\n  }\n\n  if (provider === Providers.ANTHROPIC) {\n    const providerLimit = mbToBytes(5);\n    const effectiveLimit = configuredFileSizeLimit ?? providerLimit;\n\n    if (fileSize > effectiveLimit) {\n      const limitMB = Math.round(effectiveLimit / (1024 * 1024));\n      return {\n        isValid: false,\n        error: `Image file size (${Math.round(fileSize / (1024 * 1024))}MB) exceeds the ${limitMB}MB limit`,\n      };\n    }\n  }\n\n  if (!imageBuffer || imageBuffer.length < 10) {\n    return {\n      isValid: false,\n      error: 'Invalid image file: too small or corrupted',\n    };\n  }\n\n  return { isValid: true };\n}\n","import { Providers } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport { isDocumentSupportedProvider } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { IMongoFile } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { ServerRequest, StrategyFunctions, AudioResult } from '~/types';\nimport { getFileStream, getConfiguredFileSizeLimit } from './utils';\nimport { validateAudio } from '~/files/validation';\n\n/**\n * Encodes and formats audio files for different providers\n * @param req - The request object\n * @param files - Array of audio files\n * @param params - Object containing provider and optional endpoint\n * @param params.provider - The provider to format for (currently only google is supported)\n * @param params.endpoint - Optional endpoint name for file config lookup\n * @param getStrategyFunctions - Function to get strategy functions\n * @returns Promise that resolves to audio and file metadata\n */\nexport async function encodeAndFormatAudios(\n  req: ServerRequest,\n  files: IMongoFile[],\n  params: { provider: Providers; endpoint?: string },\n  getStrategyFunctions: (source: string) => StrategyFunctions,\n): Promise<AudioResult> {\n  const { provider, endpoint } = params;\n  if (!files?.length) {\n    return { audios: [], files: [] };\n  }\n\n  const encodingMethods: Record<string, StrategyFunctions> = {};\n  const result: AudioResult = { audios: [], files: [] };\n\n  const results = await Promise.allSettled(\n    files.map((file) => getFileStream(req, file, encodingMethods, getStrategyFunctions)),\n  );\n\n  for (const settledResult of results) {\n    if (settledResult.status === 'rejected') {\n      console.error('Audio processing failed:', settledResult.reason);\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    const processed = settledResult.value;\n    if (!processed) continue;\n\n    const { file, content, metadata } = processed;\n\n    if (!content || !file) {\n      if (metadata) result.files.push(metadata);\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    if (!file.type.startsWith('audio/') || !isDocumentSupportedProvider(provider)) {\n      result.files.push(metadata);\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    const audioBuffer = Buffer.from(content, 'base64');\n\n    /** Extract configured file size limit from fileConfig for this endpoint */\n    const configuredFileSizeLimit = getConfiguredFileSizeLimit(req, {\n      provider,\n      endpoint,\n    });\n\n    const validation = await validateAudio(\n      audioBuffer,\n      audioBuffer.length,\n      provider,\n      configuredFileSizeLimit,\n    );\n\n    if (!validation.isValid) {\n      throw new Error(`Audio validation failed: ${validation.error}`);\n    }\n\n    if (provider === Providers.GOOGLE || provider === Providers.VERTEXAI) {\n      result.audios.push({\n        type: 'media',\n        mimeType: file.type,\n
