methods.findRoleByIdentifier(AccessRoleIds.PROMPTGROUP_OWNER);\n    const viewerRole = await methods.findRoleByIdentifier(AccessRoleIds.PROMPTGROUP_VIEWER);\n    const editorRole = await methods.findRoleByIdentifier(AccessRoleIds.PROMPTGROUP_EDITOR);\n\n    if (!ownerRole || !viewerRole || !editorRole) {\n      logger.warn(\n        'Required promptGroup roles not found. Permission system may not be fully initialized.',\n      );\n      return {\n        totalToMigrate: 0,\n        globalViewAccess: 0,\n        privateGroups: 0,\n      };\n    }\n\n    /** Global project prompt group IDs */\n    const globalProject = await methods.getProjectByName(GLOBAL_PROJECT_NAME, ['promptGroupIds']);\n    const globalPromptGroupIds = new Set(\n      (globalProject?.promptGroupIds || []).map((id) => id.toString()),\n    );\n\n    // Find promptGroups without ACL entries (no batching for efficiency on startup)\n    const promptGroupsToMigrate: PromptGroupMigrationData[] = await PromptGroupModel.aggregate([\n      {\n        $lookup: {\n          from: 'aclentries',\n          localField: '_id',\n          foreignField: 'resourceId',\n          as: 'aclEntries',\n        },\n      },\n      {\n        $addFields: {\n          promptGroupAclEntries: {\n            $filter: {\n              input: '$aclEntries',\n              as: 'aclEntry',\n              cond: {\n                $and: [\n                  { $eq: ['$$aclEntry.resourceType', ResourceType.PROMPTGROUP] },\n                  { $eq: ['$$aclEntry.principalType', PrincipalType.USER] },\n                ],\n              },\n            },\n          },\n        },\n      },\n      {\n        $match: {\n          author: { $exists: true, $ne: null },\n          promptGroupAclEntries: { $size: 0 },\n        },\n      },\n      {\n        $project: {\n          _id: 1,\n          name: 1,\n          author: 1,\n          authorName: 1,\n          category: 1,\n        },\n      },\n    ]);\n\n    const categories: {\n      globalViewAccess: PromptGroupMigrationData[];\n      privateGroups: PromptGroupMigrationData[];\n    } = {\n      globalViewAccess: [],\n      privateGroups: [],\n    };\n\n    promptGroupsToMigrate.forEach((group) => {\n      const isGlobalGroup = globalPromptGroupIds.has(group._id.toString());\n\n      if (isGlobalGroup) {\n        categories.globalViewAccess.push(group);\n      } else {\n        categories.privateGroups.push(group);\n      }\n    });\n\n    const result: PromptMigrationCheckResult = {\n      totalToMigrate: promptGroupsToMigrate.length,\n      globalViewAccess: categories.globalViewAccess.length,\n      privateGroups: categories.privateGroups.length,\n    };\n\n    // Add details for debugging\n    if (promptGroupsToMigrate.length > 0) {\n      result.details = {\n        globalViewAccess: categories.globalViewAccess.map((g) => ({\n          name: g.name,\n          _id: g._id.toString(),\n          category: g.category || 'uncategorized',\n        })),\n        privateGroups: categories.privateGroups.map((g) => ({\n          name: g.name,\n          _id: g._id.toString(),\n          category: g.category || 'uncategorized',\n        })),\n      };\n    }\n\n    logger.debug('Prompt migration check completed', {\n      totalToMigrate: result.totalToMigrate,\n      globalViewAccess: result.globalViewAccess,\n      privateGroups: result.privateGroups,\n    });\n\n    return result;\n  } catch (error) {\n    logger.error('Failed to check prompt permissions migration', error);\n    // Return zero counts on error to avoid blocking startup\n    return {\n      totalToMigrate: 0,\n      globalViewAccess: 0,\n      privateGroups: 0,\n    };\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Log migration warning to console if prompt groups need migration\n */\nexport function logPromptMigrationWarning(result: PromptMigrationCheckResult): void {\n  if (result.totalToMigrate === 0) {\n    return;\n  }\n\n  // Create a visible warning box\n  const border = '='.repeat(80);\n  const warning = [\n    '',\n    border,\n    '                   IMPORTANT: PROMPT PERMISSIONS MIGRATION REQUIRED',\n    border,\n    '',\n    `  Total prompt groups to migrate: ${result.totalToMigrate}`,\n    `  - Global View Access: ${result.globalViewAccess} prompt groups`,\n    `  - Private Prompt Groups: ${result.privateGroups} prompt groups`,\n    '',\n    '  The new prompt sharing system requires migrating existing prompt groups.',\n    '  Please run the following command to migrate your prompts:',\n    '',\n    '    npm run migrate:prompt-permissions',\n    '',\n    '  For a dry run (preview) of what will be migrated:',\n    '',\n    '    npm run migrate:prompt-permissions:dry-run',\n    '',\n    '  This migration will:',\n    '  1. Grant owner permissions to prompt authors',\n    '  2. Set public view permissions for prompts in the global project',\n    '  3. Keep private prompts accessible only to their authors',\n    '',\n    border,\n    '',\n  ];\n\n  // Use console methods directly for visibility\n  console.log('\\n' + warning.join('\\n') + '\\n');\n\n  // Also log with logger for consistency\n  logger.warn('Prompt permissions migration required', {\n    totalToMigrate: result.totalToMigrate,\n    globalViewAccess: result.globalViewAccess,\n    privateGroups: result.privateGroups,\n  });\n}\n","import { z } from 'zod';\nimport { Constants } from 'librechat-data-provider';\n\n/**\n * Schema for validating prompt group update payloads.\n * Only allows fields that users should be able to modify.\n * Sensitive fields like author, authorName, _id, productionId, etc. are excluded.\n */\nexport const updatePromptGroupSchema = z\n  .object({\n    /** The name of the prompt group */\n    name: z.string().min(1).max(255).optional(),\n    /** Short description/oneliner for the prompt group */\n    oneliner: z.string().max(500).optional(),\n    /** Category for organizing prompt groups */\n    category: z.string().max(100).optional(),\n    /** Project IDs to add for sharing */\n    projectIds: z.array(z.string()).optional(),\n    /** Project IDs to remove from sharing */\n    removeProjectIds: z.array(z.string()).optional(),\n    /** Command shortcut for the prompt group */\n    command: z\n      .string()\n      .max(Constants.COMMANDS_MAX_LENGTH as number)\n      .regex(/^[a-z0-9-]*$/, {\n        message: 'Command must only contain lowercase alphanumeric characters and hyphens',\n      })\n      .optional()\n      .nullable(),\n  })\n  .strict();\n\nexport type TUpdatePromptGroupSchema = z.infer<typeof updatePromptGroupSchema>;\n\n/**\n * Validates and sanitizes a prompt group update payload.\n * Returns only the allowed fields, stripping any sensitive fields.\n * @param data - The raw request body to validate\n * @returns The validated and sanitized payload\n * @throws ZodError if validation fails\n */\nexport function validatePromptGroupUpdate(data: unknown): TUpdatePromptGroupSchema {\n  return updatePromptGroupSchema.parse(data);\n}\n\n/**\n * Safely validates a prompt group update payload without throwing.\n * @param data - The raw request body to validate\n * @returns A SafeParseResult with either the validated data or validation errors\n */\nexport function safeValidatePromptGroupUpdate(data: unknown) {\n  return updatePromptGroupSchema.safeParse(data);\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { AnthropicClientOptions } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport {\n  EModelEndpoint,\n  AnthropicEffort,\n  anthropicSettings,\n  supportsContext1m,\n  supportsAdaptiveThinking,\n} from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport { matchModelName } from '~/utils/tokens';\n\n/**\n * @param {string} modelName\n * @returns {boolean}\n */\nfunction checkPromptCacheSupport(modelName: string): boolean {\n  const modelMatch = matchModelName(modelName, EModelEndpoint.anthropic) ?? '';\n  if (\n    modelMatch.includes('claude-3-5-sonnet-latest') ||\n    modelMatch.includes('claude-3.5-sonnet-latest')\n  ) {\n    return false;\n  }\n\n  return (\n    /claude-3[-.]7/.test(modelMatch) ||\n    /claude-3[-.]5-(?:sonnet|haiku)/.test(modelMatch) ||\n    /claude-3-(?:sonnet|haiku|opus)?/.test(modelMatch) ||\n    /claude-(?:sonnet|opus|haiku)-[4-9]/.test(modelMatch) ||\n    /claude-[4-9]-(?:sonnet|opus|haiku)?/.test(modelMatch) ||\n    /claude-4(?:-(?:sonnet|opus|haiku))?/.test(modelMatch)\n  );\n}\n\n/**\n * Gets the appropriate headers for Claude models with cache control\n * @param {string} model The model name\n * @param {boolean} supportsCacheControl Whether the model supports cache control\n * @returns {AnthropicClientOptions['extendedOptions']['defaultHeaders']|undefined} The headers object or undefined if not applicable\n */\nfunction getClaudeHeaders(\n  model: string,\n  supportsCacheControl: boolean,\n): Record<string, string> | undefined {\n  if (!supportsCacheControl) {\n    return undefined;\n  }\n\n  if (/claude-3[-.]5-sonnet/.test(model)) {\n    return {\n      'anthropic-beta': 'max-tokens-3-5-sonnet-2024-07-15',\n    };\n  } else if (/claude-3[-.]7/.test(model)) {\n    return {\n      'anthropic-beta': 'token-efficient-tools-2025-02-19,output-128k-2025-02-19',\n    };\n  } else if (supportsContext1m(model)) {\n    return {\n      'anthropic-beta': 'context-1m-2025-08-07',\n    };\n  }\n\n  return undefined;\n}\n\n/**\n * Configures reasoning-related options for Claude models.\n * Models supporting adaptive thinking (Opus 4.6+, Sonnet 5+) use effort control instead of manual budget_tokens.\n */\nfunction configureReasoning(\n  anthropicInput: AnthropicClientOptions & { max_tokens?: number },\n  extendedOptions: {\n    thinking?: boolean;\n    thinkingBudget?: number | null;\n    effort?: AnthropicEffort | string | null;\n  } = {},\n): AnthropicClientOptions & { max_tokens?: number } {\n  const updatedOptions = { ...anthropicInput };\n  const currentMaxTokens = updatedOptions.max_tokens ?? updatedOptions.maxTokens;\n  const modelName = updatedOptions.model ?? '';\n\n  if (extendedOptions.thinking && modelName && supportsAdaptiveThinking(modelName)) {\n    updatedOptions.thinking = { type: 'adaptive' };\n\n    const effort = extendedOptions.effort;\n    if (effort && effort !== AnthropicEffort.unset) {\n      updatedOptions.invocationKwargs = {\n        ...updatedOptions.invocationKwargs,\n        output_config: { effort },\n      };\n    }\n\n    if (currentMaxTokens == null) {\n      updatedOptions.max_tokens = anthropicSettings.maxOutputTokens.reset(modelName);\n    }\n\n    return updatedOptions;\n  }\n\n  if (\n    extendedOptions.thinking &&\n    modelName &&\n    (/claude-3[-.]7/.test(modelName) || /claude-(?:sonnet|opus|haiku)-[4-9]/.test(modelName))\n  ) {\n    updatedOptions.thinking = {\n      ...updatedOptions.thinking,\n      type: 'enabled',\n    } as { type: 'enabled'; budget_tokens: number };\n  }\n\n  if (\n    updatedOptions.thinking != null &&\n    extendedOptions.thinkingBudget != null &&\n    updatedOptions.thinking.type === 'enabled'\n  ) {\n    updatedOptions.thinking = {\n      ...updatedOptions.thinking,\n      budget_tokens: extendedOptions.thinkingBudget,\n    };\n  }\n\n  if (\n    updatedOptions.thinking != null &&\n    updatedOptions.thinking.type === 'enabled' &&\n    (currentMaxTokens == null || updatedOptions.thinking.budget_tokens > currentMaxTokens)\n  ) {\n    const maxTokens = anthropicSettings.maxOutputTokens.reset(modelName);\n    updatedOptions.max_tokens = currentMaxTokens ?? maxTokens;\n\n    logger.warn(\n      updatedOptions.max_tokens === maxTokens\n        ? '[AnthropicClient] max_tokens is not defined while thinking is enabled. Setting max_tokens to model default.'\n        : `[AnthropicClient] thinking budget_tokens (${updatedOptions.thinking.budget_tokens}) exceeds max_tokens (${updatedOptions.max_tokens}). Adjusting budget_tokens.`,\n    );\n\n    updatedOptions.thinking.budget_tokens = Math.min(\n      updatedOptions.thinking.budget_tokens,\n      Math.floor((updatedOptions.max_tokens ?? 0) * 0.9),\n    );\n  }\n\n  return updatedOptions;\n}\n\nexport { checkPromptCacheSupport, getClaudeHeaders, configureReasoning, supportsAdaptiveThinking };\n","import path from 'path';\nimport { GoogleAuth } from 'google-auth-library';\nimport { AuthKeys } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport { AnthropicVertex } from '@anthropic-ai/vertex-sdk';\nimport type { ClientOptions } from '@anthropic-ai/sdk';\nimport type { AnthropicCredentials, VertexAIClientOptions } from '~/types/anthropic';\nimport { loadServiceKey } from '~/utils/key';\n\n/**\n * Options for loading Vertex AI credentials\n */\nexport interface VertexCredentialOptions {\n  /** Path to service account key file (overrides env var) */\n  serviceKeyFile?: string;\n  /** Project ID for Vertex AI */\n  projectId?: string;\n  /** Region for Vertex AI */\n  region?: string;\n}\n\n/**\n * Interface for Vertex AI configuration from YAML config.\n * This matches the TVertexAISchema from librechat-data-provider.\n */\nexport interface VertexAIConfigInput {\n  enabled?: boolean;\n  projectId?: string;\n  region?: string;\n  serviceKeyFile?: string;\n  deploymentName?: string;\n  models?: string[] | Record<string, boolean | { deploymentName?: string }>;\n}\n\n/**\n * Loads Google service account configuration for Vertex AI.\n * Supports both YAML configuration and environment variables.\n * @param options - Optional configuration from YAML or other sources\n */\nexport async function loadAnthropicVertexCredentials(\n  options?: VertexCredentialOptions,\n): Promise<AnthropicCredentials> {\n  /** Path priority: options > env var > default location */\n  const serviceKeyPath =\n    options?.serviceKeyFile ||\n    process.env.GOOGLE_SERVICE_KEY_FILE ||\n    path.join(process.cwd(), 'api', 'data', 'auth.json');\n\n  const serviceKey = await loadServiceKey(serviceKeyPath);\n\n  if (!serviceKey) {\n    throw new Error(\n      `Google service account not found or could not be loaded from ${serviceKeyPath}`,\n    );\n  }\n\n  return {\n    [AuthKeys.GOOGLE_SERVICE_KEY]: serviceKey,\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Creates Vertex credential options from a Vertex AI configuration object.\n * @param config - The Vertex AI configuration (from YAML config or other sources)\n */\nexport function getVertexCredentialOptions(config?: VertexAIConfigInput): VertexCredentialOptions {\n  return {\n    serviceKeyFile: config?.serviceKeyFile,\n    projectId: config?.projectId,\n    region: config?.region,\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Checks if credentials are for Vertex AI (has service account key but no API key)\n */\nexport function isAnthropicVertexCredentials(credentials: AnthropicCredentials): boolean {\n  return !!credentials[AuthKeys.GOOGLE_SERVICE_KEY] && !credentials[AuthKeys.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY];\n}\n\n/**\n * Filters anthropic-beta header values to only include those supported by Vertex AI.\n * Vertex AI handles caching differently and we use 'prompt-caching-vertex' as a\n * marker to trigger cache_control application in the agents package.\n */\nfunction filterVertexHeaders(headers?: Record<string, string>): Record<string, string> | undefined {\n  if (!headers) {\n    return undefined;\n  }\n\n  const filteredHeaders = { ...headers };\n  const anthropicBeta = filteredHeaders['anthropic-beta'];\n\n  if (anthropicBeta) {\n    // Filter out unsupported beta values for Vertex AI\n    const supportedValues = anthropicBeta\n      .split(',')\n      .map((v) => v.trim())\n      .filter((v) => {\n        // Remove prompt-caching headers (Vertex handles caching via cache_control in body)\n        if (v.includes('prompt-caching')) {\n          return false;\n        }\n        // Remove max-tokens headers (Vertex has its own limits)\n        if (v.includes('max-tokens')) {\n          return false;\n        }\n        // Remove output-128k headers\n        if (v.includes('output-128k')) {\n          return false;\n        }\n        // Remove token-efficient-tools headers\n        if (v.includes('token-efficient-tools')) {\n          return false;\n        }\n        return true;\n      });\n\n    if (supportedValues.length > 0) {\n      filteredHeaders['anthropic-beta'] = supportedValues.join(',');\n    } else {\n      delete filteredHeaders['anthropic-beta'];\n    }\n  }\n\n  return Object.keys(filteredHeaders).length > 0 ? filteredHeaders : undefined;\n}\n\n/**\n * Gets the deployment name for a given model name from the Vertex AI configuration.\n * Maps visible model names to actual deployment names (model IDs).\n * @param modelName - The visible model name (e.g., \"Claude Opus 4.5\")\n * @param vertexConfig - The Vertex AI configuration with model mappings\n * @returns The deployment name to use with the API (e.g., \"claude-opus-4-5@20251101\")\n */\nexport function getVertexDeploymentName(\n  modelName: string,\n  vertexConfig?: VertexAIConfigInput,\n): string {\n  if (!vertexConfig?.models) {\n    // No models configuration, return model name as-is\n    return modelName;\n  }\n\n  // If models is an array, check if modelName is in the array\n  if (Array.isArray(vertexConfig.models)) {\n    // Legacy format - no deployment mapping\n    return modelName;\n  }\n\n  // If models is an object, look up the deployment name\n  const modelConfig = vertexConfig.models[modelName];\n\n  if (!modelConfig) {\n    // Model not found in config, return as-is\n    return modelName;\n  }\n\n  if (typeof modelConfig === 'boolean') {\n    // Model is true/false - use default deployment name or model name\n    return vertexConfig.deploymentName || modelName;\n  }\n\n  // Model has its own deployment name\n  return modelConfig.deploymentName || vertexConfig.deploymentName || modelName;\n}\n\n/**\n * Creates and configures a Vertex AI client for Anthropic.\n * Supports both YAML configuration and environment variables for region/projectId.\n * The projectId is automatically extracted from the service key if not explicitly provided.\n * @param credentials - The Google service account credentials\n * @param options - SDK client options\n * @param vertexOptions - Vertex AI specific options (region, projectId) from YAML config\n */\nexport function createAnthropicVertexClient(\n  credentials: AnthropicCredentials,\n  options?: ClientOptions,\n  vertexOptions?: VertexAIClientOptions,\n): AnthropicVertex {\n  const serviceKey = credentials[AuthKeys.GOOGLE_SERVICE_KEY];\n\n  if (!serviceKey) {\n    throw new Error('Google service account key is required for Vertex AI');\n  }\n\n  // Priority: vertexOptions > env vars > service key project_id\n  const region = vertexOptions?.region || process.env.ANTHROPIC_VERTEX_REGION || 'us-east5';\n  const projectId =\n    vertexOptions?.projectId || process.env.VERTEX_PROJECT_ID || serviceKey.project_id;\n\n  try {\n    const googleAuth = new GoogleAuth({\n      credentials: serviceKey,\n      scopes: 'https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform',\n      ...(projectId && { projectId }),\n    });\n\n    // Filter out unsupported anthropic-beta header values for Vertex AI\n    const filteredOptions = options\n      ? {\n          ...options,\n          defaultHeaders: filterVertexHeaders(\n            options.defaultHeaders as Record<string, string> | undefined,\n          ),\n        }\n      : undefined;\n\n    return new AnthropicVertex({\n      region: region,\n      googleAuth: googleAuth,\n      ...(projectId && { projectId }),\n      ...filteredOptions,\n    });\n  } catch (error) {\n    const message = error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error);\n    throw new Error(`Failed to create Vertex AI client: ${message}`);\n  }\n}\n","import { Dispatcher, ProxyAgent } from 'undici';\nimport { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { AnthropicClientOptions } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport { anthropicSettings, removeNullishValues, AuthKeys } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type {\n  AnthropicLLMConfigResult,\n  AnthropicConfigOptions,\n  AnthropicCredentials,\n} from '~/types/anthropic';\nimport {\n  supportsAdaptiveThinking,\n  checkPromptCacheSupport,\n  configureReasoning,\n  getClaudeHeaders,\n} from './helpers';\nimport {\n  createAnthropicVertexClient,\n  isAnthropicVertexCredentials,\n  getVertexDeploymentName,\n} from './vertex';\n\n/**\n * Parses credentials from string or object format\n * - If a valid JSON string is passed, it parses and returns the object\n * - If a plain API key string is passed, it wraps it in an AnthropicCredentials object\n * - If an object is passed, it returns it directly\n * - If undefined, returns an empty object\n */\nfunction parseCredentials(\n  credentials: string | AnthropicCredentials | undefined,\n): AnthropicCredentials {\n  if (typeof credentials === 'string') {\n    try {\n      return JSON.parse(credentials);\n    } catch {\n      // If not valid JSON, treat as a plain API key\n      logger.debug('[Anthropic] Credentials not JSON, treating as API key');\n      return { [AuthKeys.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY]: credentials };\n    }\n  }\n  return credentials && typeof credentials === 'object' ? credentials : {};\n}\n\n/** Known Anthropic parameters that map directly to the client config */\nexport const knownAnthropicParams = new Set([\n  'model',\n  'temperature',\n  'topP',\n  'topK',\n  'maxTokens',\n  'maxOutputTokens',\n  'stopSequences',\n  'stop',\n  'stream',\n  'apiKey',\n  'maxRetries',\n  'timeout',\n  'anthropicVersion',\n  'anthropicApiUrl',\n  'defaultHeaders',\n]);\n\n/**\n * Applies default parameters to the target object only if the field is undefined\n * @param target - The target object to apply defaults to\n * @param defaults - Record of default parameter values\n */\nfunction applyDefaultParams(target: Record<string, unknown>, defaults: Record<string, unknown>) {\n  for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(defaults)) {\n    if (target[key] === undefined) {\n      target[key] = value;\n    }\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Generates configuration options for creating an Anthropic language model (LLM) instance.\n * @param credentials - The API key for authentication with Anthropic, or credentials object for Vertex AI.\n * @param options={} - Additional options for configuring the LLM.\n * @returns Configuration options for creating an Anthropic LLM instance, with null and undefined values removed.\n */\nfunction getLLMConfig(\n  credentials: string | AnthropicCredentials | undefined,\n  options: AnthropicConfigOptions = {},\n): AnthropicLLMConfigResult {\n  const systemOptions = {\n    thinking: options.modelOptions?.thinking ?? anthropicSettings.thinking.default,\n    promptCache: options.modelOptions?.promptCache ?? anthropicSettings.promptCache.default,\n    thinkingBudget:\n      options.modelOptions?.thinkingBudget ?? anthropicSettings.thinkingBudget.default,\n    effort: options.modelOptions?.effort ?? anthropicSettings.effort.default,\n  };\n\n  if (options.modelOptions) {\n    delete options.modelOptions.thinking;\n    delete options.modelOptions.promptCache;\n    delete options.modelOptions.thinkingBudget;\n    delete options.modelOptions.effort;\n  } else {\n    throw new Error('No modelOptions provided');\n  }\n\n  const defaultOptions = {\n    model: anthropicSettings.model.default,\n    stream: true,\n  };\n\n  const mergedOptions = Object.assign(defaultOptions, options.modelOptions);\n\n  let enableWebSearch = mergedOptions.web_search;\n\n  let requestOptions: AnthropicClientOptions & { stream?: boolean } = {\n    model: mergedOptions.model,\n    stream: mergedOptions.stream,\n    temperature: mergedOptions.temperature,\n    stopSequences: mergedOptions.stop,\n    maxTokens:\n      mergedOptions.maxOutputTokens || anthropicSettings.maxOutputTokens.reset(mergedOptions.model),\n    clientOptions: {},\n    invocationKwargs: {\n      metadata: {\n        user_id: mergedOptions.user,\n      },\n    },\n  };\n\n  const creds = parseCredentials(credentials);\n  const apiKey = creds[AuthKeys.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY] ?? null;\n\n  if (isAnthropicVertexCredentials(creds)) {\n    // Vertex AI configuration - use custom client with optional YAML config\n    // Map the visible model name to the actual deployment name for Vertex AI\n    const deploymentName = getVertexDeploymentName(\n      requestOptions.model ?? '',\n      options.vertexConfig,\n    );\n    requestOptions.model = deploymentName;\n\n    requestOptions.createClient = () =>\n      createAnthropicVertexClient(creds, requestOptions.clientOptions, options.vertexOptions);\n  } else if (apiKey) {\n    // Direct API configuration\n    requestOptions.apiKey = apiKey;\n  } else {\n    throw new Error(\n      'Invalid credentials provided. Please provide either a valid Anthropic API key or service account credentials for Vertex AI.',\n    );\n  }\n\n  requestOptions = configureReasoning(requestOptions, systemOptions);\n\n  if (supportsAdaptiveThinking(mergedOptions.model)) {\n    if (\n      systemOptions.effort &&\n      (systemOptions.effort as string) !== '' &&\n      !requestOptions.invocationKwargs?.output_config\n    ) {\n      requestOptions.invocationKwargs = {\n        ...requestOptions.invocationKwargs,\n        output_config: { effort: systemOptions.effort },\n      };\n    }\n  } else {\n    if (\n      requestOptions.thinking != null &&\n      (requestOptions.thinking as unknown as { type: string }).type === 'adaptive'\n    ) {\n      delete requestOptions.thinking;\n    }\n    if (requestOptions.invocationKwargs?.output_config) {\n      delete requestOptions.invocationKwargs.output_config;\n    }\n  }\n\n  const hasActiveThinking = requestOptions.thinking != null;\n  const isThinkingModel =\n    /claude-3[-.]7/.test(mergedOptions.model) || supportsAdaptiveThinking(mergedOptions.model);\n  if (!isThinkingModel || !hasActiveThinking) {\n    requestOptions.topP = mergedOptions.topP;\n    requestOptions.topK = mergedOptions.topK;\n  }\n\n  const supportsCacheControl =\n    systemOptions.promptCache === true && checkPromptCacheSupport(requestOptions.model ?? '');\n\n  /** Pass promptCache boolean for downstream cache_control application */\n  if (supportsCacheControl) {\n    (requestOptions as Record<string, unknown>).promptCache = true;\n  }\n\n  const headers = getClaudeHeaders(requestOptions.model ?? '', supportsCacheControl);\n  if (headers && requestOptions.clientOptions) {\n    requestOptions.clientOptions.defaultHeaders = headers;\n  }\n\n  if (options.proxy && requestOptions.clientOptions) {\n    const proxyAgent = new ProxyAgent(options.proxy);\n    requestOptions.clientOptions.fetchOptions = {\n      dispatcher: proxyAgent,\n    };\n  }\n\n  if (options.reverseProxyUrl && requestOptions.clientOptions) {\n    requestOptions.clientOptions.baseURL = options.reverseProxyUrl;\n    requestOptions.anthropicApiUrl = options.reverseProxyUrl;\n  }\n\n  /** Handle defaultParams first - only process Anthropic-native params if undefined */\n  if (options.defaultParams && typeof options.defaultParams === 'object') {\n    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(options.defaultParams)) {\n      /** Handle web_search separately - don't add to config */\n      if (key === 'web_search') {\n        if (enableWebSearch === undefined && typeof value === 'boolean') {\n          enableWebSearch = value;\n        }\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      if (knownAnthropicParams.has(key)) {\n        /** Route known Anthropic params to requestOptions only if undefined */\n        applyDefaultParams(requestOptions as Record<string, unknown>, { [key]: value });\n      }\n      /** Leave other params for transform to handle - they might be OpenAI params */\n    }\n  }\n\n  /** Handle addParams - can override defaultParams */\n  if (options.addParams && typeof options.addParams === 'object') {\n    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(options.addParams)) {\n      /** Handle web_search separately - don't add to config */\n      if (key === 'web_search') {\n        if (typeof value === 'boolean') {\n          enableWebSearch = value;\n        }\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      if (knownAnthropicParams.has(key)) {\n        /** Route known Anthropic params to requestOptions */\n        (requestOptions as Record<string, unknown>)[key] = value;\n      }\n      /** Leave other params for transform to handle - they might be OpenAI params */\n    }\n  }\n\n  /** Handle dropParams - only drop from Anthropic config */\n  if (options.dropParams && Array.isArray(options.dropParams)) {\n    options.dropParams.forEach((param) => {\n      if (param === 'web_search') {\n        enableWebSearch = false;\n        return;\n      }\n\n      if (param in requestOptions) {\n        delete requestOptions[param as keyof AnthropicClientOptions];\n      }\n      if (requestOptions.invocationKwargs && param in requestOptions.invocationKwargs) {\n        delete (requestOptions.invocationKwargs as Record<string, unknown>)[param];\n      }\n    });\n  }\n\n  const tools = [];\n\n  if (enableWebSearch) {\n    tools.push({\n      type: 'web_search_20250305',\n      name: 'web_search',\n    });\n\n    if (isAnthropicVertexCredentials(creds)) {\n      if (!requestOptions.clientOptions) {\n        requestOptions.clientOptions = {};\n      }\n\n      requestOptions.clientOptions.defaultHeaders = {\n        ...requestOptions.clientOptions.defaultHeaders,\n        'anthropic-beta': 'web-search-2025-03-05',\n      };\n    }\n  }\n\n  return {\n    tools,\n    llmConfig: removeNullishValues(\n      requestOptions as Record<string, unknown>,\n    ) as AnthropicClientOptions & { clientOptions?: { fetchOptions?: { dispatcher: Dispatcher } } },\n  };\n}\n\nexport { getLLMConfig };\n","import { EModelEndpoint, AuthKeys } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { BaseInitializeParams, InitializeResultBase, AnthropicConfigOptions } from '~/types';\nimport { checkUserKeyExpiry, isEnabled } from '~/utils';\nimport { loadAnthropicVertexCredentials, getVertexCredentialOptions } from './vertex';\nimport { getLLMConfig } from './llm';\n\n/**\n * Initializes Anthropic endpoint configuration.\n * Supports both direct API key authentication and Google Cloud Vertex AI.\n *\n * @param params - Configuration parameters\n * @returns Promise resolving to Anthropic configuration options\n * @throws Error if API key is not provided (when not using Vertex AI)\n */\nexport async function initializeAnthropic({\n  req,\n  endpoint,\n  model_parameters,\n  db,\n}: BaseInitializeParams): Promise<InitializeResultBase> {\n  void endpoint;\n  const appConfig = req.config;\n  const { ANTHROPIC_API_KEY, ANTHROPIC_REVERSE_PROXY, PROXY } = process.env;\n  const { key: expiresAt } = req.body;\n\n  let credentials: Record<string, unknown> = {};\n  let vertexOptions: { region?: string; projectId?: string } | undefined;\n\n  /** @type {undefined | import('librechat-data-provider').TVertexAIConfig} */\n  const vertexConfig = appConfig?.endpoints?.[EModelEndpoint.anthropic]?.vertexConfig;\n\n  // Check for Vertex AI configuration: YAML config takes priority over env var\n  // When vertexConfig exists and enabled is not explicitly false, Vertex AI is enabled\n  const useVertexAI =\n    (vertexConfig && vertexConfig.enabled !== false) || isEnabled(process.env.ANTHROPIC_USE_VERTEX);\n\n  if (useVertexAI) {\n    // Load credentials with optional YAML config overrides\n    const credentialOptions = vertexConfig ? getVertexCredentialOptions(vertexConfig) : undefined;\n    credentials = await loadAnthropicVertexCredentials(credentialOptions);\n\n    // Store vertex options for client creation\n    if (vertexConfig) {\n      vertexOptions = {\n        region: vertexConfig.region,\n        projectId: vertexConfig.projectId,\n      };\n    }\n  } else {\n    const isUserProvided = ANTHROPIC_API_KEY === 'user_provided';\n\n    const anthropicApiKey = isUserProvided\n      ? await db.getUserKey({ userId: req.user?.id ?? '', name: EModelEndpoint.anthropic })\n      : ANTHROPIC_API_KEY;\n\n    if (!anthropicApiKey) {\n      throw new Error('Anthropic API key not provided. Please provide it again.');\n    }\n\n    if (expiresAt && isUserProvided) {\n      checkUserKeyExpiry(expiresAt, EModelEndpoint.anthropic);\n    }\n\n    credentials[AuthKeys.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY] = anthropicApiKey;\n  }\n\n  const clientOptions: AnthropicConfigOptions = {\n    proxy: PROXY ?? undefined,\n    reverseProxyUrl: ANTHROPIC_REVERSE_PROXY ?? undefined,\n    modelOptions: {\n      ...(model_parameters ?? {}),\n      user: req.user?.id,\n    },\n    // Pass Vertex AI options if configured\n    ...(vertexOptions && { vertexOptions }),\n    // Pass full Vertex AI config including model mappings\n    ...(vertexConfig && { vertexConfig }),\n  };\n\n  const anthropicConfig = appConfig?.endpoints?.[EModelEndpoint.anthropic];\n  const allConfig = appConfig?.endpoints?.all;\n\n  const result = getLLMConfig(credentials, clientOptions);\n\n  if (anthropicConfig?.streamRate) {\n    (result.llmConfig as Record<string, unknown>)._lc_stream_delay = anthropicConfig.streamRate;\n  }\n\n  if (allConfig?.streamRate) {\n    (result.llmConfig as Record<string, unknown>)._lc_stream_delay = allConfig.streamRate;\n  }\n\n  return result;\n}\n","import { HttpsProxyAgent } from 'https-proxy-agent';\nimport { NodeHttpHandler } from '@smithy/node-http-handler';\nimport { BedrockRuntimeClient } from '@aws-sdk/client-bedrock-runtime';\nimport {\n  AuthType,\n  EModelEndpoint,\n  extractEnvVariable,\n  bedrockInputParser,\n  bedrockOutputParser,\n  removeNullishValues,\n} from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type {\n  BaseInitializeParams,\n  InitializeResultBase,\n  BedrockCredentials,\n  GuardrailConfiguration,\n  InferenceProfileConfig,\n} from '~/types';\nimport { checkUserKeyExpiry } from '~/utils';\n\n/**\n * Initializes Bedrock endpoint configuration.\n *\n * This module handles configuration for AWS Bedrock endpoints, including support for\n * HTTP/HTTPS proxies and reverse proxies.\n *\n * Proxy Support:\n * - When the PROXY environment variable is set, creates a custom BedrockRuntimeClient\n *   with an HttpsProxyAgent to route all Bedrock API calls through the specified proxy\n * - The custom client is fully configured with credentials, region, and endpoint,\n *   and is passed directly to ChatBedrockConverse via the 'client' parameter\n *\n * Reverse Proxy Support:\n * - When BEDROCK_REVERSE_PROXY is set, routes Bedrock API calls through a custom endpoint\n * - Works with or without the PROXY setting\n *\n * Without Proxy:\n * - Credentials and endpoint configuration are passed separately to ChatBedrockConverse,\n *   which creates its own BedrockRuntimeClient internally\n *\n * @param params - Configuration parameters\n * @returns Promise resolving to Bedrock configuration options\n * @throws Error if credentials are not provided when required\n */\nexport async function initializeBedrock({\n  req,\n  endpoint,\n  model_parameters,\n  db,\n}: BaseInitializeParams): Promise<InitializeResultBase> {\n  void endpoint;\n  const appConfig = req.config;\n  const bedrockConfig = appConfig?.endpoints?.[EModelEndpoint.bedrock] as\n    | ({\n        guardrailConfig?: GuardrailConfiguration;\n        inferenceProfiles?: InferenceProfileConfig;\n      } & Record<string, unknown>)\n    | undefined;\n\n  const {\n    BEDROCK_AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY,\n    BEDROCK_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID,\n    BEDROCK_AWS_SESSION_TOKEN,\n    BEDROCK_REVERSE_PROXY,\n    BEDROCK_AWS_DEFAULT_REGION,\n    PROXY,\n  } = process.env;\n\n  const { key: expiresAt } = req.body;\n  const isUserProvided = BEDROCK_AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY === AuthType.USER_PROVIDED;\n\n  let credentials: BedrockCredentials | undefined = isUserProvided\n    ? await db\n        .getUserKey({ userId: req.user?.id ?? '', name: EModelEndpoint.bedrock })\n        .then((key) => JSON.parse(key) as BedrockCredentials)\n    : {\n        accessKeyId: BEDROCK_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID,\n        secretAccessKey: BEDROCK_AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY,\n        ...(BEDROCK_AWS_SESSION_TOKEN && { sessionToken: BEDROCK_AWS_SESSION_TOKEN }),\n      };\n\n  if (!credentials) {\n    throw new Error('Bedrock credentials not provided. Please provide them again.');\n  }\n\n  if (\n    !isUserProvided &&\n    (credentials.accessKeyId === undefined || credentials.accessKeyId === '') &&\n    (credentials.secretAccessKey === undefined || credentials.secretAccessKey === '')\n  ) {\n    credentials = undefined;\n  }\n\n  if (expiresAt && isUserProvided) {\n    checkUserKeyExpiry(expiresAt, EModelEndpoint.bedrock);\n  }\n\n  const requestOptions: Record<string, unknown> = {\n    model: model_parameters?.model as string | undefined,\n    region: BEDROCK_AWS_DEFAULT_REGION,\n  };\n\n  const configOptions: Record<string, unknown> = {};\n\n  const llmConfig = bedrockOutputParser(\n    bedrockInputParser.parse(\n      removeNullishValues({\n        ...requestOptions,\n        ...(model_parameters ?? {}),\n      }),\n    ),\n  ) as InitializeResultBase['llmConfig'] & {\n    model?: string;\n    region?: string;\n    client?: BedrockRuntimeClient;\n    credentials?: BedrockCredentials;\n    endpointHost?: string;\n    guardrailConfig?: GuardrailConfiguration;\n    applicationInferenceProfile?: string;\n  };\n\n  if (bedrockConfig?.guardrailConfig) {\n    llmConfig.guardrailConfig = bedrockConfig.guardrailConfig;\n  }\n\n  const model = model_parameters?.model as string | undefined;\n  if (model && bedrockConfig?.inferenceProfiles?.[model]) {\n    const applicationInferenceProfile = extractEnvVariable(bedrockConfig.inferenceProfiles[model]);\n    llmConfig.applicationInferenceProfile = applicationInferenceProfile;\n  }\n\n  /** Only include credentials if they're complete (accessKeyId and secretAccessKey are both set) */\n  const hasCompleteCredentials =\n    credentials &&\n    typeof credentials.accessKeyId === 'string' &&\n    credentials.accessKeyId !== '' &&\n    typeof credentials.secretAccessKey === 'string' &&\n    credentials.secretAccessKey !== '';\n\n  if (PROXY) {\n    const proxyAgent = new HttpsProxyAgent(PROXY);\n\n    // Create a custom BedrockRuntimeClient with proxy-enabled request handler.\n    // ChatBedrockConverse will use this pre-configured client directly instead of\n    // creating its own. Credentials are only set if explicitly provided; otherwise\n    // the AWS SDK's default credential provider chain is used (instance profiles,\n    // AWS profiles, environment variables, etc.)\n    const customClient = new BedrockRuntimeClient({\n      region: (llmConfig.region as string) ?? BEDROCK_AWS_DEFAULT_REGION,\n      ...(hasCompleteCredentials && {\n        credentials: credentials as { accessKeyId: string; secretAccessKey: string },\n      }),\n      requestHandler: new NodeHttpHandler({\n        httpAgent: proxyAgent,\n        httpsAgent: proxyAgent,\n      }),\n      ...(BEDROCK_REVERSE_PROXY && {\n        endpoint: `https://${BEDROCK_REVERSE_PROXY}`,\n      }),\n    });\n\n    llmConfig.client = customClient;\n  } else {\n    // When not using a proxy, let ChatBedrockConverse create its own client\n    // by providing credentials and endpoint separately\n    if (credentials) {\n      llmConfig.credentials = credentials;\n    }\n\n    if (BEDROCK_REVERSE_PROXY) {\n      llmConfig.endpointHost = BEDROCK_REVERSE_PROXY;\n    }\n  }\n\n  return {\n    llmConfig,\n    configOptions,\n  };\n}\n","import { EModelEndpoint, removeNullishValues } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { BindToolsInput } from '@langchain/core/language_models/chat_models';\nimport type { SettingDefinition } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { AzureOpenAIInput } from '@langchain/openai';\nimport type { OpenAI } from 'openai';\nimport type * as t from '~/types';\nimport { sanitizeModelName, constructAzureURL } from '~/utils/azure';\nimport { isEnabled } from '~/utils/common';\n\nexport const knownOpenAIParams = new Set([\n  // Constructor/Instance Parameters\n  'model',\n  'modelName',\n  'temperature',\n  'topP',\n  'frequencyPenalty',\n  'presencePenalty',\n  'n',\n  'logitBias',\n  'stop',\n  'stopSequences',\n  'user',\n  'timeout',\n  'stream',\n  'maxTokens',\n  'maxCompletionTokens',\n  'logprobs',\n  'topLogprobs',\n  'apiKey',\n  'organization',\n  'audio',\n  'modalities',\n  'reasoning',\n  'zdrEnabled',\n  'service_tier',\n  'supportsStrictToolCalling',\n  'useResponsesApi',\n  'configuration',\n  // Call-time Options\n  'tools',\n  'tool_choice',\n  'functions',\n  'function_call',\n  'response_format',\n  'seed',\n  'stream_options',\n  'parallel_tool_calls',\n  'strict',\n  'prediction',\n  'promptIndex',\n  // Responses API specific\n  'text',\n  'truncation',\n  'include',\n  'previous_response_id',\n  // LangChain specific\n  '__includeRawResponse',\n  'maxConcurrency',\n  'maxRetries',\n  'verbose',\n  'streaming',\n  'streamUsage',\n  'disableStreaming',\n]);\n\nfunction hasReasoningParams({\n  reasoning_effort,\n  reasoning_summary,\n}: {\n  reasoning_effort?: string | null;\n  reasoning_summary?: string | null;\n}): boolean {\n  return (\n    (reasoning_effort != null && reasoning_effort !== '') ||\n    (reasoning_summary != null && reasoning_summary !== '')\n  );\n}\n\n/**\n * Extracts default parameters from customParams.paramDefinitions\n * @param paramDefinitions - Array of parameter definitions with key and default values\n * @returns Record of default parameters\n */\nexport function extractDefaultParams(\n  paramDefinitions?: Partial<SettingDefinition>[],\n): Record<string, unknown> | undefined {\n  if (!paramDefinitions || !Array.isArray(paramDefinitions)) {\n    return undefined;\n  }\n\n  const defaults: Record<string, unknown> = {};\n  for (let i = 0; i < paramDefinitions.length; i++) {\n    const param = paramDefinitions[i];\n    if (param.key !== undefined && param.default !== undefined) {\n      defaults[param.key] = param.default;\n    }\n  }\n  return defaults;\n}\n\n/**\n * Applies default parameters to the target object only if the field is undefined\n * @param target - The target object to apply defaults to\n * @param defaults - Record of default parameter values\n */\nexport function applyDefaultParams(\n  target: Record<string, unknown>,\n  defaults: Record<string, unknown>,\n) {\n  for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(defaults)) {\n    if (target[key] === undefined) {\n      target[key] = value;\n    }\n  }\n}\n\nexport function getOpenAILLMConfig({\n  azure,\n  apiKey,\n  baseURL,\n  endpoint,\n  streaming,\n  addParams,\n  dropParams,\n  defaultParams,\n  useOpenRouter,\n  modelOptions: _modelOptions,\n}: {\n  apiKey: string;\n  streaming: boolean;\n  baseURL?: string | null;\n  endpoint?: EModelEndpoint | string | null;\n  modelOptions: Partial<t.OpenAIParameters>;\n  addParams?: Record<string, unknown>;\n  dropParams?: string[];\n  defaultParams?: Record<string, unknown>;\n  useOpenRouter?: boolean;\n  azure?: false | t.AzureOptions;\n}): Pick<t.LLMConfigResult, 'llmConfig' | 'tools'> & {\n  azure?: t.AzureOptions;\n} {\n  /** Clean empty strings from model options (e.g., temperature: \"\" should be removed) */\n  const cleanedModelOptions = removeNullishValues(\n    _modelOptions,\n    true,\n  ) as Partial<t.OpenAIParameters>;\n\n  const {\n    reasoning_effort,\n    reasoning_summary,\n    verbosity,\n    web_search,\n    frequency_penalty,\n    presence_penalty,\n    ...modelOptions\n  } = cleanedModelOptions;\n\n  const llmConfig = Object.assign(\n    {\n      streaming,\n      model: modelOptions.model ?? '',\n    },\n    modelOptions,\n  ) as Partial<t.OAIClientOptions> & Partial<t.OpenAIParameters> & Partial<AzureOpenAIInput>;\n\n  if (frequency_penalty != null) {\n    llmConfig.frequencyPenalty = frequency_penalty;\n  }\n  if (presence_penalty != null) {\n    llmConfig.presencePenalty = presence_penalty;\n  }\n\n  const modelKwargs: Record<string, unknown> = {};\n  let hasModelKwargs = false;\n\n  if (verbosity != null && verbosity !== '') {\n    modelKwargs.verbosity = verbosity;\n    hasModelKwargs = true;\n  }\n\n  let enableWebSearch = web_search;\n\n  /** Apply defaultParams first - only if fields are undefined */\n  if (defaultParams && typeof defaultParams === 'object') {\n    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(defaultParams)) {\n      /** Handle web_search separately - don't add to config */\n      if (key === 'web_search') {\n        if (enableWebSearch === undefined && typeof value === 'boolean') {\n          enableWebSearch = value;\n        }\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      if (knownOpenAIParams.has(key)) {\n        applyDefaultParams(llmConfig as Record<string, unknown>, { [key]: value });\n      } else {\n        /** Apply to modelKwargs if not a known param */\n        if (modelKwargs[key] === undefined) {\n          modelKwargs[key] = value;\n          hasModelKwargs = true;\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  /** Apply addParams - can override defaultParams */\n  if (addParams && typeof addParams === 'object') {\n    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(addParams)) {\n      /** Handle web_search directly here instead of adding to modelKwargs or llmConfig */\n      if (key === 'web_search') {\n        if (typeof value === 'boolean') {\n          enableWebSearch = value;\n        }\n        continue;\n      }\n      if (knownOpenAIParams.has(key)) {\n        (llmConfig as Record<string, unknown>)[key] = value;\n      } else {\n        hasModelKwargs = true;\n        modelKwargs[key] = value;\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  if (useOpenRouter) {\n    llmConfig.include_reasoning = true;\n  }\n\n  if (\n    hasReasoningParams({ reasoning_effort, reasoning_summary }) &&\n    (llmConfig.useResponsesApi === true ||\n      (endpoint !== EModelEndpoint.openAI && endpoint !== EModelEndpoint.azureOpenAI))\n  ) {\n    llmConfig.reasoning = removeNullishValues(\n      {\n        effort: reasoning_effort,\n        summary: reasoning_summary,\n      },\n      true,\n    ) as OpenAI.Reasoning;\n  } else if (hasReasoningParams({ reasoning_effort })) {\n    llmConfig.reasoning_effort = reasoning_effort;\n  }\n\n  if (llmConfig.max_tokens != null) {\n    llmConfig.maxTokens = llmConfig.max_tokens;\n    delete llmConfig.max_tokens;\n  }\n\n  const tools: BindToolsInput[] = [];\n\n  /** Check if web_search should be disabled via dropParams */\n  if (dropParams && dropParams.includes('web_search')) {\n    enableWebSearch = false;\n  }\n\n  if (useOpenRouter && enableWebSearch) {\n    /** OpenRouter expects web search as a plugins parameter */\n    modelKwargs.plugins = [{ id: 'web' }];\n    hasModelKwargs = true;\n  } else if (enableWebSearch) {\n    /** Standard OpenAI web search uses tools API */\n    llmConfig.useResponsesApi = true;\n    tools.push({ type: 'web_search' });\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Note: OpenAI reasoning models (o1/o3/gpt-5) do not support temperature and other sampling parameters\n   * Exception: gpt-5-chat and versioned models like gpt-5.1 DO support these parameters\n   */\n  if (\n    modelOptions.model &&\n    /\\b(o[13]|gpt-5)(?!\\.|-chat)(?:-|$)/.test(modelOptions.model as string)\n  ) {\n    const reasoningExcludeParams = [\n      'frequencyPenalty',\n      'presencePenalty',\n      'temperature',\n      'topP',\n      'logitBias',\n      'n',\n      'logprobs',\n    ];\n\n    const updatedDropParams = dropParams || [];\n    const combinedDropParams = [...new Set([...updatedDropParams, ...reasoningExcludeParams])];\n\n    combinedDropParams.forEach((param) => {\n      if (param in llmConfig) {\n        delete llmConfig[param as keyof t.OAIClientOptions];\n      }\n    });\n  } else if (modelOptions.model && /gpt-4o.*search/.test(modelOptions.model as string)) {\n    /**\n     * Note: OpenAI Web Search models do not support any known parameters besides `max_tokens`\n     */\n    const searchExcludeParams = [\n      'frequency_penalty',\n      'presence_penalty',\n      'reasoning',\n      'reasoning_effort',\n      'temperature',\n      'top_p',\n      'top_k',\n      'stop',\n      'logit_bias',\n      'seed',\n      'response_format',\n      'n',\n      'logprobs',\n      'user',\n    ];\n\n    const updatedDropParams = dropParams || [];\n    const combinedDropParams = [...new Set([...updatedDropParams, ...searchExcludeParams])];\n\n    combinedDropParams.forEach((param) => {\n      if (param in llmConfig) {\n        delete llmConfig[param as keyof t.OAIClientOptions];\n      }\n    });\n  } else if (dropParams && Array.isArray(dropParams)) {\n    dropParams.forEach((param) => {\n      if (param in llmConfig) {\n        delete llmConfig[param as keyof t.OAIClientOptions];\n      }\n    });\n  }\n\n  if (modelKwargs.verbosity && llmConfig.useResponsesApi === true) {\n    modelKwargs.text = { verbosity: modelKwargs.verbosity };\n    delete modelKwargs.verbosity;\n  }\n\n  if (\n    llmConfig.model &&\n    /\\bgpt-[5-9](?:\\.\\d+)?\\b/i.test(llmConfig.model) &&\n    llmConfig.maxTokens != null\n  ) {\n    const paramName =\n      llmConfig.useResponsesApi === true ? 'max_output_tokens' : 'max_completion_tokens';\n    modelKwargs[paramName] = llmConfig.maxTokens;\n    delete llmConfig.maxTokens;\n    hasModelKwargs = true;\n  }\n\n  if (hasModelKwargs) {\n    llmConfig.modelKwargs = modelKwargs;\n  }\n\n  if (!azure) {\n    llmConfig.apiKey = apiKey;\n    return { llmConfig, tools };\n  }\n\n  const useModelName = isEnabled(process.env.AZURE_USE_MODEL_AS_DEPLOYMENT_NAME);\n  const updatedAzure = { ...azure };\n  updatedAzure.azureOpenAIApiDeploymentName = useModelName\n    ? sanitizeModelName(llmConfig.model || '')\n    : azure.azureOpenAIApiDeploymentName;\n\n  if (process.env.AZURE_OPENAI_DEFAULT_MODEL) {\n    llmConfig.model = process.env.AZURE_OPENAI_DEFAULT_MODEL;\n  }\n\n  const constructAzureOpenAIBasePath = () => {\n    if (!baseURL) {\n      return;\n    }\n    const azureURL = constructAzureURL({\n      baseURL,\n      azureOptions: updatedAzure,\n    });\n    updatedAzure.azureOpenAIBasePath = azureURL.split(\n      `/${updatedAzure.azureOpenAIApiDeploymentName}`,\n    )[0];\n  };\n\n  constructAzureOpenAIBasePath();\n  Object.assign(llmConfig, updatedAzure);\n\n  const constructAzureResponsesApi = () => {\n    if (!llmConfig.useResponsesApi) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    delete llmConfig.azureOpenAIApiDeploymentName;\n    delete llmConfig.azureOpenAIApiInstanceName;\n    delete llmConfig.azureOpenAIApiVersion;\n    delete llmConfig.azureOpenAIBasePath;\n    delete llmConfig.azureOpenAIApiKey;\n    llmConfig.apiKey = apiKey;\n  };\n\n  constructAzureResponsesApi();\n\n  llmConfig.model = updatedAzure.azureOpenAIApiDeploymentName;\n  return { llmConfig, tools, azure: updatedAzure };\n}\n","import { Providers } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport { googleSettings, AuthKeys, removeNullishValues } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { GoogleClientOptions, VertexAIClientOptions } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type { GoogleAIToolType } from '@langchain/google-common';\nimport type * as t from '~/types';\nimport { isEnabled } from '~/utils';\n\n/** Known Google/Vertex AI parameters that map directly to the client config */\nexport const knownGoogleParams = new Set([\n  'model',\n  'modelName',\n  'temperature',\n  'maxOutputTokens',\n  'maxReasoningTokens',\n  'topP',\n  'topK',\n  'seed',\n  'presencePenalty',\n  'frequencyPenalty',\n  'stopSequences',\n  'stop',\n  'logprobs',\n  'topLogprobs',\n  'safetySettings',\n  'responseModalities',\n  'convertSystemMessageToHumanContent',\n  'speechConfig',\n  'streamUsage',\n  'apiKey',\n  'baseUrl',\n  'location',\n  'authOptions',\n]);\n\n/**\n * Applies default parameters to the target object only if the field is undefined\n * @param target - The target object to apply defaults to\n * @param defaults - Record of default parameter values\n */\nfunction applyDefaultParams(target: Record<string, unknown>, defaults: Record<string, unknown>) {\n  for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(defaults)) {\n    if (target[key] === undefined) {\n      target[key] = value;\n    }\n  }\n}\n\nfunction getThresholdMapping(model: string) {\n  const gemini1Pattern = /gemini-(1\\.0|1\\.5|pro$|1\\.0-pro|1\\.5-pro|1\\.5-flash-001)/;\n  const restrictedPattern = /(gemini-(1\\.5-flash-8b|2\\.0|exp)|learnlm)/;\n\n  if (gemini1Pattern.test(model)) {\n    return (value: string) => {\n      if (value === 'OFF') {\n        return 'BLOCK_NONE';\n      }\n      return value;\n    };\n  }\n\n  if (restrictedPattern.test(model)) {\n    return (value: string) => {\n      if (value === 'OFF' || value === 'HARM_BLOCK_THRESHOLD_UNSPECIFIED') {\n        return 'BLOCK_NONE';\n      }\n      return value;\n    };\n  }\n\n  return (value: string) => value;\n}\n\nexport function getSafetySettings(\n  model?: string,\n): Array<{ category: string; threshold: string }> | undefined {\n  if (isEnabled(process.env.GOOGLE_EXCLUDE_SAFETY_SETTINGS)) {\n    return undefined;\n  }\n  const mapThreshold = getThresholdMapping(model ?? '');\n\n  return [\n    {\n      category: 'HARM_CATEGORY_SEXUALLY_EXPLICIT',\n      threshold: mapThreshold(\n        process.env.GOOGLE_SAFETY_SEXUALLY_EXPLICIT || 'HARM_BLOCK_THRESHOLD_UNSPECIFIED',\n      ),\n    },\n    {\n      category: 'HARM_CATEGORY_HATE_SPEECH',\n      threshold: mapThreshold(\n        process.env.GOOGLE_SAFETY_HATE_SPEECH || 'HARM_BLOCK_THRESHOLD_UNSPECIFIED',\n      ),\n    },\n    {\n      category: 'HARM_CATEGORY_HARASSMENT',\n      threshold: mapThreshold(\n        process.env.GOOGLE_SAFETY_HARASSMENT || 'HARM_BLOCK_THRESHOLD_UNSPECIFIED',\n      ),\n    },\n    {\n      category: 'HARM_CATEGORY_DANGEROUS_CONTENT',\n      threshold: mapThreshold(\n        process.env.GOOGLE_SAFETY_DANGEROUS_CONTENT || 'HARM_BLOCK_THRESHOLD_UNSPECIFIED',\n      ),\n    },\n    {\n      category: 'HARM_CATEGORY_CIVIC_INTEGRITY',\n      threshold: mapThreshold(process.env.GOOGLE_SAFETY_CIVIC_INTEGRITY || 'BLOCK_NONE'),\n    },\n  ];\n}\n\n/**\n * Replicates core logic from GoogleClient's constructor and setOptions, plus client determination.\n * Returns an object with the provider label and the final options that would be passed to createLLM.\n *\n * @param credentials - Either a JSON string or an object containing Google keys\n * @param options - The same shape as the \"GoogleClient\" constructor options\n */\n\nexport function getGoogleConfig(\n  credentials: string | t.GoogleCredentials | undefined,\n  options: t.GoogleConfigOptions = {},\n  acceptRawApiKey = false,\n) {\n  let creds: t.GoogleCredentials = {};\n  if (acceptRawApiKey && typeof credentials === 'string') {\n    creds[AuthKeys.GOOGLE_API_KEY] = credentials;\n  } else if (typeof credentials === 'string') {\n    try {\n      creds = JSON.parse(credentials);\n    } catch (err: unknown) {\n      throw new Error(\n        `Error parsing string credentials: ${err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Unknown error'}`,\n      );\n    }\n  } else if (credentials && typeof credentials === 'object') {\n    creds = credentials;\n  }\n\n  const serviceKeyRaw = creds[AuthKeys.GOOGLE_SERVICE_KEY] ?? {};\n  const serviceKey =\n    typeof serviceKeyRaw === 'string' ? JSON.parse(serviceKeyRaw) : (serviceKeyRaw ?? {});\n\n  const apiKey = creds[AuthKeys.GOOGLE_API_KEY] ?? null;\n  const project_id = !apiKey ? (serviceKey?.project_id ?? null) : null;\n\n  const reverseProxyUrl = options.reverseProxyUrl;\n  const authHeader = options.authHeader;\n\n  const {\n    web_search,\n    thinking = googleSettings.thinking.default,\n    thinkingBudget = googleSettings.thinkingBudget.default,\n    ...modelOptions\n  } = options.modelOptions || {};\n\n  let enableWebSearch = web_search;\n\n  const llmConfig: GoogleClientOptions | VertexAIClientOptions = removeNullishValues(\n    {\n      ...(modelOptions || {}),\n      model: modelOptions?.model ?? '',\n      maxRetries: 2,\n      topP: modelOptions?.topP ?? undefined,\n      topK: modelOptions?.topK ?? undefined,\n      temperature: modelOptions?.temperature ?? undefined,\n      maxOutputTokens: modelOptions?.maxOutputTokens ?? undefined,\n    },\n    true,\n  );\n\n  /** Used only for Safety Settings */\n  llmConfig.safetySettings = getSafetySettings(llmConfig.model);\n\n  let provider;\n\n  if (project_id) {\n    provider = Providers.VERTEXAI;\n  } else {\n    provider = Providers.GOOGLE;\n  }\n\n  // If we have a GCP project => Vertex AI\n  if (provider === Providers.VERTEXAI) {\n    (llmConfig as VertexAIClientOptions).authOptions = {\n      credentials: { ...serviceKey },\n      projectId: project_id,\n    };\n    (llmConfig as VertexAIClientOptions).location = process.env.GOOGLE_LOC || 'us-central1';\n  } else if (apiKey && provider === Providers.GOOGLE) {\n    llmConfig.apiKey = apiKey;\n  } else {\n    throw new Error(\n      `Invalid credentials provided. Please provide either a valid API key or service account credentials for Google Cloud.`,\n    );\n  }\n\n  const shouldEnableThinking =\n    thinking && thinkingBudget != null && (thinkingBudget > 0 || thinkingBudget === -1);\n\n  if (shouldEnableThinking && provider === Providers.GOOGLE) {\n    (llmConfig as GoogleClientOptions).thinkingConfig = {\n      thinkingBudget: thinking ? thinkingBudget : googleSettings.thinkingBudget.default,\n      includeThoughts: Boolean(thinking),\n    };\n  } else if (shouldEnableThinking && provider === Providers.VERTEXAI) {\n    (llmConfig as VertexAIClientOptions).thinkingBudget = thinking\n      ? thinkingBudget\n      : googleSettings.thinkingBudget.default;\n    (llmConfig as VertexAIClientOptions).includeThoughts = Boolean(thinking);\n  }\n\n  /*\n  let legacyOptions = {};\n  // Filter out any \"examples\" that are empty\n  legacyOptions.examples = (legacyOptions.examples ?? (legacyOptions.examples?.length) {\n    llmConfig.examples = legacyOptions.examples.map((ex) => {\n      const { input, output } = ex;\n      if (!input?.content || !output?.content) {return undefined;}\n      return {\n        input: new HumanMessage(input.content),\n        output: new AIMessage(output.content),\n      };\n    }).filter(Boolean);\n  }\n  */\n\n  if (reverseProxyUrl) {\n    (llmConfig as GoogleClientOptions).baseUrl = reverseProxyUrl;\n  }\n\n  if (authHeader) {\n    (llmConfig as GoogleClientOptions).customHeaders = {\n      Authorization: `Bearer ${apiKey}`,\n    };\n  }\n\n  /** Handle defaultParams first - only process Google-native params if undefined */\n  if (options.defaultParams && typeof options.defaultParams === 'object') {\n    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(options.defaultParams)) {\n      /** Handle web_search separately - don't add to config */\n      if (key === 'web_search') {\n        if (enableWebSearch === undefined && typeof value === 'boolean') {\n          enableWebSearch = value;\n        }\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      if (knownGoogleParams.has(key)) {\n        /** Route known Google params to llmConfig only if undefined */\n        applyDefaultParams(llmConfig as Record<string, unknown>, { [key]: value });\n      }\n      /** Leave other params for transform to handle - they might be OpenAI params */\n    }\n  }\n\n  /** Handle addParams - can override defaultParams */\n  if (options.addParams && typeof options.addParams === 'object') {\n    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(options.addParams)) {\n      /** Handle web_search separately - don't add to config */\n      if (key === 'web_search') {\n        if (typeof value === 'boolean') {\n          enableWebSearch = value;\n        }\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      if (knownGoogleParams.has(key)) {\n        /** Route known Google params to llmConfig */\n        (llmConfig as Record<string, unknown>)[key] = value;\n      }\n      /** Leave other params for transform to handle - they might be OpenAI params */\n    }\n  }\n\n  /** Handle dropParams - only drop from Google config */\n  if (options.dropParams && Array.isArray(options.dropParams)) {\n    options.dropParams.forEach((param) => {\n      if (param === 'web_search') {\n        enableWebSearch = false;\n        return;\n      }\n\n      if (param in llmConfig) {\n        delete (llmConfig as Record<string, unknown>)[param];\n      }\n    });\n  }\n\n  const tools: GoogleAIToolType[] = [];\n\n  if (enableWebSearch) {\n    tools.push({ googleSearch: {} });\n  }\n\n  // Return the final shape\n  return {\n    /** @type {GoogleAIToolType[]} */\n    tools,\n    /** @type {Providers.GOOGLE | Providers.VERTEXAI} */\n    provider,\n    /** @type {GoogleClientOptions | VertexAIClientOptions} */\n    llmConfig,\n  };\n}\n","import { EModelEndpoint } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { GoogleAIToolType } from '@langchain/google-common';\nimport type { ClientOptions } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type * as t from '~/types';\nimport { knownOpenAIParams } from './llm';\n\nconst anthropicExcludeParams = new Set(['anthropicApiUrl']);\nconst googleExcludeParams = new Set([\n  'safetySettings',\n  'location',\n  'baseUrl',\n  'customHeaders',\n  'thinkingConfig',\n  'thinkingBudget',\n  'includeThoughts',\n]);\n\n/** Google-specific tool types that have no OpenAI-compatible equivalent */\nconst googleToolsToFilter = new Set(['googleSearch']);\n\nexport type ConfigTools = Array<Record<string, unknown>> | Array<GoogleAIToolType>;\n\n/**\n * Transforms a Non-OpenAI LLM config to an OpenAI-conformant config.\n * Non-OpenAI parameters are moved to modelKwargs.\n * Also extracts configuration options that belong in configOptions.\n * Handles addParams and dropParams for parameter customization.\n * Filters out provider-specific tools that have no OpenAI equivalent.\n */\nexport function transformToOpenAIConfig({\n  tools,\n  addParams,\n  dropParams,\n  defaultParams,\n  llmConfig,\n  fromEndpoint,\n}: {\n  tools?: ConfigTools;\n  addParams?: Record<string, unknown>;\n  dropParams?: string[];\n  defaultParams?: Record<string, unknown>;\n  llmConfig: ClientOptions;\n  fromEndpoint: string;\n}): {\n  tools: ConfigTools;\n  llmConfig: t.OAIClientOptions;\n  configOptions: Partial<t.OpenAIConfiguration>;\n} {\n  const openAIConfig: Partial<t.OAIClientOptions> = {};\n  let configOptions: Partial<t.OpenAIConfiguration> = {};\n  let modelKwargs: Record<string, unknown> = {};\n  let hasModelKwargs = false;\n\n  const isAnthropic = fromEndpoint === EModelEndpoint.anthropic;\n  const isGoogle = fromEndpoint === EModelEndpoint.google;\n\n  let excludeParams = new Set<string>();\n  if (isAnthropic) {\n    excludeParams = anthropicExcludeParams;\n  } else if (isGoogle) {\n    excludeParams = googleExcludeParams;\n  }\n\n  for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(llmConfig)) {\n    if (value === undefined || value === null) {\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    if (excludeParams.has(key)) {\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    if (isAnthropic && key === 'clientOptions') {\n      configOptions = Object.assign({}, configOptions, value as Partial<t.OpenAIConfiguration>);\n      continue;\n    } else if (isAnthropic && key === 'invocationKwargs') {\n      modelKwargs = Object.assign({}, modelKwargs, value as Record<string, unknown>);\n      hasModelKwargs = true;\n      continue;\n    } else if (isGoogle && key === 'authOptions') {\n      modelKwargs = Object.assign({}, modelKwargs, value as Record<string, unknown>);\n      hasModelKwargs = true;\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    if (knownOpenAIParams.has(key)) {\n      (openAIConfig as Record<string, unknown>)[key] = value;\n    } else {\n      modelKwargs[key] = value;\n      hasModelKwargs = true;\n    }\n  }\n\n  if (addParams && typeof addParams === 'object') {\n    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(addParams)) {\n      /** Skip web_search - it's handled separately as a tool */\n      if (key === 'web_search') {\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      if (knownOpenAIParams.has(key)) {\n        (openAIConfig as Record<string, unknown>)[key] = value;\n      } else {\n        modelKwargs[key] = value;\n        hasModelKwargs = true;\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  if (hasModelKwargs) {\n    openAIConfig.modelKwargs = modelKwargs;\n  }\n\n  if (dropParams && Array.isArray(dropParams)) {\n    dropParams.forEach((param) => {\n      /** Skip web_search - handled separately */\n      if (param === 'web_search') {\n        return;\n      }\n\n      if (param in openAIConfig) {\n        delete openAIConfig[param as keyof t.OAIClientOptions];\n      }\n      if (openAIConfig.modelKwargs && param in openAIConfig.modelKwargs) {\n        delete openAIConfig.modelKwargs[param];\n      }\n    });\n\n    /** Clean up empty modelKwargs after dropParams processing */\n    if (openAIConfig.modelKwargs && Object.keys(openAIConfig.modelKwargs).length === 0) {\n      delete openAIConfig.modelKwargs;\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Filter out provider-specific tools that have no OpenAI equivalent.\n   * Exception: If web_search was explicitly enabled via addParams or defaultParams,\n   * preserve googleSearch tools (pass through in Google-native format).\n   */\n  const webSearchExplicitlyEnabled =\n    addParams?.web_search === true || defaultParams?.web_search === true;\n\n  const filterGoogleTool = (tool: unknown): boolean => {\n    if (!isGoogle) {\n      return true;\n    }\n    if (typeof tool !== 'object' || tool === null) {\n      return false;\n    }\n    const toolKeys = Object.keys(tool as Record<string, unknown>);\n    const isGoogleSpecificTool = toolKeys.some((key) => googleToolsToFilter.has(key));\n    /** Preserve googleSearch if web_search was explicitly enabled */\n    if (isGoogleSpecificTool && webSearchExplicitlyEnabled) {\n      return true;\n    }\n    return !isGoogleSpecificTool;\n  };\n\n  const filteredTools = Array.isArray(tools) ? tools.filter(filterGoogleTool) : [];\n\n  return {\n    tools: filteredTools,\n    llmConfig: openAIConfig as t.OAIClientOptions,\n    configOptions,\n  };\n}\n","import { ProxyAgent } from 'undici';\nimport { Providers } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport { KnownEndpoints, EModelEndpoint } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type * as t from '~/types';\nimport { getLLMConfig as getAnthropicLLMConfig } from '~/endpoints/anthropic/llm';\nimport { getOpenAILLMConfig, extractDefaultParams } from './llm';\nimport { getGoogleConfig } from '~/endpoints/google/llm';\nimport { transformToOpenAIConfig } from './transform';\nimport { constructAzureURL } from '~/utils/azure';\nimport { createFetch } from '~/utils/generators';\n\ntype Fetch = (input: string | URL | Request, init?: RequestInit) => Promise<Response>;\n\n/**\n * Generates configuration options for creating a language model (LLM) instance.\n * @param apiKey - The API key for authentication.\n * @param options - Additional options for configuring the LLM.\n * @param endpoint - The endpoint name\n * @returns Configuration options for creating an LLM instance.\n */\nexport function getOpenAIConfig(\n  apiKey: string,\n  options: t.OpenAIConfigOptions = {},\n  endpoint?: string | null,\n): t.OpenAIConfigResult {\n  const {\n    proxy,\n    addParams,\n    dropParams,\n    defaultQuery,\n    directEndpoint,\n    streaming = true,\n    modelOptions = {},\n    reverseProxyUrl: baseURL,\n  } = options;\n\n  /** Extract default params from customParams.paramDefinitions */\n  const defaultParams = extractDefaultParams(options.customParams?.paramDefinitions);\n\n  let llmConfig: t.OAIClientOptions;\n  let tools: t.LLMConfigResult['tools'];\n  const isAnthropic = options.customParams?.defaultParamsEndpoint === EModelEndpoint.anthropic;\n  const isGoogle = options.customParams?.defaultParamsEndpoint === EModelEndpoint.google;\n\n  const useOpenRouter =\n    !isAnthropic &&\n    !isGoogle &&\n    ((baseURL && baseURL.includes(KnownEndpoints.openrouter)) ||\n      (endpoint != null && endpoint.toLowerCase().includes(KnownEndpoints.openrouter)));\n  const endpoint.toLowerCase().includes(KnownEndpoints.vercel)));\n\n  let azure = options.azure;\n  let headers = options.headers;\n  if (isAnthropic) {\n    const anthropicResult = getAnthropicLLMConfig(apiKey, {\n      modelOptions,\n      proxy: options.proxy,\n      reverseProxyUrl: baseURL,\n      addParams,\n      dropParams,\n      defaultParams,\n    });\n    /** Transform handles addParams/dropParams - it knows about OpenAI params */\n    const transformed = transformToOpenAIConfig({\n      addParams,\n      dropParams,\n      llmConfig: anthropicResult.llmConfig,\n      fromEndpoint: EModelEndpoint.anthropic,\n    });\n    llmConfig = transformed.llmConfig;\n    tools = anthropicResult.tools;\n    if (transformed.configOptions?.defaultHeaders) {\n      headers = Object.assign(headers ?? {}, transformed.configOptions?.defaultHeaders);\n    }\n  } else if (isGoogle) {\n    const googleResult = getGoogleConfig(\n      apiKey,\n      {\n        modelOptions,\n        reverseProxyUrl: baseURL ?? undefined,\n        authHeader: true,\n        addParams,\n        dropParams,\n        defaultParams,\n      },\n      true,\n    );\n    /** Transform handles addParams/dropParams - it knows about OpenAI params */\n    const transformed = transformToOpenAIConfig({\n      addParams,\n      dropParams,\n      defaultParams,\n      tools: googleResult.tools,\n      llmConfig: googleResult.llmConfig,\n      fromEndpoint: EModelEndpoint.google,\n    });\n    llmConfig = transformed.llmConfig;\n    tools = transformed.tools;\n  } else {\n    const openaiResult = getOpenAILLMConfig({\n      azure,\n      apiKey,\n      baseURL,\n      endpoint,\n      streaming,\n      addParams,\n      dropParams,\n      defaultParams,\n      modelOptions,\n      useOpenRouter,\n    });\n    llmConfig = openaiResult.llmConfig;\n    azure = openaiResult.azure;\n    tools = openaiResult.tools;\n  }\n\n  const configOptions: t.OpenAIConfiguration = {};\n  if (baseURL) {\n    configOptions.baseURL = baseURL;\n  }\n  if (useOpenRouter || isVercel) {\n    configOptions.defaultHeaders = Object.assign(\n      {\n        'HTTP-Referer': 'https://librechat.ai',\n        'X-Title': 'LibreChat',\n      },\n      headers,\n    );\n  } else if (headers) {\n    configOptions.defaultHeaders = headers;\n  }\n\n  if (defaultQuery) {\n    configOptions.defaultQuery = defaultQuery;\n  }\n\n  if (proxy) {\n    const proxyAgent = new ProxyAgent(proxy);\n    configOptions.fetchOptions = {\n      dispatcher: proxyAgent,\n    };\n  }\n\n  if (azure && !isAnthropic) {\n    const constructAzureResponsesApi = () => {\n      if (!llmConfig.useResponsesApi || !azure) {\n        return;\n      }\n\n      const updatedUrl = configOptions.baseURL?.replace(/\\/deployments(?:\\/.*)?$/, '/v1');\n\n      configOptions.baseURL = constructAzureURL({\n        baseURL: updatedUrl || 'https://${INSTANCE_NAME}.openai.azure.com/openai/v1',\n        azureOptions: azure,\n      });\n\n      configOptions.defaultHeaders = {\n        ...configOptions.defaultHeaders,\n        'api-key': apiKey,\n      };\n      configOptions.defaultQuery = {\n        ...configOptions.defaultQuery,\n        'api-version': configOptions.defaultQuery?.['api-version'] ?? 'preview',\n      };\n    };\n\n    constructAzureResponsesApi();\n  }\n\n  if (process.env.OPENAI_ORGANIZATION && !isAnthropic) {\n    configOptions.organization = process.env.OPENAI_ORGANIZATION;\n  }\n\n  if (directEndpoint === true && configOptions?.baseURL != null) {\n    configOptions.fetch = createFetch({\n      directEndpoint: directEndpoint,\n      reverseProxyUrl: configOptions?.baseURL,\n    }) as unknown as Fetch;\n  }\n\n  const result: t.OpenAIConfigResult = {\n    llmConfig,\n    configOptions,\n    tools,\n  };\n  if (useOpenRouter) {\n    result.provider = Providers.OPENROUTER;\n  }\n  return result;\n}\n","import axios from 'axios';\nimport { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { HttpsProxyAgent } from 'https-proxy-agent';\nimport { CacheKeys, KnownEndpoints, EModelEndpoint, defaultModels } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { IUser } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport {\n  processModelData,\n  extractBaseURL,\n  isUserProvided,\n  resolveHeaders,\n  deriveBaseURL,\n  logAxiosError,\n  inputSchema,\n} from '~/utils';\nimport { standardCache } from '~/cache';\n\nexport interface FetchModelsParams {\n  /** User ID for API requests */\n  user?: string;\n  /** API key for authentication */\n  apiKey: string;\n  /** Base URL for the API */\n  baseURL?: string;\n  /** Endpoint name (defaults to 'openAI') */\n  name?: string;\n  /** Whether directEndpoint was configured */\n  direct?: boolean;\n  /** Whether to fetch from Azure */\n  azure?: boolean;\n  /** Whether to send user ID as query parameter */\n  userIdQuery?: boolean;\n  /** Whether to create token configuration from API response */\n  createTokenConfig?: boolean;\n  /** Cache key for token configuration (uses name if omitted) */\n  tokenKey?: string;\n  /** Optional headers for the request */\n  headers?: Record<string, string> | null;\n  /** Optional user object for header resolution */\n  userObject?: Partial<IUser>;\n}\n\n/**\n * Fetches Ollama models from the specified base API path.\n * @param baseURL - The Ollama server URL\n * @param options - Optional configuration\n * @returns Promise resolving to array of model names\n */\nasync function fetchOllamaModels(\n  baseURL: string,\n  options: { headers?: Record<string, string> | null; user?: Partial<IUser> } = {},\n): Promise<string[]> {\n  if (!baseURL) {\n    return [];\n  }\n\n  const ollamaEndpoint = deriveBaseURL(baseURL);\n\n  const resolvedHeaders = resolveHeaders({\n    headers: options.headers ?? undefined,\n    user: options.user,\n  });\n\n  const response = await axios.get<{ models: Array<{ name: string }> }>(\n    `${ollamaEndpoint}/api/tags`,\n    {\n      headers: resolvedHeaders,\n      timeout: 5000,\n    },\n  );\n\n  return response.data.models.map((tag) => tag.name);\n}\n\n/**\n * Splits a string by commas and trims each resulting value.\n * @param input - The input string to split.\n * @returns An array of trimmed values.\n */\nexport function splitAndTrim(input: string | null | undefined): string[] {\n  if (!input || typeof input !== 'string') {\n    return [];\n  }\n  return input\n    .split(',')\n    .map((item) => item.trim())\n    .filter(Boolean);\n}\n\n/**\n * Fetches models from the specified base API path or Azure, based on the provided configuration.\n *\n * @param params - The parameters for fetching the models.\n * @returns A promise that resolves to an array of model identifiers.\n */\nexport async function fetchModels({\n  user,\n  apiKey,\n  baseURL: _baseURL,\n  name = EModelEndpoint.openAI,\n  direct = false,\n  azure = false,\n  userIdQuery = false,\n  createTokenConfig = true,\n  tokenKey,\n  headers,\n  userObject,\n}: FetchModelsParams): Promise<string[]> {\n  let models: string[] = [];\n  const baseURL = direct ? extractBaseURL(_baseURL ?? '') : _baseURL;\n\n  if (!baseURL && !azure) {\n    return models;\n  }\n\n  if (!apiKey) {\n    return models;\n  }\n\n  if (name && name.toLowerCase().startsWith(KnownEndpoints.ollama)) {\n    try {\n      return await fetchOllamaModels(baseURL ?? '', { headers, user: userObject });\n    } catch (ollamaError) {\n      const logMessage =\n        'Failed to fetch models from Ollama API. Attempting to fetch via OpenAI-compatible endpoint.';\n      logAxiosError({ message: logMessage, error: ollamaError as Error });\n    }\n  }\n\n  try {\n    const options: {\n      headers: Record<string, string>;\n      timeout: number;\n      httpsAgent?: HttpsProxyAgent<string>;\n    } = {\n      headers: {\n        ...(headers ?? {}),\n      },\n      timeout: 5000,\n    };\n\n    if (name === EModelEndpoint.anthropic) {\n      options.headers = {\n        'x-api-key': apiKey,\n        'anthropic-version': process.env.ANTHROPIC_VERSION || '2023-06-01',\n      };\n    } else {\n      options.headers.Authorization = `Bearer ${apiKey}`;\n    }\n\n    if (process.env.PROXY) {\n      options.httpsAgent = new HttpsProxyAgent(process.env.PROXY);\n    }\n\n    if (process.env.OPENAI_ORGANIZATION && baseURL?.includes('openai')) {\n      options.headers['OpenAI-Organization'] = process.env.OPENAI_ORGANIZATION;\n    }\n\n    const url = new URL(`${(baseURL ?? '').replace(/\\/+$/, '')}${azure ? '' : '/models'}`);\n    if (user && userIdQuery) {\n      url.searchParams.append('user', user);\n    }\n    const res = await axios.get(url.toString(), options);\n\n    const input = res.data;\n\n    const validationResult = inputSchema.safeParse(input);\n    if (validationResult.success && createTokenConfig) {\n      const endpointTokenConfig = processModelData(input);\n      const cache = standardCache(CacheKeys.TOKEN_CONFIG);\n      await cache.set(tokenKey ?? name, endpointTokenConfig);\n    }\n    models = input.data.map((item: { id: string }) => item.id);\n  } catch (error) {\n    const logMessage = `Failed to fetch models from ${azure ? 'Azure ' : ''}${name} API`;\n    logAxiosError({ message: logMessage, error: error as Error });\n  }\n\n  return models;\n}\n\n/** Options for fetching OpenAI models */\nexport interface GetOpenAIModelsOptions {\n  /** User ID for API requests */\n  user?: string;\n  /** Whether to fetch from Azure */\n  azure?: boolean;\n  /** Whether to fetch models for the Assistants endpoint */\n  assistants?: boolean;\n  /** OpenAI API key (if not using environment variable) */\n  openAIApiKey?: string;\n  /** Whether user provides their own API key */\n  userProvidedOpenAI?: boolean;\n}\n\n/**\n * Fetches models from OpenAI or Azure based on the provided options.\n * @param opts - Options for fetching models\n * @param _models - Fallback models array\n * @returns Promise resolving to array of model IDs\n */\nexport async function fetchOpenAIModels(\n  opts: GetOpenAIModelsOptions,\n  _models: string[] = [],\n): Promise<string[]> {\n  let models = _models.slice() ?? [];\n  const apiKey = opts.openAIApiKey ?? process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY;\n  const openaiBaseURL = 'https://api.openai.com/v1';\n  let baseURL = openaiBaseURL;\n  let reverseProxyUrl = process.env.OPENAI_REVERSE_PROXY;\n\n  if (opts.assistants && process.env.ASSISTANTS_BASE_URL) {\n    reverseProxyUrl = process.env.ASSISTANTS_BASE_URL;\n  } else if (opts.azure) {\n    return models;\n  }\n\n  if (reverseProxyUrl) {\n    baseURL = extractBaseURL(reverseProxyUrl) ?? openaiBaseURL;\n  }\n\n  const modelsCache = standardCache(CacheKeys.MODEL_QUERIES);\n\n  const cachedModels = await modelsCache.get(baseURL);\n  if (cachedModels) {\n    return cachedModels as string[];\n  }\n\n  if (baseURL || opts.azure) {\n    models = await fetchModels({\n      apiKey: apiKey ??
