'',\n      baseURL,\n      azure: opts.azure,\n      user: opts.user,\n      name: EModelEndpoint.openAI,\n    });\n  }\n\n  if (models.length === 0) {\n    return _models;\n  }\n\n  if (baseURL === openaiBaseURL) {\n    const regex = /(text-davinci-003|gpt-|o\\d+)/;\n    const excludeRegex = /audio|realtime/;\n    models = models.filter((model) => regex.test(model) && !excludeRegex.test(model));\n    const instructModels = models.filter((model) => model.includes('instruct'));\n    const otherModels = models.filter((model) => !model.includes('instruct'));\n    models = otherModels.concat(instructModels);\n  }\n\n  await modelsCache.set(baseURL, models);\n  return models;\n}\n\n/**\n * Loads the default models for OpenAI or Azure.\n * @param opts - Options for getting models\n * @returns Promise resolving to array of model IDs\n */\nexport async function getOpenAIModels(opts: GetOpenAIModelsOptions = {}): Promise<string[]> {\n  let models = defaultModels[EModelEndpoint.openAI];\n\n  if (opts.assistants) {\n    models = defaultModels[EModelEndpoint.assistants];\n  } else if (opts.azure) {\n    models = defaultModels[EModelEndpoint.azureAssistants];\n  }\n\n  let key: string;\n  if (opts.assistants) {\n    key = 'ASSISTANTS_MODELS';\n  } else if (opts.azure) {\n    key = 'AZURE_OPENAI_MODELS';\n  } else {\n    key = 'OPENAI_MODELS';\n  }\n\n  if (process.env[key]) {\n    return splitAndTrim(process.env[key]);\n  }\n\n  if (opts.userProvidedOpenAI) {\n    return models;\n  }\n\n  return await fetchOpenAIModels(opts, models);\n}\n\n/**\n * Fetches models from the Anthropic API.\n * @param opts - Options for fetching models\n * @param _models - Fallback models array\n * @returns Promise resolving to array of model IDs\n */\nexport async function fetchAnthropicModels(\n  opts: { user?: string } = {},\n  _models: string[] = [],\n): Promise<string[]> {\n  let models = _models.slice() ?? [];\n  const apiKey = process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY;\n  const anthropicBaseURL = 'https://api.anthropic.com/v1';\n  let baseURL = anthropicBaseURL;\n  const reverseProxyUrl = process.env.ANTHROPIC_REVERSE_PROXY;\n\n  if (reverseProxyUrl) {\n    baseURL = extractBaseURL(reverseProxyUrl) ?? anthropicBaseURL;\n  }\n\n  if (!apiKey) {\n    return models;\n  }\n\n  const modelsCache = standardCache(CacheKeys.MODEL_QUERIES);\n\n  const cachedModels = await modelsCache.get(baseURL);\n  if (cachedModels) {\n    return cachedModels as string[];\n  }\n\n  if (baseURL) {\n    models = await fetchModels({\n      apiKey,\n      baseURL,\n      user: opts.user,\n      name: EModelEndpoint.anthropic,\n      tokenKey: EModelEndpoint.anthropic,\n    });\n  }\n\n  if (models.length === 0) {\n    return _models;\n  }\n\n  await modelsCache.set(baseURL, models);\n  return models;\n}\n\n/**\n * Gets Anthropic models from environment or API.\n * @param opts - Options for fetching models\n * @returns Promise resolving to array of model IDs\n */\nexport async function getAnthropicModels(\n  opts: { user?: string; vertexModels?: string[] } = {},\n): Promise<string[]> {\n  const models = defaultModels[EModelEndpoint.anthropic];\n\n  // Vertex AI models from YAML config take priority\n  if (opts.vertexModels && opts.vertexModels.length > 0) {\n    return opts.vertexModels;\n  }\n\n  if (process.env.ANTHROPIC_MODELS) {\n    return splitAndTrim(process.env.ANTHROPIC_MODELS);\n  }\n\n  if (isUserProvided(process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY)) {\n    return models;\n  }\n\n  try {\n    return await fetchAnthropicModels(opts, models);\n  } catch (error) {\n    logger.error('Error fetching Anthropic models:', error);\n    return models;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Gets Google models from environment or defaults.\n * @returns Array of model IDs\n */\nexport function getGoogleModels(): string[] {\n  let models = defaultModels[EModelEndpoint.google];\n  if (process.env.GOOGLE_MODELS) {\n    models = splitAndTrim(process.env.GOOGLE_MODELS);\n  }\n  return models;\n}\n\n/**\n * Gets Bedrock models from environment or defaults.\n * @returns Array of model IDs\n */\nexport function getBedrockModels(): string[] {\n  let models = defaultModels[EModelEndpoint.bedrock];\n  if (process.env.BEDROCK_AWS_MODELS) {\n    models = splitAndTrim(process.env.BEDROCK_AWS_MODELS);\n  }\n  return models;\n}\n","import {\n  CacheKeys,\n  ErrorTypes,\n  envVarRegex,\n  FetchTokenConfig,\n  extractEnvVariable,\n} from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { TEndpoint } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { AppConfig } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { BaseInitializeParams, InitializeResultBase, EndpointTokenConfig } from '~/types';\nimport { getOpenAIConfig } from '~/endpoints/openai/config';\nimport { getCustomEndpointConfig } from '~/app/config';\nimport { fetchModels } from '~/endpoints/models';\nimport { isUserProvided, checkUserKeyExpiry } from '~/utils';\nimport { standardCache } from '~/cache';\n\nconst { PROXY } = process.env;\n\n/**\n * Builds custom options from endpoint configuration\n */\nfunction buildCustomOptions(\n  endpointConfig: Partial<TEndpoint>,\n  appConfig?: AppConfig,\n  endpointTokenConfig?: Record<string, unknown>,\n) {\n  const customOptions: Record<string, unknown> = {\n    headers: endpointConfig.headers,\n    addParams: endpointConfig.addParams,\n    dropParams: endpointConfig.dropParams,\n    customParams: endpointConfig.customParams,\n    titleConvo: endpointConfig.titleConvo,\n    titleModel: endpointConfig.titleModel,\n    summaryModel: endpointConfig.summaryModel,\n    modelDisplayLabel: endpointConfig.modelDisplayLabel,\n    titleMethod: endpointConfig.titleMethod ?? 'completion',\n    contextStrategy: endpointConfig.summarize ? 'summarize' : null,\n    directEndpoint: endpointConfig.directEndpoint,\n    titleMessageRole: endpointConfig.titleMessageRole,\n    streamRate: endpointConfig.streamRate,\n    endpointTokenConfig,\n  };\n\n  const allConfig = appConfig?.endpoints?.all;\n  if (allConfig) {\n    customOptions.streamRate = allConfig.streamRate;\n  }\n\n  return customOptions;\n}\n\n/**\n * Initializes a custom endpoint client configuration.\n * This function handles custom endpoints defined in librechat.yaml, including\n * user-provided API keys and URLs.\n *\n * @param params - Configuration parameters\n * @returns Promise resolving to endpoint configuration options\n * @throws Error if config is missing, API key is not provided, or base URL is missing\n */\nexport async function initializeCustom({\n  req,\n  endpoint,\n  model_parameters,\n  db,\n}: BaseInitializeParams): Promise<InitializeResultBase> {\n  const appConfig = req.config;\n  const { key: expiresAt } = req.body;\n\n  const endpointConfig = getCustomEndpointConfig({\n    endpoint,\n    appConfig,\n  });\n\n  if (!endpointConfig) {\n    throw new Error(`Config not found for the ${endpoint} custom endpoint.`);\n  }\n\n  const CUSTOM_API_KEY = extractEnvVariable(endpointConfig.apiKey ?? '');\n  const CUSTOM_BASE_URL = extractEnvVariable(endpointConfig.baseURL ?? '');\n\n  if (CUSTOM_API_KEY.match(envVarRegex)) {\n    throw new Error(`Missing API Key for ${endpoint}.`);\n  }\n\n  if (CUSTOM_BASE_URL.match(envVarRegex)) {\n    throw new Error(`Missing Base URL for ${endpoint}.`);\n  }\n\n  const userProvidesKey = isUserProvided(CUSTOM_API_KEY);\n  const userProvidesURL = isUserProvided(CUSTOM_BASE_URL);\n\n  let userValues = null;\n  if (expiresAt && (userProvidesKey || userProvidesURL)) {\n    checkUserKeyExpiry(expiresAt, endpoint);\n    userValues = await db.getUserKeyValues({ userId: req.user?.id ?? '', name: endpoint });\n  }\n\n  const apiKey = userProvidesKey ? userValues?.apiKey : CUSTOM_API_KEY;\n  const baseURL = userProvidesURL ? userValues?.baseURL : CUSTOM_BASE_URL;\n\n  if (userProvidesKey && !apiKey) {\n    throw new Error(\n      JSON.stringify({\n        type: ErrorTypes.NO_USER_KEY,\n      }),\n    );\n  }\n\n  if (userProvidesURL && !baseURL) {\n    throw new Error(\n      JSON.stringify({\n        type: ErrorTypes.NO_BASE_URL,\n      }),\n    );\n  }\n\n  if (!apiKey) {\n    throw new Error(`${endpoint} API key not provided.`);\n  }\n\n  if (!baseURL) {\n    throw new Error(`${endpoint} Base URL not provided.`);\n  }\n\n  let endpointTokenConfig: EndpointTokenConfig | undefined;\n\n  const userId = req.user?.id ?? '';\n\n  const cache = standardCache(CacheKeys.TOKEN_CONFIG);\n  /** tokenConfig is an optional extended property on custom endpoints */\n  const hasTokenConfig = (endpointConfig as Record<string, unknown>).tokenConfig != null;\n  const tokenKey =\n    !hasTokenConfig && (userProvidesKey || userProvidesURL) ? `${endpoint}:${userId}` : endpoint;\n\n  const cachedConfig =\n    !hasTokenConfig &&\n    FetchTokenConfig[endpoint.toLowerCase() as keyof typeof FetchTokenConfig] &&\n    (await cache.get(tokenKey));\n\n  endpointTokenConfig = (cachedConfig as EndpointTokenConfig) || undefined;\n\n  if (\n    FetchTokenConfig[endpoint.toLowerCase() as keyof typeof FetchTokenConfig] &&\n    endpointConfig &&\n    endpointConfig.models?.fetch &&\n    !endpointTokenConfig\n  ) {\n    await fetchModels({ apiKey, baseURL, name: endpoint, user: userId, tokenKey });\n    endpointTokenConfig = (await cache.get(tokenKey)) as EndpointTokenConfig | undefined;\n  }\n\n  const customOptions = buildCustomOptions(endpointConfig, appConfig, endpointTokenConfig);\n\n  const clientOptions: Record<string, unknown> = {\n    reverseProxyUrl: baseURL ?? null,\n    proxy: PROXY ?? null,\n    ...customOptions,\n  };\n\n  const modelOptions = { ...(model_parameters ?? {}), user: userId };\n  const finalClientOptions = {\n    modelOptions,\n    ...clientOptions,\n  };\n\n  const options = getOpenAIConfig(apiKey, finalClientOptions, endpoint);\n  if (options != null) {\n    (options as InitializeResultBase).useLegacyContent = true;\n    (options as InitializeResultBase).endpointTokenConfig = endpointTokenConfig;\n  }\n\n  const streamRate = clientOptions.streamRate as number | undefined;\n  if (streamRate) {\n    (options.llmConfig as Record<string, unknown>)._lc_stream_delay = streamRate;\n  }\n\n  return options;\n}\n","import path from 'path';\nimport { EModelEndpoint, AuthKeys } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type {\n  BaseInitializeParams,\n  InitializeResultBase,\n  GoogleConfigOptions,\n  GoogleCredentials,\n} from '~/types';\nimport { isEnabled, loadServiceKey, checkUserKeyExpiry } from '~/utils';\nimport { getGoogleConfig } from './llm';\n\n/**\n * Initializes Google/Vertex AI endpoint configuration.\n * Supports both API key authentication and service account credentials.\n *\n * @param params - Configuration parameters\n * @returns Promise resolving to Google configuration options\n * @throws Error if no valid credentials are provided\n */\nexport async function initializeGoogle({\n  req,\n  endpoint,\n  model_parameters,\n  db,\n}: BaseInitializeParams): Promise<InitializeResultBase> {\n  void endpoint;\n  const appConfig = req.config;\n  const { GOOGLE_KEY, GOOGLE_REVERSE_PROXY, GOOGLE_AUTH_HEADER, PROXY } = process.env;\n  const isUserProvided = GOOGLE_KEY === 'user_provided';\n  const { key: expiresAt } = req.body;\n\n  let userKey = null;\n  if (expiresAt && isUserProvided) {\n    checkUserKeyExpiry(expiresAt, EModelEndpoint.google);\n    userKey = await db.getUserKey({ userId: req.user?.id, name: EModelEndpoint.google });\n  }\n\n  let serviceKey: Record<string, unknown> = {};\n\n  /** Check if GOOGLE_KEY is provided at all (including 'user_provided') */\n  const isGoogleKeyProvided =\n    (GOOGLE_KEY && GOOGLE_KEY.trim() !== '') || (isUserProvided && userKey != null);\n\n  if (!isGoogleKeyProvided && loadServiceKey) {\n    /** Only attempt to load service key if GOOGLE_KEY is not provided */\n    try {\n      const serviceKeyPath =\n        process.env.GOOGLE_SERVICE_KEY_FILE || path.join(process.cwd(), 'api', 'data', 'auth.json');\n      const loadedKey = await loadServiceKey(serviceKeyPath);\n      if (loadedKey) {\n        serviceKey = loadedKey;\n      }\n    } catch {\n      // Service key loading failed, but that's okay if not required\n      serviceKey = {};\n    }\n  }\n\n  const credentials: GoogleCredentials = isUserProvided\n    ? (userKey as GoogleCredentials)\n    : {\n        [AuthKeys.GOOGLE_SERVICE_KEY]: serviceKey,\n        [AuthKeys.GOOGLE_API_KEY]: GOOGLE_KEY,\n      };\n\n  let clientOptions: GoogleConfigOptions = {};\n\n  /** @type {undefined | TBaseEndpoint} */\n  const allConfig = appConfig?.endpoints?.all;\n  /** @type {undefined | TBaseEndpoint} */\n  const googleConfig = appConfig?.endpoints?.[EModelEndpoint.google];\n\n  if (googleConfig) {\n    clientOptions.streamRate = googleConfig.streamRate;\n    clientOptions.titleModel = googleConfig.titleModel;\n  }\n\n  if (allConfig) {\n    clientOptions.streamRate = allConfig.streamRate;\n  }\n\n  clientOptions = {\n    reverseProxyUrl: GOOGLE_REVERSE_PROXY ?? undefined,\n    authHeader: isEnabled(GOOGLE_AUTH_HEADER) ?? undefined,\n    proxy: PROXY ?? undefined,\n    modelOptions: model_parameters ?? {},\n    ...clientOptions,\n  };\n\n  return getGoogleConfig(credentials, clientOptions);\n}\n","import { ErrorTypes, EModelEndpoint, mapModelToAzureConfig } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type {\n  BaseInitializeParams,\n  InitializeResultBase,\n  OpenAIConfigOptions,\n  UserKeyValues,\n} from '~/types';\nimport { getAzureCredentials, resolveHeaders, isUserProvided, checkUserKeyExpiry } from '~/utils';\nimport { getOpenAIConfig } from './config';\n\n/**\n * Initializes OpenAI options for agent usage. This function always returns configuration\n * options and never creates a client instance (equivalent to optionsOnly=true behavior).\n *\n * @param params - Configuration parameters\n * @returns Promise resolving to OpenAI configuration options\n * @throws Error if API key is missing or user key has expired\n */\nexport async function initializeOpenAI({\n  req,\n  endpoint,\n  model_parameters,\n  db,\n}: BaseInitializeParams): Promise<InitializeResultBase> {\n  const appConfig = req.config;\n  const { PROXY, OPENAI_API_KEY, AZURE_API_KEY, OPENAI_REVERSE_PROXY, AZURE_OPENAI_BASEURL } =\n    process.env;\n\n  const { key: expiresAt } = req.body;\n  const modelName = model_parameters?.model as string | undefined;\n\n  const credentials = {\n    [EModelEndpoint.openAI]: OPENAI_API_KEY,\n    [EModelEndpoint.azureOpenAI]: AZURE_API_KEY,\n  };\n\n  const baseURLOptions = {\n    [EModelEndpoint.openAI]: OPENAI_REVERSE_PROXY,\n    [EModelEndpoint.azureOpenAI]: AZURE_OPENAI_BASEURL,\n  };\n\n  const userProvidesKey = isUserProvided(credentials[endpoint as keyof typeof credentials]);\n  const userProvidesURL = isUserProvided(baseURLOptions[endpoint as keyof typeof baseURLOptions]);\n\n  let userValues: UserKeyValues | null = null;\n  if (expiresAt && (userProvidesKey || userProvidesURL)) {\n    checkUserKeyExpiry(expiresAt, endpoint);\n    userValues = await db.getUserKeyValues({ userId: req.user?.id ?? '', name: endpoint });\n  }\n\n  let apiKey = userProvidesKey\n    ? userValues?.apiKey\n    : credentials[endpoint as keyof typeof credentials];\n  const baseURL = userProvidesURL\n    ? userValues?.baseURL\n    : baseURLOptions[endpoint as keyof typeof baseURLOptions];\n\n  const clientOptions: OpenAIConfigOptions = {\n    proxy: PROXY ?? undefined,\n    reverseProxyUrl: baseURL || undefined,\n    streaming: true,\n  };\n\n  const isAzureOpenAI = endpoint === EModelEndpoint.azureOpenAI;\n  const azureConfig = isAzureOpenAI && appConfig?.endpoints?.[EModelEndpoint.azureOpenAI];\n  let isServerless = false;\n\n  if (isAzureOpenAI && azureConfig) {\n    const { modelGroupMap, groupMap } = azureConfig;\n    const {\n      azureOptions,\n      baseURL: configBaseURL,\n      headers = {},\n      serverless,\n    } = mapModelToAzureConfig({\n      modelName: modelName || '',\n      modelGroupMap,\n      groupMap,\n    });\n    isServerless = serverless === true;\n\n    clientOptions.reverseProxyUrl = configBaseURL ?? clientOptions.reverseProxyUrl;\n    clientOptions.headers = resolveHeaders({\n      headers: { ...headers, ...(clientOptions.headers ?? {}) },\n      user: req.user,\n    });\n\n    const groupName = modelGroupMap[modelName || '']?.group;\n    if (groupName && groupMap[groupName]) {\n      clientOptions.addParams = groupMap[groupName]?.addParams;\n      clientOptions.dropParams = groupMap[groupName]?.dropParams;\n    }\n\n    apiKey = azureOptions.azureOpenAIApiKey;\n    clientOptions.azure = !isServerless ? azureOptions : undefined;\n\n    if (isServerless) {\n      clientOptions.defaultQuery = azureOptions.azureOpenAIApiVersion\n        ? { 'api-version': azureOptions.azureOpenAIApiVersion }\n        : undefined;\n\n      if (!clientOptions.headers) {\n        clientOptions.headers = {};\n      }\n      clientOptions.headers['api-key'] = apiKey;\n    }\n  } else if (isAzureOpenAI) {\n    clientOptions.azure =\n      userProvidesKey && userValues?.apiKey ? JSON.parse(userValues.apiKey) : getAzureCredentials();\n    apiKey = clientOptions.azure ? clientOptions.azure.azureOpenAIApiKey : undefined;\n  }\n\n  if (userProvidesKey && !apiKey) {\n    throw new Error(\n      JSON.stringify({\n        type: ErrorTypes.NO_USER_KEY,\n      }),\n    );\n  }\n\n  if (!apiKey) {\n    throw new Error(`${endpoint} API Key not provided.`);\n  }\n\n  const modelOptions = {\n    ...(model_parameters ?? {}),\n    model: modelName,\n    user: req.user?.id,\n  };\n\n  const finalClientOptions: OpenAIConfigOptions = {\n    ...clientOptions,\n    modelOptions,\n  };\n\n  const options = getOpenAIConfig(apiKey, finalClientOptions, endpoint);\n\n  /** Set useLegacyContent for Azure serverless deployments */\n  if (isServerless) {\n    (options as InitializeResultBase).useLegacyContent = true;\n  }\n\n  const openAIConfig = appConfig?.endpoints?.[EModelEndpoint.openAI];\n  const allConfig = appConfig?.endpoints?.all;\n  const azureRate = modelName?.includes('gpt-4') ? 30 : 17;\n\n  let streamRate: number | undefined;\n\n  if (isAzureOpenAI && azureConfig) {\n    streamRate = azureConfig.streamRate ?? azureRate;\n  } else if (!isAzureOpenAI && openAIConfig) {\n    streamRate = openAIConfig.streamRate;\n  }\n\n  if (allConfig?.streamRate) {\n    streamRate = allConfig.streamRate;\n  }\n\n  if (streamRate) {\n    options.llmConfig._lc_stream_delay = streamRate;\n  }\n\n  return options;\n}\n","import { Providers } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport { EModelEndpoint } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { TEndpoint } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { AppConfig } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { BaseInitializeParams, InitializeResultBase } from '~/types';\nimport { initializeAnthropic } from './anthropic/initialize';\nimport { initializeBedrock } from './bedrock/initialize';\nimport { initializeCustom } from './custom/initialize';\nimport { initializeGoogle } from './google/initialize';\nimport { initializeOpenAI } from './openai/initialize';\nimport { getCustomEndpointConfig } from '~/app/config';\n\n/**\n * Type for initialize functions\n */\nexport type InitializeFn = (params: BaseInitializeParams) => Promise<InitializeResultBase>;\n\n/**\n * Check if the provider is a known custom provider\n * @param provider - The provider string\n * @returns True if the provider is a known custom provider, false otherwise\n */\nexport function isKnownCustomProvider(provider?: string): boolean {\n  return [Providers.XAI, Providers.DEEPSEEK, Providers.OPENROUTER, Providers.MOONSHOT].includes(\n    (provider?.toLowerCase() ?? '') as Providers,\n  );\n}\n\n/**\n * Provider configuration map mapping providers to their initialization functions\n */\nexport const providerConfigMap: Record<string, InitializeFn> = {\n  [Providers.XAI]: initializeCustom,\n  [Providers.DEEPSEEK]: initializeCustom,\n  [Providers.MOONSHOT]: initializeCustom,\n  [Providers.OPENROUTER]: initializeCustom,\n  [EModelEndpoint.openAI]: initializeOpenAI,\n  [EModelEndpoint.google]: initializeGoogle,\n  [EModelEndpoint.bedrock]: initializeBedrock,\n  [EModelEndpoint.azureOpenAI]: initializeOpenAI,\n  [EModelEndpoint.anthropic]: initializeAnthropic,\n};\n\n/**\n * Result from getProviderConfig\n */\nexport interface ProviderConfigResult {\n  /** The initialization function for this provider */\n  getOptions: InitializeFn;\n  /** The resolved provider name (may be different from input if normalized) */\n  overrideProvider: string;\n  /** Custom endpoint configuration (if applicable) */\n  customEndpointConfig?: Partial<TEndpoint>;\n}\n\n/**\n * Get the provider configuration and override endpoint based on the provider string\n *\n * @param params - Configuration parameters\n * @param params.provider - The provider string\n * @param params.appConfig - The application configuration\n * @returns Provider configuration including getOptions function, override provider, and custom config\n * @throws Error if provider is not supported\n */\nexport function getProviderConfig({\n  provider,\n  appConfig,\n}: {\n  provider: string;\n  appConfig?: AppConfig;\n}): ProviderConfigResult {\n  let getOptions = providerConfigMap[provider];\n  let overrideProvider = provider;\n  let customEndpointConfig: Partial<TEndpoint> | undefined;\n\n  if (!getOptions && providerConfigMap[provider.toLowerCase()] != null) {\n    overrideProvider = provider.toLowerCase();\n    getOptions = providerConfigMap[overrideProvider];\n  } else if (!getOptions) {\n    customEndpointConfig = getCustomEndpointConfig({ endpoint: provider, appConfig });\n    if (!customEndpointConfig) {\n      throw new Error(`Provider ${provider} not supported`);\n    }\n    getOptions = initializeCustom;\n    overrideProvider = Providers.OPENAI;\n  }\n\n  if (isKnownCustomProvider(overrideProvider) && !customEndpointConfig) {\n    customEndpointConfig = getCustomEndpointConfig({ endpoint: provider, appConfig });\n    if (!customEndpointConfig) {\n      throw new Error(`Provider ${provider} not supported`);\n    }\n  }\n\n  return {\n    getOptions,\n    overrideProvider,\n    customEndpointConfig,\n  };\n}\n","import { EModelEndpoint, extractEnvVariable, normalizeEndpointName } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { TCustomEndpoints, TEndpoint } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { TCustomEndpointsConfig } from '~/types/endpoints';\nimport { isUserProvided } from '~/utils';\n\n/**\n * Load config endpoints from the cached configuration object\n * @param customEndpointsConfig - The configuration object\n */\nexport function loadCustomEndpointsConfig(\n  customEndpoints?: TCustomEndpoints,\n): TCustomEndpointsConfig | undefined {\n  if (!customEndpoints) {\n    return;\n  }\n\n  const customEndpointsConfig: TCustomEndpointsConfig = {};\n\n  if (Array.isArray(customEndpoints)) {\n    const filteredEndpoints = customEndpoints.filter(\n      (endpoint) =>\n        endpoint.baseURL &&\n        endpoint.apiKey &&\n        endpoint.name &&\n        endpoint.models &&\n        (endpoint.models.fetch || endpoint.models.default),\n    );\n\n    for (let i = 0; i < filteredEndpoints.length; i++) {\n      const endpoint = filteredEndpoints[i] as TEndpoint;\n      const {\n        baseURL,\n        apiKey,\n        name: configName,\n        iconURL,\n        modelDisplayLabel,\n        customParams,\n      } = endpoint;\n      const name = normalizeEndpointName(configName);\n\n      const resolvedApiKey = extractEnvVariable(apiKey ?? '');\n      const resolvedBaseURL = extractEnvVariable(baseURL ?? '');\n\n      customEndpointsConfig[name] = {\n        type: EModelEndpoint.custom,\n        userProvide: isUserProvided(resolvedApiKey),\n        userProvideURL: isUserProvided(resolvedBaseURL),\n        customParams,\n        modelDisplayLabel,\n        iconURL,\n      };\n    }\n  }\n\n  return customEndpointsConfig;\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { EModelEndpoint, EToolResources, AgentCapabilities } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { AgentToolResources, TFile, AgentBaseResource } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { IMongoFile, AppConfig, IUser } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { FilterQuery, QueryOptions, ProjectionType } from 'mongoose';\nimport type { Request as ServerRequest } from 'express';\n\n/**\n * Function type for retrieving files from the database\n * @param filter - MongoDB filter query for files\n * @param _sortOptions - Sorting options (currently unused)\n * @param selectFields - Field selection options\n * @param options - Additional options including userId and agentId for access control\n * @returns Promise resolving to array of files\n */\nexport type TGetFiles = (\n  filter: FilterQuery<IMongoFile>,\n  _sortOptions: ProjectionType<IMongoFile> | null | undefined,\n  selectFields: QueryOptions<IMongoFile> | null | undefined,\n  options?: { userId?: string; agentId?: string },\n) => Promise<Array<TFile>>;\n\n/**\n * Helper function to add a file to a specific tool resource category\n * Prevents duplicate files within the same resource category\n * @param params - Parameters object\n * @param params.file - The file to add to the resource\n * @param params.resourceType - The type of tool resource (e.g., execute_code, file_search, image_edit)\n * @param params.tool_resources - The agent's tool resources object to update\n * @param params.processedResourceFiles - Set tracking processed files per resource type\n */\nconst addFileToResource = ({\n  file,\n  resourceType,\n  tool_resources,\n  processedResourceFiles,\n}: {\n  file: TFile;\n  resourceType: EToolResources;\n  tool_resources: AgentToolResources;\n  processedResourceFiles: Set<string>;\n}): void => {\n  if (!file.file_id) {\n    return;\n  }\n\n  const resourceKey = `${resourceType}:${file.file_id}`;\n  if (processedResourceFiles.has(resourceKey)) {\n    return;\n  }\n\n  const resource = tool_resources[resourceType as keyof AgentToolResources] ?? {};\n  if (!resource.files) {\n    (tool_resources[resourceType as keyof AgentToolResources] as AgentBaseResource) = {\n      ...resource,\n      files: [],\n    };\n  }\n\n  // Check if already exists in the files array\n  const resourceFiles = tool_resources[resourceType as keyof AgentToolResources]?.files;\n  const alreadyExists = resourceFiles?.some((f: TFile) => f.file_id === file.file_id);\n\n  if (!alreadyExists) {\n    resourceFiles?.push(file);\n    processedResourceFiles.add(resourceKey);\n  }\n};\n\n/**\n * Categorizes a file into the appropriate tool resource based on its properties\n * Files are categorized as:\n * - execute_code: Files with fileIdentifier metadata\n * - file_search: Files marked as embedded\n * - image_edit: Image files in the request file set with dimensions\n * @param params - Parameters object\n * @param params.file - The file to categorize\n * @param params.tool_resources - The agent's tool resources to update\n * @param params.requestFileSet - Set of file IDs from the current request\n * @param params.processedResourceFiles - Set tracking processed files per resource type\n */\nconst categorizeFileForToolResources = ({\n  file,\n  tool_resources,\n  requestFileSet,\n  processedResourceFiles,\n}: {\n  file: TFile;\n  tool_resources: AgentToolResources;\n  requestFileSet: Set<string>;\n  processedResourceFiles: Set<string>;\n}): void => {\n  if (file.metadata?.fileIdentifier) {\n    addFileToResource({\n      file,\n      resourceType: EToolResources.execute_code,\n      tool_resources,\n      processedResourceFiles,\n    });\n    return;\n  }\n\n  if (file.embedded === true) {\n    addFileToResource({\n      file,\n      resourceType: EToolResources.file_search,\n      tool_resources,\n      processedResourceFiles,\n    });\n    return;\n  }\n\n  if (\n    requestFileSet.has(file.file_id) &&\n    file.type.startsWith('image') &&\n    file.height &&\n    file.width\n  ) {\n    addFileToResource({\n      file,\n      resourceType: EToolResources.image_edit,\n      tool_resources,\n      processedResourceFiles,\n    });\n  }\n};\n\n/**\n * Primes resources for agent execution by processing attachments and tool resources\n * This function:\n * 1. Fetches OCR files if OCR is enabled\n * 2. Processes attachment files\n * 3. Categorizes files into appropriate tool resources\n * 4. Prevents duplicate files across all sources\n *\n * @param params - Parameters object\n * @param params.req - Express request object\n * @param params.appConfig - Application configuration object\n * @param params.getFiles - Function to retrieve files from database\n * @param params.requestFileSet - Set of file IDs from the current request\n * @param params.attachments - Promise resolving to array of attachment files\n * @param params.tool_resources - Existing tool resources for the agent\n * @returns Promise resolving to processed attachments and updated tool resources\n */\nexport const primeResources = async ({\n  req,\n  appConfig,\n  getFiles,\n  requestFileSet,\n  attachments: _attachments,\n  tool_resources: _tool_resources,\n  agentId,\n}: {\n  req: ServerRequest & { user?: IUser };\n  appConfig?: AppConfig;\n  requestFileSet: Set<string>;\n  attachments: Promise<Array<TFile | null>> | undefined;\n  tool_resources: AgentToolResources | undefined;\n  getFiles: TGetFiles;\n  agentId?: string;\n}): Promise<{\n  attachments: Array<TFile | undefined> | undefined;\n  tool_resources: AgentToolResources | undefined;\n}> => {\n  try {\n    /**\n     * Array to collect all unique files that will be returned as attachments\n     * Files are added from OCR results and attachment promises, with duplicates prevented\n     */\n    const attachments: Array<TFile> = [];\n    /**\n     * Set of file IDs already added to the attachments array\n     * Used to prevent duplicate files from being added multiple times\n     * Pre-populated with files from non-OCR tool_resources to prevent re-adding them\n     */\n    const attachmentFileIds = new Set<string>();\n    /**\n     * Set tracking which files have been added to specific tool resource categories\n     * Format: \"resourceType:fileId\" (e.g., \"execute_code:file123\")\n     * Prevents the same file from being added multiple times to the same resource\n     */\n    const processedResourceFiles = new Set<string>();\n    /**\n     * The agent's tool resources object that will be updated with categorized files\n     * Create a shallow copy first to avoid mutating the original\n     */\n    const tool_resources: AgentToolResources = { ...(_tool_resources ?? {}) };\n\n    // Deep copy each resource to avoid mutating nested objects/arrays\n    for (const [resourceType, resource] of Object.entries(tool_resources)) {\n      if (!resource) {\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      // Deep copy the resource to avoid mutations\n      tool_resources[resourceType as keyof AgentToolResources] = {\n        ...resource,\n        // Deep copy arrays to prevent mutations\n        ...(resource.files && { files: [...resource.files] }),\n        ...(resource.file_ids && { file_ids: [...resource.file_ids] }),\n        ...(resource.vector_store_ids && { vector_store_ids: [...resource.vector_store_ids] }),\n      } as AgentBaseResource;\n\n      // Now track existing files\n      if (resource.files && Array.isArray(resource.files)) {\n        for (const file of resource.files) {\n          if (file?.file_id) {\n            processedResourceFiles.add(`${resourceType}:${file.file_id}`);\n            // Files from non-context resources should not be added to attachments from _attachments\n            if (resourceType !== EToolResources.context && resourceType !== EToolResources.ocr) {\n              attachmentFileIds.add(file.file_id);\n            }\n          }\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    const isContextEnabled = (\n      appConfig?.endpoints?.[EModelEndpoint.agents]?.capabilities ?? []\n    ).includes(AgentCapabilities.context);\n\n    const fileIds = tool_resources[EToolResources.context]?.file_ids ?? [];\n    const ocrFileIds = tool_resources[EToolResources.ocr]?.file_ids;\n    if (ocrFileIds != null) {\n      fileIds.push(...ocrFileIds);\n      delete tool_resources[EToolResources.ocr];\n    }\n\n    if (fileIds.length > 0 && isContextEnabled) {\n      delete tool_resources[EToolResources.context];\n      const context = await getFiles(\n        {\n          file_id: { $in: fileIds },\n        },\n        {},\n        {},\n        { userId: req.user?.id, agentId },\n      );\n\n      for (const file of context) {\n        if (!file?.file_id) {\n          continue;\n        }\n\n        // Clear from attachmentFileIds if it was pre-added\n        attachmentFileIds.delete(file.file_id);\n\n        // Add to attachments\n        attachments.push(file);\n        attachmentFileIds.add(file.file_id);\n\n        // Categorize for tool resources\n        categorizeFileForToolResources({\n          file,\n          tool_resources,\n          requestFileSet,\n          processedResourceFiles,\n        });\n      }\n    }\n\n    if (!_attachments) {\n      return { attachments: attachments.length > 0 ? attachments : undefined, tool_resources };\n    }\n\n    const files = await _attachments;\n\n    for (const file of files) {\n      if (!file) {\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      categorizeFileForToolResources({\n        file,\n        tool_resources,\n        requestFileSet,\n        processedResourceFiles,\n      });\n\n      if (file.file_id && attachmentFileIds.has(file.file_id)) {\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      attachments.push(file);\n      if (file.file_id) {\n        attachmentFileIds.add(file.file_id);\n      }\n    }\n\n    return { attachments: attachments.length > 0 ? attachments : [], tool_resources };\n  } catch (error) {\n    logger.error('Error priming resources', error);\n\n    // Safely try to get attachments without rethrowing\n    let safeAttachments: Array<TFile | undefined> = [];\n    if (_attachments) {\n      try {\n        const attachmentFiles = await _attachments;\n        safeAttachments = (attachmentFiles?.filter((file) => !!file) ?? []) as Array<TFile>;\n      } catch (attachmentError) {\n        // If attachments promise is also rejected, just use empty array\n        logger.error('Error resolving attachments in catch block', attachmentError);\n        safeAttachments = [];\n      }\n    }\n\n    return {\n      attachments: safeAttachments,\n      tool_resources: _tool_resources,\n    };\n  }\n};\n","import { Providers } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport {\n  Constants,\n  ErrorTypes,\n  EModelEndpoint,\n  EToolResources,\n  paramEndpoints,\n  isAgentsEndpoint,\n  replaceSpecialVars,\n  providerEndpointMap,\n} from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type {\n  AgentToolResources,\n  AgentToolOptions,\n  TEndpointOption,\n  TFile,\n  Agent,\n  TUser,\n} from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { GenericTool, LCToolRegistry, ToolMap, LCTool } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type { Response as ServerResponse } from 'express';\nimport type { IMongoFile } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { InitializeResultBase, ServerRequest, EndpointDbMethods } from '~/types';\nimport {\n  optionalChainWithEmptyCheck,\n  extractLibreChatParams,\n  getModelMaxTokens,\n  getThreadData,\n} from '~/utils';\nimport { filterFilesByEndpointConfig } from '~/files';\nimport { generateArtifactsPrompt } from '~/prompts';\nimport { getProviderConfig } from '~/endpoints';\nimport { primeResources } from './resources';\n\n/**\n * Extended agent type with additional fields needed after initialization\n */\nexport type InitializedAgent = Agent & {\n  tools: GenericTool[];\n  attachments: IMongoFile[];\n  toolContextMap: Record<string, unknown>;\n  maxContextTokens: number;\n  useLegacyContent: boolean;\n  resendFiles: boolean;\n  tool_resources?: AgentToolResources;\n  userMCPAuthMap?: Record<string, Record<string, string>>;\n  /** Tool map for ToolNode to use when executing tools (required for PTC) */\n  toolMap?: ToolMap;\n  /** Tool registry for PTC and tool search (only present when MCP tools with env classification exist) */\n  toolRegistry?: LCToolRegistry;\n  /** Serializable tool definitions for event-driven execution */\n  toolDefinitions?: LCTool[];\n  /** Precomputed flag indicating if any tools have defer_loading enabled (for efficient runtime checks) */\n  hasDeferredTools?: boolean;\n};\n\n/**\n * Parameters for initializing an agent\n * Matches the CJS signature from api/server/services/Endpoints/agents/agent.js\n */\nexport interface InitializeAgentParams {\n  /** Request object */\n  req: ServerRequest;\n  /** Response object */\n  res: ServerResponse;\n  /** Agent to initialize */\n  agent: Agent;\n  /** Conversation ID (optional) */\n  conversationId?: string | null;\n  /** Parent message ID for determining the current thread (optional) */\n  parentMessageId?: string | null;\n  /** Request files */\n  requestFiles?: IMongoFile[];\n  /** Function to load agent tools */\n  loadTools?: (params: {\n    req: ServerRequest;\n    res: ServerResponse;\n    provider: string;\n    agentId: string;\n    tools: string[];\n    model: string | null;\n    tool_options: AgentToolOptions | undefined;\n    tool_resources: AgentToolResources | undefined;\n  }) => Promise<{\n    /** Full tool instances (only present when definitionsOnly=false) */\n    tools?: GenericTool[];\n    toolContextMap?: Record<string, unknown>;\n    userMCPAuthMap?: Record<string, Record<string, string>>;\n    toolRegistry?: LCToolRegistry;\n    /** Serializable tool definitions for event-driven mode */\n    toolDefinitions?: LCTool[];\n    hasDeferredTools?: boolean;\n  } | null>;\n  /** Endpoint option (contains model_parameters and endpoint info) */\n  endpointOption?: Partial<TEndpointOption>;\n  /** Set of allowed providers */\n  allowedProviders: Set<string>;\n  /** Whether this is the initial agent */\n  isInitialAgent?: boolean;\n}\n\n/**\n * Database methods required for agent initialization\n * Most methods come from data-schemas via createMethods()\n * getConvoFiles not yet in data-schemas but included here for consistency\n */\nexport interface InitializeAgentDbMethods extends EndpointDbMethods {\n  /** Update usage tracking for multiple files */\n  updateFilesUsage: (files: Array<{ file_id: string }>, fileIds?: string[]) => Promise<unknown[]>;\n  /** Get files from database */\n  getFiles: (filter: unknown, sort: unknown, select: unknown, opts?: unknown) => Promise<unknown[]>;\n  /** Get tool files by IDs (user-uploaded files only, code files handled separately) */\n  getToolFilesByIds: (fileIds: string[], toolSet: Set<EToolResources>) => Promise<unknown[]>;\n  /** Get conversation file IDs */\n  getConvoFiles: (conversationId: string) => Promise<string[] | null>;\n  /** Get code-generated files by conversation ID and optional message IDs */\n  getCodeGeneratedFiles?: (conversationId: string, messageIds?: string[]) => Promise<unknown[]>;\n  /** Get user-uploaded execute_code files by file IDs (from message.files in thread) */\n  getUserCodeFiles?: (fileIds: string[]) => Promise<unknown[]>;\n  /** Get messages for a conversation (supports select for field projection) */\n  getMessages?: (\n    filter: { conversationId: string },\n    select?: string,\n  ) => Promise<Array<{\n    messageId: string;\n    parentMessageId?: string;\n    files?: Array<{ file_id: string }>;\n  }> | null>;\n}\n\n/**\n * Initializes an agent for use in requests.\n * Handles file processing, tool loading, provider configuration, and context token calculations.\n *\n * This function is exported from @librechat/api and replaces the CJS version from\n * api/server/services/Endpoints/agents/agent.js\n *\n * @param params - Initialization parameters\n * @param deps - Optional dependency injection for testing\n * @returns Promise resolving to initialized agent with tools and configuration\n * @throws Error if agent provider is not allowed or if required dependencies are missing\n */\nexport async function initializeAgent(\n  params: InitializeAgentParams,\n  db?: InitializeAgentDbMethods,\n): Promise<InitializedAgent> {\n  const {\n    req,\n    res,\n    agent,\n    loadTools,\n    requestFiles = [],\n    conversationId,\n    endpointOption,\n    parentMessageId,\n    allowedProviders,\n    isInitialAgent = false,\n  } = params;\n\n  if (!db) {\n    throw new Error('initializeAgent requires db methods to be passed');\n  }\n\n  if (\n    isAgentsEndpoint(endpointOption?.endpoint) &&\n    allowedProviders.size > 0 &&\n    !allowedProviders.has(agent.provider)\n  ) {\n    throw new Error(\n      `{ \"type\": \"${ErrorTypes.INVALID_AGENT_PROVIDER}\", \"info\": \"${agent.provider}\" }`,\n    );\n  }\n\n  let currentFiles: IMongoFile[] | undefined;\n\n  const _modelOptions = structuredClone(\n    Object.assign(\n      { model: agent.model },\n      agent.model_parameters ?? { model: agent.model },\n      isInitialAgent === true ? endpointOption?.model_parameters : {},\n    ),\n  );\n\n  const { resendFiles, maxContextTokens, modelOptions } = extractLibreChatParams(\n    _modelOptions as Record<string, unknown>,\n  );\n\n  const provider = agent.provider;\n  agent.endpoint = provider;\n\n  /**\n   * Load conversation files for ALL agents, not just the initial agent.\n   * This enables handoff agents to access files that were uploaded earlier\n   * in the conversation. Without this, file_search and execute_code tools\n   * on handoff agents would fail to find previously attached files.\n   */\n  if (conversationId != null && resendFiles) {\n    const fileIds = (await db.getConvoFiles(conversationId)) ?? [];\n    const toolResourceSet = new Set<EToolResources>();\n    for (const tool of agent.tools ?? []) {\n      if (EToolResources[tool as keyof typeof EToolResources]) {\n        toolResourceSet.add(EToolResources[tool as keyof typeof EToolResources]);\n      }\n    }\n\n    const toolFiles = (await db.getToolFilesByIds(fileIds, toolResourceSet)) as IMongoFile[];\n\n    /**\n     * Retrieve execute_code files filtered to the current thread.\n     * This includes both code-generated files and user-uploaded execute_code files.\n     */\n    let codeGeneratedFiles: IMongoFile[] = [];\n    let userCodeFiles: IMongoFile[] = [];\n\n    if (toolResourceSet.has(EToolResources.execute_code)) {\n      let threadMessageIds: string[] | undefined;\n      let threadFileIds: string[] | undefined;\n\n      if (parentMessageId && parentMessageId !== Constants.NO_PARENT && db.getMessages) {\n        /** Only select fields needed for thread traversal */\n        const messages = await db.getMessages(\n          { conversationId },\n          'messageId parentMessageId files',\n        );\n        if (messages && messages.length > 0) {\n          /** Single O(n) pass: build Map, traverse thread, collect both IDs */\n          const threadData = getThreadData(messages, parentMessageId);\n          threadMessageIds = threadData.messageIds;\n          threadFileIds = threadData.fileIds;\n        }\n      }\n\n      /** Code-generated files (context: execute_code) filtered by messageId */\n      if (db.getCodeGeneratedFiles) {\n        codeGeneratedFiles = (await db.getCodeGeneratedFiles(\n          conversationId,\n          threadMessageIds,\n        )) as IMongoFile[];\n      }\n\n      /** User-uploaded execute_code files (context: agents/message_attachment) from thread messages */\n      if (db.getUserCodeFiles && threadFileIds && threadFileIds.length > 0) {\n        userCodeFiles = (await db.getUserCodeFiles(threadFileIds)) as IMongoFile[];\n      }\n    }\n\n    const allToolFiles = toolFiles.concat(codeGeneratedFiles, userCodeFiles);\n    if (requestFiles.length || allToolFiles.length) {\n      currentFiles = (await db.updateFilesUsage(requestFiles.concat(allToolFiles))) as IMongoFile[];\n    }\n  } else if (requestFiles.length) {\n    currentFiles = (await db.updateFilesUsage(requestFiles)) as IMongoFile[];\n  }\n\n  if (currentFiles && currentFiles.length) {\n    let endpointType: EModelEndpoint | undefined;\n    if (!paramEndpoints.has(agent.endpoint ?? '')) {\n      endpointType = EModelEndpoint.custom;\n    }\n\n    currentFiles = filterFilesByEndpointConfig(req, {\n      files: currentFiles,\n      endpoint: agent.endpoint ?? '',\n      endpointType,\n    });\n  }\n\n  const { attachments: primedAttachments, tool_resources } = await primeResources({\n    req: req as never,\n    getFiles: db.getFiles as never,\n    appConfig: req.config,\n    agentId: agent.id,\n    attachments: currentFiles\n      ? (Promise.resolve(currentFiles) as unknown as Promise<TFile[]>)\n      : undefined,\n    tool_resources: agent.tool_resources,\n    requestFileSet: new Set(requestFiles?.map((file) => file.file_id)),\n  });\n\n  const {\n    toolRegistry,\n    toolContextMap,\n    userMCPAuthMap,\n    toolDefinitions,\n    hasDeferredTools,\n    tools: structuredTools,\n  } = (await loadTools?.({\n    req,\n    res,\n    provider,\n    agentId: agent.id,\n    tools: agent.tools ?? [],\n    model: agent.model,\n    tool_options: agent.tool_options,\n    tool_resources,\n  })) ?? {\n    tools: [],\n    toolContextMap: {},\n    userMCPAuthMap: undefined,\n    toolRegistry: undefined,\n    toolDefinitions: [],\n    hasDeferredTools: false,\n  };\n\n  const { getOptions, overrideProvider } = getProviderConfig({\n    provider,\n    appConfig: req.config,\n  });\n  if (overrideProvider !== agent.provider) {\n    agent.provider = overrideProvider;\n  }\n\n  const finalModelOptions = {\n    ...modelOptions,\n    model: agent.model,\n  };\n\n  const options: InitializeResultBase = await getOptions({\n    req,\n    endpoint: provider,\n    model_parameters: finalModelOptions,\n    db,\n  });\n\n  const llmConfig = options.llmConfig as Record<string, unknown>;\n  const tokensModel =\n    agent.provider === EModelEndpoint.azureOpenAI ? agent.model : (llmConfig?.model as string);\n  const maxOutputTokens = optionalChainWithEmptyCheck(\n    llmConfig?.maxOutputTokens as number | undefined,\n    llmConfig?.maxTokens as number | undefined,\n    0,\n  );\n  const agentMaxContextTokens = optionalChainWithEmptyCheck(\n    maxContextTokens,\n    getModelMaxTokens(\n      tokensModel ?? '',\n      providerEndpointMap[provider as keyof typeof providerEndpointMap],\n      options.endpointTokenConfig,\n    ),\n    18000,\n  );\n\n  if (\n    agent.endpoint === EModelEndpoint.azureOpenAI &&\n    (llmConfig?.azureOpenAIApiInstanceName as string | undefined) == null\n  ) {\n    agent.provider = Providers.OPENAI;\n  }\n\n  if (options.provider != null) {\n    agent.provider = options.provider;\n  }\n\n  /** Check for tool presence from either full instances or definitions (event-driven mode) */\n  const hasAgentTools = (structuredTools?.length ?? 0) > 0 || (toolDefinitions?.length ?? 0) > 0;\n\n  let tools: GenericTool[] = options.tools?.length\n    ? (options.tools as GenericTool[])\n    : (structuredTools ?? []);\n\n  if (\n    (agent.provider === Providers.GOOGLE || agent.provider === Providers.VERTEXAI) &&\n    options.tools?.length &&\n    hasAgentTools\n  ) {\n    throw new Error(`{ \"type\": \"${ErrorTypes.GOOGLE_TOOL_CONFLICT}\"}`);\n  } else if (\n    (agent.provider === Providers.OPENAI ||\n      agent.provider === Providers.AZURE ||\n      agent.provider === Providers.ANTHROPIC) &&\n    options.tools?.length &&\n    structuredTools?.length\n  ) {\n    tools = structuredTools.concat(options.tools as GenericTool[]);\n  }\n\n  agent.model_parameters = { ...options.llmConfig } as Agent['model_parameters'];\n  if (options.configOptions) {\n    (agent.model_parameters as Record<string, unknown>).configuration = options.configOptions;\n  }\n\n  if (agent.instructions && agent.instructions !== '') {\n    agent.instructions = replaceSpecialVars({\n      text: agent.instructions,\n      user: req.user ? (req.user as unknown as TUser) : null,\n    });\n  }\n\n  if (typeof agent.artifacts === 'string' && agent.artifacts !== '') {\n    const artifactsPromptResult = generateArtifactsPrompt({\n      endpoint: agent.provider,\n      artifacts: agent.artifacts as never,\n    });\n    agent.additional_instructions = artifactsPromptResult ?? undefined;\n  }\n\n  const agentMaxContextNum = Number(agentMaxContextTokens) || 18000;\n  const maxOutputTokensNum = Number(maxOutputTokens) || 0;\n\n  const finalAttachments: IMongoFile[] = (primedAttachments ?? [])\n    .filter((a): a is TFile => a != null)\n    .map((a) => a as unknown as IMongoFile);\n\n  const initializedAgent: InitializedAgent = {\n    ...agent,\n    resendFiles,\n    toolRegistry,\n    tool_resources,\n    userMCPAuthMap,\n    toolDefinitions,\n    hasDeferredTools,\n    attachments: finalAttachments,\n    toolContextMap: toolContextMap ?? {},\n    useLegacyContent: !!options.useLegacyContent,\n    tools: (tools ?? []) as GenericTool[] & string[],\n    maxContextTokens:\n      maxContextTokens != null && maxContextTokens > 0\n        ? maxContextTokens\n        : Math.round((agentMaxContextNum - maxOutputTokensNum) * 0.9),\n  };\n\n  return initializedAgent;\n}\n","import { EToolResources } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { AgentToolResources, TFile } from 'librechat-data-provider';\n\n/**\n * Converts OCR tool resource to context tool resource in place.\n * This modifies the input object directly (used for updateData in the handler).\n *\n * @param data - Object containing tool_resources and/or tools to convert\n * @returns void - modifies the input object directly\n */\nexport function convertOcrToContextInPlace(data: {\n  tool_resources?: AgentToolResources;\n  tools?: string[];\n}): void {\n  // Convert OCR to context in tool_resources\n  if (data.tool_resources?.ocr) {\n    if (!data.tool_resources.context) {\n      data.tool_resources.context = data.tool_resources.ocr;\n    } else {\n      // Merge OCR into existing context\n      if (data.tool_resources.ocr?.file_ids?.length) {\n        const existingFileIds = data.tool_resources.context.file_ids || [];\n        const ocrFileIds = data.tool_resources.ocr.file_ids || [];\n        data.tool_resources.context.file_ids = [...new Set([...existingFileIds, ...ocrFileIds])];\n      }\n      if (data.tool_resources.ocr?.files?.length) {\n        const existingFiles = data.tool_resources.context.files || [];\n        const ocrFiles = data.tool_resources.ocr.files || [];\n        const filesMap = new Map<string, TFile>();\n        [...existingFiles, ...ocrFiles].forEach((file) => {\n          if (file?.file_id) {\n            filesMap.set(file.file_id, file);\n          }\n        });\n        data.tool_resources.context.files = Array.from(filesMap.values());\n      }\n    }\n    delete data.tool_resources.ocr;\n  }\n\n  // Convert OCR to context in tools array\n  if (data.tools?.includes(EToolResources.ocr)) {\n    data.tools = data.tools.map((tool) =>\n      tool === EToolResources.ocr ? EToolResources.context : tool,\n    );\n    data.tools = [...new Set(data.tools)];\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Merges tool resources from existing agent with incoming update data,\n * converting OCR to context and handling deduplication.\n * Used when existing agent has OCR that needs to be converted and merged with updateData.\n *\n * @param existingAgent - The existing agent data\n * @param updateData - The incoming update data\n * @returns Object with merged tool_resources and tools\n */\nexport function mergeAgentOcrConversion(\n  existingAgent: { tool_resources?: AgentToolResources; tools?: string[] },\n  updateData: { tool_resources?: AgentToolResources; tools?: string[] },\n): { tool_resources?: AgentToolResources; tools?: string[] } {\n  if (!existingAgent.tool_resources?.ocr) {\n    return {};\n  }\n\n  const result: { tool_resources?: AgentToolResources; tools?: string[] } = {};\n\n  // Convert existing agent's OCR to context\n  result.tool_resources = { ...existingAgent.tool_resources };\n\n  if (!result.tool_resources.context) {\n    // Simple case: no context exists, just move ocr to context\n    result.tool_resources.context = result.tool_resources.ocr;\n  } else {\n    // Merge case: context already exists, merge both file_ids and files arrays\n\n    // Merge file_ids if they exist\n    if (result.tool_resources.ocr?.file_ids?.length) {\n      const existingFileIds = result.tool_resources.context.file_ids || [];\n      const ocrFileIds = result.tool_resources.ocr.file_ids || [];\n      result.tool_resources.context.file_ids = [...new Set([...existingFileIds, ...ocrFileIds])];\n    }\n\n    // Merge files array if it exists (already fetched files)\n    if (result.tool_resources.ocr?.files?.length) {\n      const existingFiles = result.tool_resources.context.files || [];\n      const ocrFiles = result.tool_resources.ocr?.files || [];\n      // Merge and deduplicate by file_id\n      const filesMap = new Map<string, TFile>();\n      [...existingFiles, ...ocrFiles].forEach((file) => {\n        if (file?.file_id) {\n          filesMap.set(file.file_id, file);\n        }\n      });\n      result.tool_resources.context.files = Array.from(filesMap.values());\n    }\n  }\n\n  // Remove the deprecated ocr resource\n  delete result.tool_resources.ocr;\n\n  // Update tools array: replace 'ocr' with 'context'\n  if (existingAgent.tools?.includes(EToolResources.ocr)) {\n    result.tools = existingAgent.tools.map((tool) =>\n      tool === EToolResources.ocr ? EToolResources.context : tool,\n    );\n    // Remove duplicates if context already existed\n    result.tools = [...new Set(result.tools)];\n  }\n\n  // Merge with any context that might already be in updateData (from incoming OCR conversion)\n  if (updateData.tool_resources?.context && result.tool_resources.context) {\n    // Merge the contexts\n    const mergedContext = { ...result.tool_resources.context };\n\n    // Merge file_ids\n    if (updateData.tool_resources.context.file_ids?.length) {\n      const existingIds = mergedContext.file_ids || [];\n      const newIds = updateData.tool_resources.context.file_ids || [];\n      mergedContext.file_ids = [...new Set([...existingIds, ...newIds])];\n    }\n\n    // Merge files\n    if (updateData.tool_resources.context.files?.length) {\n      const existingFiles = mergedContext.files || [];\n      const newFiles = updateData.tool_resources.context.files || [];\n      const filesMap = new Map<string, TFile>();\n      [...existingFiles, ...newFiles].forEach((file) => {\n        if (file?.file_id) {\n          filesMap.set(file.file_id, file);\n        }\n      });\n      mergedContext.files = Array.from(filesMap.values());\n    }\n\n    result.tool_resources.context = mergedContext;\n  }\n\n  return result;\n}\n","import { EventEmitter } from 'events';\nimport { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { IEventTransport } from '../interfaces/IJobStore';\n\ninterface StreamState {\n  emitter: EventEmitter;\n  allSubscribersLeftCallback?: () => void;\n}\n\n/**\n * In-memory event transport using Node.js EventEmitter.\n * For horizontal scaling, replace with RedisEventTransport.\n */\nexport class InMemoryEventTransport implements IEventTransport {\n  private streams = new Map<string, StreamState>();\n\n  private getOrCreateStream(streamId: string): StreamState {\n    let state = this.streams.get(streamId);\n    if (!state) {\n      const emitter = new EventEmitter();\n      emitter.setMaxListeners(100);\n      state = { emitter };\n      this.streams.set(streamId, state);\n    }\n    return state;\n  }\n\n  subscribe(\n    streamId: string,\n    handlers: {\n      onChunk: (event: unknown) => void;\n      onDone?: (event: unknown) => void;\n      onError?: (error: string) => void;\n    },\n  ): { unsubscribe: () => void; ready?: Promise<void> } {\n    const state = this.getOrCreateStream(streamId);\n\n    const chunkHandler = (event: unknown) => handlers.onChunk(event);\n    const doneHandler = (event: unknown) => handlers.onDone?.(event);\n    const errorHandler = (error: string) => handlers.onError?.(error);\n\n    state.emitter.on('chunk', chunkHandler);\n    state.emitter.on('done', doneHandler);\n    state.emitter.on('error', errorHandler);\n\n    logger.debug(\n      `[InMemoryEventTransport] subscribe ${streamId}: listeners=${state.emitter.listenerCount('chunk')}`,\n    );\n\n    return {\n      unsubscribe: () => {\n        const currentState = this.streams.get(streamId);\n        if (currentState) {\n          currentState.emitter.off('chunk', chunkHandler);\n          currentState.emitter.off('done', doneHandler);\n          currentState.emitter.off('error', errorHandler);\n\n          // Check if all subscribers left - cleanup and notify\n          if (currentState.emitter.listenerCount('chunk') === 0) {\n            currentState.allSubscribersLeftCallback?.();\n            // Auto-cleanup the stream entry when no subscribers remain\n            currentState.emitter.removeAllListeners();\n            this.streams.delete(streamId);\n          }\n        }\n      },\n    };\n  }\n\n  emitChunk(streamId: string, event: unknown): void {\n    const state = this.streams.get(streamId);\n    state?.emitter.emit('chunk', event);\n  }\n\n  emitDone(streamId: string, event: unknown): void {\n    const state = this.streams.get(streamId);\n    state?.emitter.emit('done', event);\n  }\n\n  emitError(streamId: string, error: string): void {\n    const state = this.streams.get(streamId);\n    // Only emit if there are listeners - Node.js throws on unhandled 'error' events\n    // This is intentional for the race condition where error occurs before client connects\n    if (state?.emitter.listenerCount('error') ?? 0 > 0) {\n      state?.emitter.emit('error', error);\n    }\n  }\n\n  getSubscriberCount(streamId: string): number {\n    const state = this.streams.get(streamId);\n    return state?.emitter.listenerCount('chunk') ?? 0;\n  }\n\n  onAllSubscribersLeft(streamId: string, callback: () => void): void {\n    const state = this.getOrCreateStream(streamId);\n    state.allSubscribersLeftCallback = callback;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Check if this is the first subscriber (for ready signaling)\n   */\n  isFirstSubscriber(streamId: string): boolean {\n    const state = this.streams.get(streamId);\n    const count = state?.emitter.listenerCount('chunk') ?? 0;\n    logger.debug(`[InMemoryEventTransport] isFirstSubscriber ${streamId}: count=${count}`);\n    return count === 1;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Cleanup a stream's event emitter\n   */\n  cleanup(streamId: string): void {\n    const state = this.streams.get(streamId);\n    if (state) {\n      state.emitter.removeAllListeners();\n      this.streams.delete(streamId);\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get count of tracked streams (for monitoring)\n   */\n  getStreamCount(): number {\n    return this.streams.size;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get all tracked stream IDs (for orphan cleanup)\n   */\n  getTrackedStreamIds(): string[] {\n    return Array.from(this.streams.keys());\n  }\n\n  destroy(): void {\n    for (const state of this.streams.values()) {\n      state.emitter.removeAllListeners();\n    }\n    this.streams.clear();\n    logger.debug('[InMemoryEventTransport] Destroyed');\n  }\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { StandardGraph } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type { Agents } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type {\n  SerializableJobData,\n  UsageMetadata,\n  IJobStore,\n  JobStatus,\n} from '~/stream/interfaces/IJobStore';\n\n/**\n * Content state for a job - volatile, in-memory only.\n * Uses WeakRef to allow garbage collection of graph when no longer needed.\n */\ninterface ContentState {\n  contentParts: Agents.MessageContentComplex[];\n  graphRef: WeakRef<StandardGraph> | null;\n  collectedUsage: UsageMetadata[];\n}\n\n/**\n * In-memory implementation of IJobStore.\n * Suitable for single-instance deployments.\n * For horizontal scaling, use RedisJobStore.\n *\n * Content state is tied to jobs:\n * - Uses WeakRef to graph for live access to contentParts and contentData (run steps)\n * - No chunk persistence needed - same instance handles generation and reconnects\n */\nexport class InMemoryJobStore implements IJobStore {\n  private jobs = new Map<string, SerializableJobData>();\n  private contentState = new Map<string, ContentState>();\n  private cleanupInterval: NodeJS.Timeout | null = null;\n\n  /** Maps userId -> Set of streamIds (conversationIds) for active jobs */\n  private userJobMap = new Map<string, Set<string>>();\n\n  /** Time to keep completed jobs before cleanup (0 = immediate) */\n  private ttlAfterComplete = 0;\n\n  /** Maximum number of concurrent jobs */\n  private maxJobs = 1000;\n\n  constructor(options?: { ttlAfterComplete?: number; maxJobs?: number }) {\n    if (options?.ttlAfterComplete) {\n      this.ttlAfterComplete = options.ttlAfterComplete;\n    }\n    if (options?.maxJobs) {\n      this.maxJobs = options.maxJobs;\n    }\n  }\n\n  async initialize(): Promise<void> {\n    if (this.cleanupInterval) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    this.cleanupInterval = setInterval(() => {\n      this.cleanup();\n    }, 60000);\n\n    if (this.cleanupInterval.unref) {\n      this.cleanupInterval.unref();\n    }\n\n    logger.debug('[InMemoryJobStore] Initialized with cleanup interval');\n  }\n\n  async createJob(\n    streamId: string,\n    userId: string,\n    conversationId?: string,\n  ): Promise<SerializableJobData> {\n    if (this.jobs.size >= this.maxJobs) {\n      await this.evictOldest();\n    }\n\n    const job: SerializableJobData = {\n      streamId,\n      userId,\n      status: 'running',\n      createdAt: Date.now(),\n      conversationId,\n      syncSent: false,\n    };\n\n    this.jobs.set(streamId, job);\n\n    // Track job by userId for efficient user-scoped queries\n    let userJobs = this.userJobMap.get(userId);\n    if (!userJobs) {\n      userJobs = new Set();\n      this.userJobMap.set(userId, userJobs);\n    }\n    userJobs.add(streamId);\n\n    logger.debug(`[InMemoryJobStore] Created job: ${streamId}`);\n\n    return job;\n  }\n\n  async getJob(streamId: string): Promise<SerializableJobData | null> {\n    return this.jobs.get(streamId) ?? null;\n  }\n\n  async updateJob(streamId: string, updates: Partial<SerializableJobData>): Promise<void> {\n    const job = this.jobs.get(streamId);\n    if (!job) {\n      return;\n    }\n    Object.assign(job, updates);\n  }\n\n  async deleteJob(streamId: string): Promise<void> {\n    this.jobs.delete(streamId);\n    this.contentState.delete(streamId);\n    logger.debug(`[InMemoryJobStore] Deleted job: ${streamId}`);\n  }\n\n  async hasJob(streamId: string): Promise<boolean> {\n    return this.jobs.has(streamId);\n  }\n\n  async getRunningJobs(): Promise<SerializableJobData[]> {\n    const running: SerializableJobData[] = [];\n    for (const job of this.jobs.values()) {\n      if (job.status === 'running') {\n        running.push(job);\n      }\n    }\n    return running;\n  }\n\n  async cleanup(): Promise<number> {\n    const now = Date.now();\n    const toDelete: string[] = [];\n\n    for (const [streamId, job] of this.jobs) {\n      const isFinished = ['complete', 'error', 'aborted'].includes(job.status);\n      if (isFinished && job.completedAt) {\n        // TTL of 0 means immediate cleanup, otherwise wait for TTL to expire\n        if (this.ttlAfterComplete === 0 || now - job.completedAt > this.ttlAfterComplete) {\n          toDelete.push(streamId);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    for (const id of toDelete) {\n      await this.deleteJob(id);\n    }\n\n    if (toDelete.length > 0) {\n      logger.debug(`[InMemoryJobStore] Cleaned up ${toDelete.length} expired jobs`);\n    }\n\n    return toDelete.length;\n  }\n\n  private async evictOldest(): Promise<void> {\n    let oldestId: string | null = null;\n    let oldestTime = Infinity;\n\n    for (const [streamId, job] of this.jobs) {\n      if (job.createdAt < oldestTime) {\n        oldestTime = job.createdAt;\n        oldestId = streamId;\n      }\n    }\n\n    if (oldestId) {\n      logger.warn(`[InMemoryJobStore] Evicting oldest job: ${oldestId}`);\n      await this.deleteJob(oldestId);\n    }\n  }\n\n  /** Get job count (for monitoring) */\n  async getJobCount(): Promise<number> {\n    return this.jobs.size;\n  }\n\n  /** Get job count by status (for monitoring) */\n  async getJobCountByStatus(status: JobStatus): Promise<number> {\n    let count = 0;\n    for (const job of this.jobs.values()) {\n      if (job.status === status) {\n        count++;\n      }\n    }\n    return count;\n  }\n\n  async destroy(): Promise<void> {\n    if (this.cleanupInterval) {\n      clearInterval(this.cleanupInterval);\n      this.cleanupInterval = null;\n    }\n    this.jobs.clear();\n    this.contentState.clear();\n    this.userJobMap.clear();\n    logger.debug('[InMemoryJobStore] Destroyed');\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get active job IDs for a user.\n   * Returns conversation IDs of running jobs belonging to the user.\n   * Also performs self-healing cleanup: removes stale entries for jobs that no longer exist.\n   */\n  async getActiveJobIdsByUser(userId: string): Promise<string[]> {\n    const trackedIds = this.userJobMap.get(userId);\n    if (!trackedIds || trackedIds.size === 0) {\n      return [];\n    }\n\n    const activeIds: string[] = [];\n\n    for (const streamId of trackedIds) {\n      const job = this.jobs.get(streamId);\n      // Only include if job exists AND is still running\n      if (job && job.status === 'running') {\n        activeIds.push(streamId);\n      } else {\n        // Self-healing: job completed/deleted but mapping wasn't cleaned - fix it now\n        trackedIds.delete(streamId);\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Clean up empty set\n    if (trackedIds.size === 0) {\n      this.userJobMap.delete(userId);\n    }\n\n    return activeIds;\n  }\n\n  // ===== Content State Methods =====\n\n  /**\n   * Set the graph reference for a job.\n   * Uses WeakRef to allow garbage collection when graph is no longer needed.\n   */\n  setGraph(streamId: string, graph: StandardGraph): void {\n    const existing = this.contentState.get(streamId);\n    if (existing) {\n      existing.graphRef = new WeakRef(graph);\n    } else {\n      this.contentState.set(streamId, {\n        contentParts: [],\n        graphRef: new WeakRef(graph),\n        collectedUsage: [],\n      });\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Set content parts reference for a job.\n   */\n  setContentParts(streamId: string, contentParts: Agents.MessageContentComplex[]): void {\n    const existing = this.contentState.get(streamId);\n    if (existing) {\n      existing.contentParts = contentParts;\n    } else {\n      this.contentState.set(streamId, { contentParts, graphRef: null, collectedUsage: [] });\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Set collected usage reference for a job.\n   */\n  setCollectedUsage(streamId: string, collectedUsage: UsageMetadata[]): void {\n    const existing = this.contentState.get(streamId);\n    if (existing) {\n      existing.collectedUsage = collectedUsage;\n    } else {\n      this.contentState.set(streamId, { contentParts: [], graphRef: null, collectedUsage });\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get collected usage for a job.\n   */\n  getCollectedUsage(streamId: string): UsageMetadata[] {\n    const state = this.contentState.get(streamId);\n    return state?.collectedUsage ?? [];\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get content parts for a job.\n   * Returns live content from stored reference.\n   */\n  async getContentParts(streamId: string): Promise<{\n    content: Agents.MessageContentComplex[];\n  } | null> {\n    const state = this.contentState.get(streamId);\n    if (!state?.contentParts) {\n      return null;\n    }\n    return {\n      content: state.contentParts,\n    };\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get run steps for a job from graph.contentData.\n   * Uses WeakRef - may return empty if graph has been GC'd.\n   */\n  async getRunSteps(streamId: string): Promise<Agents.RunStep[]> {\n    const state = this.contentState.get(streamId);\n    if (!state?.graphRef) {\n      return [];\n    }\n\n    // Dereference WeakRef - may return undefined if GC'd\n    const graph = state.graphRef.deref();\n    return graph?.contentData ?? [];\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * No-op for in-memory - content available via graph reference.\n   */\n  async appendChunk(): Promise<void> {\n    // No-op: content available via graph reference\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Clear content state for a job.\n   */\n  clearContentState(streamId: string): void {\n    this.contentState.delete(streamId);\n  }\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { StandardGraph } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport { parseTextParts } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { Agents, TMessageContentParts } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type {\n  SerializableJobData,\n  IEventTransport,\n  UsageMetadata,\n  AbortResult,\n  IJobStore,\n} from './interfaces/IJobStore';\nimport type * as t from '~/types';\nimport { InMemoryEventTransport } from './implementations/InMemoryEventTransport';\nimport { InMemoryJobStore } from './implementations/InMemoryJobStore';\n\n/**\n * Configuration options for GenerationJobManager\n */\nexport interface GenerationJobManagerOptions {\n  jobStore?: IJobStore;\n  eventTransport?: IEventTransport;\n  /**\n   * If true, cleans up event transport immediately when job completes.\n   * If false, keeps EventEmitters until periodic cleanup for late reconnections.\n   * Default: true (immediate cleanup to save memory)\n   */\n  cleanupOnComplete?: boolean;\n}\n\n/**\n * Runtime state for active jobs - not serializable, kept in-memory per instance.\n * Contains AbortController, ready promise, and other non-serializable state.\n *\n * @property abortController - Controller to abort the generation\n * @property readyPromise - Resolves immediately (legacy, kept for API compatibility)\n * @property resolveReady - Function to resolve readyPromise\n * @property finalEvent - Cached final event for late subscribers\n * @property errorEvent - Cached error event for late subscribers (errors before client connects)\n * @property syncSent - Whether sync event was sent (reset when all subscribers leave)\n * @property earlyEventBuffer - Buffer for events emitted before first subscriber connects\n * @property hasSubscriber - Whether at least one subscriber has connected\n * @property allSubscribersLeftHandlers - Internal handlers for disconnect events.\n *   These are stored separately from eventTransport subscribers to avoid being counted\n *   in subscriber count. This is critical: if these were registered via subscribe(),\n *   they would count as subscribers, causing isFirstSubscriber() to return false\n *   when the real client connects, which would prevent readyPromise from resolving.\n */\ninterface RuntimeJobState {\n  abortController: AbortController;\n  readyPromise: Promise<void>;\n  resolveReady: () => void;\n  finalEvent?: t.ServerSentEvent;\n  errorEvent?: string;\n  syncSent: boolean;\n  earlyEventBuffer: t.ServerSentEvent[];\n  hasSubscriber: boolean;\n  allSubscribersLeftHandlers?: Array<(...args: unknown[]) => void>;\n}\n\n/**\n * Manages generation jobs for resumable LLM streams.\n *\n * Architecture: Composes two pluggable services via dependency injection:\n * - jobStore: Job metadata + content state (InMemory â†’ Redis for horizontal scaling)\n * - eventTransport: Pub/sub events (InMemory â†’ Redis Pub/Sub for horizontal scaling)\n *\n * Content state is tied to jobs:\n * - In-memory: jobStore holds WeakRef to graph for live content/run steps access\n * - Redis: jobStore persists chunks, reconstructs content on demand\n *\n * All storage methods are async to support both in-memory and external stores (Redis, etc.).\n *\n * @example Redis injection:\n * ```ts\n * const manager = new GenerationJobManagerClass({\n *   jobStore: new RedisJobStore(redisClient),\n *   eventTransport: new RedisPubSubTransport(redisClient),\n * });\n * ```\n */\nclass GenerationJobManagerClass {\n  /** Job metadata + content state storage - swappable for Redis, etc. */\n  private jobStore: IJobStore;\n  /** Event pub/sub transport - swappable for Redis Pub/Sub, etc. */\n  private eventTransport: IEventTransport;\n\n  /** Runtime state - always in-memory, not serializable */\n  private runtimeState = new Map<string, RuntimeJobState>();\n\n  private cleanupInterval: NodeJS.Timeout | null = null;\n\n  /** Whether we're using Redis stores */\n  private _isRedis = false;\n\n  /** Whether to cleanup event transport immediately on job completion */\n  private _cleanupOnComplete = true;\n\n  constructor(options?: GenerationJobManagerOptions) {\n    this.jobStore =\n      options?.jobStore ?? new InMemoryJobStore({ ttlAfterComplete: 0, maxJobs: 1000 });\n    this.eventTransport = options?.eventTransport ?? new InMemoryEventTransport();\n    this._cleanupOnComplete = options?.cleanupOnComplete ?? true;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Initialize the job manager with periodic cleanup.\n   * Call this once at application startup.\n   */\n  initialize(): void {\n    if (this.cleanupInterval) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    this.jobStore.initialize();\n\n    this.cleanupInterval = setInterval(() => {\n      this.cleanup();\n    }, 60000);\n\n    if (this.cleanupInterval.unref) {\n      this.cleanupInterval.unref();\n    }\n\n    logger.debug('[GenerationJobManager] Initialized');\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Configure the manager with custom stores.\n   * Call this BEFORE initialize() to use Redis or other stores.\n   *\n   * @example Using Redis\n   * ```ts\n   * import { createStreamServicesFromCache } from '~/stream/createStreamServices';\n   * import { cacheConfig, ioredisClient } from '~/cache';\n   *\n   * const services = createStreamServicesFromCache({ cacheConfig, ioredisClient });\n   * GenerationJobManager.configure(services);\n   * GenerationJobManager.initialize();\n   * ```\n   */\n  configure(services: {\n    jobStore: IJobStore;\n    eventTransport: IEventTransport;\n    isRedis?: boolean;\n    cleanupOnComplete?: boolean;\n  }): void {\n    if (this.cleanupInterval) {\n      logger.warn(\n        '[GenerationJobManager] Reconfiguring after initialization - destroying existing services',\n      );\n      this.destroy();\n    }\n\n    this.jobStore = services.jobStore;\n    this.eventTransport = services.eventTransport;\n    this._isRedis = services.isRedis ?? false;\n    this._cleanupOnComplete = services.cleanupOnComplete ?? true;\n\n    logger.info(\n      `[GenerationJobManager] Configured with ${this._isRedis ? 'Redis' : 'in-memory'} stores`,\n    );\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Check if using Redis stores.\n   */\n  get isRedis(): boolean {\n    return this._isRedis;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get the job store instance (for advanced use cases).\n   */\n  getJobStore(): IJobStore {\n    return this.jobStore;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Create a new generation job.\n   *\n   * This sets up:\n   * 1. Serializable job data in the job store\n   * 2. Runtime state including readyPromise (resolves when first SSE client connects)\n   * 3. allSubscribersLeft callback for handling client disconnections\n   *\n   * The readyPromise mechanism ensures generation doesn't start before the client\n   * is ready to receive events. The controller awaits this promise (with a short timeout)\n   * before starting LLM generation.\n   *\n   * @param streamId - Unique identifier for this stream\n   * @param userId - User who initiated the request\n   * @param conversationId - Optional conversation ID for lookup\n   * @returns A facade object for the GenerationJob\n   */\n  async createJob(\n    streamId: string,\n    userId: string,\n    conversationId?: string,\n  ): Promise<t.GenerationJob> {\n    const jobData = await this.jobStore.createJob(streamId, userId, conversationId);\n\n    /**\n     * Create runtime state with readyPromise.\n     *\n     * With the resumable stream architecture, we no longer need to wait for the\n     * first subscriber before starting generation:\n     * - Redis mode: Events are persisted and can be replayed via sync\n     * - In-memory mode: Content is aggregated and sent via sync on connect\n     *\n     * We resolve readyPromise immediately to eliminate startup latency.\n     * The sync mechanism handles late-connecting clients.\n     */\n    let resolveReady: () => void;\n    const readyPromise = new Promise<void>((resolve) => {\n      resolveReady = resolve;\n    });\n\n    const runtime: RuntimeJobState = {\n      abortController: new AbortController(),\n      readyPromise,\n      resolveReady: resolveReady!,\n      syncSent: false,\n      earlyEventBuffer: [],\n      hasSubscriber: false,\n    };\n    this.runtimeState.set(streamId, runtime);\n\n    // Resolve immediately - early event buffer handles late subscribers\n    resolveReady!();\n\n    /**\n     * Set up all-subscribers-left callback.\n     * When all SSE clients disconnect, this:\n     * 1. Resets syncSent so reconnecting clients get sync event (persisted to Redis)\n     * 2. Calls any registered allSubscribersLeft handlers (e.g., to save partial responses)\n     */\n    this.eventTransport.onAllSubscribersLeft(streamId, () => {\n      const currentRuntime = this.runtimeState.get(streamId);\n      if (currentRuntime) {\n        currentRuntime.syncSent = false;\n        currentRuntime.hasSubscriber = false;\n        // Persist syncSent=false to Redis for cross-replica consistency\n        this.jobStore.updateJob(streamId, { syncSent: false }).catch((err) => {\n          logger.error(`[GenerationJobManager] Failed to persist syncSent=false:`, err);\n        });\n        // Call registered handlers (from job.emitter.on('allSubscribersLeft', ...))\n        if (currentRuntime.allSubscribersLeftHandlers) {\n          this.jobStore\n            .getContentParts(streamId)\n            .then((result) => {\n              const parts = result?.content ?? [];\n              for (const handler of currentRuntime.allSubscribersLeftHandlers ?? []) {\n                try {\n                  handler(parts);\n                } catch (err) {\n                  logger.error(`[GenerationJobManager] Error in allSubscribersLeft handler:`, err);\n                }\n              }\n            })\n            .catch((err) => {\n              logger.error(\n                `[GenerationJobManager] Failed to get content parts for allSubscribersLeft handlers:`,\n                err,\n              );\n            });\n        }\n      }\n    });\n\n    /**\n     * Set up cross-replica abort listener (Redis mode only).\n     * When abort is triggered on ANY replica, this replica receives the signal\n     * and aborts its local AbortController (if it's the one running generation).\n     */\n    if (this.eventTransport.onAbort) {\n      this.eventTransport.onAbort(streamId, () => {\n        const currentRuntime = this.runtimeState.get(streamId);\n        if (currentRuntime && !currentRuntime.abortController.signal.aborted) {\n          logger.debug(`[GenerationJobManager] Received cross-replica abort for ${streamId}`);\n          currentRuntime.abortController.abort();\n        }\n      });\n    }\n\n    logger.debug(`[GenerationJobManager] Created job: ${streamId}`);\n\n    // Return facade for backwards compatibility\n    return this.buildJobFacade(streamId, jobData, runtime);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Build a GenerationJob facade from composed services.\n   *\n   * This facade provides a unified API (job.emitter, job.abortController, etc.)\n   * while internally delegating to the injected services (jobStore, eventTransport,\n   * contentState). This allows swapping implementations (e.g., Redis) without\n   * changing consumer code.\n   *\n   * IMPORTANT: The emitterProxy.on('allSubscribersLeft') handler registration\n   * does NOT use eventTransport.subscribe().
