This is intentional:\n   *\n   * If we used subscribe() for internal handlers, those handlers would count\n   * as subscribers. When the real SSE client connects, isFirstSubscriber()\n   * would return false (because internal handler was \"first\"), and readyPromise\n   * would never resolve - causing a 5-second timeout delay before generation starts.\n   *\n   * Instead, allSubscribersLeft handlers are stored in runtime.allSubscribersLeftHandlers\n   * and called directly from the onAllSubscribersLeft callback in createJob().\n   *\n   * @param streamId - The stream identifier\n   * @param jobData - Serializable job metadata from job store\n   * @param runtime - Non-serializable runtime state (abort controller, promises, etc.)\n   * @returns A GenerationJob facade object\n   */\n  private buildJobFacade(\n    streamId: string,\n    jobData: SerializableJobData,\n    runtime: RuntimeJobState,\n  ): t.GenerationJob {\n    /**\n     * Proxy emitter that delegates to eventTransport for most operations.\n     * Exception: allSubscribersLeft handlers are stored separately to avoid\n     * incrementing subscriber count (see class JSDoc above).\n     */\n    const emitterProxy = {\n      on: (event: string, handler: (...args: unknown[]) => void) => {\n        if (event === 'allSubscribersLeft') {\n          // Store handler for internal callback - don't use subscribe() to avoid counting as a subscriber\n          if (!runtime.allSubscribersLeftHandlers) {\n            runtime.allSubscribersLeftHandlers = [];\n          }\n          runtime.allSubscribersLeftHandlers.push(handler);\n        }\n      },\n      emit: () => {\n        /* handled via eventTransport */\n      },\n      listenerCount: () => this.eventTransport.getSubscriberCount(streamId),\n      setMaxListeners: () => {\n        /* no-op for proxy */\n      },\n      removeAllListeners: () => this.eventTransport.cleanup(streamId),\n      off: () => {\n        /* handled via unsubscribe */\n      },\n    };\n\n    return {\n      streamId,\n      emitter: emitterProxy as unknown as t.GenerationJob['emitter'],\n      status: jobData.status as t.GenerationJobStatus,\n      createdAt: jobData.createdAt,\n      completedAt: jobData.completedAt,\n      abortController: runtime.abortController,\n      error: jobData.error,\n      metadata: {\n        userId: jobData.userId,\n        conversationId: jobData.conversationId,\n        userMessage: jobData.userMessage,\n        responseMessageId: jobData.responseMessageId,\n        sender: jobData.sender,\n      },\n      readyPromise: runtime.readyPromise,\n      resolveReady: runtime.resolveReady,\n      finalEvent: runtime.finalEvent,\n      syncSent: runtime.syncSent,\n    };\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get or create runtime state for a job.\n   *\n   * This enables cross-replica support in Redis mode:\n   * - If runtime exists locally (same replica), return it\n   * - If job exists in Redis but not locally (cross-replica), create minimal runtime\n   *\n   * The lazily-created runtime state is sufficient for:\n   * - Subscribing to events (via Redis pub/sub)\n   * - Getting resume state\n   * - Handling reconnections\n   * - Receiving cross-replica abort signals (via Redis pub/sub)\n   *\n   * @param streamId - The stream identifier\n   * @returns Runtime state or null if job doesn't exist anywhere\n   */\n  private async getOrCreateRuntimeState(streamId: string): Promise<RuntimeJobState | null> {\n    const existingRuntime = this.runtimeState.get(streamId);\n    if (existingRuntime) {\n      return existingRuntime;\n    }\n\n    // Job doesn't exist locally - check Redis\n    const jobData = await this.jobStore.getJob(streamId);\n    if (!jobData) {\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    // Cross-replica scenario: job exists in Redis but not locally\n    // Create minimal runtime state for handling reconnection/subscription\n    logger.debug(`[GenerationJobManager] Creating cross-replica runtime for ${streamId}`);\n\n    let resolveReady: () => void;\n    const readyPromise = new Promise<void>((resolve) => {\n      resolveReady = resolve;\n    });\n\n    // For jobs created on other replicas, readyPromise should be pre-resolved\n    // since generation has already started\n    resolveReady!();\n\n    // Parse finalEvent from Redis if available\n    let finalEvent: t.ServerSentEvent | undefined;\n    if (jobData.finalEvent) {\n      try {\n        finalEvent = JSON.parse(jobData.finalEvent) as t.ServerSentEvent;\n      } catch {\n        // Ignore parse errors\n      }\n    }\n\n    const runtime: RuntimeJobState = {\n      abortController: new AbortController(),\n      readyPromise,\n      resolveReady: resolveReady!,\n      syncSent: jobData.syncSent ?? false,\n      earlyEventBuffer: [],\n      hasSubscriber: false,\n      finalEvent,\n      errorEvent: jobData.error,\n    };\n\n    this.runtimeState.set(streamId, runtime);\n\n    // Set up all-subscribers-left callback for this replica\n    this.eventTransport.onAllSubscribersLeft(streamId, () => {\n      const currentRuntime = this.runtimeState.get(streamId);\n      if (currentRuntime) {\n        currentRuntime.syncSent = false;\n        currentRuntime.hasSubscriber = false;\n        // Persist syncSent=false to Redis\n        this.jobStore.updateJob(streamId, { syncSent: false }).catch((err) => {\n          logger.error(`[GenerationJobManager] Failed to persist syncSent=false:`, err);\n        });\n        // Call registered handlers\n        if (currentRuntime.allSubscribersLeftHandlers) {\n          this.jobStore\n            .getContentParts(streamId)\n            .then((result) => {\n              const parts = result?.content ?? [];\n              for (const handler of currentRuntime.allSubscribersLeftHandlers ?? []) {\n                try {\n                  handler(parts);\n                } catch (err) {\n                  logger.error(`[GenerationJobManager] Error in allSubscribersLeft handler:`, err);\n                }\n              }\n            })\n            .catch((err) => {\n              logger.error(\n                `[GenerationJobManager] Failed to get content parts for allSubscribersLeft handlers:`,\n                err,\n              );\n            });\n        }\n      }\n    });\n\n    // Set up cross-replica abort listener (Redis mode only)\n    // This ensures lazily-initialized jobs can receive abort signals\n    if (this.eventTransport.onAbort) {\n      this.eventTransport.onAbort(streamId, () => {\n        const currentRuntime = this.runtimeState.get(streamId);\n        if (currentRuntime && !currentRuntime.abortController.signal.aborted) {\n          logger.debug(\n            `[GenerationJobManager] Received cross-replica abort for lazily-init job ${streamId}`,\n          );\n          currentRuntime.abortController.abort();\n        }\n      });\n    }\n\n    return runtime;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get a job by streamId.\n   */\n  async getJob(streamId: string): Promise<t.GenerationJob | undefined> {\n    const jobData = await this.jobStore.getJob(streamId);\n    if (!jobData) {\n      return undefined;\n    }\n\n    const runtime = await this.getOrCreateRuntimeState(streamId);\n    if (!runtime) {\n      return undefined;\n    }\n\n    return this.buildJobFacade(streamId, jobData, runtime);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Check if a job exists.\n   */\n  async hasJob(streamId: string): Promise<boolean> {\n    return this.jobStore.hasJob(streamId);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get job status.\n   */\n  async getJobStatus(streamId: string): Promise<t.GenerationJobStatus | undefined> {\n    const jobData = await this.jobStore.getJob(streamId);\n    return jobData?.status as t.GenerationJobStatus | undefined;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Mark job as complete.\n   * If cleanupOnComplete is true (default), immediately cleans up job resources.\n   * Exception: Jobs with errors are NOT immediately deleted to allow late-connecting\n   * clients to receive the error (race condition where error occurs before client connects).\n   * Note: eventTransport is NOT cleaned up here to allow the final event to be\n   * fully transmitted. It will be cleaned up when subscribers disconnect or\n   * by the periodic cleanup job.\n   */\n  async completeJob(streamId: string, error?: string): Promise<void> {\n    const runtime = this.runtimeState.get(streamId);\n\n    // Abort the controller to signal all pending operations (e.g., OAuth flow monitors)\n    // that the job is done and they should clean up\n    if (runtime) {\n      runtime.abortController.abort();\n    }\n\n    // Clear content state and run step buffer (Redis only)\n    this.jobStore.clearContentState(streamId);\n    this.runStepBuffers?.delete(streamId);\n\n    // For error jobs, DON'T delete immediately - keep around so late-connecting\n    // clients can receive the error. This handles the race condition where error\n    // occurs before client connects to SSE stream.\n    //\n    // Cleanup strategy: Error jobs are cleaned up by periodic cleanup (every 60s)\n    // via jobStore.cleanup() which checks for jobs with status 'error' and\n    // completedAt set. The TTL is configurable via jobStore options (default: 0,\n    // meaning cleanup on next interval). This gives clients ~60s to connect and\n    // receive the error before the job is removed.\n    if (error) {\n      await this.jobStore.updateJob(streamId, {\n        status: 'error',\n        completedAt: Date.now(),\n        error,\n      });\n      // Keep runtime state so subscribe() can access errorEvent\n      logger.debug(\n        `[GenerationJobManager] Job completed with error (keeping for late subscribers): ${streamId}`,\n      );\n      return;\n    }\n\n    // Immediate cleanup if configured (default: true) - only for successful completions\n    if (this._cleanupOnComplete) {\n      this.runtimeState.delete(streamId);\n      // Don't cleanup eventTransport here - let the done event fully transmit first.\n      // EventTransport will be cleaned up when subscribers disconnect or by periodic cleanup.\n      await this.jobStore.deleteJob(streamId);\n    } else {\n      // Only update status if keeping the job around\n      await this.jobStore.updateJob(streamId, {\n        status: 'complete',\n        completedAt: Date.now(),\n      });\n    }\n\n    logger.debug(`[GenerationJobManager] Job completed: ${streamId}`);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Abort a job (user-initiated).\n   * Returns all data needed for token spending and message saving.\n   *\n   * Cross-replica support (Redis mode):\n   * - Emits abort signal via Redis pub/sub\n   * - The replica running generation receives signal and aborts its AbortController\n   */\n  async abortJob(streamId: string): Promise<AbortResult> {\n    const jobData = await this.jobStore.getJob(streamId);\n    const runtime = this.runtimeState.get(streamId);\n\n    if (!jobData) {\n      logger.warn(`[GenerationJobManager] Cannot abort - job not found: ${streamId}`);\n      return {\n        text: '',\n        content: [],\n        jobData: null,\n        success: false,\n        finalEvent: null,\n        collectedUsage: [],\n      };\n    }\n\n    // Emit abort signal for cross-replica support (Redis mode)\n    // This ensures the generating replica receives the abort signal\n    if (this.eventTransport.emitAbort) {\n      this.eventTransport.emitAbort(streamId);\n    }\n\n    // Also abort local controller if we have it (same-replica abort)\n    if (runtime) {\n      runtime.abortController.abort();\n    }\n\n    /** Content before clearing state */\n    const result = await this.jobStore.getContentParts(streamId);\n    const content = result?.content ?? [];\n\n    /** Collected usage for all models */\n    const collectedUsage = this.jobStore.getCollectedUsage(streamId);\n\n    /** Text from content parts for fallback token counting */\n    const text = parseTextParts(content as TMessageContentParts[]);\n\n    /** Detect \"early abort\" - aborted before any generation happened (e.g., during tool loading)\n    In this case, no messages were saved to DB, so frontend shouldn't navigate to conversation */\n    const isEarlyAbort = content.length === 0 && !jobData.responseMessageId;\n\n    /** Final event for abort */\n    const userMessageId = jobData.userMessage?.messageId;\n\n    const abortFinalEvent: t.ServerSentEvent = {\n      final: true,\n      // Don't include conversation for early aborts - it doesn't exist in DB\n      conversation: isEarlyAbort ? null : { conversationId: jobData.conversationId },\n      title: 'New Chat',\n      requestMessage: jobData.userMessage\n        ? {\n            messageId: userMessageId,\n            parentMessageId: jobData.userMessage.parentMessageId,\n            conversationId: jobData.conversationId,\n            text: jobData.userMessage.text ?? '',\n            isCreatedByUser: true,\n          }\n        : null,\n      responseMessage: isEarlyAbort\n        ? null\n        : {\n            messageId: jobData.responseMessageId ?? `${userMessageId ?? 'aborted'}_`,\n            parentMessageId: userMessageId,\n            conversationId: jobData.conversationId,\n            content,\n            sender: jobData.sender ?? 'AI',\n            unfinished: true,\n            error: false,\n            isCreatedByUser: false,\n          },\n      aborted: true,\n      // Flag for early abort - no messages saved, frontend should go to new chat\n      earlyAbort: isEarlyAbort,\n    } as unknown as t.ServerSentEvent;\n\n    if (runtime) {\n      runtime.finalEvent = abortFinalEvent;\n    }\n\n    await this.eventTransport.emitDone(streamId, abortFinalEvent);\n    this.jobStore.clearContentState(streamId);\n    this.runStepBuffers?.delete(streamId);\n\n    // Immediate cleanup if configured (default: true)\n    if (this._cleanupOnComplete) {\n      this.runtimeState.delete(streamId);\n      // Don't cleanup eventTransport here - let the abort event fully transmit first.\n      await this.jobStore.deleteJob(streamId);\n    } else {\n      // Only update status if keeping the job around\n      await this.jobStore.updateJob(streamId, {\n        status: 'aborted',\n        completedAt: Date.now(),\n      });\n    }\n\n    logger.debug(`[GenerationJobManager] Job aborted: ${streamId}`);\n\n    return {\n      success: true,\n      jobData,\n      content,\n      finalEvent: abortFinalEvent,\n      text,\n      collectedUsage,\n    };\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Subscribe to a job's event stream.\n   *\n   * This is called when an SSE client connects to /chat/stream/:streamId.\n   * On first subscription:\n   * - Resolves readyPromise (legacy, for API compatibility)\n   * - Replays any buffered early events (e.g., 'created' event)\n   *\n   * Supports cross-replica reconnection in Redis mode:\n   * - If job exists in Redis but not locally, creates minimal runtime state\n   * - Events are delivered via Redis pub/sub, not in-memory EventEmitter\n   *\n   * @param streamId - The stream to subscribe to\n   * @param onChunk - Handler for chunk events (streamed tokens, run steps, etc.)\n   * @param onDone - Handler for completion event (includes final message)\n   * @param onError - Handler for error events\n   * @returns Subscription object with unsubscribe function, or null if job not found\n   */\n  async subscribe(\n    streamId: string,\n    onChunk: t.ChunkHandler,\n    onDone?: t.DoneHandler,\n    onError?: t.ErrorHandler,\n  ): Promise<{ unsubscribe: t.UnsubscribeFn } | null> {\n    // Use lazy initialization to support cross-replica subscriptions\n    const runtime = await this.getOrCreateRuntimeState(streamId);\n    if (!runtime) {\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    const jobData = await this.jobStore.getJob(streamId);\n\n    // If job already complete/error, send final event or error\n    // Error status takes precedence to ensure errors aren't misreported as successes\n    setImmediate(() => {\n      if (jobData && ['complete', 'error', 'aborted'].includes(jobData.status)) {\n        // Check for error status FIRST and prioritize error handling\n        if (jobData.status === 'error' && (runtime.errorEvent || jobData.error)) {\n          const errorToSend = runtime.errorEvent ?? jobData.error;\n          if (errorToSend) {\n            logger.debug(\n              `[GenerationJobManager] Sending stored error to late subscriber: ${streamId}`,\n            );\n            onError?.(errorToSend);\n          }\n        } else if (runtime.finalEvent) {\n          onDone?.(runtime.finalEvent);\n        }\n      }\n    });\n\n    const subscription = this.eventTransport.subscribe(streamId, {\n      onChunk: (event) => {\n        const e = event as t.ServerSentEvent;\n        if (!(e as Record<string, unknown>)._internal) {\n          onChunk(e);\n        }\n      },\n      onDone: (event) => onDone?.(event as t.ServerSentEvent),\n      onError,\n    });\n\n    if (subscription.ready) {\n      await subscription.ready;\n    }\n\n    const isFirst = this.eventTransport.isFirstSubscriber(streamId);\n\n    if (!runtime.hasSubscriber) {\n      runtime.hasSubscriber = true;\n\n      if (runtime.earlyEventBuffer.length > 0) {\n        logger.debug(\n          `[GenerationJobManager] Replaying ${runtime.earlyEventBuffer.length} buffered events for ${streamId}`,\n        );\n        for (const bufferedEvent of runtime.earlyEventBuffer) {\n          onChunk(bufferedEvent);\n        }\n        runtime.earlyEventBuffer = [];\n      }\n\n      this.eventTransport.syncReorderBuffer?.(streamId);\n    }\n\n    if (isFirst) {\n      runtime.resolveReady();\n      logger.debug(\n        `[GenerationJobManager] First subscriber ready, resolving promise for ${streamId}`,\n      );\n    }\n\n    return subscription;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Emit a chunk event to all subscribers.\n   * Uses runtime state check for performance (avoids async job store lookup per token).\n   *\n   * If no subscriber has connected yet, buffers the event for replay when they do.\n   * This ensures early events (like 'created') aren't lost due to race conditions.\n   *\n   * In Redis mode, awaits the publish to guarantee event ordering.\n   * This is critical for streaming deltas (tool args, message content) to arrive in order.\n   */\n  async emitChunk(streamId: string, event: t.ServerSentEvent): Promise<void> {\n    const runtime = this.runtimeState.get(streamId);\n    if (!runtime || runtime.abortController.signal.aborted) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    // Track user message from created event\n    this.trackUserMessage(streamId, event);\n\n    // For Redis mode, persist chunk for later reconstruction (fire-and-forget for resumability)\n    if (this._isRedis) {\n      // The SSE event structure is { event: string, data: unknown, ... }\n      // The aggregator expects { event: string, data: unknown } where data is the payload\n      const eventObj = event as Record<string, unknown>;\n      const eventType = eventObj.event as string | undefined;\n      const eventData = eventObj.data;\n\n      if (eventType && eventData !== undefined) {\n        // Store in format expected by aggregateContent: { event, data }\n        this.jobStore.appendChunk(streamId, { event: eventType, data: eventData }).catch((err) => {\n          logger.error(`[GenerationJobManager] Failed to append chunk:`, err);\n        });\n\n        // For run step events, also save to run steps key for quick retrieval\n        if (eventType === 'on_run_step' || eventType === 'on_run_step_completed') {\n          this.saveRunStepFromEvent(streamId, eventData as Record<string, unknown>);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    if (!runtime.hasSubscriber) {\n      runtime.earlyEventBuffer.push(event);\n      if (!this._isRedis) {\n        return;\n      }\n    }\n\n    await this.eventTransport.emitChunk(streamId, event);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Extract and save run step from event data.\n   * The data is already the run step object from the event payload.\n   */\n  private saveRunStepFromEvent(streamId: string, data: Record<string, unknown>): void {\n    // The data IS the run step object\n    const runStep = data as Agents.RunStep;\n    if (!runStep.id) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    // Fire and forget - accumulate run steps\n    this.accumulateRunStep(streamId, runStep);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Accumulate run steps for a stream (Redis mode only).\n   * Uses a simple in-memory buffer that gets flushed to Redis.\n   * Not used in in-memory mode - run steps come from live graph via WeakRef.\n   */\n  private runStepBuffers: Map<string, Agents.RunStep[]> | null = null;\n\n  private accumulateRunStep(streamId: string, runStep: Agents.RunStep): void {\n    // Lazy initialization - only create map when first used (Redis mode)\n    if (!this.runStepBuffers) {\n      this.runStepBuffers = new Map();\n    }\n\n    let buffer = this.runStepBuffers.get(streamId);\n    if (!buffer) {\n      buffer = [];\n      this.runStepBuffers.set(streamId, buffer);\n    }\n\n    // Update or add run step\n    const existingIdx = buffer.findIndex((rs) => rs.id === runStep.id);\n    if (existingIdx >= 0) {\n      buffer[existingIdx] = runStep;\n    } else {\n      buffer.push(runStep);\n    }\n\n    // Save to Redis\n    if (this.jobStore.saveRunSteps) {\n      this.jobStore.saveRunSteps(streamId, buffer).catch((err) => {\n        logger.error(`[GenerationJobManager] Failed to save run steps:`, err);\n      });\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Track user message from created event.\n   */\n  private trackUserMessage(streamId: string, event: t.ServerSentEvent): void {\n    const data = event as Record<string, unknown>;\n    if (!data.created || !data.message) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    const message = data.message as Record<string, unknown>;\n    const updates: Partial<SerializableJobData> = {\n      userMessage: {\n        messageId: message.messageId as string,\n        parentMessageId: message.parentMessageId as string | undefined,\n        conversationId: message.conversationId as string | undefined,\n        text: message.text as string | undefined,\n      },\n    };\n\n    if (message.conversationId) {\n      updates.conversationId = message.conversationId as string;\n    }\n\n    this.jobStore.updateJob(streamId, updates);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Update job metadata.\n   */\n  async updateMetadata(\n    streamId: string,\n    metadata: Partial<t.GenerationJobMetadata>,\n  ): Promise<void> {\n    const updates: Partial<SerializableJobData> = {};\n    if (metadata.responseMessageId) {\n      updates.responseMessageId = metadata.responseMessageId;\n    }\n    if (metadata.sender) {\n      updates.sender = metadata.sender;\n    }\n    if (metadata.conversationId) {\n      updates.conversationId = metadata.conversationId;\n    }\n    if (metadata.userMessage) {\n      updates.userMessage = metadata.userMessage;\n    }\n    if (metadata.endpoint) {\n      updates.endpoint = metadata.endpoint;\n    }\n    if (metadata.iconURL) {\n      updates.iconURL = metadata.iconURL;\n    }\n    if (metadata.model) {\n      updates.model = metadata.model;\n    }\n    if (metadata.promptTokens !== undefined) {\n      updates.promptTokens = metadata.promptTokens;\n    }\n    await this.jobStore.updateJob(streamId, updates);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Set reference to the graph's contentParts array.\n   */\n  setContentParts(streamId: string, contentParts: Agents.MessageContentComplex[]): void {\n    // Use runtime state check for performance (sync check)\n    if (!this.runtimeState.has(streamId)) {\n      return;\n    }\n    this.jobStore.setContentParts(streamId, contentParts);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Set reference to the collectedUsage array.\n   * This array accumulates token usage from all models during generation.\n   */\n  setCollectedUsage(streamId: string, collectedUsage: UsageMetadata[]): void {\n    // Use runtime state check for performance (sync check)\n    if (!this.runtimeState.has(streamId)) {\n      return;\n    }\n    this.jobStore.setCollectedUsage(streamId, collectedUsage);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Set reference to the graph instance.\n   */\n  setGraph(streamId: string, graph: StandardGraph): void {\n    // Use runtime state check for performance (sync check)\n    if (!this.runtimeState.has(streamId)) {\n      return;\n    }\n    this.jobStore.setGraph(streamId, graph);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get resume state for reconnecting clients.\n   */\n  async getResumeState(streamId: string): Promise<t.ResumeState | null> {\n    const jobData = await this.jobStore.getJob(streamId);\n    if (!jobData) {\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    const result = await this.jobStore.getContentParts(streamId);\n    const aggregatedContent = result?.content ?? [];\n    const runSteps = await this.jobStore.getRunSteps(streamId);\n\n    logger.debug(`[GenerationJobManager] getResumeState:`, {\n      streamId,\n      runStepsLength: runSteps.length,\n      aggregatedContentLength: aggregatedContent.length,\n    });\n\n    return {\n      runSteps,\n      aggregatedContent,\n      userMessage: jobData.userMessage,\n      responseMessageId: jobData.responseMessageId,\n      conversationId: jobData.conversationId,\n      sender: jobData.sender,\n    };\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Mark that sync has been sent.\n   * Persists to Redis for cross-replica consistency.\n   */\n  markSyncSent(streamId: string): void {\n    const runtime = this.runtimeState.get(streamId);\n    if (runtime) {\n      runtime.syncSent = true;\n    }\n    // Persist to Redis for cross-replica consistency\n    this.jobStore.updateJob(streamId, { syncSent: true }).catch((err) => {\n      logger.error(`[GenerationJobManager] Failed to persist syncSent flag:`, err);\n    });\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Check if sync has been sent.\n   * Checks local runtime first, then falls back to Redis for cross-replica scenarios.\n   */\n  async wasSyncSent(streamId: string): Promise<boolean> {\n    const localSyncSent = this.runtimeState.get(streamId)?.syncSent;\n    if (localSyncSent !== undefined) {\n      return localSyncSent;\n    }\n    // Cross-replica: check Redis\n    const jobData = await this.jobStore.getJob(streamId);\n    return jobData?.syncSent ?? false;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Emit a done event.\n   * Persists finalEvent to Redis for cross-replica access.\n   */\n  async emitDone(streamId: string, event: t.ServerSentEvent): Promise<void> {\n    const runtime = this.runtimeState.get(streamId);\n    if (runtime) {\n      runtime.finalEvent = event;\n    }\n    // Persist finalEvent to Redis for cross-replica consistency\n    this.jobStore.updateJob(streamId, { finalEvent: JSON.stringify(event) }).catch((err) => {\n      logger.error(`[GenerationJobManager] Failed to persist finalEvent:`, err);\n    });\n    await this.eventTransport.emitDone(streamId, event);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Emit an error event.\n   * Stores the error for late-connecting subscribers (race condition where error\n   * occurs before client connects to SSE stream).\n   */\n  async emitError(streamId: string, error: string): Promise<void> {\n    const runtime = this.runtimeState.get(streamId);\n    if (runtime) {\n      runtime.errorEvent = error;\n    }\n    // Persist error to job store for cross-replica consistency\n    this.jobStore.updateJob(streamId, { error }).catch((err) => {\n      logger.error(`[GenerationJobManager] Failed to persist error:`, err);\n    });\n    await this.eventTransport.emitError(streamId, error);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Cleanup expired jobs.\n   * Also cleans up any orphaned runtime state, buffers, and event transport entries.\n   */\n  private async cleanup(): Promise<void> {\n    const count = await this.jobStore.cleanup();\n\n    // Cleanup runtime state for deleted jobs\n    for (const streamId of this.runtimeState.keys()) {\n      if (!(await this.jobStore.hasJob(streamId))) {\n        this.runtimeState.delete(streamId);\n        this.runStepBuffers?.delete(streamId);\n        this.jobStore.clearContentState(streamId);\n        this.eventTransport.cleanup(streamId);\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Also check runStepBuffers for any orphaned entries (Redis mode only)\n    if (this.runStepBuffers) {\n      for (const streamId of this.runStepBuffers.keys()) {\n        if (!(await this.jobStore.hasJob(streamId))) {\n          this.runStepBuffers.delete(streamId);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Check eventTransport for orphaned streams (e.g., connections dropped without clean close)\n    // These are streams that exist in eventTransport but have no corresponding job\n    for (const streamId of this.eventTransport.getTrackedStreamIds()) {\n      if (!(await this.jobStore.hasJob(streamId)) && !this.runtimeState.has(streamId)) {\n        this.eventTransport.cleanup(streamId);\n      }\n    }\n\n    if (count > 0) {\n      logger.debug(`[GenerationJobManager] Cleaned up ${count} expired jobs`);\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get stream info for status endpoint.\n   */\n  async getStreamInfo(streamId: string): Promise<{\n    active: boolean;\n    status: t.GenerationJobStatus;\n    aggregatedContent?: Agents.MessageContentComplex[];\n    createdAt: number;\n  } | null> {\n    const jobData = await this.jobStore.getJob(streamId);\n    if (!jobData) {\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    const result = await this.jobStore.getContentParts(streamId);\n    const aggregatedContent = result?.content ?? [];\n\n    return {\n      active: jobData.status === 'running',\n      status: jobData.status as t.GenerationJobStatus,\n      aggregatedContent,\n      createdAt: jobData.createdAt,\n    };\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get total job count.\n   */\n  async getJobCount(): Promise<number> {\n    return this.jobStore.getJobCount();\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get job count by status.\n   */\n  async getJobCountByStatus(): Promise<Record<t.GenerationJobStatus, number>> {\n    const [running, complete, error, aborted] = await Promise.all([\n      this.jobStore.getJobCountByStatus('running'),\n      this.jobStore.getJobCountByStatus('complete'),\n      this.jobStore.getJobCountByStatus('error'),\n      this.jobStore.getJobCountByStatus('aborted'),\n    ]);\n    return { running, complete, error, aborted };\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get active job IDs for a user.\n   * Returns conversation IDs of running jobs belonging to the user.\n   * Performs self-healing cleanup of stale entries.\n   *\n   * @param userId - The user ID to query\n   * @returns Array of conversation IDs with active jobs\n   */\n  async getActiveJobIdsForUser(userId: string): Promise<string[]> {\n    return this.jobStore.getActiveJobIdsByUser(userId);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Destroy the manager.\n   * Cleans up all resources including runtime state, buffers, and stores.\n   */\n  async destroy(): Promise<void> {\n    if (this.cleanupInterval) {\n      clearInterval(this.cleanupInterval);\n      this.cleanupInterval = null;\n    }\n\n    await this.jobStore.destroy();\n    this.eventTransport.destroy();\n    this.runtimeState.clear();\n    this.runStepBuffers?.clear();\n\n    logger.debug('[GenerationJobManager] Destroyed');\n  }\n}\n\nexport const GenerationJobManager = new GenerationJobManagerClass();\nexport { GenerationJobManagerClass };\n","/** Memories */\nimport { z } from 'zod';\nimport { tool } from '@langchain/core/tools';\nimport { Tools } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { HumanMessage } from '@langchain/core/messages';\nimport { Run, Providers, GraphEvents } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type {\n  OpenAIClientOptions,\n  StreamEventData,\n  ToolEndCallback,\n  ClientOptions,\n  EventHandler,\n  ToolEndData,\n  LLMConfig,\n} from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type { ObjectId, MemoryMethods, IUser } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { TAttachment, MemoryArtifact } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { BaseMessage, ToolMessage } from '@langchain/core/messages';\nimport type { Response as ServerResponse } from 'express';\nimport { GenerationJobManager } from '~/stream/GenerationJobManager';\nimport { Tokenizer, resolveHeaders, createSafeUser } from '~/utils';\n\ntype RequiredMemoryMethods = Pick<\n  MemoryMethods,\n  'setMemory' | 'deleteMemory' | 'getFormattedMemories'\n>;\n\ntype ToolEndMetadata = Record<string, unknown> & {\n  run_id?: string;\n  thread_id?: string;\n};\n\nexport interface MemoryConfig {\n  validKeys?: string[];\n  instructions?: string;\n  llmConfig?: Partial<LLMConfig>;\n  tokenLimit?: number;\n}\n\nexport const memoryInstructions =\n  'The system automatically stores important user information and can update or delete memories based on user requests, enabling dynamic memory management.';\n\nconst getDefaultInstructions = (\n  validKeys?: string[],\n  tokenLimit?: number,\n) => `Use the \\`set_memory\\` tool to save important information about the user, but ONLY when the user has requested you to remember something.\n\nThe \\`delete_memory\\` tool should only be used in two scenarios:\n  1. When the user explicitly asks to forget or remove specific information\n  2. When updating existing memories, use the \\`set_memory\\` tool instead of deleting and re-adding the memory.\n\n1. ONLY use memory tools when the user requests memory actions with phrases like:\n   - \"Remember [that] [I]...\"\n   - \"Don't forget [that] [I]...\"\n   - \"Please remember...\"\n   - \"Store this...\"\n   - \"Forget [that] [I]...\"\n   - \"Delete the memory about...\"\n\n2. NEVER store information just because the user mentioned it in conversation.\n\n3. NEVER use memory tools when the user asks you to use other tools or invoke tools in general.\n\n4. Memory tools are ONLY for memory requests, not for general tool usage.\n\n5. If the user doesn't ask you to remember or forget something, DO NOT use any memory tools.\n\n${validKeys && validKeys.length > 0 ? `\\nVALID KEYS: ${validKeys.join(', ')}` : ''}\n\n${tokenLimit ? `\\nTOKEN LIMIT: Maximum ${tokenLimit} tokens per memory value.` : ''}\n\nWhen in doubt, and the user hasn't asked to remember or forget anything, END THE TURN IMMEDIATELY.`;\n\n/**\n * Creates a memory tool instance with user context\n */\nexport const createMemoryTool = ({\n  userId,\n  setMemory,\n  validKeys,\n  tokenLimit,\n  totalTokens = 0,\n}: {\n  userId: string | ObjectId;\n  setMemory: MemoryMethods['setMemory'];\n  validKeys?: string[];\n  tokenLimit?: number;\n  totalTokens?: number;\n}) => {\n  const remainingTokens = tokenLimit ? tokenLimit - totalTokens : Infinity;\n  const isOverflowing = tokenLimit ? remainingTokens <= 0 : false;\n\n  return tool(\n    async ({ key, value }) => {\n      try {\n        if (validKeys && validKeys.length > 0 && !validKeys.includes(key)) {\n          logger.warn(\n            `Memory Agent failed to set memory: Invalid key \"${key}\". Must be one of: ${validKeys.join(\n              ', ',\n            )}`,\n          );\n          return [`Invalid key \"${key}\". Must be one of: ${validKeys.join(', ')}`, undefined];\n        }\n\n        const tokenCount = Tokenizer.getTokenCount(value, 'o200k_base');\n\n        if (isOverflowing) {\n          const errorArtifact: Record<Tools.memory, MemoryArtifact> = {\n            [Tools.memory]: {\n              key: 'system',\n              type: 'error',\n              value: JSON.stringify({\n                errorType: 'already_exceeded',\n                tokenCount: Math.abs(remainingTokens),\n                totalTokens: totalTokens,\n                tokenLimit: tokenLimit!,\n              }),\n              tokenCount: totalTokens,\n            },\n          };\n          return [`Memory storage exceeded. Cannot save new memories.`, errorArtifact];\n        }\n\n        if (tokenLimit) {\n          const newTotalTokens = totalTokens + tokenCount;\n          const newRemainingTokens = tokenLimit - newTotalTokens;\n\n          if (newRemainingTokens < 0) {\n            const errorArtifact: Record<Tools.memory, MemoryArtifact> = {\n              [Tools.memory]: {\n                key: 'system',\n                type: 'error',\n                value: JSON.stringify({\n                  errorType: 'would_exceed',\n                  tokenCount: Math.abs(newRemainingTokens),\n                  totalTokens: newTotalTokens,\n                  tokenLimit,\n                }),\n                tokenCount: totalTokens,\n              },\n            };\n            return [`Memory storage would exceed limit. Cannot save this memory.`, errorArtifact];\n          }\n        }\n\n        const artifact: Record<Tools.memory, MemoryArtifact> = {\n          [Tools.memory]: {\n            key,\n            value,\n            tokenCount,\n            type: 'update',\n          },\n        };\n\n        const result = await setMemory({ userId, key, value, tokenCount });\n        if (result.ok) {\n          logger.debug(`Memory set for key \"${key}\" (${tokenCount} tokens) for user \"${userId}\"`);\n          return [`Memory set for key \"${key}\" (${tokenCount} tokens)`, artifact];\n        }\n        logger.warn(`Failed to set memory for key \"${key}\" for user \"${userId}\"`);\n        return [`Failed to set memory for key \"${key}\"`, undefined];\n      } catch (error) {\n        logger.error('Memory Agent failed to set memory', error);\n        return [`Error setting memory for key \"${key}\"`, undefined];\n      }\n    },\n    {\n      name: 'set_memory',\n      description: 'Saves important information about the user into memory.',\n      responseFormat: 'content_and_artifact',\n      schema: z.object({\n        key: z\n          .string()\n          .describe(\n            validKeys && validKeys.length > 0\n              ? `The key of the memory value. Must be one of: ${validKeys.join(', ')}`\n              : 'The key identifier for this memory',\n          ),\n        value: z\n          .string()\n          .describe(\n            'Value MUST be a complete sentence that fully describes relevant user information.',\n          ),\n      }),\n    },\n  );\n};\n\n/**\n * Creates a delete memory tool instance with user context\n */\nconst createDeleteMemoryTool = ({\n  userId,\n  deleteMemory,\n  validKeys,\n}: {\n  userId: string | ObjectId;\n  deleteMemory: MemoryMethods['deleteMemory'];\n  validKeys?: string[];\n}) => {\n  return tool(\n    async ({ key }) => {\n      try {\n        if (validKeys && validKeys.length > 0 && !validKeys.includes(key)) {\n          logger.warn(\n            `Memory Agent failed to delete memory: Invalid key \"${key}\". Must be one of: ${validKeys.join(\n              ', ',\n            )}`,\n          );\n          return [`Invalid key \"${key}\". Must be one of: ${validKeys.join(', ')}`, undefined];\n        }\n\n        const artifact: Record<Tools.memory, MemoryArtifact> = {\n          [Tools.memory]: {\n            key,\n            type: 'delete',\n          },\n        };\n\n        const result = await deleteMemory({ userId, key });\n        if (result.ok) {\n          logger.debug(`Memory deleted for key \"${key}\" for user \"${userId}\"`);\n          return [`Memory deleted for key \"${key}\"`, artifact];\n        }\n        logger.warn(`Failed to delete memory for key \"${key}\" for user \"${userId}\"`);\n        return [`Failed to delete memory for key \"${key}\"`, undefined];\n      } catch (error) {\n        logger.error('Memory Agent failed to delete memory', error);\n        return [`Error deleting memory for key \"${key}\"`, undefined];\n      }\n    },\n    {\n      name: 'delete_memory',\n      description:\n        'Deletes specific memory data about the user using the provided key. For updating existing memories, use the `set_memory` tool instead',\n      responseFormat: 'content_and_artifact',\n      schema: z.object({\n        key: z\n          .string()\n          .describe(\n            validKeys && validKeys.length > 0\n              ? `The key of the memory to delete. Must be one of: ${validKeys.join(', ')}`\n              : 'The key identifier of the memory to delete',\n          ),\n      }),\n    },\n  );\n};\nexport class BasicToolEndHandler implements EventHandler {\n  private callback?: ToolEndCallback;\n  constructor(callback?: ToolEndCallback) {\n    this.callback = callback;\n  }\n\n  handle(\n    event: string,\n    data: StreamEventData | undefined,\n    metadata?: Record<string, unknown>,\n  ): void {\n    if (!metadata) {\n      console.warn(`Graph or metadata not found in ${event} event`);\n      return;\n    }\n    const toolEndData = data as ToolEndData | undefined;\n    if (!toolEndData?.output) {\n      console.warn('No output found in tool_end event');\n      return;\n    }\n    this.callback?.(toolEndData, metadata);\n  }\n}\n\nexport async function processMemory({\n  res,\n  userId,\n  setMemory,\n  deleteMemory,\n  messages,\n  memory,\n  messageId,\n  conversationId,\n  validKeys,\n  instructions,\n  llmConfig,\n  tokenLimit,\n  totalTokens = 0,\n  streamId = null,\n  user,\n}: {\n  res: ServerResponse;\n  setMemory: MemoryMethods['setMemory'];\n  deleteMemory: MemoryMethods['deleteMemory'];\n  userId: string | ObjectId;\n  memory: string;\n  messageId: string;\n  conversationId: string;\n  messages: BaseMessage[];\n  validKeys?: string[];\n  instructions: string;\n  tokenLimit?: number;\n  totalTokens?: number;\n  llmConfig?: Partial<LLMConfig>;\n  streamId?: string | null;\n  user?: IUser;\n}): Promise<(TAttachment | null)[] | undefined> {\n  try {\n    const memoryTool = createMemoryTool({\n      userId,\n      tokenLimit,\n      setMemory,\n      validKeys,\n      totalTokens,\n    });\n    const deleteMemoryTool = createDeleteMemoryTool({\n      userId,\n      validKeys,\n      deleteMemory,\n    });\n\n    const currentMemoryTokens = totalTokens;\n\n    let memoryStatus = `# Existing memory:\\n${memory ?? 'No existing memories'}`;\n\n    if (tokenLimit) {\n      const remainingTokens = tokenLimit - currentMemoryTokens;\n      memoryStatus = `# Memory Status:\nCurrent memory usage: ${currentMemoryTokens} tokens\nToken limit: ${tokenLimit} tokens\nRemaining capacity: ${remainingTokens} tokens\n\n# Existing memory:\n${memory ?? 'No existing memories'}`;\n    }\n\n    const defaultLLMConfig: LLMConfig = {\n      provider: Providers.OPENAI,\n      model: 'gpt-4.1-mini',\n      temperature: 0.4,\n      streaming: false,\n      disableStreaming: true,\n    };\n\n    const finalLLMConfig: ClientOptions = {\n      ...defaultLLMConfig,\n      ...llmConfig,\n      /**\n       * Ensure streaming is always disabled for memory processing\n       */\n      streaming: false,\n      disableStreaming: true,\n    };\n\n    // Handle GPT-5+ models\n    if ('model' in finalLLMConfig && /\\bgpt-[5-9](?:\\.\\d+)?\\b/i.test(finalLLMConfig.model ?? '')) {\n      // Remove temperature for GPT-5+ models\n      delete finalLLMConfig.temperature;\n\n      // Move maxTokens to modelKwargs for GPT-5+ models\n      if ('maxTokens' in finalLLMConfig && finalLLMConfig.maxTokens != null) {\n        const modelKwargs = (finalLLMConfig as OpenAIClientOptions).modelKwargs ?? {};\n        const paramName =\n          (finalLLMConfig as OpenAIClientOptions).useResponsesApi === true\n            ? 'max_output_tokens'\n            : 'max_completion_tokens';\n        modelKwargs[paramName] = finalLLMConfig.maxTokens;\n        delete finalLLMConfig.maxTokens;\n        (finalLLMConfig as OpenAIClientOptions).modelKwargs = modelKwargs;\n      }\n    }\n\n    const bedrockConfig = finalLLMConfig as {\n      additionalModelRequestFields?: { thinking?: unknown };\n      temperature?: number;\n    };\n    if (\n      llmConfig?.provider === Providers.BEDROCK &&\n      bedrockConfig.additionalModelRequestFields?.thinking != null &&\n      bedrockConfig.temperature != null\n    ) {\n      (finalLLMConfig as unknown as Record<string, unknown>).temperature = 1;\n    }\n\n    const anthropicConfig = finalLLMConfig as {\n      thinking?: { type?: string };\n      temperature?: number;\n    };\n    if (\n      llmConfig?.provider === Providers.ANTHROPIC &&\n      anthropicConfig.thinking?.type === 'enabled' &&\n      anthropicConfig.temperature != null\n    ) {\n      delete (finalLLMConfig as Record<string, unknown>).temperature;\n    }\n\n    const llmConfigWithHeaders = finalLLMConfig as OpenAIClientOptions;\n    if (llmConfigWithHeaders?.configuration?.defaultHeaders != null) {\n      llmConfigWithHeaders.configuration.defaultHeaders = resolveHeaders({\n        headers: llmConfigWithHeaders.configuration.defaultHeaders as Record<string, string>,\n        user: user ? createSafeUser(user) : undefined,\n      });\n    }\n\n    const artifactPromises: Promise<TAttachment | null>[] = [];\n    const memoryCallback = createMemoryCallback({ res, artifactPromises, streamId });\n    const customHandlers = {\n      [GraphEvents.TOOL_END]: new BasicToolEndHandler(memoryCallback),\n    };\n\n    /**\n     * For Bedrock provider, include instructions in the user message instead of as a system prompt.\n     * Bedrock's Converse API requires conversations to start with a user message, not a system message.\n     * Other providers can use the standard system prompt approach.\n     */\n    const isBedrock = llmConfig?.provider === Providers.BEDROCK;\n\n    let graphInstructions: string | undefined = instructions;\n    let graphAdditionalInstructions: string | undefined = memoryStatus;\n    let processedMessages = messages;\n\n    if (isBedrock) {\n      const combinedInstructions = [instructions, memoryStatus].filter(Boolean).join('\\n\\n');\n\n      if (messages.length > 0) {\n        const firstMessage = messages[0];\n        const originalContent =\n          typeof firstMessage.content === 'string' ? firstMessage.content : '';\n\n        if (typeof firstMessage.content !== 'string') {\n          logger.warn(\n            'Bedrock memory processing: First message has non-string content, using empty string',\n          );\n        }\n\n        const bedrockUserMessage = new HumanMessage(\n          `${combinedInstructions}\\n\\n${originalContent}`,\n        );\n        processedMessages = [bedrockUserMessage, ...messages.slice(1)];\n      } else {\n        processedMessages = [new HumanMessage(combinedInstructions)];\n      }\n\n      graphInstructions = undefined;\n      graphAdditionalInstructions = undefined;\n    }\n\n    const run = await Run.create({\n      runId: messageId,\n      graphConfig: {\n        type: 'standard',\n        llmConfig: finalLLMConfig,\n        tools: [memoryTool, deleteMemoryTool],\n        instructions: graphInstructions,\n        additional_instructions: graphAdditionalInstructions,\n        toolEnd: true,\n      },\n      customHandlers,\n      returnContent: true,\n    });\n\n    const config = {\n      runName: 'MemoryRun',\n      configurable: {\n        user_id: userId,\n        thread_id: conversationId,\n        provider: llmConfig?.provider,\n      },\n      streamMode: 'values',\n      recursionLimit: 3,\n      version: 'v2',\n    } as const;\n\n    const inputs = {\n      messages: processedMessages,\n    };\n    const content = await run.processStream(inputs, config);\n    if (content) {\n      logger.debug('Memory Agent processed memory successfully', content);\n    } else {\n      logger.warn('Memory Agent processed memory but returned no content');\n    }\n    return await Promise.all(artifactPromises);\n  } catch (error) {\n    logger.error('Memory Agent failed to process memory', error);\n  }\n}\n\nexport async function createMemoryProcessor({\n  res,\n  userId,\n  messageId,\n  memoryMethods,\n  conversationId,\n  config = {},\n  streamId = null,\n  user,\n}: {\n  res: ServerResponse;\n  messageId: string;\n  conversationId: string;\n  userId: string | ObjectId;\n  memoryMethods: RequiredMemoryMethods;\n  config?: MemoryConfig;\n  streamId?: string | null;\n  user?: IUser;\n}): Promise<[string, (messages: BaseMessage[]) => Promise<(TAttachment | null)[] | undefined>]> {\n  const { validKeys, instructions, llmConfig, tokenLimit } = config;\n  const finalInstructions = instructions || getDefaultInstructions(validKeys, tokenLimit);\n\n  const { withKeys, withoutKeys, totalTokens } = await memoryMethods.getFormattedMemories({\n    userId,\n  });\n\n  return [\n    withoutKeys,\n    async function (messages: BaseMessage[]): Promise<(TAttachment | null)[] | undefined> {\n      try {\n        return await processMemory({\n          res,\n          userId,\n          messages,\n          validKeys,\n          llmConfig,\n          messageId,\n          tokenLimit,\n          streamId,\n          conversationId,\n          memory: withKeys,\n          totalTokens: totalTokens || 0,\n          instructions: finalInstructions,\n          setMemory: memoryMethods.setMemory,\n          deleteMemory: memoryMethods.deleteMemory,\n          user,\n        });\n      } catch (error) {\n        logger.error('Memory Agent failed to process memory', error);\n      }\n    },\n  ];\n}\n\nasync function handleMemoryArtifact({\n  res,\n  data,\n  metadata,\n  streamId = null,\n}: {\n  res: ServerResponse;\n  data: ToolEndData;\n  metadata?: ToolEndMetadata;\n  streamId?: string | null;\n}) {\n  const output = data?.output as ToolMessage | undefined;\n  if (!output) {\n    return null;\n  }\n\n  if (!output.artifact) {\n    return null;\n  }\n\n  const memoryArtifact = output.artifact[Tools.memory] as MemoryArtifact | undefined;\n  if (!memoryArtifact) {\n    return null;\n  }\n\n  const attachment: Partial<TAttachment> = {\n    type: Tools.memory,\n    toolCallId: output.tool_call_id,\n    messageId: metadata?.run_id ?? '',\n    conversationId: metadata?.thread_id ?? '',\n    [Tools.memory]: memoryArtifact,\n  };\n  if (!res.headersSent) {\n    return attachment;\n  }\n  if (streamId) {\n    GenerationJobManager.emitChunk(streamId, { event: 'attachment', data: attachment });\n  } else {\n    res.write(`event: attachment\\ndata: ${JSON.stringify(attachment)}\\n\\n`);\n  }\n  return attachment;\n}\n\n/**\n * Creates a memory callback for handling memory artifacts\n * @param params - The parameters object\n * @param params.res - The server response object\n * @param params.artifactPromises - Array to collect artifact promises\n * @param params.streamId - The stream ID for resumable mode, or null for standard mode\n * @returns The memory callback function\n */\nexport function createMemoryCallback({\n  res,\n  artifactPromises,\n  streamId = null,\n}: {\n  res: ServerResponse;\n  artifactPromises: Promise<Partial<TAttachment> | null>[];\n  streamId?: string | null;\n}): ToolEndCallback {\n  return async (data: ToolEndData, metadata?: Record<string, unknown>) => {\n    const output = data?.output as ToolMessage | undefined;\n    const memoryArtifact = output?.artifact?.[Tools.memory] as MemoryArtifact;\n    if (memoryArtifact == null) {\n      return;\n    }\n    artifactPromises.push(\n      handleMemoryArtifact({ res, data, metadata, streamId }).catch((error) => {\n        logger.error('Error processing memory artifact content:', error);\n        return null;\n      }),\n    );\n  };\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { AccessRoleIds, ResourceType, PrincipalType, Constants } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport { ensureRequiredCollectionsExist } from '../db/utils';\nimport type { AccessRoleMethods, IAgent } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { Model, Mongoose } from 'mongoose';\n\nconst { GLOBAL_PROJECT_NAME } = Constants;\n\nexport interface MigrationCheckDbMethods {\n  findRoleByIdentifier: AccessRoleMethods['findRoleByIdentifier'];\n  getProjectByName: (\n    projectName: string,\n    fieldsToSelect?: string[] | null,\n  ) => Promise<{\n    agentIds?: string[];\n    [key: string]: unknown;\n  } | null>;\n}\n\nexport interface MigrationCheckParams {\n  mongoose: Mongoose;\n  methods: MigrationCheckDbMethods;\n  AgentModel: Model<IAgent>;\n}\n\ninterface AgentMigrationData {\n  _id: string;\n  id: string;\n  name: string;\n  author: string;\n  isCollaborative: boolean;\n}\n\nexport interface MigrationCheckResult {\n  totalToMigrate: number;\n  globalEditAccess: number;\n  globalViewAccess: number;\n  privateAgents: number;\n  details?: {\n    globalEditAccess: Array<{ name: string; id: string }>;\n    globalViewAccess: Array<{ name: string; id: string }>;\n    privateAgents: Array<{ name: string; id: string }>;\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Check if agents need to be migrated to the new permission system\n * This performs a dry-run check similar to the migration script\n */\nexport async function checkAgentPermissionsMigration({\n  methods,\n  mongoose,\n  AgentModel,\n}: MigrationCheckParams): Promise<MigrationCheckResult> {\n  logger.debug('Checking if agent permissions migration is needed');\n\n  try {\n    const db = mongoose.connection.db;\n    if (db) {\n      await ensureRequiredCollectionsExist(db);\n    }\n\n    // Verify required roles exist\n    const ownerRole = await methods.findRoleByIdentifier(AccessRoleIds.AGENT_OWNER);\n    const viewerRole = await methods.findRoleByIdentifier(AccessRoleIds.AGENT_VIEWER);\n    const editorRole = await methods.findRoleByIdentifier(AccessRoleIds.AGENT_EDITOR);\n\n    if (!ownerRole || !viewerRole || !editorRole) {\n      logger.warn(\n        'Required agent roles not found. Permission system may not be fully initialized.',\n      );\n      return {\n        totalToMigrate: 0,\n        globalEditAccess: 0,\n        globalViewAccess: 0,\n        privateAgents: 0,\n      };\n    }\n\n    // Get global project agent IDs\n    const globalProject = await methods.getProjectByName(GLOBAL_PROJECT_NAME, ['agentIds']);\n    const globalAgentIds = new Set(globalProject?.agentIds || []);\n\n    // Find agents without ACL entries (no batching for efficiency on startup)\n    const agentsToMigrate: AgentMigrationData[] = await AgentModel.aggregate([\n      {\n        $lookup: {\n          from: 'aclentries',\n          localField: '_id',\n          foreignField: 'resourceId',\n          as: 'aclEntries',\n        },\n      },\n      {\n        $addFields: {\n          userAclEntries: {\n            $filter: {\n              input: '$aclEntries',\n              as: 'aclEntry',\n              cond: {\n                $and: [\n                  { $eq: ['$$aclEntry.resourceType', ResourceType.AGENT] },\n                  { $eq: ['$$aclEntry.principalType', PrincipalType.USER] },\n                ],\n              },\n            },\n          },\n        },\n      },\n      {\n        $match: {\n          author: { $exists: true, $ne: null },\n          userAclEntries: { $size: 0 },\n        },\n      },\n      {\n        $project: {\n          _id: 1,\n          id: 1,\n          name: 1,\n          author: 1,\n          isCollaborative: 1,\n        },\n      },\n    ]);\n\n    const categories: {\n      globalEditAccess: AgentMigrationData[];\n      globalViewAccess: AgentMigrationData[];\n      privateAgents: AgentMigrationData[];\n    } = {\n      globalEditAccess: [],\n      globalViewAccess: [],\n      privateAgents: [],\n    };\n\n    agentsToMigrate.forEach((agent) => {\n      const isGlobal = globalAgentIds.has(agent.id);\n      const isCollab = agent.isCollaborative;\n\n      if (isGlobal && isCollab) {\n        categories.globalEditAccess.push(agent);\n      } else if (isGlobal && !isCollab) {\n        categories.globalViewAccess.push(agent);\n      } else {\n        categories.privateAgents.push(agent);\n      }\n    });\n\n    const result: MigrationCheckResult = {\n      totalToMigrate: agentsToMigrate.length,\n      globalEditAccess: categories.globalEditAccess.length,\n      globalViewAccess: categories.globalViewAccess.length,\n      privateAgents: categories.privateAgents.length,\n    };\n\n    // Add details for debugging\n    if (agentsToMigrate.length > 0) {\n      result.details = {\n        globalEditAccess: categories.globalEditAccess.map((a) => ({\n          name: a.name,\n          id: a.id,\n        })),\n        globalViewAccess: categories.globalViewAccess.map((a) => ({\n          name: a.name,\n          id: a.id,\n        })),\n        privateAgents: categories.privateAgents.map((a) => ({\n          name: a.name,\n          id: a.id,\n        })),\n      };\n    }\n\n    logger.debug('Agent migration check completed', {\n      totalToMigrate: result.totalToMigrate,\n      globalEditAccess: result.globalEditAccess,\n      globalViewAccess: result.globalViewAccess,\n      privateAgents: result.privateAgents,\n    });\n\n    return result;\n  } catch (error) {\n    logger.error('Failed to check agent permissions migration', error);\n    // Return zero counts on error to avoid blocking startup\n    return {\n      totalToMigrate: 0,\n      globalEditAccess: 0,\n      globalViewAccess: 0,\n      privateAgents: 0,\n    };\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Log migration warning to console if agents need migration\n */\nexport function logAgentMigrationWarning(result: MigrationCheckResult): void {\n  if (result.totalToMigrate === 0) {\n    return;\n  }\n\n  // Create a visible warning box\n  const border = '='.repeat(80);\n  const warning = [\n    '',\n    border,\n    '                    IMPORTANT: AGENT PERMISSIONS MIGRATION REQUIRED',\n    border,\n    '',\n    `  Total agents to migrate: ${result.totalToMigrate}`,\n    `  - Global Edit Access: ${result.globalEditAccess} agents`,\n    `  - Global View Access: ${result.globalViewAccess} agents`,\n    `  - Private Agents: ${result.privateAgents} agents`,\n    '',\n    '  The new agent sharing system requires migrating existing agents.',\n    '  Please run the following command to migrate your agents:',\n    '',\n    '    npm run migrate:agent-permissions',\n    '',\n    '  For a dry run (preview) of what will be migrated:',\n    '',\n    '    npm run migrate:agent-permissions:dry-run',\n    '',\n    '  This migration will:',\n    '  1. Grant owner permissions to agent authors',\n    '  2. Set appropriate public permissions based on global project status',\n    '  3. Preserve existing collaborative settings',\n    '',\n    border,\n    '',\n  ];\n\n  // Use console methods directly for visibility\n  console.log('\\n' + warning.join('\\n') + '\\n');\n\n  // Also log with logger for consistency\n  logger.warn('Agent permissions migration required', {\n    totalToMigrate: result.totalToMigrate,\n    globalEditAccess: result.globalEditAccess,\n    globalViewAccess: result.globalViewAccess,\n    privateAgents: result.privateAgents,\n  });\n}\n","/**\n * OpenAI-compatible event handlers for agent streaming.\n *\n * These handlers convert LibreChat's internal graph events into OpenAI-compatible\n * streaming format (SSE with chat.completion.chunk objects).\n */\nimport type { Response as ServerResponse } from 'express';\nimport type {\n  ChatCompletionChunkChoice,\n  OpenAIResponseContext,\n  ChatCompletionChunk,\n  CompletionUsage,\n  ToolCall,\n} from './types';\nimport type { ToolExecuteOptions } from '~/agents/handlers';\nimport { createToolExecuteHandler } from '~/agents/handlers';\n\n/**\n * Create a chat completion chunk in OpenAI format\n */\nexport function createChunk(\n  context: OpenAIResponseContext,\n  delta: ChatCompletionChunkChoice['delta'],\n  finishReason: ChatCompletionChunkChoice['finish_reason'] = null,\n  usage?: CompletionUsage,\n): ChatCompletionChunk {\n  return {\n    id: context.requestId,\n    object: 'chat.completion.chunk',\n    created: context.created,\n    model: context.model,\n    choices: [\n      {\n        index: 0,\n        delta,\n        finish_reason: finishReason,\n      },\n    ],\n    ...(usage && { usage }),\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Write an SSE event to the response\n */\nexport function writeSSE(res: ServerResponse, data: ChatCompletionChunk | string): void {\n  if (typeof data === 'string') {\n    res.write(`data: ${data}\\n\\n`);\n  } else {\n    res.write(`data: ${JSON.stringify(data)}\\n\\n`);\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Lightweight tracker for streaming responses.\n * Only tracks what's needed for finish_reason and usage - doesn't store content.\n */\nexport interface OpenAIStreamTracker {\n  /** Whether any text content was emitted */\n  hasText: boolean;\n  /** Whether any reasoning content was emitted */\n  hasReasoning: boolean;\n  /** Accumulated tool calls by index */\n  toolCalls: Map<number, ToolCall>;\n  /** Accumulated usage metadata */\n  usage: {\n    promptTokens: number;\n    completionTokens: number;\n    reasoningTokens: number;\n  };\n  /** Mark that text was emitted */\n  addText: () => void;\n  /** Mark that reasoning was emitted */\n  addReasoning: () => void;\n}\n\n/**\n * Create a lightweight stream tracker (doesn't store content)\n */\nexport function createOpenAIStreamTracker(): OpenAIStreamTracker {\n  const tracker: OpenAIStreamTracker = {\n    hasText: false,\n    hasReasoning: false,\n    toolCalls: new Map(),\n    usage: {\n      promptTokens: 0,\n      completionTokens: 0,\n      reasoningTokens: 0,\n    },\n    addText: () => {\n      tracker.hasText = true;\n    },\n    addReasoning: () => {\n      tracker.hasReasoning = true;\n    },\n  };\n  return tracker;\n}\n\n/**\n * Content aggregator for non-streaming responses.\n * Accumulates full text content, reasoning, and tool calls.\n * Uses arrays for O(n) text accumulation instead of O(nÂ²) string concatenation.\n */\nexport interface OpenAIContentAggregator {\n  /** Accumulated text chunks */\n  textChunks: string[];\n  /** Accumulated reasoning/thinking chunks */\n  reasoningChunks: string[];\n  /** Accumulated tool calls by index */\n  toolCalls: Map<number, ToolCall>;\n  /** Accumulated usage metadata */\n  usage: {\n    promptTokens: number;\n    completionTokens: number;\n    reasoningTokens: number;\n  };\n  /** Get accumulated text (joins chunks) */\n  getText: () => string;\n  /** Get accumulated reasoning (joins chunks) */\n  getReasoning: () => string;\n  /** Add text chunk */\n  addText: (text: string) => void;\n  /** Add reasoning chunk */\n  addReasoning: (text: string) => void;\n}\n\n/**\n * Create a content aggregator for non-streaming responses\n */\nexport function createOpenAIContentAggregator(): OpenAIContentAggregator {\n  const textChunks: string[] = [];\n  const reasoningChunks: string[] = [];\n\n  return {\n    textChunks,\n    reasoningChunks,\n    toolCalls: new Map(),\n    usage: {\n      promptTokens: 0,\n      completionTokens: 0,\n      reasoningTokens: 0,\n    },\n    getText: () => textChunks.join(''),\n    getReasoning: () => reasoningChunks.join(''),\n    addText: (text: string) => textChunks.push(text),\n    addReasoning: (text: string) => reasoningChunks.push(text),\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Handler configuration for OpenAI streaming\n */\nexport interface OpenAIStreamHandlerConfig {\n  res: ServerResponse;\n  context: OpenAIResponseContext;\n  tracker: OpenAIStreamTracker;\n}\n\n/**\n * Graph event types from @librechat/agents\n */\nexport const GraphEvents = {\n  CHAT_MODEL_END: 'on_chat_model_end',\n  TOOL_END: 'on_tool_end',\n  CHAT_MODEL_STREAM: 'on_chat_model_stream',\n  ON_RUN_STEP: 'on_run_step',\n  ON_RUN_STEP_DELTA: 'on_run_step_delta',\n  ON_RUN_STEP_COMPLETED: 'on_run_step_completed',\n  ON_MESSAGE_DELTA: 'on_message_delta',\n  ON_REASONING_DELTA: 'on_reasoning_delta',\n  ON_TOOL_EXECUTE: 'on_tool_execute',\n} as const;\n\n/**\n * Step types from librechat-data-provider\n */\nexport const StepTypes = {\n  MESSAGE_CREATION: 'message_creation',\n  TOOL_CALLS: 'tool_calls',\n} as const;\n\n/**\n * Event data interfaces\n */\nexport interface MessageDeltaData {\n  id?: string;\n  content?: Array<{ type: string; text?: string }>;\n}\n\nexport interface RunStepDeltaData {\n  id?: string;\n  delta?: {\n    type?: string;\n    tool_calls?: Array<{\n      index?: number;\n      id?: string;\n      type?: string;\n      function?: {\n        name?: string;\n        arguments?: string;\n      };\n    }>;\n  };\n}\n\nexport interface ToolEndData {\n  output?: {\n    name?: string;\n    tool_call_id?: string;\n    content?: string;\n  };\n}\n\nexport interface ModelEndData {\n  output?: {\n    usage_metadata?: {\n      input_tokens?: number;\n      output_tokens?: number;\n      model?: string;\n    };\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Event handler interface\n */\nexport interface EventHandler {\n  handle(\n    event: string,\n    data: unknown,\n    metadata?: Record<string, unknown>,\n    graph?: unknown,\n  ): void | Promise<void>;\n}\n\n/**\n * Handler for message delta events - streams text content\n */\nexport class OpenAIMessageDeltaHandler implements EventHandler {\n  constructor(private config: OpenAIStreamHandlerConfig) {}\n\n  handle(_event: string, data: MessageDeltaData): void {\n    const content = data?.content;\n    if (!content || !Array.isArray(content)) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    for (const part of content) {\n      if (part.type === 'text' && part.text) {\n        this.config.tracker.addText();\n        const chunk = createChunk(this.config.context, { content: part.text });\n        writeSSE(this.config.res, chunk);\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Handler for run step delta events - streams tool calls\n */\nexport class OpenAIRunStepDeltaHandler implements EventHandler {\n  constructor(private config: OpenAIStreamHandlerConfig) {}\n\n  handle(_event: string, data: RunStepDeltaData): void {\n    const delta = data?.delta;\n    if (!delta || delta.type !== StepTypes.TOOL_CALLS) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    const toolCalls = delta.tool_calls;\n    if (!toolCalls || !Array.isArray(toolCalls)) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    for (const tc of toolCalls) {\n      if (tc.index === undefined) {\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      // Initialize tool call in tracker if needed\n      let trackedTc = this.config.tracker.toolCalls.get(tc.index);\n      if (!trackedTc && tc.id) {\n        trackedTc = {\n          id: tc.id,\n          type: 'function',\n          function: {\n            name: '',\n            arguments: '',\n          },\n        };\n        this.config.tracker.toolCalls.set(tc.index, trackedTc);\n      }\n\n      // Build the streaming delta\n      const streamDelta: ChatCompletionChunkChoice['delta'] = {\n        tool_calls: [\n          {\n            index: tc.index,\n            ...(tc.id && { id: tc.id }),\n            ...(tc.type && { type: tc.type as 'function' }),\n            ...(tc.function && {\n              function: {\n                ...(tc.function.name && { name: tc.function.name }),\n                ...(tc.function.arguments && { arguments: tc.function.arguments }),\n              },\n            }),\n          },\n        ],\n      };\n\n      // Update tracked tool call\n      if (trackedTc) {\n        if (tc.function?.name) {\n          trackedTc.function.name += tc.function.name;\n        }\n        if (tc.function?.arguments) {\n          trackedTc.function.arguments += tc.function.arguments;\n        }\n      }\n\n      const chunk = createChunk(this.config.context, streamDelta);\n      writeSSE(this.config.res, chunk);\n    }\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Handler for run step events - sends initial tool call info\n */\nexport class OpenAIRunStepHandler implements EventHandler {\n  constructor(private config: OpenAIStreamHandlerConfig) {}\n\n  handle(_event: string, data: { stepDetails?: { type?: string } }): void {\n    // Run step events are primarily for LibreChat UI, we use deltas for streaming\n    // This handler is a no-op for OpenAI format\n    if (data?.stepDetails?.type === StepTypes.TOOL_CALLS) {\n      // Tool calls will be streamed via delta events\n    }\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Handler for model end events - captures usage\n */\nexport class OpenAIModelEndHandler implements EventHandler {\n  constructor(private config: OpenAIStreamHandlerConfig) {}\n\n  handle(_event: string, data: ModelEndData): void {\n    const usage = data?.output?.usage_metadata;\n    if (!usage) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    this.config.tracker.usage.promptTokens += usage.input_tokens ?? 0;\n    this.config.tracker.usage.completionTokens += usage.output_tokens ?? 0;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Handler for chat model stream events\n */\nexport class OpenAIChatModelStreamHandler implements EventHandler {\n  handle(): void {\n    // Handled by message delta handler\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Handler for tool end events\n */\nexport class OpenAIToolEndHandler implements EventHandler {\n  handle(): void {\n    // Tool results don't need to be streamed in OpenAI format\n    // They're used internally by the agent\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Handler for reasoning delta events.\n * Streams reasoning/thinking content using the `delta.reasoning` field (OpenRouter convention).\n */\nexport class OpenAIReasoningDeltaHandler implements EventHandler {\n  constructor(private config: OpenAIStreamHandlerConfig) {}\n\n  handle(_event: string, data: MessageDeltaData): void {\n    const content = data?.content;\n    if (!content || !Array.isArray(content)) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    for (const part of content) {\n      if (part.type === 'text' && part.text) {\n        // Mark that reasoning was emitted\n        this.config.tracker.addReasoning();\n\n        // Stream as delta.reasoning (OpenRouter convention)\n        const chunk = createChunk(this.config.context, { reasoning: part.text });\n        writeSSE(this.config.res, chunk);\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Create all handlers for OpenAI streaming format\n */\nexport function createOpenAIHandlers(\n  config: OpenAIStreamHandlerConfig,\n  toolExecuteOptions?: ToolExecuteOptions,\n): Record<string, EventHandler> {\n  const handlers: Record<string, EventHandler> = {\n    [GraphEvents.ON_MESSAGE_DELTA]: new OpenAIMessageDeltaHandler(config),\n    [GraphEvents.ON_RUN_STEP_DELTA]: new OpenAIRunStepDeltaHandler(config),\n    [GraphEvents.ON_RUN_STEP]: new OpenAIRunStepHandler(config),\n    [GraphEvents.ON_RUN_STEP_COMPLETED]: new OpenAIRunStepHandler(config),\n    [GraphEvents.CHAT_MODEL_END]: new OpenAIModelEndHandler(config),\n    [GraphEvents.CHAT_MODEL_STREAM]: new OpenAIChatModelStreamHandler(),\n    [GraphEvents.TOOL_END]: new OpenAIToolEndHandler(),\n    [GraphEvents.ON_REASONING_DELTA]: new OpenAIReasoningDeltaHandler(config),\n  };\n\n  if (toolExecuteOptions) {\n    handlers[GraphEvents.ON_TOOL_EXECUTE] = createToolExecuteHandler(toolExecuteOptions);\n  }\n\n  return handlers;\n}\n\n/**\n * Send the final chunk with finish_reason and optional usage\n */\nexport function sendFinalChunk(\n  config: OpenAIStreamHandlerConfig,\n  finishReason: ChatCompletionChunkChoice['finish_reason'] = 'stop',\n): void {\n  const { res, context, tracker } = config;\n\n  // Determine finish reason based on content\n  let reason = finishReason;\n  if (tracker.toolCalls.size > 0 && !tracker.hasText) {\n    reason = 'tool_calls';\n  }\n\n  // Build usage object with reasoning token details (OpenRouter/OpenAI convention)\n  const usage: CompletionUsage = {\n    prompt_tokens: tracker.usage.promptTokens,\n    completion_tokens: tracker.usage.completionTokens,\n    total_tokens: tracker.usage.promptTokens + tracker.usage.completionTokens,\n  };\n\n  // Add reasoning token breakdown if there are reasoning tokens\n  if (tracker.usage.reasoningTokens > 0) {\n    usage.completion_tokens_details = {\n      reasoning_tokens: tracker.usage.reasoningTokens,\n    };\n  }\n\n  const finalChunk = createChunk(context, {}, reason, usage);\n  writeSSE(res, finalChunk);\n\n  // Send [DONE] marker\n  writeSSE(res, '[DONE]');\n}\n","// This alphabet uses `A-Za-z0-9_-` symbols.\n// The order of characters is optimized for better gzip and brotli compression.\n// Same as in non-secure/index.js\nlet urlAlphabet =\n  'useandom-26T198340PX75pxJACKVERYMINDBUSHWOLF_GQZbfghjklqvwyzrict'\n\nexport { urlAlphabet }\n","import crypto from 'crypto'\n\nimport { urlAlphabet } from './url-alphabet/index.js'\n\n// It is best to make fewer, larger requests to the crypto module to\n// avoid system call overhead. So, random numbers are generated in a\n// pool. The pool is a Buffer that is larger than the initial random\n// request size by this multiplier. The pool is enlarged if subsequent\n// requests exceed the maximum buffer size.\nconst POOL_SIZE_MULTIPLIER = 128\nlet pool, poolOffset\n\nlet fillPool = bytes => {\n  if (!pool || pool.length < bytes) {\n    pool = Buffer.allocUnsafe(bytes * POOL_SIZE_MULTIPLIER)\n    crypto.randomFillSync(pool)\n    poolOffset = 0\n  } else if (poolOffset + bytes > pool.length) {\n    crypto.randomFillSync(pool)\n    poolOffset = 0\n  }\n  poolOffset += bytes\n}\n\nlet random = bytes => {\n  // `|=` convert `bytes` to number to prevent `valueOf` abusing and pool pollution\n  fillPool((bytes |= 0))\n  return pool.subarray(poolOffset - bytes, poolOffset)\n}\n\nlet customRandom = (alphabet, defaultSize, getRandom) => {\n  // First, a bitmask is necessary to generate the ID. The bitmask makes bytes\n  // values closer to the alphabet size. The bitmask calculates the closest\n  // `2^31 - 1` number, which exceeds the alphabet size.\n  // For example, the bitmask for the alphabet size 30 is 31 (00011111).\n  let mask = (2 << (31 - Math.clz32((alphabet.length - 1) | 1))) - 1\n  // Though, the bitmask solution is not perfect since the bytes exceeding\n  // the alphabet size are refused. Therefore, to reliably generate the ID,\n  // the random bytes redundancy has to be satisfied.\n\n  // Note: every hardware random generator call is performance expensive,\n  // because the system call for entropy collection takes a lot of time.\n  // So, to avoid additional system calls, extra bytes are requested in advance.\n\n  // Next, a step determines how many random bytes to generate.\n  // The number of random bytes gets decided upon the ID size, mask,\n  // alphabet size, and magic number 1.6 (using 1.6 peaks at performance\n  // according to benchmarks).\n  let step = Math.ceil((1.6 * mask * defaultSize) / alphabet.length)\n\n  return (size = defaultSize) => {\n    let id = ''\n    while (true) {\n      let bytes = getRandom(step)\n      // A compact alternative for `for (let i = 0; i < step; i++)`.\n      let i = step\n      while (i--) {\n        // Adding `|| ''` refuses a random byte that exceeds the alphabet size.\n        id += alphabet[bytes[i] & mask] || ''\n        if (id.length === size) return id\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n\nlet customAlphabet = (alphabet, size = 21) =>\n  customRandom(alphabet, size, random)\n\nlet nanoid = (size = 21) => {\n  // `|=` convert `size` to number to prevent `valueOf` abusing and pool pollution\n  fillPool((size |= 0))\n  let id = ''\n  // We are reading directly from the random pool to avoid creating new array\n  for (let i = poolOffset - size; i < poolOffset; i++) {\n    // It is incorrect to use bytes exceeding the alphabet size.\n    // The following mask reduces the random byte in the 0-255 value\n    // range to the 0-63 value range. Therefore, adding hacks, such\n    // as empty string fallback or magic numbers, is unneccessary because\n    // the bitmask trims bytes down to the alphabet size.\n    id += urlAlphabet[pool[i] & 63]\n  }\n  return id\n}\n\nexport { nanoid, customAlphabet, customRandom, urlAlphabet, random }\n","/**\n * OpenAI-compatible chat completions service for agents.\n *\n * This service provides an OpenAI v1/chat/completions compatible API for\n * interacting with LibreChat agents. The agent_id is passed as the \"model\"\n * parameter per OpenAI spec.\n *\n * Usage:\n * ```typescript\n * import { createAgentChatCompletion } from '@librechat/api';\n *\n * // In your Express route handler:\n * app.post('/v1/chat/completions', async (req, res) => {\n *   await createAgentChatCompletion(req, res, {\n *     getAgent: db.getAgent,\n *     // ... other dependencies\n *   });\n * });\n * ```\n */\nimport { nanoid } from 'nanoid';\nimport type { Response as ServerResponse, Request } from 'express';\nimport type {\n  ChatCompletionResponse,\n  OpenAIResponseContext,\n  ChatCompletionRequest,\n  OpenAIErrorResponse,\n  CompletionUsage,\n  ChatMessage,\n  ToolCall,\n} from './types';\nimport type { OpenAIStreamHandlerConfig, EventHandler } from './handlers';\nimport {\n  createOpenAIContentAggregator,\n  createOpenAIStreamTracker,\n  createOpenAIHandlers,\n  sendFinalChunk,\n  createChunk,\n  writeSSE,\n} from './handlers';\nimport type { ToolExecuteOptions } from '../handlers';\n\n/**\n * Dependencies for the chat completion service\n */\nexport interface ChatCompletionDependencies {\n  /** Get agent by ID */\n  getAgent: (params: { id: string }) => Promise<Agent | null>;\n  /** Initialize agent for use */\n  initializeAgent: (params: InitializeAgentParams) => Promise<InitializedAgent>;\n  /** Load agent tools */\n  loadAgentTools?: LoadToolsFn;\n  /** Get models config */\n  getModelsConfig?: (req: Request) => Promise<unknown>;\n  /** Validate agent model */\n  validateAgentModel?: (\n    params: unknown,\n  ) => Promise<{ isValid: boolean; error?: { message: string } }>;\n  /** Log violation */\n  logViolation?: (\n    req: Request,\n    res: ServerResponse,\n    type: string,\n    info: unknown,\n    score: number,\n  ) => Promise<void>;\n  /** Create agent run */\n  createRun?: CreateRunFn;\n  /** App config */\n  appConfig?: AppConfig;\n  /** Tool execute options for event-driven tool execution */\n  toolExecuteOptions?: ToolExecuteOptions;\n}\n\n/**\n * Agent type from librechat-data-provider\n */\ninterface Agent {\n  id: string;\n  name?: string;\n  model?: string;\n  provider: string;\n  tools?: string[];\n  instructions?: string;\n  model_parameters?: Record<string, unknown>;\n  tool_resources?: Record<string, unknown>;\n  tool_options?: Record<string, unknown>;\n  [key: string]: unknown;\n}\n\n/**\n * Initialized agent type - note: after initialization, tools become structured tool objects\n */\ninterface InitializedAgent {\n  id: string;\n  name?: string;\n  model?: string;\n  provider: string;\n  /** After initialization, tools are structured tool objects, not strings */\n  tools: unknown[];\n  instructions?: string;\n  model_parameters?: Record<string, unknown>;\n  tool_resources?: Record<string, unknown>;\n  tool_options?: Record<string, unknown>;\n  attachments: unknown[];\n  toolContextMap: Record<string, unknown>;\n  maxContextTokens: number;\n  userMCPAuthMap?: Record<string, Record<string, string>>;\n  [key: string]: unknown;\n}\n\n/**\n * Initialize agent params\n */\ninterface InitializeAgentParams {\n  req: Request;\n  res: ServerResponse;\n  agent: Agent;\n  conversationId?: string | null;\n  parentMessageId?: string | null;\n  requestFiles?: unknown[];\n  loadTools?: LoadToolsFn;\n  endpointOption?: Record<string, unknown>;\n  allowedProviders: Set<string>;\n  isInitialAgent?: boolean;\n}\n\n/**\n * Tool loading function type\n */\ntype LoadToolsFn = (params: {\n  req: Request;\n  res: ServerResponse;\n  provider: string;\n  agentId: string;\n  tools: string[];\n  model: string | null;\n  tool_options: unknown;\n  tool_resources: unknown;\n}) => Promise<{\n  tools: unknown[];\n  toolContextMap: Record<string, unknown>;\n  userMCPAuthMap?: Record<string, Record<string, string>>;\n} | null>;\n\n/**\n * Create run function type\n */\ntype CreateRunFn = (params: {\n  agents: unknown[];\n  messages: unknown[];\n  runId: string;\n  signal: AbortSignal;\n  customHandlers: Record<string, EventHandler>;\n  requestBody: Record<string, unknown>;\n  user: Record<string, unknown>;\n  tokenCounter?: (message: unknown) => number;\n}) => Promise<{\n  Graph?: unknown;\n  processStream: (\n    input: { messages: unknown[] },\n    config: Record<string, unknown>,\n    options: Record<string, unknown>,\n  ) => Promise<void>;\n} | null>;\n\n/**\n * App config type\n */\ninterface AppConfig {\n  endpoints?: Record<string, unknown>;\n  [key: string]: unknown;\n}\n\n/**\n *
