file_search: agentFileResourceSchema.optional(),\n    context: agentBaseResourceSchema.optional(),\n    /** @deprecated Use context instead */\n    ocr: agentBaseResourceSchema.optional(),\n  })\n  .optional();\n\n/** Support contact schema for agent */\nexport const agentSupportContactSchema = z\n  .object({\n    name: z.string().optional(),\n    email: z.union([z.literal(''), z.string().email()]).optional(),\n  })\n  .optional();\n\n/** Graph edge schema for agent handoffs */\nexport const graphEdgeSchema = z.object({\n  from: z.union([z.string(), z.array(z.string())]),\n  to: z.union([z.string(), z.array(z.string())]),\n  description: z.string().optional(),\n  edgeType: z.enum(['handoff', 'direct']).optional(),\n  prompt: z.union([z.string(), z.function()]).optional(),\n  excludeResults: z.boolean().optional(),\n  promptKey: z.string().optional(),\n});\n\n/** Per-tool options schema (defer_loading, allowed_callers) */\nexport const toolOptionsSchema = z.object({\n  defer_loading: z.boolean().optional(),\n  allowed_callers: z.array(z.enum(['direct', 'code_execution'])).optional(),\n});\n\n/** Agent tool options - map of tool_id to tool options */\nexport const agentToolOptionsSchema = z.record(z.string(), toolOptionsSchema).optional();\n\n/** Base agent schema with all common fields */\nexport const agentBaseSchema = z.object({\n  name: z.string().nullable().optional(),\n  description: z.string().nullable().optional(),\n  instructions: z.string().nullable().optional(),\n  avatar: agentAvatarSchema.nullable().optional(),\n  model_parameters: z.record(z.unknown()).optional(),\n  tools: z.array(z.string()).optional(),\n  /** @deprecated Use edges instead */\n  agent_ids: z.array(z.string()).optional(),\n  edges: z.array(graphEdgeSchema).optional(),\n  end_after_tools: z.boolean().optional(),\n  hide_sequential_outputs: z.boolean().optional(),\n  artifacts: z.string().optional(),\n  recursion_limit: z.number().optional(),\n  conversation_starters: z.array(z.string()).optional(),\n  tool_resources: agentToolResourcesSchema,\n  tool_options: agentToolOptionsSchema,\n  support_contact: agentSupportContactSchema,\n  category: z.string().optional(),\n});\n\n/** Create schema extends base with required fields for creation */\nexport const agentCreateSchema = agentBaseSchema.extend({\n  provider: z.string(),\n  model: z.string().nullable(),\n  tools: z.array(z.string()).optional().default([]),\n});\n\n/** Update schema extends base with all fields optional and additional update-only fields */\nexport const agentUpdateSchema = agentBaseSchema.extend({\n  avatar: z.union([agentAvatarSchema, z.null()]).optional(),\n  provider: z.string().optional(),\n  model: z.string().nullable().optional(),\n  projectIds: z.array(z.string()).optional(),\n  removeProjectIds: z.array(z.string()).optional(),\n  isCollaborative: z.boolean().optional(),\n});\n\ninterface ValidateAgentModelParams {\n  req: Request;\n  res: Response;\n  agent: Agent;\n  modelsConfig: TModelsConfig;\n  logViolation: (\n    req: Request,\n    res: Response,\n    type: string,\n    errorMessage: Record<string, unknown>,\n    score?: number | string,\n  ) => Promise<void>;\n}\n\ninterface ValidateAgentModelResult {\n  isValid: boolean;\n  error?: {\n    message: string;\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Validates an agent's model against the available models configuration.\n * This is a non-middleware version of validateModel that can be used\n * in service initialization flows.\n *\n * @param params - Validation parameters\n * @returns Object indicating whether the model is valid and any error details\n */\nexport async function validateAgentModel(\n  params: ValidateAgentModelParams,\n): Promise<ValidateAgentModelResult> {\n  const { req, res, agent, modelsConfig, logViolation } = params;\n  const { model, provider: endpoint } = agent;\n\n  if (!model) {\n    return {\n      isValid: false,\n      error: {\n        message: `{ \"type\": \"${ErrorTypes.MISSING_MODEL}\", \"info\": \"${endpoint}\" }`,\n      },\n    };\n  }\n\n  if (!modelsConfig) {\n    return {\n      isValid: false,\n      error: {\n        message: `{ \"type\": \"${ErrorTypes.MODELS_NOT_LOADED}\" }`,\n      },\n    };\n  }\n\n  const availableModels = modelsConfig[endpoint];\n  if (!availableModels) {\n    return {\n      isValid: false,\n      error: {\n        message: `{ \"type\": \"${ErrorTypes.ENDPOINT_MODELS_NOT_LOADED}\", \"info\": \"${endpoint}\" }`,\n      },\n    };\n  }\n\n  const validModel = !!availableModels.find((availableModel) => availableModel === model);\n\n  if (validModel) {\n    return { isValid: true };\n  }\n\n  const { ILLEGAL_MODEL_REQ_SCORE: score = 1 } = process.env ?? {};\n  const type = ViolationTypes.ILLEGAL_MODEL_REQUEST;\n  const errorMessage = {\n    type,\n    model,\n    endpoint,\n  };\n\n  await logViolation(req, res, type, errorMessage, score);\n\n  return {\n    isValid: false,\n    error: {\n      message: `{ \"type\": \"${ViolationTypes.ILLEGAL_MODEL_REQUEST}\", \"info\": \"${endpoint}|${model}\" }`,\n    },\n  };\n}\n","import { AuthType, EToolResources } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { TPlugin } from 'librechat-data-provider';\n\n/**\n * Filters out duplicate plugins from the list of plugins.\n *\n * @param plugins The list of plugins to filter.\n * @returns The list of plugins with duplicates removed.\n */\nexport const filterUniquePlugins = (plugins?: TPlugin[]): TPlugin[] => {\n  const seen = new Set();\n  return (\n    plugins?.filter((plugin) => {\n      const duplicate = seen.has(plugin.pluginKey);\n      seen.add(plugin.pluginKey);\n      return !duplicate;\n    }) || []\n  );\n};\n\n/**\n * Determines if a plugin is authenticated by checking if all required authentication fields have non-empty values.\n * Supports alternate authentication fields, allowing validation against multiple possible environment variables.\n *\n * @param plugin The plugin object containing the authentication configuration.\n * @returns True if the plugin is authenticated for all required fields, false otherwise.\n */\nexport const checkPluginAuth = (plugin?: TPlugin): boolean => {\n  if (!plugin?.authConfig || plugin.authConfig.length === 0) {\n    return false;\n  }\n\n  return plugin.authConfig.every((authFieldObj) => {\n    const authFieldOptions = authFieldObj.authField.split('||');\n    let isFieldAuthenticated = false;\n\n    for (const fieldOption of authFieldOptions) {\n      const envValue = process.env[fieldOption];\n      if (envValue && envValue.trim() !== '' && envValue !== AuthType.USER_PROVIDED) {\n        isFieldAuthenticated = true;\n        break;\n      }\n    }\n\n    return isFieldAuthenticated;\n  });\n};\n\n/**\n * @param toolkits\n * @param toolName\n * @returns toolKey\n */\nexport function getToolkitKey({\n  toolkits,\n  toolName,\n}: {\n  toolkits: TPlugin[];\n  toolName?: string;\n}): string | undefined {\n  let toolkitKey: string | undefined;\n  if (!toolName) {\n    return toolkitKey;\n  }\n  for (const toolkit of toolkits) {\n    if (toolName.startsWith(EToolResources.image_edit)) {\n      const splitMatches = toolkit.pluginKey.split('_');\n      const suffix = splitMatches[splitMatches.length - 1];\n      if (toolName.endsWith(suffix)) {\n        toolkitKey = toolkit.pluginKey;\n        break;\n      }\n    }\n    if (toolName.startsWith(toolkit.pluginKey)) {\n      toolkitKey = toolkit.pluginKey;\n      break;\n    }\n  }\n  return toolkitKey;\n}\n","import {\n  WebSearchToolDefinition,\n  CalculatorToolDefinition,\n  CodeExecutionToolDefinition,\n} from '@librechat/agents';\n\n/** Extended JSON Schema type that includes standard validation keywords */\nexport type ExtendedJsonSchema = {\n  type?: 'string' | 'number' | 'integer' | 'float' | 'boolean' | 'array' | 'object' | 'null';\n  enum?: (string | number | boolean | null)[];\n  items?: ExtendedJsonSchema;\n  properties?: Record<string, ExtendedJsonSchema>;\n  required?: string[];\n  description?: string;\n  additionalProperties?: boolean | ExtendedJsonSchema;\n  minLength?: number;\n  maxLength?: number;\n  minimum?: number;\n  maximum?: number;\n  minItems?: number;\n  maxItems?: number;\n  pattern?: string;\n  format?: string;\n  default?: unknown;\n  const?: unknown;\n  oneOf?: ExtendedJsonSchema[];\n  anyOf?: ExtendedJsonSchema[];\n  allOf?: ExtendedJsonSchema[];\n  $ref?: string;\n  $defs?: Record<string, ExtendedJsonSchema>;\n  definitions?: Record<string, ExtendedJsonSchema>;\n};\n\nexport interface ToolRegistryDefinition {\n  name: string;\n  description: string;\n  schema: ExtendedJsonSchema;\n  description_for_model?: string;\n Must be one of transparent, opaque or auto (default). When transparent, the output format should be png or webp.',\n    },\n    quality: {\n      type: 'string',\n      enum: ['auto', 'high', 'medium', 'low'],\n      description: 'The quality of the image. One of auto (default), high, medium, or low.',\n    },\n    size: {\n      type: 'string',\n      enum: ['auto', '1024x1024', '1536x1024', '1024x1536'],\n      description:\n        'The size of the generated image. One of 1024x1024, 1536x1024 (landscape), 1024x1536 (portrait), or auto (default).',\n    },\n  },\n  required: ['prompt'],\n};\n\n/** OpenAI Image Edit tool JSON schema */\nexport const imageEditOaiSchema: ExtendedJsonSchema = {\n  type: 'object',\n  properties: {\n    image_ids: {\n      type: 'array',\n      items: { type: 'string' },\n      minItems: 1,\n      description: `IDs (image ID strings) of previously generated or uploaded images that should guide the edit.\n\nGuidelines:\n- If the user's request depends on any prior image(s), copy their image IDs into the \\`image_ids\\` array (in the same order the user refers to them).  \n- Never invent or hallucinate IDs; only use IDs that are still visible in the conversation context.\n- If no earlier image is relevant, omit the field entirely.`,\n    },\n    prompt: {\n      type: 'string',\n      maxLength: 32000,\n      description: `Describe the changes, enhancements, or new ideas to apply to the uploaded image(s).\n      Be highly specificâ€”break your request into layers: \n      (1) main concept or transformation,\n      (2) specific edits/replacements or composition guidance,\n      (3) desired style, mood, or technique,\n      (4) features/items to keep, change, or add (such as objects, people, clothing, lighting, etc.).\n      Use positive, descriptive language and clarify what should be included or changed, not what to avoid.\n      Always base this prompt on the most recently uploaded reference images.`,\n    },\n    quality: {\n      type: 'string',\n      enum: ['auto', 'high', 'medium', 'low'],\n      description:\n        'The quality of the image. One of auto (default), high, medium, or low. High/medium/low only supported for gpt-image-1.',\n    },\n    size: {\n      type: 'string',\n      enum: ['auto', '1024x1024', '1536x1024', '1024x1536', '256x256', '512x512'],\n      description:\n        'The size of the generated images. For gpt-image-1: auto (default), 1024x1024, 1536x1024, 1024x1536. For dall-e-2: 256x256, 512x512, 1024x1024.',\n    },\n  },\n  required: ['image_ids', 'prompt'],\n};\n\n/** Gemini Image Generation tool JSON schema */\nexport const geminiImageGenSchema: ExtendedJsonSchema = {\n  type: 'object',\n  properties: {\n    prompt: {\n      type: 'string',\n      maxLength: 32000,\n      description:\n        'A detailed text description of the desired image, up to 32000 characters. For \"editing\" requests, describe the changes you want to make to the referenced image. Be specific about composition, style, lighting, and subject matter.',\n    },\n    image_ids: {\n      type: 'array',\n      items: { type: 'string' },\n      description: `Optional array of image IDs to use as visual context for generation.\n\nGuidelines:\n- For \"editing\" requests: ALWAYS include the image ID being \"edited\"\n- For new generation with context: Include any relevant reference image IDs\n- If the user's request references any prior images, include their image IDs in this array\n- These images will be used as visual context/inspiration for the new generation\n- Never invent or hallucinate IDs; only use IDs that are visible in the conversation\n- If no images are relevant, omit this field entirely`,\n    },\n    aspectRatio: {\n      type: 'string',\n      enum: ['1:1', '2:3', '3:2', '3:4', '4:3', '4:5', '5:4', '9:16', '16:9', '21:9'],\n      description:\n        'The aspect ratio of the generated image. Use 16:9 or 3:2 for landscape, 9:16 or 2:3 for portrait, 21:9 for ultra-wide/cinematic, 1:1 for square. Defaults to 1:1 if not specified.',\n    },\n    imageSize: {\n      type: 'string',\n      enum: ['1K', '2K', '4K'],\n      description:\n        'The resolution of the generated image. Use 1K for standard, 2K for high, 4K for maximum quality. Defaults to 1K if not specified.',\n    },\n  },\n  required: ['prompt'],\n};\n\n/** Tool definitions registry - maps tool names to their definitions */\nexport const toolDefinitions: Record<string, ToolRegistryDefinition> = {\n  google: {\n    name: 'google',\n    description:\n      'A search engine optimized for comprehensive, accurate, and trusted results. ToolRegistryDefinition[] {\n  return [...Object.values(toolDefinitions), ...Object.values(agentToolDefinitions)];\n}\n\nexport function getToolSchema(toolName: string): ExtendedJsonSchema | undefined {\n  return getToolDefinition(toolName)?.schema;\n}\n","import type { ExtendedJsonSchema } from '../registry/definitions';\n\n/** Default description for Gemini image generation tool */\nconst Prompts should be detailed and specific for best results.\n2. One image per function call. Create only 1 image per request.\n3. IMPORTANT: When user asks to \"edit\", \"modify\", \"change\", or \"swap\" elements in an existing image:\n   - ALWAYS include the original image ID in the image_ids array\n   - Describe the desired changes clearly in the prompt\n   - The tool will generate a new image based on the original image context + your prompt\n4. IMPORTANT: For editing requests, use DIRECT editing instructions:\n   - User says \"remove the gun\" â†’ prompt should be \"remove the gun from this image\"\n   - User says \"make it blue\" â†’ prompt should be \"make this image blue\"\n   - User says \"add sunglasses\" â†’ prompt should be \"add sunglasses to this image\"\n   - DO NOT reconstruct or modify the original prompt - use the user's editing instruction directly\n   - ALWAYS include the image being edited in image_ids array\n5. OPTIONAL: Use image_ids to provide context images that will influence the generation:\n   - Include any relevant image IDs from the conversation in the image_ids array\n   - These images will be used as visual context/inspiration for the new generation\n   - For \"editing\" requests, always include the image being \"edited\"\n6. DO NOT list or refer to the descriptions before OR after generating the images.\n7. You may also include previously referenced or generated image IDs.`;\n    }\n  }\n  return toolContext;\n}\n","import type { ExtendedJsonSchema } from '../registry/definitions';\n\n/** Default use \\`image_gen_oai\\`:\n- To create entirely new images from detailed text descriptions that do NOT reference any image files.\n\nWhen NOT to use \\`image_gen_oai\\`:\n- If the user has uploaded any requirements (e.g., \"DSLR photo, 85mm lens, golden hour\").\n      Do not reference any uploaded imagesâ€”use for new image creation from text only.` as const;\n\nconst getImageGenPromptDescription = Cite sources properly, tailor tone to query type, and provide comprehensive details.\n\n**CITATION FORMAT - UNICODE ESCAPE SEQUENCES ONLY:**\nUse these EXACT escape sequences (copy verbatim): \\\\ue202 (before each anchor), \\\\ue200 (group start), \\\\ue201 (group end), \\\\ue203 (highlight start), \\\\ue204 (highlight end)\n\nAnchor pattern: \\\\ue202turn{N}{type}{index} where N=turn number, type=search|news|image|ref, index=0,1,2...\n\n**Examples (copy these exactly):**\n- Single: \"Statement.\\\\ue202turn0search0\"\n- Multiple: \"Statement.\\\\ue202turn0search0\\\\ue202turn0news1\"\n- Group: \"Statement. \\\\ue200\\\\ue202turn0search0\\\\ue202turn0news1\\\\ue201\"\n- Highlight: \"\\\\ue203Cited text.\\\\ue204\\\\ue202turn0search0\"\n- Image: \"See photo\\\\ue202turn0image0.\"\n\n**CRITICAL:** Output escape sequences EXACTLY as shown. Do NOT substitute with â€  or other symbols. Place anchors AFTER punctuation. Cite every non-obvious fact/quote. NEVER use markdown links, [1], footnotes, or HTML tags.`.trim();\n}\n","/**\n * @fileoverview Utility functions for building tool registries from agent tool_options.\n * Tool classification (deferred_tools, allowed_callers) is configured via the agent UI.\n *\n * @module packages/api/src/tools/classification\n */\n\nimport { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { Constants } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport {\n  EnvVar,\n  createToolSearch,\n  ToolSearchToolDefinition,\n  createProgrammaticToolCallingTool,\n  ProgrammaticToolCallingDefinition,\n} from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type { AgentToolOptions } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type {\n  LCToolRegistry,\n  JsonSchemaType,\n  AllowedCaller,\n  GenericTool,\n  LCTool,\n} from '@librechat/agents';\n\nexport type { LCTool, LCToolRegistry, AllowedCaller, JsonSchemaType };\n\nexport interface ToolDefinition {\n  name: string;\n  description?: string;\n  parameters?: JsonSchemaType;\n  /** MCP server name extracted from tool name */\n  serverName?: string;\n}\n\n/**\n * Extracts the MCP server name from a tool name.\n * Tool names follow the pattern: toolName_mcp_ServerName\n * @param toolName - The full tool name\n * @returns The server name or undefined if not an MCP tool\n */\nexport function getServerNameFromTool(toolName: string): string | undefined {\n  const parts = toolName.split(Constants.mcp_delimiter);\n  if (parts.length >= 2) {\n    return parts[parts.length - 1];\n  }\n  return undefined;\n}\n\n/**\n * Builds a tool registry from agent-level tool_options.\n *\n * @param tools - Array of tool definitions\n * @param agentToolOptions - Per-tool configuration from the agent\n * @returns Map of tool name to tool definition with classification\n */\nexport function buildToolRegistryFromAgentOptions(\n  tools: ToolDefinition[],\n  agentToolOptions: AgentToolOptions,\n): LCToolRegistry {\n  const registry: LCToolRegistry = new Map();\n\n  for (const tool of tools) {\n    const { name, description, parameters } = tool;\n    const agentOptions = agentToolOptions[name];\n\n    const allowed_callers: AllowedCaller[] =\n      agentOptions?.allowed_callers && agentOptions.allowed_callers.length > 0\n        ? agentOptions.allowed_callers\n        : ['direct'];\n\n    const defer_loading = agentOptions?.defer_loading === true;\n\n    const toolDef: LCTool = {\n      name,\n      allowed_callers,\n      defer_loading,\n      toolType: 'mcp',\n    };\n\n    if (description) {\n      toolDef.description = description;\n    }\n    if (parameters) {\n      toolDef.parameters = parameters;\n    }\n    if (tool.serverName) {\n      toolDef.serverName = tool.serverName;\n    }\n\n    registry.set(name, toolDef);\n  }\n\n  return registry;\n}\n\ninterface MCPToolInstance {\n  name: string;\n  description?: string;\n  mcp?: boolean;\n  /** Original JSON schema attached at MCP tool creation time */\n  mcpJsonSchema?: JsonSchemaType;\n}\n\n/**\n * Extracts MCP tool definition from a loaded tool instance.\n * MCP tools have the original JSON schema attached as `mcpJsonSchema` property.\n *\n * @param tool - The loaded tool instance\n * @returns Tool definition\n */\nexport function extractMCPToolDefinition(tool: MCPToolInstance): ToolDefinition {\n  const def: ToolDefinition = { name: tool.name };\n\n  if (tool.description) {\n    def.description = tool.description;\n  }\n\n  if (tool.mcpJsonSchema) {\n    def.parameters = tool.mcpJsonSchema;\n  }\n\n  const serverName = getServerNameFromTool(tool.name);\n  if (serverName) {\n    def.serverName = serverName;\n  }\n\n  return def;\n}\n\n/**\n * Checks if a tool is an MCP tool based on its properties.\n * @param tool - The tool to check (can be any object with potential mcp property)\n * @returns Whether the tool is an MCP tool\n */\nexport function isMCPTool(tool: unknown): tool is MCPToolInstance {\n  return typeof tool === 'object' && tool !== null && (tool as MCPToolInstance).mcp === true;\n}\n\n/**\n * Cleans up the temporary mcpJsonSchema property from MCP tools after registry is populated.\n * This property is only needed during registry building and can be safely removed afterward.\n *\n * @param tools - Array of tools to clean up\n */\nexport function cleanupMCPToolSchemas(tools: MCPToolInstance[]): void {\n  for (const tool of tools) {\n    if (tool.mcpJsonSchema !== undefined) {\n      delete tool.mcpJsonSchema;\n    }\n  }\n}\n\n/** Builds tool registry from MCP tool definitions. */\nfunction buildToolRegistry(\n  mcpToolDefs: ToolDefinition[],\n  agentToolOptions?: AgentToolOptions,\n): LCToolRegistry {\n  if (agentToolOptions && Object.keys(agentToolOptions).length > 0) {\n    return buildToolRegistryFromAgentOptions(mcpToolDefs, agentToolOptions);\n  }\n\n  /** No agent options - build basic definitions for event-driven mode */\n  const registry: LCToolRegistry = new Map<string, LCTool>();\n  for (const toolDef of mcpToolDefs) {\n    registry.set(toolDef.name, {\n      name: toolDef.name,\n      description: toolDef.description,\n      parameters: toolDef.parameters,\n      serverName: toolDef.serverName,\n      toolType: 'mcp',\n    });\n  }\n  return registry;\n}\n\n/** Parameters for building tool classification and creating PTC/tool search tools */\nexport interface BuildToolClassificationParams {\n  /** All loaded tools (will be filtered for MCP tools) */\n  loadedTools: GenericTool[];\n  /** User ID for auth lookup */\n  userId: string;\n  /** Agent ID (used for logging and context) */\n  agentId?: string;\n  /** Per-tool configuration from the agent */\n  agentToolOptions?: AgentToolOptions;\n  /** Whether the deferred_tools capability is enabled (from agent config) */\n  deferredToolsEnabled?: boolean;\n  /** When true, skip creating tool instances (for event-driven mode) */\n  definitionsOnly?: boolean;\n  /** Function to load auth values (dependency injection) */\n  loadAuthValues: (params: {\n    userId: string;\n    authFields: string[];\n  }) => Promise<Record<string, string>>;\n}\n\n/** Result from building tool classification */\nexport interface BuildToolClassificationResult {\n  /** Tool registry built from MCP tools (undefined if no MCP tools) */\n  toolRegistry?: LCToolRegistry;\n  /** Tool definitions array for event-driven execution (built simultaneously with registry) */\n  toolDefinitions: LCTool[];\n  /** Additional tools created (PTC and/or tool search) */\n  additionalTools: GenericTool[];\n  /** Whether any tools have defer_loading enabled (precomputed for efficiency) */\n  hasDeferredTools: boolean;\n}\n\n/**\n * Checks if an agent's tools have any that match PTC patterns (programmatic only or dual context).\n * @param toolRegistry - The tool registry to check\n * @returns Whether any tools are configured for programmatic calling\n */\nexport function agentHasProgrammaticTools(toolRegistry: LCToolRegistry): boolean {\n  for (const toolDef of toolRegistry.values()) {\n    if (toolDef.allowed_callers?.includes('code_execution')) {\n      return true;\n    }\n  }\n  return false;\n}\n\n/**\n * Checks if an agent's tools have any that are deferred.\n * @param toolRegistry - The tool registry to check\n * @returns Whether any tools are configured as deferred\n */\nexport function agentHasDeferredTools(toolRegistry: LCToolRegistry): boolean {\n  for (const toolDef of toolRegistry.values()) {\n    if (toolDef.defer_loading === true) {\n      return true;\n    }\n  }\n  return false;\n}\n\n/**\n * Builds the tool registry from MCP tools and conditionally creates PTC and tool search tools.\n *\n * This function:\n * 1. Filters loaded tools for MCP tools\n * 2. Extracts tool definitions and builds the registry from agent's tool_options\n * 3. Cleans up temporary mcpJsonSchema properties\n * 4. Creates PTC tool only if agent has tools configured for programmatic calling\n * 5. Creates tool search tool only if agent has deferred tools\n *\n * @param params - Parameters including loaded tools, userId, agentId, agentToolOptions, and dependencies\n * @returns Tool registry and any additional tools created\n */\nexport async function buildToolClassification(\n  params: BuildToolClassificationParams,\n): Promise<BuildToolClassificationResult> {\n  const {\n    userId,\n    agentId,\n    loadedTools,\n    agentToolOptions,\n    definitionsOnly = false,\n    deferredToolsEnabled = true,\n    loadAuthValues,\n  } = params;\n  const additionalTools: GenericTool[] = [];\n\n  const mcpTools = loadedTools.filter(isMCPTool);\n  if (mcpTools.length === 0) {\n    return {\n      additionalTools,\n      toolDefinitions: [],\n      toolRegistry: undefined,\n      hasDeferredTools: false,\n    };\n  }\n\n  const mcpToolDefs = mcpTools.map(extractMCPToolDefinition);\n  const toolRegistry: LCToolRegistry = buildToolRegistry(mcpToolDefs, agentToolOptions);\n\n  /** Clean up temporary mcpJsonSchema property from tools now that registry is populated */\n  cleanupMCPToolSchemas(mcpTools);\n\n  /**\n   * Check if this agent actually has tools configured for these features.\n   * Only enable PTC if the agent has programmatic tools.\n   * Only enable tool search if the agent has deferred tools AND the capability is enabled.\n   */\n  const hasProgrammaticTools = agentHasProgrammaticTools(toolRegistry);\n  const hasDeferredTools = deferredToolsEnabled && agentHasDeferredTools(toolRegistry);\n\n  /** Clear defer_loading if capability disabled */\n  if (!deferredToolsEnabled) {\n    for (const toolDef of toolRegistry.values()) {\n      if (toolDef.defer_loading !== true) {\n        continue;\n      }\n      toolDef.defer_loading = false;\n    }\n  }\n\n  /** Build toolDefinitions array from registry (single pass, reused) */\n  const toolDefinitions: LCTool[] = Array.from(toolRegistry.values());\n\n  /** No programmatic or deferred tools - skip PTC/ToolSearch */\n  if (!hasProgrammaticTools && !hasDeferredTools) {\n    logger.debug(\n      `[buildToolClassification] Agent ${agentId} has no programmatic or deferred tools, skipping PTC/ToolSearch`,\n    );\n    return { toolRegistry, toolDefinitions, additionalTools, hasDeferredTools: false };\n  }\n\n  /** Tool search uses local mode (no API key needed) */\n  if (hasDeferredTools) {\n    if (!definitionsOnly) {\n      const toolSearchTool = createToolSearch({\n        mode: 'local',\n        toolRegistry,\n      });\n      additionalTools.push(toolSearchTool);\n    }\n\n    /** Add ToolSearch definition for event-driven mode */\n    toolDefinitions.push({\n      name: ToolSearchToolDefinition.name,\n      description: ToolSearchToolDefinition.description,\n      parameters: ToolSearchToolDefinition.schema as unknown as LCTool['parameters'],\n    });\n    toolRegistry.set(ToolSearchToolDefinition.name, {\n      name: ToolSearchToolDefinition.name,\n      allowed_callers: ['direct'],\n    });\n\n    logger.debug(`[buildToolClassification] Tool Search enabled for agent ${agentId}`);\n  }\n\n  /** PTC requires CODE_API_KEY for sandbox execution */\n  if (!hasProgrammaticTools) {\n    return { toolRegistry, toolDefinitions, additionalTools, hasDeferredTools };\n  }\n\n  /** In definitions-only mode, add PTC definition without creating the tool instance */\n  if (definitionsOnly) {\n    toolDefinitions.push({\n      name: ProgrammaticToolCallingDefinition.name,\n      description: ProgrammaticToolCallingDefinition.description,\n      parameters: ProgrammaticToolCallingDefinition.schema as unknown as LCTool['parameters'],\n    });\n    toolRegistry.set(ProgrammaticToolCallingDefinition.name, {\n      name: ProgrammaticToolCallingDefinition.name,\n      allowed_callers: ['direct'],\n    });\n    logger.debug(\n      `[buildToolClassification] PTC definition added for agent ${agentId} (definitions only)`,\n    );\n    return { toolRegistry, toolDefinitions, additionalTools, hasDeferredTools };\n  }\n\n  try {\n    const authValues = await loadAuthValues({\n      userId,\n      authFields: [EnvVar.CODE_API_KEY],\n    });\n    const codeApiKey = authValues[EnvVar.CODE_API_KEY];\n\n    if (!codeApiKey) {\n      logger.warn('[buildToolClassification] PTC configured but CODE_API_KEY not available');\n      return { toolRegistry, toolDefinitions, additionalTools, hasDeferredTools };\n    }\n\n    const ptcTool = createProgrammaticToolCallingTool({ apiKey: codeApiKey });\n    additionalTools.push(ptcTool);\n\n    /** Add PTC definition for event-driven mode */\n    toolDefinitions.push({\n      name: ProgrammaticToolCallingDefinition.name,\n      description: ProgrammaticToolCallingDefinition.description,\n      parameters: ProgrammaticToolCallingDefinition.schema as unknown as LCTool['parameters'],\n    });\n    toolRegistry.set(ProgrammaticToolCallingDefinition.name, {\n      name: ProgrammaticToolCallingDefinition.name,\n      allowed_callers: ['direct'],\n    });\n\n    logger.debug(`[buildToolClassification] PTC tool enabled for agent ${agentId}`);\n  } catch (error) {\n    logger.error('[buildToolClassification] Error creating PTC tool:', error);\n  }\n\n  return { toolRegistry, toolDefinitions, additionalTools, hasDeferredTools };\n}\n","/**\n * @fileoverview Tool definitions loader for event-driven mode.\n * Loads tool definitions without creating tool instances for efficient initialization.\n *\n * @module packages/api/src/tools/definitions\n */\n\nimport { Constants, actionDelimiter } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { AgentToolOptions } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { LCToolRegistry, JsonSchemaType, LCTool, GenericTool } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type { ToolDefinition } from './classification';\nimport { resolveJsonSchemaRefs, normalizeJsonSchema } from '~/mcp/zod';\nimport { buildToolClassification } from './classification';\nimport { getToolDefinition } from './registry/definitions';\n\nexport interface MCPServerTool {\n  function?: {\n    name?: string;\n    description?: string;\n    parameters?: JsonSchemaType;\n  };\n}\n\nexport type MCPServerTools = Record<string, MCPServerTool>;\n\nexport interface LoadToolDefinitionsParams {\n  /** User ID for MCP server tool lookup */\n  userId: string;\n  /** Agent ID for tool classification */\n  agentId: string;\n  /** Agent's tool list (tool names/identifiers) */\n  tools: string[];\n  /** Agent-specific tool options */\n  toolOptions?: AgentToolOptions;\n  /** Whether deferred tools feature is enabled */\n  deferredToolsEnabled?: boolean;\n}\n\nexport interface ActionToolDefinition {\n  name: string;\n  description?: string;\n  parameters?: JsonSchemaType;\n}\n\nexport interface LoadToolDefinitionsDeps {\n  /** Gets MCP server tools - first checks cache, then initializes server if needed */\n  getOrFetchMCPServerTools: (userId: string, serverName: string) => Promise<MCPServerTools | null>;\n  /** Checks if a tool name is a known built-in tool */\n  isBuiltInTool: (toolName: string) => boolean;\n  /** Loads auth values for tool search (passed to buildToolClassification) */\n  loadAuthValues: (params: {\n    userId: string;\n    authFields: string[];\n  }) => Promise<Record<string, string>>;\n  /** Loads action tool definitions (schemas) from OpenAPI specs */\n  getActionToolDefinitions?: (\n    agentId: string,\n    actionToolNames: string[],\n  ) => Promise<ActionToolDefinition[]>;\n}\n\nexport interface LoadToolDefinitionsResult {\n  toolDefinitions: (ToolDefinition | LCTool)[];\n  toolRegistry: LCToolRegistry;\n  hasDeferredTools: boolean;\n}\n\nconst mcpToolPattern = /_mcp_/;\n\n/**\n * Loads tool definitions without creating tool instances.\n * This is the efficient path for event-driven mode where tools are loaded on-demand.\n */\nexport async function loadToolDefinitions(\n  params: LoadToolDefinitionsParams,\n  deps: LoadToolDefinitionsDeps,\n): Promise<LoadToolDefinitionsResult> {\n  const { userId, agentId, tools, toolOptions = {}, deferredToolsEnabled = false } = params;\n  const { getOrFetchMCPServerTools, isBuiltInTool, loadAuthValues, getActionToolDefinitions } =\n    deps;\n\n  const emptyResult: LoadToolDefinitionsResult = {\n    toolDefinitions: [],\n    toolRegistry: new Map(),\n    hasDeferredTools: false,\n  };\n\n  if (!tools || tools.length === 0) {\n    return emptyResult;\n  }\n\n  const mcpServerToolsCache = new Map<string, MCPServerTools>();\n  const mcpToolDefs: ToolDefinition[] = [];\n  const builtInToolDefs: ToolDefinition[] = [];\n  let actionToolDefs: ToolDefinition[] = [];\n  const actionToolNames: string[] = [];\n\n  const mcpAllPattern = `${Constants.mcp_all}${Constants.mcp_delimiter}`;\n\n  for (const toolName of tools) {\n    if (toolName.includes(actionDelimiter)) {\n      actionToolNames.push(toolName);\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    if (!mcpToolPattern.test(toolName)) {\n      if (!isBuiltInTool(toolName)) {\n        continue;\n      }\n      const registryDef = getToolDefinition(toolName);\n      if (!registryDef) {\n        continue;\n      }\n      builtInToolDefs.push({\n        name: toolName,\n        description: registryDef.description,\n        parameters: registryDef.schema as JsonSchemaType | undefined,\n      });\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    const parts = toolName.split(Constants.mcp_delimiter);\n    const serverName = parts[parts.length - 1];\n\n    if (!mcpServerToolsCache.has(serverName)) {\n      const serverTools = await getOrFetchMCPServerTools(userId, serverName);\n      mcpServerToolsCache.set(serverName, serverTools || {});\n    }\n\n    const serverTools = mcpServerToolsCache.get(serverName);\n    if (!serverTools) {\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    if (toolName.startsWith(mcpAllPattern)) {\n      for (const [actualToolName, toolDef] of Object.entries(serverTools)) {\n        if (toolDef?.function) {\n          mcpToolDefs.push({\n            name: actualToolName,\n            description: toolDef.function.description,\n            parameters: toolDef.function.parameters\n              ? normalizeJsonSchema(resolveJsonSchemaRefs(toolDef.function.parameters))\n              : undefined,\n            serverName,\n          });\n        }\n      }\n      continue;\n    }\n\n    const toolDef = serverTools[toolName];\n    if (toolDef?.function) {\n      mcpToolDefs.push({\n        name: toolName,\n        description: toolDef.function.description,\n        parameters: toolDef.function.parameters\n          ? normalizeJsonSchema(resolveJsonSchemaRefs(toolDef.function.parameters))\n          : undefined,\n        serverName,\n      });\n    }\n  }\n\n  if (actionToolNames.length > 0 && getActionToolDefinitions) {\n    const fetchedActionDefs = await getActionToolDefinitions(agentId, actionToolNames);\n    actionToolDefs = fetchedActionDefs.map((def) => ({\n      name: def.name,\n      description: def.description,\n      parameters: def.parameters,\n    }));\n  }\n\n  const loadedTools = mcpToolDefs.map((def) => ({\n    name: def.name,\n    description: def.description,\n    mcp: true as const,\n    mcpJsonSchema: def.parameters,\n  })) as unknown as GenericTool[];\n\n  const classificationResult = await buildToolClassification({\n    userId,\n    agentId,\n    loadedTools,\n    loadAuthValues,\n    deferredToolsEnabled,\n    definitionsOnly: true,\n    agentToolOptions: toolOptions,\n  });\n\n  const { toolDefinitions, hasDeferredTools } = classificationResult;\n  const toolRegistry: LCToolRegistry = classificationResult.toolRegistry ?? new Map();\n\n  for (const actionDef of actionToolDefs) {\n    if (!toolRegistry.has(actionDef.name)) {\n      toolRegistry.set(actionDef.name, {\n        name: actionDef.name,\n        description: actionDef.description,\n        parameters: actionDef.parameters,\n        allowed_callers: ['direct'],\n      });\n    }\n  }\n\n  for (const builtInDef of builtInToolDefs) {\n    if (!toolRegistry.has(builtInDef.name)) {\n      toolRegistry.set(builtInDef.name, {\n        name: builtInDef.name,\n        description: builtInDef.description,\n        parameters: builtInDef.parameters,\n        allowed_callers: ['direct'],\n      });\n    }\n  }\n\n  const allDefinitions: (ToolDefinition | LCTool)[] = [\n    ...toolDefinitions,\n    ...actionToolDefs.filter((d) => !toolDefinitions.some((td) => td.name === d.name)),\n    ...builtInToolDefs.filter((d) => !toolDefinitions.some((td) => td.name === d.name)),\n  ];\n\n  return {\n    toolDefinitions: allDefinitions,\n    toolRegistry,\n    hasDeferredTools,\n  };\n}\n","import {\n  AuthType,\n  SafeSearchTypes,\n  SearchCategories,\n  extractVariableName,\n} from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport { webSearchAuth } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type {\n  RerankerTypes,\n  TCustomConfig,\n  SearchProviders,\n  ScraperProviders,\n  TWebSearchConfig,\n} from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { TWebSearchKeys, TWebSearchCategories } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\n\nexport function extractWebSearchEnvVars({\n  keys,\n  config,\n}: {\n  keys: TWebSearchKeys[];\n  config: TCustomConfig['webSearch'] | undefined;\n}): string[] {\n  if (!config) {\n    return [];\n  }\n\n  const authFields: string[] = [];\n  const relevantKeys = keys.filter((k) => k in config);\n\n  for (const key of relevantKeys) {\n    const value = config[key];\n    if (typeof value === 'string') {\n      const varName = extractVariableName(value);\n      if (varName) {\n        authFields.push(varName);\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  return authFields;\n}\n\n/**\n * Type for web search authentication result\n */\nexport interface WebSearchAuthResult {\n  /** Whether all required categories have at least one authenticated service */\n  authenticated: boolean;\n  /** Authentication type (user_provided or system_defined) by category */\n  authTypes: [TWebSearchCategories, AuthType][];\n  /** Original authentication values mapped to their respective keys */\n  authResult: Partial<TWebSearchConfig>;\n}\n\n/**\n * Loads and verifies web search authentication values\n * @param params - Authentication parameters\n * @returns Authentication result\n */\nexport async function loadWebSearchAuth({\n  userId,\n  webSearchConfig,\n  loadAuthValues,\n  throwError = true,\n}: {\n  userId: string;\n  webSearchConfig: TCustomConfig['webSearch'];\n  loadAuthValues: (params: {\n    userId: string;\n    authFields: string[];\n    optional?: Set<string>;\n    throwError?: boolean;\n  }) => Promise<Record<string, string>>;\n  throwError?: boolean;\n}): Promise<WebSearchAuthResult> {\n  let authenticated = true;\n  const authResult: Partial<TWebSearchConfig> = {};\n\n  /** Type-safe iterator for the category-service combinations */\n  async function checkAuth<C extends TWebSearchCategories>(\n    category: C,\n  ): Promise<[boolean, boolean]> {\n    type ServiceType = keyof (typeof webSearchAuth)[C];\n    let isUserProvided = false;\n\n    // Check if a specific service is specified in the config\n    let specificService: ServiceType | undefined;\n    if (category === SearchCategories.PROVIDERS && webSearchConfig?.searchProvider) {\n      specificService = webSearchConfig.searchProvider as unknown as ServiceType;\n    } else if (category === SearchCategories.SCRAPERS && webSearchConfig?.scraperProvider) {\n      specificService = webSearchConfig.scraperProvider as unknown as ServiceType;\n    } else if (category === SearchCategories.RERANKERS && webSearchConfig?.rerankerType) {\n      specificService = webSearchConfig.rerankerType as unknown as ServiceType;\n    }\n\n    // If a specific service is specified, only check that one\n    const services = specificService\n      ? [specificService]\n      : (Object.keys(webSearchAuth[category]) as ServiceType[]);\n\n    for (const service of services) {\n      // Skip if the service doesn't exist in the webSearchAuth config\n      if (!webSearchAuth[category][service]) {\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      const serviceConfig = webSearchAuth[category][service];\n\n      // Split keys into required and optional\n      const requiredKeys: TWebSearchKeys[] = [];\n      const optionalKeys: TWebSearchKeys[] = [];\n\n      for (const key in serviceConfig) {\n        const typedKey = key as TWebSearchKeys;\n        if (serviceConfig[typedKey as keyof typeof serviceConfig] === 1) {\n          requiredKeys.push(typedKey);\n        } else if (serviceConfig[typedKey as keyof typeof serviceConfig] === 0) {\n          optionalKeys.push(typedKey);\n        }\n      }\n\n      if (requiredKeys.length === 0) continue;\n\n      const requiredAuthFields = extractWebSearchEnvVars({\n        keys: requiredKeys,\n        config: webSearchConfig,\n      });\n      const optionalAuthFields = extractWebSearchEnvVars({\n        keys: optionalKeys,\n        config: webSearchConfig,\n      });\n      if (requiredAuthFields.length !== requiredKeys.length) continue;\n\n      const allKeys = [...requiredKeys, ...optionalKeys];\n      const allAuthFields = [...requiredAuthFields, ...optionalAuthFields];\n      const optionalSet = new Set(optionalAuthFields);\n\n      try {\n        const authValues = await loadAuthValues({\n          userId,\n          authFields: allAuthFields,\n          optional: optionalSet,\n          throwError,\n        });\n\n        let allFieldsAuthenticated = true;\n        for (let j = 0; j < allAuthFields.length; j++) {\n          const field = allAuthFields[j];\n          const value = authValues[field];\n          const originalKey = allKeys[j];\n          if (originalKey) authResult[originalKey] = value;\n          if (!optionalSet.has(field) && !value) {\n            allFieldsAuthenticated = false;\n            break;\n          }\n          if (!isUserProvided && process.env[field] !== value) {\n            isUserProvided = true;\n          }\n        }\n\n        if (!allFieldsAuthenticated) {\n          continue;\n        }\n        if (category === SearchCategories.PROVIDERS) {\n          authResult.searchProvider = service as SearchProviders;\n        } else if (category === SearchCategories.SCRAPERS) {\n          authResult.scraperProvider = service as ScraperProviders;\n        } else if (category === SearchCategories.RERANKERS) {\n          authResult.rerankerType = service as RerankerTypes;\n        }\n        return [true, isUserProvided];\n      } catch {\n        continue;\n      }\n    }\n    return [false, isUserProvided];\n  }\n\n  const categories = [\n    SearchCategories.PROVIDERS,\n    SearchCategories.SCRAPERS,\n    SearchCategories.RERANKERS,\n  ] as const;\n  const authTypes: [TWebSearchCategories, AuthType][] = [];\n  for (const category of categories) {\n    const [isCategoryAuthenticated, isUserProvided] = await checkAuth(category);\n    if (!isCategoryAuthenticated) {\n      authenticated = false;\n      authTypes.push([category, AuthType.USER_PROVIDED]);\n      continue;\n    }\n    authTypes.push([category, isUserProvided ? AuthType.USER_PROVIDED : AuthType.SYSTEM_DEFINED]);\n  }\n\n  authResult.safeSearch = webSearchConfig?.safeSearch ?? SafeSearchTypes.MODERATE;\n  authResult.scraperTimeout =\n    webSearchConfig?.scraperTimeout ?? webSearchConfig?.firecrawlOptions?.timeout ?? 7500;\n  authResult.firecrawlOptions = webSearchConfig?.firecrawlOptions;\n\n  return {\n    authTypes,\n    authResult,\n    authenticated,\n  };\n}\n","import { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport { createContentAggregator } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type { StandardGraph } from '@librechat/agents';\nimport type { Agents } from 'librechat-data-provider';\nimport type { Redis, Cluster } from 'ioredis';\nimport type {\n  SerializableJobData,\n  UsageMetadata,\n  IJobStore,\n  JobStatus,\n} from '~/stream/interfaces/IJobStore';\n\n/**\n * Key prefixes for Redis storage.\n * All keys include the streamId for easy cleanup.\n * Note: streamId === conversationId, so no separate mapping needed.\n *\n * IMPORTANT: Uses hash tags {streamId} for Redis Cluster compatibility.\n * All keys for the same stream hash to the same slot, enabling:\n * - Pipeline operations across related keys\n * - Atomic multi-key operations\n */\nconst KEYS = {\n  /** Job metadata: stream:{streamId}:job */\n  job: (streamId: string) => `stream:{${streamId}}:job`,\n  /** Chunk stream (Redis Streams): stream:{streamId}:chunks */\n  chunks: (streamId: string) => `stream:{${streamId}}:chunks`,\n  /** Run steps: stream:{streamId}:runsteps */\n  runSteps: (streamId: string) => `stream:{${streamId}}:runsteps`,\n  /** Running jobs set for cleanup (global set - single slot) */\n  runningJobs: 'stream:running',\n  /** User's active jobs set: stream:user:{userId}:jobs */\n  userJobs: (userId: string) => `stream:user:{${userId}}:jobs`,\n};\n\n/**\n * Default TTL values in seconds.\n * Can be overridden via constructor options.\n */\nconst DEFAULT_TTL = {\n  /** TTL for completed jobs (5 minutes) */\n  completed: 300,\n  /** TTL for running jobs/chunks (20 minutes - failsafe for crashed jobs) */\n  running: 1200,\n  /** TTL for chunks after completion (0 = delete immediately) */\n  chunksAfterComplete: 0,\n  /** TTL for run steps after completion (0 = delete immediately) */\n  runStepsAfterComplete: 0,\n};\n\n/**\n * Redis implementation of IJobStore.\n * Enables horizontal scaling with multi-instance deployments.\n *\n * Storage strategy:\n * - Job metadata: Redis Hash (fast field access)\n * - Chunks: Redis Streams (append-only, efficient for streaming)\n * - Run steps: Redis String (JSON serialized)\n *\n * Note: streamId === conversationId, so getJob(conversationId) works directly.\n *\n * @example\n * ```ts\n * import { ioredisClient } from '~/cache';\n * const store = new RedisJobStore(ioredisClient);\n * await store.initialize();\n * ```\n */\n/**\n * Configuration options for RedisJobStore\n */\nexport interface RedisJobStoreOptions {\n  /** TTL for completed jobs in seconds (default: 300 = 5 minutes) */\n  completedTtl?: number;\n  /** TTL for running jobs/chunks in seconds (default: 1200 = 20 minutes) */\n  runningTtl?: number;\n  /** TTL for chunks after completion in seconds (default: 0 = delete immediately) */\n  chunksAfterCompleteTtl?: number;\n  /** TTL for run steps after completion in seconds (default: 0 = delete immediately) */\n  runStepsAfterCompleteTtl?: number;\n}\n\nexport class RedisJobStore implements IJobStore {\n  private redis: Redis | Cluster;\n  private cleanupInterval: NodeJS.Timeout | null = null;\n  private ttl: typeof DEFAULT_TTL;\n\n  /** Whether Redis client is in cluster mode (affects pipeline usage) */\n  private isCluster: boolean;\n\n  /**\n   * Local cache for graph references on THIS instance.\n   * Enables fast reconnects when client returns to the same server.\n   * Uses WeakRef to allow garbage collection when graph is no longer needed.\n   */\n  private localGraphCache = new Map<string, WeakRef<StandardGraph>>();\n\n  /**\n   * Local cache for collectedUsage arrays.\n   * Generation happens on a single instance, so collectedUsage is only available locally.\n   * For cross-replica abort, the abort handler falls back to text-based token counting.\n   */\n  private localCollectedUsageCache = new Map<string, UsageMetadata[]>();\n\n  /** Cleanup interval in ms (1 minute) */\n  private cleanupIntervalMs = 60000;\n\n  constructor(redis: Redis | Cluster, options?: RedisJobStoreOptions) {\n    this.redis = redis;\n    this.ttl = {\n      completed: options?.completedTtl ?? DEFAULT_TTL.completed,\n      running: options?.runningTtl ?? DEFAULT_TTL.running,\n      chunksAfterComplete: options?.chunksAfterCompleteTtl ?? DEFAULT_TTL.chunksAfterComplete,\n      runStepsAfterComplete: options?.runStepsAfterCompleteTtl ?? DEFAULT_TTL.runStepsAfterComplete,\n    };\n    // Detect cluster mode using ioredis's isCluster property\n    this.isCluster = (redis as Cluster).isCluster === true;\n  }\n\n  async initialize(): Promise<void> {\n    if (this.cleanupInterval) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    // Start periodic cleanup\n    this.cleanupInterval = setInterval(() => {\n      this.cleanup().catch((err) => {\n        logger.error('[RedisJobStore] Cleanup error:', err);\n      });\n    }, this.cleanupIntervalMs);\n\n    if (this.cleanupInterval.unref) {\n      this.cleanupInterval.unref();\n    }\n\n    logger.info('[RedisJobStore] Initialized with cleanup interval');\n  }\n\n  async createJob(\n    streamId: string,\n    userId: string,\n    conversationId?: string,\n  ): Promise<SerializableJobData> {\n    const job: SerializableJobData = {\n      streamId,\n      userId,\n      status: 'running',\n      createdAt: Date.now(),\n      conversationId,\n      syncSent: false,\n    };\n\n    const key = KEYS.job(streamId);\n    const userJobsKey = KEYS.userJobs(userId);\n\n    // For cluster mode, we can't pipeline keys on different slots\n    // The job key uses hash tag {streamId}, runningJobs and userJobs are on different slots\n    if (this.isCluster) {\n      await this.redis.hset(key, this.serializeJob(job));\n      await this.redis.expire(key, this.ttl.running);\n      await this.redis.sadd(KEYS.runningJobs, streamId);\n      await this.redis.sadd(userJobsKey, streamId);\n    } else {\n      const pipeline = this.redis.pipeline();\n      pipeline.hset(key, this.serializeJob(job));\n      pipeline.expire(key, this.ttl.running);\n      pipeline.sadd(KEYS.runningJobs, streamId);\n      pipeline.sadd(userJobsKey, streamId);\n      await pipeline.exec();\n    }\n\n    logger.debug(`[RedisJobStore] Created job: ${streamId}`);\n    return job;\n  }\n\n  async getJob(streamId: string): Promise<SerializableJobData | null> {\n    const data = await this.redis.hgetall(KEYS.job(streamId));\n    if (!data || Object.keys(data).length === 0) {\n      return null;\n    }\n    return this.deserializeJob(data);\n  }\n\n  async updateJob(streamId: string, updates: Partial<SerializableJobData>): Promise<void> {\n    const key = KEYS.job(streamId);\n\n    const serialized = this.serializeJob(updates as SerializableJobData);\n    if (Object.keys(serialized).length === 0) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    const fields = Object.entries(serialized).flat();\n    const updated = await this.redis.eval(\n      'if redis.call(\"EXISTS\", KEYS[1]) == 1 then redis.call(\"HSET\", KEYS[1], unpack(ARGV)) return 1 else return 0 end',\n      1,\n      key,\n      ...fields,\n    );\n\n    if (updated === 0) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    // If status changed to complete/error/aborted, update TTL and remove from running set\n    // Note: userJobs cleanup is handled lazily via self-healing in getActiveJobIdsByUser\n    if (updates.status && ['complete', 'error', 'aborted'].includes(updates.status)) {\n      // In cluster mode, separate runningJobs (global) from stream-specific keys\n      if (this.isCluster) {\n        await this.redis.expire(key, this.ttl.completed);\n        await this.redis.srem(KEYS.runningJobs, streamId);\n\n        if (this.ttl.chunksAfterComplete === 0) {\n          await this.redis.del(KEYS.chunks(streamId));\n        } else {\n          await this.redis.expire(KEYS.chunks(streamId), this.ttl.chunksAfterComplete);\n        }\n\n        if (this.ttl.runStepsAfterComplete === 0) {\n          await this.redis.del(KEYS.runSteps(streamId));\n        } else {\n          await this.redis.expire(KEYS.runSteps(streamId), this.ttl.runStepsAfterComplete);\n        }\n      } else {\n        const pipeline = this.redis.pipeline();\n        pipeline.expire(key, this.ttl.completed);\n        pipeline.srem(KEYS.runningJobs, streamId);\n\n        if (this.ttl.chunksAfterComplete === 0) {\n          pipeline.del(KEYS.chunks(streamId));\n        } else {\n          pipeline.expire(KEYS.chunks(streamId), this.ttl.chunksAfterComplete);\n        }\n\n        if (this.ttl.runStepsAfterComplete === 0) {\n          pipeline.del(KEYS.runSteps(streamId));\n        } else {\n          pipeline.expire(KEYS.runSteps(streamId), this.ttl.runStepsAfterComplete);\n        }\n\n        await pipeline.exec();\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  async deleteJob(streamId: string): Promise<void> {\n    // Clear local caches\n    this.localGraphCache.delete(streamId);\n    this.localCollectedUsageCache.delete(streamId);\n\n    // Note: userJobs cleanup is handled lazily via self-healing in getActiveJobIdsByUser\n    // In cluster mode, separate runningJobs (global) from stream-specific keys (same slot)\n    if (this.isCluster) {\n      // Stream-specific keys all hash to same slot due to {streamId}\n      const pipeline = this.redis.pipeline();\n      pipeline.del(KEYS.job(streamId));\n      pipeline.del(KEYS.chunks(streamId));\n      pipeline.del(KEYS.runSteps(streamId));\n      await pipeline.exec();\n      // Global set is on different slot - execute separately\n      await this.redis.srem(KEYS.runningJobs, streamId);\n    } else {\n      const pipeline = this.redis.pipeline();\n      pipeline.del(KEYS.job(streamId));\n      pipeline.del(KEYS.chunks(streamId));\n      pipeline.del(KEYS.runSteps(streamId));\n      pipeline.srem(KEYS.runningJobs, streamId);\n      await pipeline.exec();\n    }\n    logger.debug(`[RedisJobStore] Deleted job: ${streamId}`);\n  }\n\n  async hasJob(streamId: string): Promise<boolean> {\n    const exists = await this.redis.exists(KEYS.job(streamId));\n    return exists === 1;\n  }\n\n  async getRunningJobs(): Promise<SerializableJobData[]> {\n    const streamIds = await this.redis.smembers(KEYS.runningJobs);\n    if (streamIds.length === 0) {\n      return [];\n    }\n\n    const jobs: SerializableJobData[] = [];\n    for (const streamId of streamIds) {\n      const job = await this.getJob(streamId);\n      if (job && job.status === 'running') {\n        jobs.push(job);\n      }\n    }\n    return jobs;\n  }\n\n  async cleanup(): Promise<number> {\n    const now = Date.now();\n    const streamIds = await this.redis.smembers(KEYS.runningJobs);\n    let cleaned = 0;\n\n    // Clean up stale local graph cache entries (WeakRefs that were collected)\n    for (const [streamId, graphRef] of this.localGraphCache) {\n      if (!graphRef.deref()) {\n        this.localGraphCache.delete(streamId);\n      }\n    }\n\n    for (const streamId of streamIds) {\n      const job = await this.getJob(streamId);\n\n      // Job no longer exists (TTL expired) - remove from set\n      if (!job) {\n        await this.redis.srem(KEYS.runningJobs, streamId);\n        this.localGraphCache.delete(streamId);\n        this.localCollectedUsageCache.delete(streamId);\n        cleaned++;\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      // Job completed but still in running set (shouldn't happen, but handle it)\n      if (job.status !== 'running') {\n        await this.redis.srem(KEYS.runningJobs, streamId);\n        this.localGraphCache.delete(streamId);\n        this.localCollectedUsageCache.delete(streamId);\n        cleaned++;\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      // Stale running job (failsafe - running for > configured TTL)\n      if (now - job.createdAt > this.ttl.running * 1000) {\n        logger.warn(`[RedisJobStore] Cleaning up stale job: ${streamId}`);\n        await this.deleteJob(streamId);\n        cleaned++;\n      }\n    }\n\n    if (cleaned > 0) {\n      logger.debug(`[RedisJobStore] Cleaned up ${cleaned} jobs`);\n    }\n\n    return cleaned;\n  }\n\n  async getJobCount(): Promise<number> {\n    // This is approximate - counts jobs in running set + scans for job keys\n    // For exact count, would need to scan all job:* keys\n    const runningCount = await this.redis.scard(KEYS.runningJobs);\n    return runningCount;\n  }\n\n  async getJobCountByStatus(status: JobStatus): Promise<number> {\n    if (status === 'running') {\n      return this.redis.scard(KEYS.runningJobs);\n    }\n\n    // For other statuses, we'd need to scan - return 0 for now\n    // In production, consider maintaining separate sets per status if needed\n    return 0;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get active job IDs for a user.\n   * Returns conversation IDs of running jobs belonging to the user.\n   * Also performs self-healing cleanup: removes stale entries for jobs that no longer exist.\n   *\n   * @param userId - The user ID to query\n   * @returns Array of conversation IDs with active jobs\n   */\n  async getActiveJobIdsByUser(userId: string): Promise<string[]> {\n    const userJobsKey = KEYS.userJobs(userId);\n    const trackedIds = await this.redis.smembers(userJobsKey);\n\n    if (trackedIds.length === 0) {\n      return [];\n    }\n\n    const activeIds: string[] = [];\n    const staleIds: string[] = [];\n\n    for (const streamId of trackedIds) {\n      const job = await this.getJob(streamId);\n      // Only include if job exists AND is still running\n      if (job && job.status === 'running') {\n        activeIds.push(streamId);\n      } else {\n        // Self-healing: job completed/deleted but mapping wasn't cleaned - mark for removal\n        staleIds.push(streamId);\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Clean up stale entries\n    if (staleIds.length > 0) {\n      await this.redis.srem(userJobsKey, ...staleIds);\n      logger.debug(\n        `[RedisJobStore] Self-healed ${staleIds.length} stale job entries for user ${userId}`,\n      );\n    }\n\n    return activeIds;\n  }\n\n  async destroy(): Promise<void> {\n    if (this.cleanupInterval) {\n      clearInterval(this.cleanupInterval);\n      this.cleanupInterval = null;\n    }\n    // Clear local caches\n    this.localGraphCache.clear();\n    this.localCollectedUsageCache.clear();\n    // Don't close the Redis connection - it's shared\n    logger.info('[RedisJobStore] Destroyed');\n  }\n\n  // ===== Content State Methods =====\n  // For Redis, content is primarily reconstructed from chunks.\n  // However, we keep a LOCAL graph cache for fast same-instance reconnects.\n\n  /**\n   * Store graph reference in local cache.\n   * This enables fast reconnects when client returns to the same instance.\n   * Falls back to Redis chunk reconstruction for cross-instance reconnects.\n   *\n   * @param streamId - The stream identifier\n   * @param graph - The graph instance (stored as WeakRef)\n   */\n  setGraph(streamId: string, graph: StandardGraph): void {\n    this.localGraphCache.set(streamId, new WeakRef(graph));\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * No-op for Redis - content parts are reconstructed from chunks.\n   * Metadata (agentId, groupId) is embedded directly on content parts by the agent runtime.\n   */\n  setContentParts(): void {\n    // Content parts are reconstructed from chunks during getContentParts\n    // No separate storage needed\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Store collectedUsage reference in local cache.\n   * This is used for abort handling to spend tokens for all models.\n   * Note: Only available on the generating instance; cross-replica abort uses fallback.\n   */\n  setCollectedUsage(streamId: string, collectedUsage: UsageMetadata[]): void {\n    this.localCollectedUsageCache.set(streamId, collectedUsage);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get collected usage for a job.\n   * Only available if this is the generating instance.\n   */\n  getCollectedUsage(streamId: string): UsageMetadata[] {\n    return this.localCollectedUsageCache.get(streamId) ?? [];\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get aggregated content - tries local cache first, falls back to Redis reconstruction.\n   *\n   * Optimization: If this instance has the live graph (same-instance reconnect),\n   * we return the content directly without Redis round-trip.\n   * For cross-instance reconnects, we reconstruct from Redis Streams.\n   *\n   * @param streamId - The stream identifier\n   * @returns Content parts array or null if not found\n   */\n  async getContentParts(streamId: string): Promise<{\n    content: Agents.MessageContentComplex[];\n  } | null> {\n    // 1. Try local graph cache first (fast path for same-instance reconnect)\n    const graphRef = this.localGraphCache.get(streamId);\n    if (graphRef) {\n      const graph = graphRef.deref();\n      if (graph) {\n        const localParts = graph.getContentParts();\n        if (localParts && localParts.length > 0) {\n          return {\n            content: localParts,\n          };\n        }\n      } else {\n        // WeakRef was collected, remove from cache\n        this.localGraphCache.delete(streamId);\n      }\n    }\n\n    // 2. Fall back to Redis chunk reconstruction (cross-instance reconnect)\n    const chunks = await this.getChunks(streamId);\n    if (chunks.length === 0) {\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    // Use the same content aggregator as live streaming\n    const { contentParts, aggregateContent } = createContentAggregator();\n\n    // Valid event types for content aggregation\n    const validEvents = new Set([\n      'on_run_step',\n      'on_message_delta',\n      'on_reasoning_delta',\n      'on_run_step_delta',\n      'on_run_step_completed',\n      'on_agent_update',\n    ]);\n\n    for (const chunk of chunks) {\n      const event = chunk as { event?: string; data?: unknown };\n      if (!event.event || !event.data || !validEvents.has(event.event)) {\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      // Pass event string directly - GraphEvents values are lowercase strings\n      // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-explicit-any\n      aggregateContent({ event: event.event as any, data: event.data as any });\n    }\n\n    // Filter out undefined entries\n    const filtered: Agents.MessageContentComplex[] = [];\n    for (const part of contentParts) {\n      if (part !== undefined) {\n        filtered.push(part);\n      }\n    }\n\n    return {\n      content: filtered,\n    };\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get run steps - tries local cache first, falls back to Redis.\n   *\n   * Optimization: If this instance has the live graph, we get run steps\n   * directly without Redis round-trip.\n   *\n   * @param streamId - The stream identifier\n   * @returns Run steps array\n   */\n  async getRunSteps(streamId: string): Promise<Agents.RunStep[]> {\n    // 1. Try local graph cache first (fast path for same-instance reconnect)\n    const graphRef = this.localGraphCache.get(streamId);\n    if (graphRef) {\n      const graph = graphRef.deref();\n      if (graph) {\n        const localSteps = graph.getRunSteps();\n        if (localSteps && localSteps.length > 0) {\n          return localSteps;\n        }\n      }\n      // Note: Don't delete from cache here - graph may still be valid\n      // but just not have run steps yet\n    }\n\n    // 2. Fall back to Redis (cross-instance reconnect)\n    const key = KEYS.runSteps(streamId);\n    const data = await this.redis.get(key);\n    if (!data) {\n      return [];\n    }\n    try {\n      return JSON.parse(data);\n    } catch {\n      return [];\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Clear content state for a job.\n   * Removes both local cache and Redis data.\n   */\n  clearContentState(streamId: string): void {\n    // Clear local caches immediately\n    this.localGraphCache.delete(streamId);\n    this.localCollectedUsageCache.delete(streamId);\n\n    // Fire and forget - async cleanup for Redis\n    this.clearContentStateAsync(streamId).catch((err) => {\n      logger.error(`[RedisJobStore] Failed to clear content state for ${streamId}:`, err);\n    });\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Clear content state async.\n   */\n  private async clearContentStateAsync(streamId: string): Promise<void> {\n    const pipeline = this.redis.pipeline();\n    pipeline.del(KEYS.chunks(streamId));\n    pipeline.del(KEYS.runSteps(streamId));\n    await pipeline.exec();\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Append a streaming chunk to Redis Stream.\n   * Uses XADD for efficient append-only storage.\n   * Sets TTL on first chunk to ensure cleanup if job crashes.\n   */\n  async appendChunk(streamId: string, event: unknown): Promise<void> {\n    const key = KEYS.chunks(streamId);\n    const added = await this.redis.xadd(key, '*', 'event', JSON.stringify(event));\n\n    // Set TTL on first chunk (when stream is created)\n    // Subsequent chunks inherit the stream's TTL\n    if (added) {\n      const len = await this.redis.xlen(key);\n      if (len === 1) {\n        await this.redis.expire(key, this.ttl.running);\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get all chunks from Redis Stream.\n   */\n  private async getChunks(streamId: string): Promise<unknown[]> {\n    const key = KEYS.chunks(streamId);\n    const entries = await this.redis.xrange(key, '-', '+');\n\n    return entries\n      .map(([, fields]) => {\n        const eventIdx = fields.indexOf('event');\n        if (eventIdx >= 0 && eventIdx + 1 < fields.length) {\n          try {\n            return JSON.parse(fields[eventIdx + 1]);\n          } catch {\n            return null;\n          }\n        }\n        return null;\n      })\n      .filter(Boolean);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Save run steps for resume state.\n   */\n  async saveRunSteps(streamId: string, runSteps: Agents.RunStep[]): Promise<void> {\n    const key = KEYS.runSteps(streamId);\n    await this.redis.set(key, JSON.stringify(runSteps), 'EX', this.ttl.running);\n  }\n\n  // ===== Consumer Group Methods =====\n  // These enable tracking which chunks each client has seen.\n  // Based on https://upstash.com/blog/resumable-llm-streams\n\n  /**\n   * Create a consumer group for a stream.\n   * Used to track which chunks a client has already received.\n   *\n   * @param streamId - The stream identifier\n   * @param groupName - Unique name for the consumer group (e.g., session ID)\n   * @param startFrom - Where to start reading ('0' = from beginning, '$' = only new)\n   */\n  async createConsumerGroup(\n    streamId: string,\n    groupName: string,\n    startFrom: '0' | '$' = '0',\n  ): Promise<void> {\n    const key = KEYS.chunks(streamId);\n    try {\n      await this.redis.xgroup('CREATE', key, groupName, startFrom, 'MKSTREAM');\n      logger.debug(`[RedisJobStore] Created consumer group ${groupName} for ${streamId}`);\n    } catch (err) {\n      // BUSYGROUP error means group already exists - that's fine\n      const error = err as Error;\n      if (!error.message?.includes('BUSYGROUP')) {\n        throw err;\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Read chunks from a consumer group (only unseen chunks).\n   * This is the key to the resumable stream pattern.\n   *\n   * @param streamId - The stream identifier\n   * @param groupName - Consumer group name\n   * @param consumerName - Name of the consumer within the group\n   * @param count - Maximum number of chunks to read (default: all available)\n   * @returns Array of { id, event } where id is the Redis stream entry ID\n   */\n  async readChunksFromGroup(\n    streamId: string,\n    groupName: string,\n    consumerName: string = 'consumer-1',\n    count?: number,\n  ): Promise<Array<{ id: string; event: unknown }>> {\n    const key = KEYS.chunks(streamId);\n\n    try {\n      // XREADGROUP GROUP groupName consumerName [COUNT count] STREAMS key >\n      // The '>' means only read new messages not yet delivered to this consumer\n      let result;\n      if (count) {\n        result = await this.redis.xreadgroup(\n          'GROUP',\n          groupName,\n          consumerName,\n          'COUNT',\n          count,\n          'STREAMS',\n          key,\n          '>',\n        );\n      } else {\n        result = await this.redis.xreadgroup('GROUP', groupName, consumerName, 'STREAMS', key, '>');\n      }\n\n      if (!result || result.length === 0) {\n        return [];\n      }\n\n      // Result format: [[streamKey, [[id, [field, value, ...]], ...]]]\n      const [, messages] = result[0] as [string, Array<[string, string[]]>];\n      const chunks: Array<{ id: string; event: unknown }> = [];\n\n      for (const [id, fields] of messages) {\n        const eventIdx = fields.indexOf('event');\n        if (eventIdx >= 0 && eventIdx + 1 < fields.length) {\n          try {\n            chunks.push({\n              id,\n              event: JSON.parse(fields[eventIdx + 1]),\n            });\n          } catch {\n            // Skip malformed entries\n          }\n        }\n      }\n\n      return chunks;\n    } catch (err) {\n      const error = err as Error;\n      // NOGROUP error means the group doesn't exist yet\n      if (error.message?.includes('NOGROUP')) {\n        return [];\n      }\n      throw err;\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Acknowledge that chunks have been processed.\n   * This tells Redis we've successfully delivered these chunks to the client.\n   *\n   * @param streamId - The stream identifier\n   * @param groupName - Consumer group name\n   * @param messageIds - Array of Redis stream entry IDs to acknowledge\n   */\n  async acknowledgeChunks(\n    streamId: string,\n    groupName: string,\n    messageIds: string[],\n  ): Promise<void> {\n    if (messageIds.length === 0) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    const key = KEYS.chunks(streamId);\n    await this.redis.xack(key, groupName, ...messageIds);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Delete a consumer group.\n   * Called when a client disconnects and won't reconnect.\n   *\n   * @param streamId - The stream identifier\n   * @param groupName - Consumer group name to delete\n   */\n  async deleteConsumerGroup(streamId: string, groupName: string): Promise<void> {\n    const key = KEYS.chunks(streamId);\n    try {\n      await this.redis.xgroup('DESTROY', key, groupName);\n      logger.debug(`[RedisJobStore] Deleted consumer group ${groupName} for ${streamId}`);\n    } catch {\n      // Ignore errors - group may not exist\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get pending chunks for a consumer (chunks delivered but not acknowledged).\n   * Useful for recovering from crashes.\n   *\n   * @param streamId - The stream identifier\n   * @param groupName - Consumer group name\n   * @param consumerName - Consumer name\n   */\n  async getPendingChunks(\n    streamId: string,\n    groupName: string,\n    consumerName: string = 'consumer-1',\n  ): Promise<Array<{ id: string; event: unknown }>> {\n    const key = KEYS.chunks(streamId);\n\n    try {\n      // Read pending messages (delivered but not acked) by using '0' instead of '>'\n      const result = await this.redis.xreadgroup(\n        'GROUP',\n        groupName,\n        consumerName,\n        'STREAMS',\n        key,\n        '0',\n      );\n\n      if (!result || result.length === 0) {\n        return [];\n      }\n\n      const [, messages] = result[0] as [string, Array<[string, string[]]>];\n      const chunks: Array<{ id: string; event: unknown }> = [];\n\n      for (const [id, fields] of messages) {\n        const eventIdx = fields.indexOf('event');\n        if (eventIdx >= 0 && eventIdx + 1 < fields.length) {\n          try {\n            chunks.push({\n              id,\n              event: JSON.parse(fields[eventIdx + 1]),\n            });\n          } catch {\n            // Skip malformed entries\n          }\n        }\n      }\n\n      return chunks;\n    } catch {\n      return [];\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Serialize job data for Redis hash storage.\n   * Converts complex types to strings.\n   */\n  private serializeJob(job: Partial<SerializableJobData>): Record<string, string> {\n    const result: Record<string, string> = {};\n\n    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(job)) {\n      if (value === undefined) {\n        continue;\n      }\n\n      if (typeof value === 'object') {\n        result[key] = JSON.stringify(value);\n      } else if (typeof value === 'boolean') {\n        result[key] = value ? '1' : '0';\n      } else {\n        result[key] = String(value);\n      }\n    }\n\n    return result;\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Deserialize job data from Redis hash.\n   */\n  private deserializeJob(data: Record<string, string>): SerializableJobData {\n    return {\n      streamId: data.streamId,\n      userId: data.userId,\n      status: data.status as JobStatus,\n      createdAt: parseInt(data.createdAt, 10),\n      completedAt: data.completedAt ? parseInt(data.completedAt, 10) : undefined,\n      conversationId: data.conversationId || undefined,\n      error: data.error || undefined,\n      userMessage: data.userMessage ? JSON.parse(data.userMessage) : undefined,\n      responseMessageId: data.responseMessageId || undefined,\n      sender: data.sender || undefined,\n      syncSent: data.syncSent === '1',\n      finalEvent: data.finalEvent || undefined,\n      endpoint: data.endpoint || undefined,\n      iconURL: data.iconURL || undefined,\n      model: data.model || undefined,\n      promptTokens: data.promptTokens ? parseInt(data.promptTokens, 10) : undefined,\n    };\n  }\n}\n","import type { Redis, Cluster } from 'ioredis';\nimport { logger } from '@librechat/data-schemas';\nimport type { IEventTransport } from '~/stream/interfaces/IJobStore';\n\n/**\n * Redis key prefixes for pub/sub channels\n */\nconst CHANNELS = {\n  /** Main event channel: stream:{streamId}:events (hash tag for cluster compatibility) */\n  events: (streamId: string) => `stream:{${streamId}}:events`,\n};\n\n/**\n * Event types for pub/sub messages\n */\nconst EventTypes = {\n  CHUNK: 'chunk',\n  DONE: 'done',\n  ERROR: 'error',\n  ABORT: 'abort',\n} as const;\n\ninterface PubSubMessage {\n  type: (typeof EventTypes)[keyof typeof EventTypes];\n  /** Sequence number for ordering (critical for Redis Cluster) */\n  seq?: number;\n  data?: unknown;\n  error?: string;\n}\n\n/**\n * Reorder buffer state for a stream subscription.\n * Handles out-of-order message delivery in Redis Cluster mode.\n */\ninterface ReorderBuffer {\n  /** Next expected sequence number */\n  nextSeq: number;\n  /** Buffered messages waiting for earlier sequences */\n  pending: Map<number, PubSubMessage>;\n  /** Timeout handle for flushing stale messages */\n  flushTimeout: ReturnType<typeof setTimeout> | null;\n}\n\n/** Max time (ms) to wait for out-of-order messages before force-flushing */\nconst REORDER_TIMEOUT_MS = 500;\n/** Max messages to buffer before force-flushing (prevents memory issues) */\nconst MAX_BUFFER_SIZE = 100;\n\n/**\n * Subscriber state for a stream\n */\ninterface StreamSubscribers {\n  count: number;\n  handlers: Map<\n    string,\n    {\n      onChunk: (event: unknown) => void;\n      onDone?: (event: unknown) => void;\n      onError?: (error: string) => void;\n    }\n  >;\n  allSubscribersLeftCallbacks: Array<() => void>;\n  /** Abort callbacks - called when abort signal is received from any replica */\n  abortCallbacks: Array<() => void>;\n  /** Reorder buffer for handling out-of-order delivery in Redis Cluster */\n  reorderBuffer: ReorderBuffer;\n}\n\n/**\n * Redis Pub/Sub implementation of IEventTransport.\n * Enables real-time event delivery across multiple instances.\n *\n * Architecture (inspired by https://upstash.com/blog/resumable-llm-streams):\n * - Publisher: Emits events to Redis channel when chunks arrive\n * - Subscriber: Listens to Redis channel and forwards to SSE clients\n * - Decoupled: Generator and consumer don't need direct connection\n *\n * Note: Requires TWO Redis connections - one for publishing, one for subscribing.\n * This is a Redis limitation: a client in subscribe mode can't publish.\n *\n * @example\n * ```ts\n * const transport = new RedisEventTransport(publisherClient, subscriberClient);\n * transport.subscribe(streamId, { onChunk: (e) => res.write(e) });\n * transport.emitChunk(streamId, { text: 'Hello' });\n * ```\n */\nexport class RedisEventTransport implements IEventTransport {\n  /** Redis client for publishing events */\n  private publisher: Redis | Cluster;\n  /** Redis client for subscribing to events (separate connection required) */\n  private subscriber: Redis | Cluster;\n  /** Track subscribers per stream */\n  private streams = new Map<string, StreamSubscribers>();\n  /** Track channel subscription state: resolved promise = active, pending = in-flight */\n  private channelSubscriptions = new Map<string, Promise<void>>();\n  /** Counter for generating unique subscriber IDs */\n  private subscriberIdCounter = 0;\n  /** Sequence counters per stream for publishing (ensures ordered delivery in cluster mode) */\n  private sequenceCounters = new Map<string, number>();\n\n  /**\n   * Create a new Redis event transport.\n   *\n   * @param publisher - Redis client for publishing (can be shared)\n   * @param subscriber - Redis client for subscribing (must be dedicated)\n   */\n  constructor(publisher: Redis | Cluster, subscriber: Redis | Cluster) {\n    this.publisher = publisher;\n    this.subscriber = subscriber;\n\n    // Set up message handler for all subscriptions\n    this.subscriber.on('message', (channel: string, message: string) => {\n      this.handleMessage(channel, message);\n    });\n  }\n\n  /** Get next sequence number for a stream (0-indexed) */\n  private getNextSequence(streamId: string): number {\n    const current = this.sequenceCounters.get(streamId) ?? 0;\n    this.sequenceCounters.set(streamId, current + 1);\n    return current;\n  }\n\n  /** Reset publish sequence counter and subscriber reorder state for a stream (full cleanup only) */\n  resetSequence(streamId: string): void {\n    this.sequenceCounters.delete(streamId);\n    const state = this.streams.get(streamId);\n    if (state) {\n      if (state.reorderBuffer.flushTimeout) {\n        clearTimeout(state.reorderBuffer.flushTimeout);\n        state.reorderBuffer.flushTimeout = null;\n      }\n      state.reorderBuffer.nextSeq = 0;\n      state.reorderBuffer.pending.clear();\n    }\n  }\n\n  /** Advance subscriber reorder buffer to current publisher sequence without resetting publisher (cross-replica safe) */\n  syncReorderBuffer(streamId: string): void {\n    const currentSeq = this.sequenceCounters.get(streamId) ?? 0;\n    const state = this.streams.get(streamId);\n    if (state) {\n      if (state.reorderBuffer.flushTimeout) {\n        clearTimeout(state.reorderBuffer.flushTimeout);\n        state.reorderBuffer.flushTimeout = null;\n      }\n      state.reorderBuffer.nextSeq = currentSeq;\n      state.reorderBuffer.pending.clear();\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Handle incoming pub/sub message with reordering support for Redis Cluster\n   */\n  private handleMessage(channel: string, message: string): void {\n    const match = channel.match(/^stream:\\{([^}]+)\\}:events$/);\n    if (!match) {\n      return;\n    }\n    const streamId = match[1];\n\n    const streamState = this.streams.get(streamId);\n    if (!streamState) {\n      return;\n    }\n\n    try {\n      const parsed = JSON.parse(message) as PubSubMessage;\n\n      if (parsed.type === EventTypes.CHUNK && parsed.seq != null) {\n        this.handleOrderedChunk(streamId, streamState, parsed);\n      } else if (\n        (parsed.type === EventTypes.DONE || parsed.type === EventTypes.ERROR) &&\n        parsed.seq != null\n      ) {\n        this.handleTerminalEvent(streamId, streamState, parsed);\n      } else {\n        this.deliverMessage(streamState, parsed);\n      }\n    } catch (err) {\n      logger.error(`[RedisEventTransport] Failed to parse message:`, err);\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Handle terminal events (done/error) with sequence-based ordering.\n   * Buffers the terminal event and delivers after all preceding chunks arrive.\n   */\n  private handleTerminalEvent(\n    streamId: string,\n    streamState: StreamSubscribers,\n    message: PubSubMessage,\n  ): void {\n    const buffer = streamState.reorderBuffer;\n    const seq = message.seq!;\n\n    if (seq < buffer.nextSeq) {\n      logger.debug(\n        `[RedisEventTransport] Dropping duplicate terminal event for stream
